주소: 1 Chome-9 Dotonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
A famous attraction in Osaka, Japan, filled with shops, restaurants, and cafes. The area gets busy and lively in the evening, but remains safe. It's an ideal spot for Instagramworthy photos. There's ample space for strolling or sitting alone or with friends. The atmosphere is especially vibrant at night, with the streets lit up by glowing billboards and 3D signs. With its vibrant energy, rich cultural experiences, and endless entertainment options, this area is undoubtedly a mustvisit destination in Osaka, offering something for every type of traveler. Whether youre here to shop, dine, or simply soak in the sights, its a place you wont want to miss during your trip to Osaka. Obviously you know what this area is if you're looking it up.  It's what you think it is and what you've read and heard about it  a great, fun, sensoryoverloading district in Osaka filled with more food options than you could explore in a year.  The scenery, people watching, shopping, eating, drinking  all just fantastic.  Every time you turn a corner there will be something else, some other street or alley way to explore, all with countless bars, booths and restaurants tucked in everywhere you look.  There are also pachinko parlors, cranegame and other seizureinducing places if you go for such things. It is Osaka's most famous tourist attraction, known for its bright and extravagant  lights, which pierce the night and reflect off the surface of the river flowing through the city. It's a hotspot for tourists and revelers alike, Dotonbori is filled with towering neon signs, clubs, bars, and restaurants serving up local specialties. It's also a great place for shopping in Osaka. Definitely not to be missed during your trip to Japan if you are a night life lover and want to experience the local street food in the country It's really nice and lively. Really busy in the evenings. If you want to have a nice dinner you need reservations for the good restaurants.
Normal restaurants don't need reservations.
There are some boats to have a tour on water. A lot of neom lamps everywhere. Great place to walk around to shop and eat. Lots of stores and restaurants. Cant go wrong if you are in Osaka and need something to do. Highly recommend a visit. Just be aware that is is very crowded and some restaurants may take a while to get into. But well worth the wait.

주소: 1-1 Ōsakajō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0002, Japan
리뷰:
Today, we visited Osaka Castle... it is  magnificent looking from the outside,  but from the inside, they have changed it into a museum, so I have no idea how it looked like a few hundred years back, other than telling us it used to house their gold and silver, so sounds like a central bank of old? The museum itself was okay. Now the area around it is also nice and very accessible and family friendly. Their main elevator was out of service, so I'm not sure what people with a disability or prams did as the place have at least a million steps you need to climb! The view from all the way at the top is very nice, with a small gift shop up there and another larger one downstairs. I won't spoil the story, but check out the story of the Lord who built the original castle, it has a twist in it that I didn't see coming! But the only hint I'll mention is that he was 57 when it happened. Buy tickets online as the line was huge, at least a 30minute wait, even though at the end of the line, you find 3 ticket vending machines! I think they could have easily doubled the number of those machines! Online tickets have a line of their own, and you get in within a minute. Worth the trip... Very beautiful and relaxing castle to visit. Get there early or make reservations to avoid lines. Either way you get in rather quickly.  Plenty to see and take in amazing views once you are atop the main observation deck. The view around the city is spectacular. The grounds themselves are worth a visit as well. Osaka Castle is a mustsee if youre in the city. The castle itself is stunning, with its towering structure and beautiful grounds. Inside, theres a museum that walks you through the history of the castle and Osaka. The views from the top are amazing, giving you a great look at the city. The surrounding park is a lovely spot for a peaceful walk or a picnic. Its wellmaintained and easy to navigate. Overall, its a fantastic mix of history and nature, worth visiting! Osaka Castle is absolutely mesmerizing at night! I walked around the grounds, and the castle looked stunning with its beautiful illumination against the night sky. The peaceful atmosphere made it a perfect spot to take in the impressive architecture and enjoy a quiet evening stroll. Even though I didnt go inside, exploring the exterior and the surrounding park was well worth it. Highly recommend visiting during the evening for a unique and serene experience! Definitely worth a visit! Incredible architecture and history.

Buy your entrance passes ahead of time. There was a long line when we went, even early in the morning. You can skip the queue. Get the audio guide too.

The elevator wasn't working but the top floor has wonderful views of the city. Worth the climb. There's also golf cart stops at the entrances if you don't want to walk too much around the compound. Especially after the walk from the station.

There's several vending machines about 100m straight out of the exit.

주소: 1-chōme-1-10 Kaigandōri, Minato Ward, Osaka, 552-0022, Japan
리뷰:
Amazing aquarium and a mustvisit in Osaka! The Kaiyukan is beautifully designed, with huge tanks that give you an immersive experience of marine life. The highlight for me was the massive central tank with the whale sharkits breathtaking! The exhibits are wellorganized, taking you on a journey from Japans seas to the Pacific Ocean, with diverse species like jellyfish, penguins, and otters. The layout is easy to navigate, and there are plenty of interactive displays for kids. Its a great place for families, and you can easily spend a few hours here. Worth every penny! A large array of sea creatures with big enclosures for them, which is great. Have accessible access with wheel chair spots to make it easier for them to see things. The whole thing is one big loop down, so it's easy to navigate. No amount of words would, of course, really describe this, got to be there to get the experience. A bonus, you ask? It's close to a shopping mall and the biggest Ferris wheel I've seen, so you can do a few things while there. We took one bus all the way there from close to Osaka station for the flat fee of 210 yen for adults and half that for children even though it was a 34minute trip. It's worth a visit for adults and kids... By far one of the best aquariums I have ever been to. Fully immersive and well done with tons of different sea animals and some land animals. The building feels new and modern, and the aquarium alone takes at least 90120 minutes to complete. Well worth it and this was my second visit here. You should certainly buy tickets online beforehand to beat the crowds waiting at the ticket counter. If you go on a weekend, expect chaos. It's really busy at that time. Nice mall close by as well with some cool souvenirs and restaurants. An amazing aquarium, spent hours just watching and looking.

We did have to book a time slot to enter but well worth the wait.

It was very busy, just take your time and enjoy the place.

Took a good part of the day but would recommend for sure. If you purchase tickets online it might be faster and they sell based on time slots.

We paid for the extra tour to view the whale sharks in person. You cannot bring your phone and belongings into the viewing area free lockers are provided when you view them. The entrance to the viewing is not that far once you entered the aquarium. They let you in even if you're late for your slot I saw some come in after 510 minutes

이름: OSAKA STATION CITY square of space-time
주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 3-chōme−1−３ 大阪ステーションシティ 大阪駅5F
리뷰:
Located in the heart of Osaka, the Osaka Station City Square of SpaceTime is a visually striking testament to modern design and innovation. As soon as you step foot onto the square, you are transported into a realm where time and space merge in mesmerizing ways.

The first thing that catches the eye is the square's sleek and futuristic architecture. The cuttingedge design, with its blend of glass and steel, creates an atmosphere that is both elegant and aweinspiring. The seamless integration of technology into the square's layout adds an extra layer of intrigue, captivating visitors from the moment they arrive. Fun to look down many trains ,the next door is big shopping centre so convenient place Osaka Station City  A great place to wander around, whether or not you're catching a train I was!.

Many great views of Osaka city, particularly at night. A photographer's delight. Possibly the longest escalators in the world!

Five stars if you're a train enthusiast! Cute space that provides you with somewhere to rest and things to do in a huge confusing station. There's a building nearby with a garden and a view on the 11th floor, this building also has an elevator with a view. The other nearby building hosts the Nintendo and Pokemon shops. Big, nice, huge, crowded, massive. You can finds anything you are looking for. The station is involved in a super building with many floors basement included and every kind of service your heart would ask for. And the basement of the mall goes through a huge part of the station area

이름: Osaka Castle Main Tower (Osaka Castle Museum)
주소: 1-1 Ōsakajō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0002, Japan
리뷰:
This is a stunning building and well worth the wait in the queue to get in. This tower was rebuilt in 1931 based on pictures of the original 1585 tower. Great views from the top.
You can cut out an often long queue by purchasing on the internet in advance. The castle grounds were really pretty and it was cool to see how there were 2 bodies of water surrounding the castle for defensive purposes. The inside of the castle has been transformed into a modern museum which I didnt really like as I wouldve liked to see the old interior. Theres also a photoshoot where you can dress up as a samurai which was really cool. Our first stop in country.
Early May 2024, cool overcast day, still plenty of crowds.
The view from the top was good and the exhibits were informative. 100 score for the beauty of sakura surroundings the place. First time coming and seeing the beautiful flowers is such a lucky moments to our family. Nearby have some street foods smell really good. You should find somewhere hidden to take pictures due to over crowded people there, especially hot season such as Sakura or maple leaf. From the outside it looks very nice, but as soon as you enter the grounds of the castle it looks a bit rundown. The gardens around it also look as if not much attention has been paid to them. I have not been to the castle myself.

리뷰:
The boat ride is only 20 minutes and is not worth the money unless you have the Osaka Awsome pass. It just loops around the moat and shows you a special rock with a face you can hardly even see. very nice place with nice view It's said to be a space to hide soldiers in case of an invasion, but from outside the moat, it looks like they were barely able to do it...

As stated in the explanatory version, the family crest of the feudal domain that built it is engraved on the stones of the stone wall. Osaka Castle Honmaru's only band ring "Hidden Curve"
The enemy sneaked through the defenses of Osaka Castle's iron walls and invaded Gokuraku Bridge, Yamazato Maru, and Honmaru.
A secret castle tower where castle soldiers stand by and attack the enemy's rear by surprise.It's quite spacious.On the south side of the hidden castle tower, there is a tower towering beyond it Visited on April 17, 2022.

A kuruwa built when Osaka Castle was rebuilt during the Edo period. It is said that it was a place to hide soldiers by keeping the entrance inconspicuous.

The inconspicuous entrance means there are fewer tourists.
The stones on the stone wall had the stamps of the clans that carried them there, and you could see the barges floating in the moat below, making the scenery very beautiful.

주소: 1-chōme-1-88 Ōyodonaka, Kita Ward, Osaka, 531-6023, Japan
리뷰:
One of the best panoramic views Ive ever experienced! The Umeda Sky Building offers an incredible view of Osaka from its floating  observatory, and its very accessible. The entrance fee is quite affordable, making it a mustvisit for anyone who loves breathtaking cityscapes. You can see a perfect, uninterrupted view of Osakas skyline, which is absolutely stunning, especially at sunset. The openair deck is an amazing spot to just sit and take it all in.

However, it does get really hot during the summer, and I found myself looking for some shade after a while. Despite the heat, it was worth every moment, and I could stay there for hours just soaking in the view. Im hoping to come back someday during the winter season when its cooler and enjoy the view under different conditions. If youre ever in Osaka, this is definitely a place you dont want to miss! Get klook pass kansai is value for money, you can choose the number of venues you like to visit. If not Umeda sky building admission fee is 2000yen. I would say still worth to go if you are first time visiting Osaka like I do Daylight in Japan is kind of short, so be there around 4pm would be great to do your photography and immersed with the beautiful sunset. I didnt stay for the night lights of buildings. The sunset alone was already super captivating. Getting a good shot may be tough if you go on weekends and peak seasons many tourists and locals as well Oh, if you have bad knees like me, dont worry there are escalators and lifts to take you all the way up to the highest observatory deck!  Beautiful building.

As we have seen many viewing platforms on our trip to Japan also in Osaka, we only went up to the 39th floor. Up to that point it is free and tickets for the platform are also sold there for 2000 yen. We were not convinced by the price for the visit. The escalators can also be used free of charge. This building has an open roof top observation deck, so on a good day this is an added bonus. You'll get a decent 360 view of Osaka here and with Eagle eyes you can spot Osaka airport from the northern view. I'd also recommend adding the museum to your booking if you like a bit of history. Umeda sky deck is an architectural triumph, incorporating a very unique design that allows visitors to soak up the ambiance of viewing Osakas magnificent skyline!
Entry is via level 3 and costs 2000 pp which is very good value to see the city from internally and for the very brave on the sky walk.
Cafebar is available with great selection of craft beers and sensational coffee to sip as the sun sinks into the ocean.
A trip into the gift shop, offers a plethora of unique gifts and souvenirs.
Yay! I did it! Im terrified of heights, and was very challenged by this experience but super thrilled that I did it! Give it a go! Not to be missed when in Osaka!

주소: 2-chōme-1-33 Sakurajima, Konohana Ward, Osaka, 554-0031, Japan
리뷰:
Ive never seen so many people in one place. We did go during a major holiday and I cant stress enough how important the express pass is. Without it lines were 120 minutes plus for the major rides. I would consider. It mandatory to pay the express pass unless you are happy to spend a long time waiting. They do charge a lot. If the good news is it seems the restaurants are actually better value than the concessions. Our 3 course sit down in ac Italian lunch was 2700. Yen and a chicken leg from a concession stand was 1200 yen. And you had to stand in line for that and eat it in the street. I know which one I would prefer. And we didnt have a booking. For lunch. Simply walked in at 12pm.  The kids had a blast and many of the rides are really good. But I am glad its one and done for me I love Universal in Florida, and loved Universal Osaka just as much, if not more. First, it was unbelievably easy to get to the park and enter. The train station drops you off directly near the gate no need to navigate a city sized parking lot. I purchased my ticket and express pass via on Klook, and was able to enter with a screen shot of the ticket. Trying to purchase tickets directly on the Universal site can be very difficult, if not impossible.

The staff were all delightful, friendly, and super helpful. The staff here felt more like the cast members at Disney Parks. The rides are also diverse and super fun. Having the express pass helped get quickly onto the most popular rides and I would recommend getting one. I was super excited to get to ride Jaws, as it no longer exists in Orlando.

It was, of course, an all day event. If you want to do things totally unique to Japan, you might want to skip Universal. If you are a big fan of amusement parks and want to ride some of the exclusive rides, I can't recommend visiting here enough! This place is amazing. Weve been to both Universal parks in the US and Japan is as good as Florida. Each area is really well done and has its own Japanese flare and additions compared to the US. The staff are so helpful and wave at people all day.
We experienced Halloween which was so cool with zombies walking the park and scaring people. The Flying Dinosaur ride is the most thrilling ride Ive been on and Ive ridden a lot of thrill rides. If you love theme parks, or Nintendo, Universal Studios is a must!
Firstly, BOOK IN ADVANCE
Check a few months in advance when your planned date will become available to book and be ready to book as soon as they are released. Especially if you want to get express pass tickets. The express passes that we wanted were sold out when we booked but we got the next best ones.
I highly recommend the express pass if you want to go on lots of rides as it saves a lot of time queuing.
Food was good, we ate at the jaws restaurant. We had a shark sandwich and a BBQ shrimp sandwich which were both good.
Nintendo world is very impressive and again you need a special ticket to enter there and Harry potter world so check online to make sure you book that in advance. An Unforgettable Experience!

Universal Studios Osaka was truly unique! Super Nintendo World, especially Mario World, was a highlight  you can actively participate in games, and its something you wont find anywhere else. The Harry Potter area was also fantastic. The park itself is beautiful and very clean, with friendly staff who made the visit even better. Plus, it wasnt too expensive compared to other theme parks. Overall, an unforgettable experience!

Beautiful park right next to the Osaka zoo.  Easy access from the train station, lots of restaurants in the area.  Definitely a must stop while you are in the area. A lovely landmark for photo taking. The best part is they have Christmas decorations when visiting in December. A monument located at the northwest gate of Tennoji Park's lawn plaza, commonly known as "Tensiba." Everyone will want to take a photo with Abeno Harukas, the symbol of Tennoji. It turns out that you can get to Tianji Station faster without taking the peripheral roads in the New World....
The road next to the middle entrance of Tennoji Zoo in the direction of Shinsekai leads directly to Tennoji Park through Tennoji Park....
I also found this OSAKA brand in Tennoji Park that looks beautiful in photos...
The environment is great and the inside is very comfortable!!! You can take a photo with Abeno Harukas in the background 
There are lawns and cafes around the area, so you can relax

리뷰:
The ony bridge across the inner moat, so its very busy, especially as it is a main route from a Metro station. You get a nice view of the moat and pleasure boats coming and going. The bridge leads to  the tenshu main keep from the north after passing the outer moat.

Osakajo is a recreation of what was once a much larger complex, and home to Toyotomi Hideyoshi, one of the three great unifiers of Japan. Prior to this area being Osaka Castle, it was the site of the Honganji citadel, a nearly impenetrable fortress built by monks who unwisely went up against Oda Nobunaga. The donjon area you see today dates back to 1931, while the original Osakajo was completed in 1586. It was destroyeddamaged and rebuilt several times between 1615 and the days of WWII. You will see the Osaka Castle with amazing view from the boat and listen to the story about the castle Nice old bridge that goes over the moat. There were signposts from the Aoyamon that leads here to get to Osaka Castle. A very nice landscape of Osaka Castle in the background here. A great scenic spot to take a photo of yourself, which I took quite a few here.

리뷰:
Such a beautiful landmark in Osaka. You can do 2 things here, going up the tower to see the whole Osaka city or go experience the long slide. I did not do it because I'm scared of heights and the queue for the slide is too long. Worth a visit Another great observation deck. Definitely go at night. It's lit up nicely. Has great viewing and photo spots. Only place we went that had a waiting line though. Line moved pretty quickly. Worth the Wait! This Tower is a Blast! 

The 30minute queue flew by! The elevator ride alone is an experience  it's like being launched into space with a super cool, Japanesestyle video briefing. Think dramatic, animeinspired visuals! Totally unique and definitely worth the wait.  Its Sunday after lunch and the line up to get up to the observation deck is quite long. If you want to go up the tower suggest to come early in weekday. Quite a bit of restaurants and entertainment shops nearby for all ages. The most popular type seems to be shooting targets for prize. Definitely enjoyed catching my own fish which was prepared as we liked! Fun for families and groups. Excellent teambuilding activity! Enjoyed how helpful and funloving the staff were. A true mustdo for Osaka visitors!

주소: 5 Reinincho, Tennoji Ward, Osaka, 543-0061, Japan
리뷰:
I passed this road every time I went to school. Didnt know it was a monument.
On some days, you can also see flocks of crows  murder hopping down the stairs.
If youre lucky usually therell be a Golden Retriever named FuChan.
Hes very friendly  definitely made my stay in Japan more memorable  Paved footpath stair, nothing special about it. The area is known for its famous hot springs, and the clear waters of Kinryu, Tosa Arisu, Masui, Yasui, Tamate, Kamei, and Osaka are called Tennoji's Seven Famous Waters.
A slope located on the north side of Mt. Arisu Kiyomizu Temple in Reijincho, Tennoji Ward, between Osaka Seiko Gakuin and Kiyomizu Temple. It forms part of Yokooji and Takeuchi Kaido Japan's oldest national highway. One of the seven slopes of Tennoji. From the north, Shingonzaka, Genshojizaka, Kuchinawazaka, Aizenzaka, Tenjinzaka, and Osaka. There is also a slope called Gakuenzaka, but does it have a new history? Cars can drive eastbound on a oneway street. It is not included in Tennoji Nanazaka. Tennoji Nanazaka is a series of seven slopes that climb from Matsuyamachisuji to the west side of Noboriyamachisuji from Tanimachi 9chome to Tennoji. It has become a temple town for Osaka Castle.

This is Osaka Castle, which stands at the northernmost tip of Kamimachi Plateau. If you go south along this Uemachi Plateau, you will end up at Shitennoji Temple, the head temple of the Japanese sect of Tennoji, and Yasui Shrine, the final resting place of Yukimura Sanada, who was active in the Osaka Summer Campaign. With the exception of Osaka, which is now a main road, the narrow cobblestone pavement and stone steps are impassable to cars, and the combination with the walls and stone walls on both sides is beautiful, making it a great spot for sketching and taking photos.

If you go up the same Kiyomizuzaka slope as Kiyomizudera in Kyoto, you will find Kiyomizudera. It is said that he invited the 11faced Kannon from Kiyomizudera Temple in Kyoto. There are places with spring water, a stage for Kiyomizudera Temple, and a panoramic view of the castle town of Osaka Castle.

Kiyomizudera is a Japanese Buddhist temple located in Reijincho, Tennojiku, Osaka City. The principal image is the elevenfaced thousandarmed Kanzeon Bodhisattva, and it is a branch temple of Shitennoji, the head temple of the Japanese sect. The full name is Mt. Arisu Seikoin Kiyomizudera. It is registered as a religious corporation with Seikoin. It is also known for having Tamade Falls, which is said to be the only natural waterfall in Osaka city.

Access Get off at JRSubway Tennoji Station and walk for about 10 minutes. Tennoji Nanazaka are seven slopes with historical value located on the west side of Uemachi Plateau in the center of Osaka City.
The third slope from the south side is Kiyomizuzaka.
Kiyomizudera, a temple on the south side of the slope, has the Elevenfaced ThousandArmed Kannon Bodhisattva, which was moved from the famous Kiyomizudera Temple in Kyoto, as its principal image. It is said that Kiyomizudera Temple is the origin of the name of this slope.
There are stone stairs and a slope next to them that is wide enough to push a bicycle along, giving me the impression that it is the most wellmaintained of all the Tennoji Nanazaka slopes.
The entrance from the Matsuyamachisuji side is very difficult to find, so if you don't check the map in advance, you may not be able to decide where to enter. As a landmark, go east at a small intersection with a car dealership called "Nissan Tennoji Store."
On the other hand, when accessing from the Tanimachisuji side, take the road south of Osaka Seiko Gakuin High School and continue forward while looking at the school's field on your right.

주소: 1-1 Ōsakajō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0002, Japan
리뷰:
Osaka Castle Park  is a perfect blend of history, nature, and tranquility in the heart of the city. Spanning a vast area around the iconic Osaka Castle, the park offers a peaceful escape with beautiful walking paths, scenic ponds, and wellmaintained gardens. Whether youre a history buff or just looking for a serene spot to relax, the park has something for everyone. The observation platform offers breathtaking views of the city, and the museum inside provides a look into the castles past.
I visited in September, and the waiting time was around 20 minutes, which was quite reasonable. The queue moved quickly, and the staff were efficient and friendly. The surrounding park is beautiful. Frankly, it looks incredibly beautiful from the outside. But the inside has nothing to do with its exterior. It's a museum. If I remember correctly, it's 800 yen per person and taking photos inside is prohibited. They close the doors at 1630. The last people to enter are allowed to stay inside for 3040 minutes. The castle itself didn't mean much to me, but the surroundings and atmosphere are beautiful, you can take beautiful photos. Getting there is quite easy  straight forward. I feel there could be more assistance with tickets since there are two lines one with online ticket  one purchasing onsite. This might be confusing for the first time. Overall the castle is well equipped  you get to learn the history quite well  like the audiovisual part. The views at the top is breathtaking. A very beautiful sight for those that wish to visit later in the day past sunset. The crowd dies down and there is a sense of serenity and mystery about the place. The lights stayed on until about 10PM and provided a stellar view of the castle and its surroundings. The gardens and walks around the moats are gorgeous and provide lots of educational history for those interested.

주소: 4-chōme-1-32 Ōtemae, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0008, Japan
리뷰:
Detailed history of the region given over several floors of the NHK building. Views not only provide sights of Osaka, but a birds eye view of Osaka castle. Displays containing pieces of the areas history, and detailed examples of life during each period. Worth a visit. Super awesome way to learn local history. Broken into very specific time periods on each floor. Worth spending a few hours wandering. Some sections make you feel as though youre living in the history structural replicas and scenic walls. Very organized path to follow through, and theres even an exhibit dedicated to archeology! Mainly to teach kiddos but can be fun for all ages! I am amazed by the level of delicacy of every single detail in the museum. Some English content to look at and search up.

How to fully absorb the place Highly recommended to scan the QR code wherever you see one and use translation app to read the information. We learned a lot about the history of Osaka food, art and architecture.

Ticket Please go to the museum the first day you arrive at Osaka. It is ideal to buy a set ticket  of Osaka Museum of History and Osaka Castle Museum.

Time Osaka Museum of History has 4 massive floors and Osaka Castle Museum has 8 also very comprehensive floors  Please make sure you have at least 3 hours for the museum and another 3 hours for the castle. We thought that it only takes 45mins and arrived at noon so it was a rush to enjoy Osaka Castle Museum later before the closing time at 5pm. Interesting museum dedicated to the history of Osaka, from the 6th century to modern times. Although it offers a lot of knowledge, the museum's focus on a single theme may not be suitable for the broadest audience. Nonetheless, the facility is clean, the exhibits are beautifully displayed, and entry is affordable at 600 yen. Its also a good place to escape the heat of a hot day. The view of Osaka Castle from the 10th floor is spectacular, although a designated photo area without window reflections would enhance the experience. Expansive museum that takes up several floors. Lots of exhibits detailing the history of Osaka from ancient times all the way up to the 21st century. I especially enjoyed the miniature dioramas that were extremely detailed and helped to provide a better understanding of the different architecture. Well worth the 45 dollar entry fee and a nice place to visit on a cloudier day. Close to the subway line and Osaka Castle which is an another benefit.

The name might be a little misleading as it is not a natural forest, but where trees are planted in commemoration of loved ones, hence the name Memorial Forest. There are wide concrete paths with benches along the way and every time I visit the park is very well kept. My favorite time of year to visit is around late November  early December due to the warm tones of gold and red fall foliage. We walked through the park on our way back from visiting Osaka Castle and it was so much more interesting that when we arrived from the other side of the castle.

There was a group of kids on stilts or on unicycles walking around. Nice place for barbecue. Offers a pleasant walk around the castle

This small shrine is located in the heart of Namba, Hozenji temple is flocked by locals and tourists both day and night.

It is believed to bring good luck if you splash water on the mosscovered statue. I also recommend walking onto the Hozenji yokocho, which I also think, is a sight to behold at night.

주소: 2-chōme-1-8 Tenjinbashi, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0041, Japan
리뷰:
This is a very traditional shrine. I came here for my child's Omiyamairi shrine visit, and I was very satisfied with how quickly we were able to proceed with the ceremony. However, there is little shade, so be cautious if you visit on a hot day. It's particularly important to take care if you have young children or elderly people with you. Despite the lack of shade, the experience was wonderful and the shrine's traditional atmosphere made it a memorable visit. Fantastic place to get away from the crowds of Osaka. Peaceful, quaint and minimal tourists.

There's worship areas and tourist spaces for people who just wish to look around and not take part in any religious ceremonies. Though there is a place to purchase items for offering and wishes.

Unfortunately it was lightly raining during my visit, but even still, I enjoyed the atmosphere and the scenery. The shrine is absolutely stunning with its intricate architecture and serene atmosphere. The peaceful ambiance made it a perfect place for reflection and tranquility. I was fascinated by the rich history and cultural significance of the shrine. The beautifully manicured gardens and the traditional structures added to its charm. Osaka Tenmangu Shrine, established in the 10th century, is a key shrine among many in Japan dedicated to Tenjin, the Shinto God of scholarship, who is associated with Sugawara Michizane, a notable scholar of the Heian Period.

Michizane liked plum trees, which are commonly found at Tenmangu Shrines, and the plum blossom motif serves as the symbol of these shrines.

Although Tenmangu Shrine in Osaka doesn't draw many foreign visitors like its counterparts in Tokyo and Kyoto, it holds significant importance for locals in Osaka.

Osaka Tenmangu is famous for the annual Tenjin Matsuri festival, held on July 24 and 25, which is ranked as one of Japan's top three festivals, along with Kyoto's Gion Matsuri and Tokyo's Kanda Matsuri. The festival features a joyful land and river procession, where the shrine's deity is paraded in a divine palanquin called mikoshi, accompanied by fireworks.

The shrine is conveniently located near the busy shopping street, Tenjinbashisuji.

I've visited the shrine a few times when I was in Osaka. Once, I had a good udon at the small restaurant inside the shrine grounds around lunchtime. It was a memorable meal. A big shrine in town. They have a big main hall for people to pray, one for stamps, charms and fortunes, and several others. The goshuin was nice and costs 500.

이름: Site of Naniwanomiya-Daigokuden (Council Hall in the Imperial Palace)
주소: 1 Chome-6 Hoenzaka, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0006, Japan
리뷰:
Visited on April 17, 2022.
It was a hot day.
It is a spacious park that many families enjoyed.

The remains of Daigokuden have been restored. You can't really tell just by walking around, but if you look at it from the Osaka Museum of History, you can get a sense of the layout of the palace. There is a restored diorama in the museum, so it would be a good idea to compare it.

Naniwa Palace is said to be divided into an early and a late period.
In the first period, after the Itsumi Incident, Emperor Kotoku moved the capital to this area, and it is said that the imperial edict for reforms was issued here. It's very emotional.
After that, the capital was moved many times, and during the reign of Emperor Tenmu it was considered a multiple capital, but it is said to have been destroyed by fire.

In the later period, Emperor Shomu moved the capital from place to place, so it seems to have been the capital for about a year. After that, it is said that he returned to Heijokyo via Shikorakukyo.
However, it was also a suitable location as an entrance to foreign countries, and it seems that it remained as a shrine for some time afterwards. Origin of Osaka The ruins of Naniwa Palace are currently under construction. It can be clearly seen from the elevator hall of the Osaka Museum of History. The event introduction character for this part of the history museum is Prince Naka no Oe. It is related to Naniwa Palace in the first half. The foundations of the palace buildings can be seen on the glass floor of the foundation of the Osaka Museum of History. It is highly praised that Naniwa Palace, which was said to be a phantom, was excavated and the site was preserved on a large scale as a park. However, it would be better not to display the Daigokuden ruins as if they were a large stage made of concrete, which would make it difficult to see the location of the foundation stones, and give the viewer the misunderstanding that there was a stone building like that in China. . There's nothing special about it, but it seems like there was a lot going on in the past, so I'm excited to be here after researching it. In the summer, there are many people who sleep naked to get a tan. It's just a square with almost no structures. Good for a walk. It can also be used as an evacuation site in the event of a disaster. I think it is better not to build large structures in the future.

주소: Japan, 〒543-0062 大阪府大阪市天王寺区伶人町１丁目５
리뷰:
Ordinary paved footpath, nothing special about it. Serene local street. A slope in Reijincho, Tennoji Ward, Osaka City.
Its origin is the nearby Yasui Shrine Tenjinsama. Although it has dried up now, it is said that there was once a spring called Tennojiku Shichimeisui.
It is an impressive place that appears at the end of the animated movie Josee, the Tiger and the Fish, and has become a sacred pilgrimage spot among fans, along with nearby Aizenzaka. It is one of the seven slopes of Tennoji Temple and is so named because it is the path that leads to Yasui Tenjin Shrine from above. Although it is called seven slopes, there are actually eight slopes. These are Shingon, Genshoji, Kuchinawa, Aizen, Shimizu, Osaka, Shimodera, and Tenjinzaka. The spring water has dried up. Vehicles are not allowed on the cobblestone road, but you can pass with permission from the neighborhood association. This is related to residents and home deliverypostal services. This name comes from the west torii gate of Yasui Shrine as you go down Tenjinzaka and go to your left.

Actually, there is the north stone staircase of Yasui Shrine at the end of the slope, so it is a shorter cut from here, but this is the back entrance.
The west torii gate is the main entrance, so if you are going to visit the shrine, it is best to go from there if possible.

Yasui Shrine is famous for being the place where Yukimura Sanada passed away.
There is also a Yukimura statue and stone monument.

There is also a statue halfway up Tenjinzaka that recreates the image of water gushing out from Kamimachi Plateau.
Don't miss this either

Osaka has the image of being completely flat, but it actually has slopes that give it an atmosphere like this.
The area around Yuhigaoka along Tanimachisuji on Kamimachi Plateau has steep slopes continuing to the west, and there are many named slopes.
It is called "Nanasaka of Tennoji"

from the north
Shingonzaka
Genshojizaka
Kuchinawazaka
Aizenzaka
Kiyomizuzaka
Tenjinzaka
Osaka

There are many sights to see around the slope, and I don't think you could cover all of them in one day.
Moreover, there is Ikunitama Shrine at the northern end, and Shitennoji and Isshinji at the southern end.
I think it would be more realistic to visit the area in two parts the northern half and the southern half.

리뷰:
There is nothing not to love. Just make sure to factor time for crowds as you need to wait for lifts and buy tickets also be polite in taking turns to do your photography. I would recommend to be there about late 3pm to 4pm daylight is short in Japan, dont forget! The sunset is so captivating! While some comments mentioned it being expensive, it really depends on what youre comparing it to. We purchased our tickets in advance, but you still need to queue up to scan your QR code and get the physical tickets.

Fortunately, the wait wasnt long, which was a pleasant surprise since we arrived a bit before sunset. We had a great time, and the views were fantastic. It's truly a beautiful place to visit. Beautifully constructed observatory. It was not too crowded during daytime and the openairskywalk offers phenomenal views over Osaka. There is a nice 360 degree indoor area with a caf where you can enjoy the view through huge windows with air condition  its totally worth it! Amazing view from the top. I highly recommend coming before sunset so that you can see the view during the day and at night. I wouldve given 5 stars but the line to go up was quite long we went on a Saturday. The value was very good, the ticket to go up was only 2000 yen. Nice place to visit to get 360 degrees view of the Osaka skyline. The place is well organised and there wasnt much of a queue when we arrived around 0930. Unusually you buy your entrance ticket half way through the ascent process after the elevator journey. Admission is AS15 and is worth it for the views and the experience of the open air views. There are some videos, stills and models of the design and construction process that are interesting too.  Worth a visit.

리뷰: The Tempozan Ferris Wheel offers a nice view, and the whole ride lasts about 15 minutes for one complete round. While the experience was pleasant, I couldnt help but feel that one round wasnt enough for the 900 yen price. It would have been great if they allowed two rounds instead of just one, which would make the ride feel more worth the cost. Still, its a fun experience if youre in the area and looking for some scenic views of Osaka. Must go! Forget about the Hep Five Ferris one. This is bigger and taller and of course come with better view!  only 900 yen for adult and you can choose to queue for the normal gondola or the full glass gondola usually longer queue and needs to wait cos there are fewer glass ones If you are in a rush, just go for the normal one and be stunned by the view. Very helpful and friendly staff at the ticket area and boarding lighting area! Thanks for the hardwork We accidentally timed our ride for sunset and it was gorgeous! The night time view is amazing. Ride is about 1520 minutes all around and only slightly scary for those apprehensive of heights. The pod rocks if you switch from one side to the other. The Ferris Wheel is a remarkable attraction offering great views of Osaka and its bay. Each cabin accommodates up to six people and is equipped with air conditioning, making it comfortable and pleasant for families with kids. We also, didnt experience much waiting time. The ticket price at the counter is 900 yen, which I find to be the only questionable aspect, as its not particularly budgetfriendly for families 2 adults, 3 kids for us !. It might be best to look for online discounts if available. The ride itself takes about 15 minutes. Musttry! The ride offers a stunning view of the city, including a great perspective of the Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan. The experience is incredibly enjoyable, and the ticket price is quite reasonable. Its a perfect way to see the city from above without breaking the bank!

이름: The National Museum of Art, Osaka
주소: Japan, 〒530-0005 Osaka, Kita Ward, Nakanoshima, 4-chōme−2−５５ 国立国際美術館
리뷰:
I had a great time going through the museum. They had several pieces you could view for free which I actually really liked. They currently have the exhibition of  Yoichi Umetsu Crystal Palace. The placards were also in English which really made a difference for me, it allowed to understand the artist, his intentions and motivations. The entry is only 1200 yen, 1000 yen after 5PM and that's a bargain. Recommended! Bought the amazing pass. Travelled across Osaka and got to the entrance where I learned there is a charge. Oh yes, the free part of the museum has a total of 4 pieces of art. I will include what you will see. My son who is a high school student was able to see the paid exhibition. He was not impressed. Classic bait and switch. This was really disgusting and a terrible way to treat visitors to Osaka.
Really a tremendous waste of time, both the amazing pass and this "art museum".

And like other people describe, there are way too many people employed here and they are directed to stand up and shadow you when you approach exhibits. I'm not sure if this is a cultural thing but it really made us very uncomfortable and destroyed any enjoyment of the museum.
I can possibly see their purpose because I saw a family of Chinese tourists and they were told to hold their little girls hand. They refused in the little girl went up to the art. It may help with such minor incidents but if someone had intention of doing harm I don't think they could stop them. Basically it was just creepy and made the place seem uncomfortable and unwelcoming.
And before anyone has something to say about me calling out Chinese tourists, well, in general they are a scourge and are very disrespectful tourists. Just search Chinese tourist reputation. Im a big fan of museums in Japan, whenever I come to Japan my biggest interest is only in art exhibitions. I have visited Osaka for many times and finally got to visit this one since they have closed for a long time

The disappointment is not about art or artist. I felt bad for smelling weird inside the building. And also, the position they put artwork made me feel like just placing it at will. Works are beautiful including the main exhibition that has ticket on sale, but its not a comfortable experience for me to look at art.
I know the lighting usually wont be too strong in museums because they want you to focus on the artwork, but this one I dont know why somehow too dark?

Hope they will improve in the future. They really have nice art but the arrangement inside is not good. Bizarre works of yoichi umetsu, surreal and organic. Seems like he worked with a group of potters and printmakers who support his work. I heard his work is inspired by plastic tree. Hard work put out to create the exhibition! This is a museum located in Nakanoshima, Osaka. As of late April 2024, there was an Aztec exhibition taking place. The exhibits are located in the basement. The restrooms prioritize appearance over functionality and are difficult to use. Additionally, my companion mentioned that there are too few toilets.

주소: 1 Yuhigaokacho, Tennoji Ward, Osaka, 543-0075, Japan
리뷰:
One of the slopes on the west side of Kamimachi Plateau. It is called this after the Aizendo Shotoji Temple on the slope.
It's a normal slope, not stone steps, and I don't think it's as good as Kuchinawazaka in the north or Shimizuzaka in the south. 2024.04.07
It is one of Tennoji's seven slopes, and on the top of the slope are Aizendo Shotoin and Oe Shrine.
The hill in the movie Jose, the Tiger and the Fish''
The characteristic wavy paving stones that are the model are also depicted.
Especially when the cherry blossoms at Oe Shrine are in full bloom, it becomes an even more nostalgic scene. It is a slope that can be accessed from just south of the east torii gate of Oe Shrine. It is easier to use than the stairs inside Oe Shrine. A fairly elderly woman, who must have had many years of experience using it, waddled down the stairs. I have to learn from you. Google Maps shows that it is faster to walk up the hill than to use public transportation to get to Nihonbashi or Namba from the Tennoji side.
This slope is also one of the eight slopes on the fault cliff wave cliff of Kamimachi Plateau. One area has a short history, so it is called Tennoji Nanazaka''. There are eight slopes Shingonzaka, Kiyomizuzaka, Genshojizaka, Aizenzaka, Tenjinzaka, Osaka, and Shimoderazaka.
Aizenzaka takes its name from Aizenin Temple, and has a deep literary relationship with it. The slope is right next to Oe Shrine and parallel to the stairs leading down from Oe Shrine to the west. This is a staircase called the 100yearold staircase. A slope in Yuhigaokacho, Tennoji Ward, Osaka City. The name comes from the nearby Aizendo.
This is the sacred place in the animated movie Jose, the Tiger and the Fish,'' where Josee and the main character Tsuneo meet for the first time. When you actually see the scene, it's just like the scene in the movie, making it a mustsee for fans. The origin of Aizendo's blessing is marriage, so it's perfect for the romantic movie Josee Tora. Tennoji Nanazaka are seven slopes with historical value located on the west side of Uemachi Plateau in the center of Osaka City.
Aizenzaka is located right in the middle of the seven slopes.
The name comes from Shomanin Temple, which is located at the bottom of the slope, and is said to have the power to pray for good relationships and bring luck in marriage.
The concrete ground with its jagged pattern is impressive, and at first glance it looks like a typical slope.
There are no stairs near the top exit, so bicycles can pass normally, but there was a signboard warning people to get off and pass for safety.
If you are accessing from the Matsuyamachisuji side, the landmark is the torii gate of Oe Shrine that can be seen at the end of the road. On the other hand, from the Tanimachisuji side, the landmark is a brick guidepost and a pillarshaped sign with the word "Aizensan" written in large letters.

Went here last week on a Saturday night, and as usual, there were so many people and the place is very lively. What I like about here is it's safe to walk around despite the crowded place.

The Summer Eve Festival was also held during that time in Ebisubashisuji. Boat processions with portable shrines crossed the bridges of Dohtonbori, plus energetic music and dances made the crowds feel the festive atmosphere of the place. April 8th, 2023

The view is outstanding from many of the other bridges vantage points. We just happened to be on this bridge first. You can feel the energy build up in this area as the night progresses.

The vibes are great. It's a mustsee destination while in Osaka. Neonlit structures are vibrant and breathtaking. Awesome place for shopping and getting local foods. But the street environment was a bit messy due to tourist overloads. Seems to be busy 247. Great view of the neon signs and canal

주소: 2-chōme-2-22 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
ShinsaibashiSuji Shopping Street  is one of Osakas premier shopping destinations, offering a dynamic blend of modern and traditional retail experiences. This covered arcade stretches for nearly 600 meters, making it a shoppers paradise with a wide range of stores, from luxury boutiques and global brands to local fashion and souvenir shops. Whether youre hunting for highend fashion or affordable finds, the variety here is impressive.

One of the most convenient features is the rooftop walkway that connects directly to Dotonbori, allowing you to easily explore both districts. The arcades lively atmosphere is enhanced by the abundance of cafes and restaurants, making it a perfect spot to pause for a meal or coffee during your shopping spree. Its especially fun to visit in the evening when the area is lit up, creating a vibrant ambiance. Beautiful night view with all lights making it so colorful.

Very crowded with locals and tourists. Better allocate enough time for this area if you want to do something shopping and have meals here apart from just taking some nice pictures. Pretty much have everything here.

The vibe is very touristy and if you enjoy being in the crowd, this is the perfect place . Become very crowded at night and it more lively during the night with all the light from the shoplots.

Most of the shops except for restaurant food closed pretty early,some close even before 9 pm, so plan your time wisely. As crowded as it's, I founded it incredibly fun and entertaining to walk in these streets, they felt infinite and so many nice hidden gems here and there, go early and enjoy exploring. Very busy street filled with popular brand name stores as well as smaller thrift shops. It is a great area to walk down and "window shop".
If you do not like crowds or busy bustling streets then this might not be for you as there will be a lot of people even later during the day.
A little shopping advice for my fellow Americans, the prices are slightly cheaper but not that significant of a difference compared to back home. However, great to come and look around. Osaka's extremely busy shopping street. Lots of shops lining the streets, as well as inside department stores like Parco and Daimaru.

You can find everything from high end shops to kitschy souvenirs and the popular pharmacies. Most of the stores do close around 8pm, and the place gets extremely busy past 5 pm with the street full of throngs of tourists.

We took the ride at a great time with a spectacular view of the city at night. I highly recommend it! This place was fun. Dotonbori is a big area to shop, eat, and drink. Don Quijote is a good spot to purchase anything you may need.

주소: 2-chōme-9-19 Motomachi, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0016, Japan
리뷰:
A beautiful and small shrine located walking distance from Osaka station. They do sell amulets and charms. Expect to spend about 15 30 mins inside cos we cant get inside the mouth of the lionDevil, you can walk all the way up to it.... When we were there, there was a drum "performance"  by some children, adding up to the atmosphere... Namba Yasaka Jinja is a small but beautiful shinto shrine in the heart of Osaka, near various metro stations  specifically the large station Namba. It has a large performance stage which is sculpted to resemble a lion head. This makes for great photos but be sure to come in the late afternoon or early morning since it does attract much foot traffic. Highly recommend coming to see what this shrine has to offer if you're ever planning to come to Osaka or are near the area. Namba Yasaka Shrine is truly a beautiful place, especially when you visit during opening hours. Unfortunately, I arrived a bit late and wasnt able to explore the shrine up close in peace. However, since Im a bit taller, I was able to take a picture over the gate, and as you can see, its a stunning shrine.

If you want to fully appreciate its beauty, I highly recommend arriving early to take your time and enjoy the serene atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit! Nice shrine in Osaka and worth a visit to marvel at the structure. I visited early morning via rental bike making it easy to get around Osaka before the crowds arrive. Its a nice spot to reflect. I recommend stopping by if you are near, renting a bike or enjoy walking around the city. This place is impressive, you really ask yourself how all of this was built, even though you read about it. But it is so impressive. It's a peaceful place, surrounded by an area so crowded. I visited this early morning, I don't know how this is in the afternoon or evening, but i guess it receives a lot of visitors.

주소: 3 Chome-2 Chikko, Minato Ward, Osaka, 552-0021, Japan
리뷰: Surprisingly not well kept, sandy paths and not as clean as the rest of Osaka. There are some concetre terraces you can sit on but not much else. A column or obelisk is in the centre of one space. Do notice the nice murals on the wall at the entrance gate. We visited this park in November 2023. It was very nice and quiet. Since it is beside the Osaka Aquarium, nobody really visits the place. Please visit this park if you want to spend some alone time with your partner and enjoy the view of the sea and trees, especially during Autumn! This is also a great place to propose since the trees were beautiful when we were there. It's not a well organized park but also not crowded at all. Could really enjoy the peace of a sunny day Even in the midst of the summer holidays, the park was surprisingly quiet, which can be attributed to the nearby famous Osaka Aquarium and Ferris wheel that attract all the tourists. The park is appealing for those seeking a peaceful stroll among the trees, offering a nice escape from the bustling attractions. However, it's not particularly outstanding. The park is too small for joggers, and the maintenance and gardening work could use some improvement. Very nice Osaka park on the water. It has what I am told the lowest mountain in Japan and if you should want to go on a boat ride there is also the Tempozan Ferry that will take you across the river and back. Very nice way to cross the river. It is a pedestrian ferry for only people and bikes and it is also handicapped accessible  although the ramp on the other side of the river is very steep  certainly not up to code so if anyone is using a wheel chair be sure to have someone with you to provide assistance and if you do not  I would imagine that the ferry operators would be willing to assist you on the ramps.

On a Sunday night 5524, the club was pretty packed with Japanese and tourists that are nice and sociable. Has 2 security guards that makes the club appears safe. 1k entrance for both men and women, 2k yen for 4 shots is pretty awesome deal! The DJ is engaging to the crowd. The dancers are pretty good! The space is not too big but you still have space to dance. The problem is people smoke shisha and cigarettes inside the club and if you are Health conscious, this is not for you. My visit to Pure Osaka was far from satisfactory, and I would not recommend going back there.

Cleanliness and Atmosphere
 Messy and Dirty The venue was incredibly messy and dirty. It was clear that cleanliness was not a priority, with trash and spills everywhere, making it an uncomfortable place to be.
 Unpleasant Environment The overall atmosphere felt neglected and poorly maintained. This lack of care contributed to a rather unpleasant experience.

Safety Concerns
 Questionable Crowd The crowd inside also added to the feeling of insecurity. It didn't seem like a place where one could relax and have a good time without constantly watching their back. One drunk guy walked towards me and says something like someone is gonna steal my sling bag ???

Affordability
 Cheap The only redeeming quality of Pure Osaka is its affordability. Its cheap compared to other venues, but you certainly get what you pay for.
 Value for Money Even though it's inexpensive, the poor conditions and safety concerns make it hard to justify saving a few yen. Found my brother from another mother here. Im half black half Japanese, from America. Bartender is half black half Japanese but from Japan. We barely understood each other, yet the vibes were immaculate . Highly recommend if youre from out of town and looking for a place to go out! The promise was to get a free drink if I do a Google comment. Well, this place has good music to be honest, looking forward to get my free drink. Atmosphere is good, you may check it out, too

리뷰:
We visited Ammona on the last night of our holiday in Asia as wanted to finish off partying and experience the renowned Osaka Clubbing scene.

The team did not disappoint. Everyone from security to bar staff, DJ's and dancers were warm, friendly, professional and made sure you have a great night out.

I did not see any stupid people or behaviour which means security must do a great job screening who is admitted and removing anyone who becomes stupid quickly and discreetly.

Everyone was just having a great time and felt safe the whole evening.

Some reviews say the drinks are expensive, this is true comparing to a basic bar however this is a premium nightclub that needs to cover the cost of running a huge team, venue and equipment to ensure a great night out so in the context, I think the drink prices are very reasonable. They are also much cheaper than at a comparable nightclub in Australia where we come from.

We look forward to visiting again when we return next year. Full of cute Japanese girls!

Sister club with Club Kitsune Kyoto. Has a loft with many VIP tables. Right in the middle of Shinsaibashi nightlife! Easy entrance from the first floor, elevator takes you into the club. If you want to experience Japanese nightlife in Osaka this is the place!



Edited Had an event for InterNations in this club and it was fun fun fun nice club with free welcome drinks for foreigners. music is good.
smoking place inside.
this a nice club, but i want you to be aware of a couple of things
no going out of the club policy
the club is rather small, with no quiet spaces to rest for a bit
music is really loud. though clubs are expected to be loud, sometimes it was too much
toilet is for 3 people at a time maximum
smoking place is right next to the stage, so you might smell tobacco while dancing
a lot of 5star reviews are written just to get a free drink

i dont want say that i didnt enjoy my time there, though i want to be completely honest with my review. enjoy! Its an amazing place to have fun. Something realmente diferent to do in osaka Awesome vibe! People are so friendly, locals and foreigners alike! We spent our first night in Osaka here and had so much fun. "Max" from the staff is the best!!!

We've been here last night with my friend.. i was surprised because the place was soo cool,the music was soo good..feel like you can't stop dancing because they've a good remixes that can make you move.. the owner also is soo approachable and hospitable.. if you're looking for a cheap place that you can enjoy to drink, dance and forget the stressful life.. come here in life.. they will revive your soul  As you see in the photos the place is empty the music is so loud it's hard to chat  okay the games  music is too redubbed for dancing Very nice little club wirh friendly staff. 리뷰:
Great club!! From the service staff to the DJs as a DJ myself. I am truly impressed by the talents and how the DJs are really well rounded..

Drinks are amazing and just priced right. Not sure if this is a Japanese thing, but me and both of my friends were groped at this club. Literally we would hit the dance floor and the guys would make a circle around us and just stare, then get closer and closer and start touching us. It was SO uncomfortable and weird. We wanted to dance on the main floor but the guys there were way too creepy. Once we got to the ladies onlyvip section it was great. The music was amazing and the confetti was a nice touch. Just wish the guys werent so weird. Ladies, go with a guy if you can otherwise youll probably be groped too. Great music choices. The djs know how to bring the party! Definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Japan So, first time in Japan let alone Osaka, and heard about this place. Decided to check this place out on a friday night with a couple of my friends. Ended up running into a promotermanager there I believe by the name of Michael. Which was crazy, because he ended up being from the same area back in the states I was from! Due to the event going on we were able to get a free drink upon purchase of entrywhich was discounted and the party commenced. The plan was actually to only stay there for a bit, but due to the how lively everything was and to Mike's hospitality of course we ended up getting a VIP Table! Stayed there till the end pretty much. Ended up having a blast!!  Would definitely recommend this place. Locals were friendly and there were a couple of foreigners there as well perfect mix. Shoutout to the big home Mike!! Look, this place has a great vibe, but Saturday night at midnight was impossible to move around and get a drink. Lots of locals, good music but just too packed, if there was a way to space it out itd be perfect but just too crowded on weekends to have a good time haha

주소: Dai-Ni Shoei Kaikan, 6-14, 堂山町, ６ 堂山町 北区 大阪市 堂山町 ６－１４ 第２松栄会館1階, Osaka 530-0027, Japan
리뷰:
The night we spent at Grand Slam was by far one of the highlights of our vacation in Osaka.

I'm not much of a drinker or bar hopper, but we wanted to visit an LGBT bar while in Osaka and only had time for one. We spent longer than we should have reading Google reviews, reddit posts, and blogsarticles about all of the bars in Dyamach and the Namba area before we settled on Grand Slam, and we can now echo what everyone else online is saying!

It's a quaint, small bar with maybe 14 seats at the bar and two small tablebooths. I had no problem with my very limited Japanese the bartenders are a delight and the crowd is a great mix of locals and tourists. We made friends from both crowds and got coaxed into singing several songs on the karaoke system.

Super reasonably priced drinks with no attempts at upselling or pouring more than you want. In fact, the one drink I did get was a very generous portion. The owner is super, super kind and even saw us out personally when we were leaving.

I can't recommend Grand Slam enough whenever we visit Osaka again, we're definitely going back! Small but enjoyable karaoke bar. Great atmosphere. Some really awesome regulars.  Cozy, friendly, and nonsmoking bar important to us. We were immediately greeted on entering in Japanese, English, and Spanish. Very helpful and friendly staff that we talked with for a while as the bar filled up and got quite busy. Everyone enjoyed karaoke. Drink prices are very reasonable. We will be going back! Grand Slam is the go to place for hanging out after work on a weeknight or having a great time on the weekend. The bar is small, but once youre in, you dont need to move around except to get to the karaoke machine. The mama is a kind and erotic muscle man who likes to sing too. Ive never had a bad night here. Love this place! Papi and Masa were incredibly kind. The crowd and the atmosphere were friendly. As a tourist and nonJapanese speaker, I felt safe and welcomed. I'll definitely come back here when I visit Japan again.

That said, the music was great and by the time an hour or 2 had passed, it was so packed you could barely squeeze it in there. If you enjoy great atmosphere, positive energy and good music, this is the spot. If youre looking for a huge glitzy Las Vegas style club with snooty people and fake vibes, this aint it. However, I want to revisit this place when I visit Osaka again, but 3rd floor too. I have been here many times in the last 2 weeks and it was a great experience!

Good music, good vibes, and great service!

I would definitely recommend this place! This building is a onestop party destination! On the first floor, theres a sports bar with billiards, and upstairs, you'll find the nightclub. The club is a blast, featuring great music and a handy locker system for storing your belongings. My friend and I had a fantastic time dancing with some locals, communicating through Google Translate! It's a smokingfriendly club, complete with ashtrays on the tables. The cocktail menu was quite good, offering some excellent juices and teas as well. As one of the many foreign residents here, Gala is such a good place to be in. Its fun but I think some of the staff, including the guards and bouncers are the ones whore making a bit of discouragement to people.

I would suggest you to give them more lectures on how to treat people well, they could use their words and give clearer instructions without touching and pushing the people. Some of the bouncers are rude and thats not cool at all. If someone is getting uncontrollable then thats the time they could be more physical. I think they should be more respectful.

Besides that, Gala is fun and it would be nicer if they could give their staff some proper disciplinary lectures. Anyway, shout out to the Japanese staff at the front desk on the first floor who seems to be more mature. Hes nice and respectful. Youre handling your job well! I recently visited Osaka, a trendy bar located in the heart of Osaka. My experience was nothing short of fantastic, thanks to their excellent amenities and vibrant atmosphere.

The first thing that caught my attention was their wellmaintained billiard tables. Whether you're a novice or a seasoned player, you'll enjoy a thrilling game of billiards with friends while sipping on their delicious drinks.

Additionally, their dartboards provided endless entertainment. It was refreshing to see a bar that not only offers traditional pub games but also ensures they are in topnotch condition for patrons to enjoy.

The music selection was on point, creating a lively ambiance that added to the overall experience. From classic tunes to the latest hits, there was something for everyone to groove to.

리뷰:
What can I say we stumbled upon this place in Osaka after struggling to find a bar late night and boy were we happy we did, the owner was amazing we talked about our football team Manchester United, He let us play whatever Reggae music we wanted and he made very good drinks! Will come back here next time I visit Osaka again 1010 it was great having conversations with you thank you. Funniest and nicest BartenderOwner I ever experienced anywhere! Amazing cocktails as well since he creates new signature cocktails with every cocktail he makes. We stayed there for quite while because Roy was just amazingly friendly. You should definitely check it out if you are looking for a fun and different bar experience.   No false advertising with the name, goods time are indeed had here.

Nice sound system, excellent selection of drinks, good sized place not too big, not too small with very friendly clientele, and the bartenderowner much like the other customers, is a real pleasure to deal with.   Had such a good time I couldn't leave 'til closing.  Thank you.   Roy is so welcoming and fun to talk to. He took such good care of us. Definitely reccomend coming to this bar at the beginning of the night to get tips on where to head next. Want and awesome place to chill when in downtown Osaka. You won't go wrong drinking here. Warm welcomes, great selection of drinks and tunes to March.

리뷰:
How this club made it in the top 100 Dj Mag 99 is hard to believe. Sound system very poor, lights poor, dance floor small. Dont waste your time going there. Good music, good dancers, very nice mood... But definitely not worth it... We had to pay 4800 for the entrance  2 drinks, which was not the price indicated on the website or at the entrance of the club 3500 . No explanation or we didn't understand because we're foreign. A bitter feeling of having been scammed... Even if we had fun, we won't come back !
Visited 191122 Its a a good club, service is good but nothing special about this club. You would find many expats there but that is about it. Dance floor is small and nothing compared to Tokyo clubs. My thought on this club. First the good. Visually its the best club in Osaka I have seen. Nice. Professional staff. Good looking clientele. Easy access to the bar. Overall setup is nice.

The bad. its pricey at 3000 yen for male wirh one drink ticketwhatever. My main problem was the mediocre DJ and sub par sound system. All the sound seems to be coming from 2 speakers. Hip hop was the main genre and not many people dancing. kinda crappy.

I would return to give another shot but was slightly disappointed. 16th of August from 2200500 will be doing Latin Party!! music and is Latin and Brazil Funk!!
for guest discount say Osaka Latin Crew at the entrance 2000 with 1drink  1000 with 1drink. For more info please follow us on Instagram osakalatincrew
BEST LATIN PARTY OF OSAKA

리뷰:
My best experience go to Club Night in japan the music sound quality of the audio whas nice event i really drunk on that time Fasho I had a fantastic time celebrating my birthday at this club. The staff was friendly and welcoming, and the music was amazing. If you're visiting from out of town and want to experience a great club, this is a mustvisit spot! The only drawback of the place was the strong smell of smoke. Plays hip hop travisdrake etc and very lively with a good mix of foreigners too. Best club in Osaka in my opinion. Small entry fee 500, and drinks are reasonable. We went on a Thursday around 11 PM
500 yen each for entry.
We were the only customers.
Music 5 stars as I like hip hop and RB.
But difficult to dance to around 11 PM when the place is empty.
It became busier around 1230 PM and atmosphere was great as more people are dancing.
800 yen for a glass of beer and 500 yen for soft drink, 300 yen for mineral water.
I would come back on a weekend around 1AM, if I were younger 
No energy to party after 1 AM 
All clubs in Japan people can smoke so thats one start less . Seems like a good place and reasonable drink prices for a club however we got in at midnight on a Saturday for 500 but it was not busy. Additionally the music was alright very TikTok like if you get what I mean. On the good note the staff was very nice and the bouncers where friendly

주소: 喜久ビル 3F, 6-26 Souemonchō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0084, Japan
리뷰:
This was a nice bar with very friendly staff. The drinks were great, and they were all around 1000 yen. I bought about 89 drinks and a round of shots, and the total bill was only 11000 yen. Theres a massive amount of songs to choose from to sing karaoke, and its very easy to cue up as you select them yourself from a portable tablet. Absolutely nobody cares about your talent level here and will applaud at the end of your song, so even if youre not confident in your voice this is a fun experience. If you like to socialize and sing, this is the place to be. Amazing bar, we had a lot of fun singing the karaoke and even the staff was singing with us. Great evening thanks to that bar! Unexpected nice, really recommended! Prices are fine too. Not too cheap but its a bar after all! Quite literally the greatest bar I've ever been to. Was solo travelling from Australia so didn't know anyone at the bar but I really wanted to sing. The vibes and atmosphere were unmatched. The bartenders made me feel at home and the people were great. Soon enough I made some new friends.

The karaoke is was really sets this bar apart. Don't be afraid to sing, you might just meet some people with the same passion and soul for music. Everyone is there to have fun so don't be afraid to let loose and belt out your favourite song.

One of the greatest nights ever. Billy Joel's piano man is always a good song to sing. Too bad I had a flight back to Australia the next day otherwise you might just spend the entire night at your place!

Highly recommended if you're in Osaka. The Drunken Clam is a must visit bar while in Osaka, the staff is top notch and were very kind and welcoming during my time in the area!

If you get a chance to talk with the owner or any of the bartenders there they are wonderful people and will make sure you enjoy yourself in Dotombori

This is a must stop if you like Karaoke, there is no cover charge, or karaoke charge, it is open mic style so other patrons normally join in to the songs making for very fun and friendly nights

International exchange here is also great! Lots of english speakers come here which can help if youre not comfortable with Japanese but still want to learn more about the area and night life

Highly recommend going around 930pm  1000pm on Fridays and Saturdays to meet more locals in the area who go out for the weekend! Tucked away up a tiny stairwell so look for the sign on the street or above the doorway. Small venue that wasn't too busy, BUT, drinks are watered down or very weak and on the pricey side. Good place to say you went to, with great staff and public Karaoke. Not much Family Guy reference other than some pictures on the wall and figurines. Worth a short visit for a laugh.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−18−２７, Park 10, B1F
리뷰:
The security guards are brutal !! We were waiting for our cab on the street . Security guard  kept pushing us away from our pick up spot . Then choked our female friends neck !! She literally almost passed out ! So Brutal ! And told us they own the block Overall my experience was really bad.
The music was kinda meh, a little bit overpriced and the management of this club is a disaster.
Around 1A.M it gets really crowded and, basically they let anyone in. There were a few times when I thought there would be a man crush! The worst part were the security guards. If you try to take a rest at the side of the dance floor Basically because you can not dance they force you back there! They were completely rude and careless that I would be not surpised is someday something bad happens Probably not the best club, there are better clubs out there. Its mostly full of very young kids trying to mess around. They often lack manners. There are some foreigners and also some creepy and weirdo men, both foreign and Japanese.

However this club seems to be the most crowded these days. Especially at Saturday night which can get too crowded. If you go on the other days, its probably fine unless its a day before holiday. Was discriminated by the club.
First, they took cover charges from girls from our group despite girls were supposed to enter for free for young Japanese girls. I spoke with a local Japanese girl that frequents clubs in Osaka and confirmed that was discrimination.
Second, girls were suppose to drink for free. There was a Girl's All You Can Drink Menu written in Japanese at the bar. Despite not being Japanese, I do understand Japanese. I asked the bartender if I can get the AYCD menu because I am a girl in Japanese. They refuse to honor that and lied to me that it's only for Birthday Girls. Our group happened to have a birthday girl but they also didn't honor that and said her birthday was before midnight.

Foreigners, avoid this club at all costs! They do not welcome foreigners at all... This is not a club for foreigners. Way too crowded, can't really dance freely, good luck trying to reach the smoking zone after 1am its packed as hell... Guys are being treated like trash by the security. Music was good, the dancers and the lights were nice but it was way too crowded to enjoy it for real...

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−12−８ 佐々木ビル
리뷰:
Intimate and cozy karaoke bar with great vibes. Very "foreigner friendly",  a good spot if you're just trying to meet and talk to fellow tourists or just jam out!. I enjoyed the Moonshine cocktail a delicious spiced apple cider type but a wide selection of finer whiskeys and liquors for those interested was available. Joshua was super friendly and seemed to be having just as good a time! My absolute favourite bar in Osaka.

This bar is a must visit if you are interested in some casual karaoke and meeting people from all over the world.

It is very foreignerfriendly and the overall vibe is very welcoming.

The bar has around 8 seats and I believe around 2 standing tables out front, which makes it very cozy and easy to talk to people.

The karaoke is free to use for however long you want after ordering a drink and there is a great happy hour with 500 tap beer available from 1900  2100 I believe.

Overall it is a must visit when visiting Osaka and you are guaranteed to have fun and meet great people there. Small little bar that has a cool chill vibe! My karaoke chops are not good though lol. Owner is definitely cool and I hope to come by there again the next time I'm in Osaka. Visiting from the US, and stopped by the Moonshine Karaoke bar to pregame the night. It was a blast! The bar is super small, but creates an intimate  friendly setting. Song selection is both English  Japanese, so there is something for everyone. We ended up making friends with a travel group with ppl visiting from Australia  UK. Its a cute venue, and there is literally no need to be shy! Grab a drink, grab a mic  have a great time! Cheers!!

The host was a dude who gave us great spots to hit while in Osaka  also while in Thailand our next destination on this trip I've been coming to this bar since around 2017 whenever I come to Osaka. I've always had fun. And today has been no different. Maasa and Alyssa are super nice.
Drinks are very reasonnably priced and the karaoke is great. 100 would recommend.
