리뷰:
Dope club. Service is INCREDIBLE. Workers are all so sweet and kind. Shout out to Soto who took such good care of us! He knew it was my friends birthday and even had a happy birthday banner and a deejay shout out set up for us!

1,000 yen to get in but all you can drink from their list of well drinks. Good vibes. Good music. Spacious. 1000 recommend if youre looking for a great night! Best club in Osaka. Best night club in Osaka for foreigners. Drinks and music are great with super fun atmosphere Foreigners get to drink all night for 7, what?! Fumi was a great host. The music is focused on pop. There are two levels with a main dancefloor in the front, VIP tables along the outside and ladies seating in the middle. The staff works hard to make sure you're having a good time, good vibes all around  amazing vibes and music! i went during a weekday and it was still so much fun and had a lot of people. the staff is super kind, welcoming and they went out of their way to make my birthday an amazing experience here. Ill definitely visit again when Im back in Osaka . Aqesome environment, and 1000 yen for unlimited drinks, definitely come here!

리뷰: I tried to ask for a drink 4 times, 4 different bars. The first bar didn't have tonic for the gin and tonic, I settled for a gin and soda. The second bar didn't have redbull, I had to settle for a drink with passion fruit redbull. The third bar didn't even have vodka. The fourth only had redbull with no sugar not that bad compared to the others, but at that time I was already mad enough. I paid 2500 yen for the entrance, but the service is really poor. They let me in for 2000 yen, gave me a tiny lil half shot of jager, and a drink ticket that i used for a vodka redbull. The place was nice, the vibes were very hip hop  wannabe. Not my thing. Club bunny or annon were the best for dance pop techno, respectively. They had posters on the door that they have a event and online it said they have a event but the place was closed Great club. Always playing nice trance, hard trance, psytrance, etc. Sound is good and drinks are reasonable. Cool club with good Soundsystem and nice Lightshow. They do have 3 different dancefloors.

리뷰:
I had 3 drinks and very happy with all of them. Very unique tastes and flavors and even an Osaka version of a drink Bisco Sour that highlights a famous local cookie.   There is an extensive offering of whiskies for those that like.  Apparently some very limited bourbon is also available.

Was tricky to find with a dark hidden door next to Cool Beyond thats easy to miss in evening, but it is on the Main Street right next to it.

Highly recommend! One of the few cocktail bars that you MUST visit when in Osaka. Great selections of drink with great knowledgeable staff along with a great vibe. From what I saw on the menu it seems like they do make non alcoholic drinks so even if you dont drink alcohol you can still drink and have a good relaxing time. Very cool Osaka speakeasy bar experience.  Nice place to chill and te try different cocktails. Friendly bartenders that speak English. Highly recommend if you want picture worthy drinks that taste as good as they look. The ambience  drinks was 
It has a rule of 1 drink per hour, so you need to drink quickly. Its perfect for a quick drink, but not suitable for slow drinkers or those wanting to catch up with friends for a long conversation This place is a hidden gem. Unique in atmosphere and impeccable service from staff. Cocktails are sublime, and each stylistically beautiful. Would recommend the Bonnie and Clyde as an elevated espresso martini and the Mr Hendricks was absolutely exquisite.

리뷰:
This bar is easy to find and very fun. It's foreignerfriendly and full of people from all over the world. The ambiance is super chill, and the drinks are good. My friends and I got to add our names to the wall, and that makes for great memories and fun stories of a crazy night out. Great bar, with very friendly bar staff.  Music and atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for after walking all day through Dotonbori area! Great find. Good international bar with good mix music. Amazing vibe and bar tender. Owner is also sweet. Must visit for a good time. We stayed till 4am! Its open till 5am! Cheers If you are from out of town and not familiar with Osaka come to this bar. You'll love it and meet people from all over the world. Great vibes, even better music, great bartenders. You'll make friends and just have a place to enjoy what Osaka is about.  Unity and one love. Thank you Crystal Bar for showing so much love. See you soon Fun place. Happy people. Life is beautiful
with people like them. I will definetly come  back again. Please come and have fun

주소: Higashi Shinsaibashi, Chuo-ku, Osaka 2-4-21 Tamayacho Galaxy Building No.2, B1 ２丁目-４ 東心斎橋 中央区 大阪市 大阪府 542-0083, Japan
리뷰:
Quiet night when we went but nevertheless the good music kept pumping and we made a couple new friends. A little hard to find but an awesome spot to kick off your night out. Good prices too. Had a great time here. A good sense of belonging, certainly a home away from home. A beautiful community you have here. Good music and positive vibes. Keep up the good work Anyemi. One of the best place to Party in Osaka
Pita is the best!!! Thank you for the great time
I will definitely come again on my next trip Honestly, it's really fun, and both the people and staff are incredibly welcoming. There's a nice mix of nationalities there. I'd definitely recommend it if you want to dance on afro beats without breaking the bank. Super great bar! It always feels like family when we come through! The drinks are good! The music is great! They play a mix of reggae, hip hop and rap! They have darts and other games. I love this bar. Me and my boyfriend go every week. Visit if you have the chance to in Osaka

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−9−５ 3F
리뷰: Very chill bar with good vibes, it's on the 3rd floor of the building and can be a bit hard to find. Very small cover charge but the drink is good and the owner is cool and speak a little bit of english. Definitely a place to check out. A very unique experience. With a very friendly staff behind the bar. It might seem a little sketchy at first but then you're welcomed by room of lights and and tubes that are lit up giving a psychedelic experience while also drinking a very nice cocktail. Such a cool bar, at first its pitch black when you enter do not be intimidated. As you buy some drinks the bartender turns on the neon lights, and the experience begins. The atmosphere was awesome and talking to the bartender was a great experience. Honestly this was one of the biggest highlights of my trip coming here, I highly recommend. First time I stepped in, I was little scared because of darkness. But it's worth it if you are looking for relaxing space. Yes, it's somehow relaxing despite of bar name and darkness. The seat charge is 3bucks, pretty cheap for normal Japanese bar. There's no menu. Drinks are little bit pricy but worth it. It can feel odd walking in if the lights are off, but once youre there the owner is very nice and makes some interesting cocktails. He also makes an effort to make conversation in English and has good recommendations for sightseeing. This is one of the most unique bars in Japan and if youre looking for that Burning Man vibe, youll find it here.

주소: 2-chōme-4-6 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
If theres any place to go to in Japan for bars and the best vibe in town, it would be Subterra!
I cant recommend it enough. Its a place where youll make new friends and by the time you look up four hours have passed by. Truly one of a kind place. Highly recommend for anyone coming to Japan not to OSAKA! Its not even the drinks itself that are good,  which they are! but its the owner deuce that makes it such a chill vibe and really makes an effort to really get to know you! I I can see why its flourishing so much and Im assuming itll be 10 times as big in no time! If theres any reason to come in Japan, it would be this bar. This is a great little funky basement bar right in the Dotonbori area.  There is an excellent selection of specialty cocktails, as well as more conventional drinks, draft beer, etc.  All four specialty cocktails that we tried were really good.  The space itself is fantastic, aesthetically speaking, with interesting art at every turn.  The staff was super friendly and helpful as well.  A DJ was just setting up as we were leaving so we didn't experience that, but the music that was being played the whole time we were there was great. Cool basement bar in Dotonbori. Very reasonable prices, and compared to other bars we had tried the drinks sizes were fair. Some bars in Osaka serve smaller drinks for these prices. Good cocktails and nice positive attitude with the service. The atmosphere is nice and its easy to meet new friends at the bar. No service charge and definitely foreigner friendly. Good cocktail list and some interesting house specials. Definitely worth a visit. Awesome cocktail bar along Dotonburi! Deuce and his team do an incredible job on taste, presentation and vibe. They'll even do an Omakase style drink where you tell them what you like and they'll make up a drink for you. Highly recommend visiting here if you're in Osaka, you will not regret it. My go to bar in Osaka. Known Deuce for nearly a decade. Deuce and his staff make one of the best cocktails including his feature of the old classic old fashion into his own intake of it called the Shinsekaithe new world. The vibe is super chill and this place is really nice. Both for the locals and for tourist. If your ever in the area I highly recommend going here and you will not be disappointed. Not only is he a local expat in Osaka he knows other great spots ShinsaibashiAmemura and other parts of the fun Dotonbori. Ask him about why he's so passionate about his goals and so forth. You will never meet such a kind and open dude ever in Japan. My favorite go to drink was the bye bye birdie, but honestly if he's not too busy ask him for a custom cocktail and it will blow your minds out of your chair!

THE BAR, social and talkative bartenders, playing games and good old Funky music. CBD drinks. Amazing place with good karaoke and great bartenders! A warm recommendation from me Very nice place to have a drink 
friendly staff and good music from the 80's, good atmosphere with karaoke Most FUN night we had in Osaka! Bartenders were a blast and we sang karaoke all night! So thankful that this place introduced me to some local Japanese friends. Cant wait to come back for more fun karaoke nights!!! Strong drink, friendly staff and the Japanese definitely take their karaoke seriously.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−6−１７ マリオビル5F
리뷰:
If youre seeking a cocktail bar thats truly a haven for imagination and the creation of taste, look no further. The beauty of this place is that you dont need to study the menujust share your preferences, and let the talented staff craft a drink that suits you perfectly. As someone who doesnt drink alcohol, I was thrilled by the care and creativity they put into their mocktails. Ive never had anything quite as delicate and refined before Really!.

Id recommend this bar to everyone, regardless of whether you drink alcohol or not. The only downside is that it gets quite crowded later in the night, but the service remains impeccable. The waitstaff handled everything with ease, ensuring we were well taken care of. Ill definitely be coming back, though I might aim to arrive a bit earlier next time to enjoy the experience without the crowd. The speakeasy lives up to the reviews! The bartenders were all so welcoming, had one of my favourite cocktails ever! Certainly wont the visit! It does get quite busy, so best to get there early! This speakeasy is on the 5th floor! Just take the elevator up and you should be there. There is a sign outside the door that you should be careful not to break their expensive glass or you would be charged!

It's relatively small and you have to dunk to get through a small door. We sat at the bar and the bartenders knew English. It seems like most of the customers were tourists.

We asked for their signature drinks and tried them. One was coffee flavored and the other is their version of an old fashion. They were both very good and surprisingly strong! 4 of us got 2 drinks each 14,000 yen total, VERY reasonable based only on our personal tastes they made drinks that blew us all away. We struggled to even leave because the ambience and drink were so good. They do nothing fast so don't be in a rush. Also no clinking glassware since it's so delcate and expect someone to be smoking cuz it's not banned here. They speak English, it's mostly foreigners maybe because great cocktails aren't a big thing in Japan?. Would 100 come back repeatedly if I could. This is such a cool place. The bartenders are very welcoming and friendly. You just have to tell them the flavour profile or alcohol base you want and they will create you something based on that. I mentioned I liked the Japanese plum wine and they made a cocktail just like it, maybe better. Another time I said something spicy, with no other restrictions and it was one of the best spicy drinks I've had to date. Will be back if we can!

리뷰:
Nice vibe. Would be awesome if there was more people. Had an awesome chat with the bartender too. Really welcoming! I will be visiting again! Ive been going to Rock Rock since 2005, and wont make a trip to Osaka without stopping in!

The staff are incredible, and the tunes are always cranked. You can spend hours looking at the wall of pics from the bands that have been in over the years, and the way its spoken about  youd assume the bar was ten times the size. Amazing atmosphere and one of the worlds true great rock bars. Kampai!  What a great gem in Osaka. Thanks to Yoko and the entire RockRock crew for making it an awesome experience.

The music is great, drinks are reasonably priced and the atmosphere is so friendly.

Also, thanks for the suggestions of the bars in Shinjuku, Tokyo! I had a great time.  Fun bar with lots of photos of all the famous people that have been there in the past. Had a nice local whisky Small bar in Osaka with so much Rock and Roll history you'll need more than 1 night to take it all in.
Yoko speaks English and has so much Rock knowledge you'll leave a greater person than when you arrived.
Very nice people and frequently any touring band will already be there. Great music. Good times always!

리뷰:
A great place were you can see many rock bands and more! As punk as it gets. Good music, fun crowd.
Warning this place is loud. LOUD loud. This can be taken as a compliment or a criticism, but in any case I would definitely advise bringing earplugs. Great music, very interesting bands, but very small and crowded. No sitting space, and smoking is allowed. Great evening with a friendly crowd Honestly one of the worst clubs I've ever attended. Sound system is absolutely horrible, and the price 2500Y is a complete ripoff. I'm not sure what these other reviewers are talking about, but their sound system is absolutely awful, coming from a soundstage professional working on major projects Coachella, Lightning in a Bottle, Burning Man, etc. for over 20 years. Not a big club but lots kind of great party going on weekend. You can meet nice local people and have great time. One of the best small club DJ bar in Osaka. I love it!

주소: 5F, 2-chōme-4-4-8 Higashishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0083, Japan
리뷰:
Just two words  love it. Keep doing what you are doing, Chris and other cofounder of.this wonderful bar that epitomises the spirit of a good oldfashioned barpub where the bartender is friendly and welcoming and everyone talks to everyone. Wonderful experience for our first night in Osaka! Good bar if youre into rock and metal music! Hidden oldschool rockbar run by Americans.
Taking the elevator takes you directly there.

Nice interior, cold beer and rockmetal music  what else do you need?

A lot of international guests here. What an awesome place! Walked in and immediately welcomed! They love some good old punk rock and other great tunes! Highly recommend! Although it was smaller than I expected, the vibe inside was fun and kind of cozy. Quite narrow and has fun music but not too overwhelming. They had taco Tuesday which I recommend because they were pretty delicious, went well with a cold Asahi beer

This is definitely the place to be for karaoke night! Lovely little bar in Osaka with great service. Sorin, the owner always made sure we had a drink and glasses of water for those not drinking and was friendly and accommodating. Would highly highly recommend coming here if you want a good night out with good songs and great company! Amazing bar located on the 4th floor! The drinks are affordable and tasty, and the staff there is very friendly. There's Karaoke and darts too! Pretty good place with good atmosphere
Staff are really professional and friendly
We can play darts and do karaoke inside
Its a bar i can easily recommend for my friends The staff here are always so fun and welcoming. This bar has everything you could ask for in Osaka party street! Karaoke, atmosphere and great prices. Check it out for intimate, memorable vibes  Great night. Normal prices and a lot of fun. Darts, Shisha, Cigars, very good cocktails and the staff is amazing.

리뷰:
Went there with some people we met from our hostel. It was 2000yen for men and 1000yen for women all you can drink nomihodai. The music was okay, live DJs. Drank way too much that night I couldn't even hit on my date anymore and I blew it lmao.
Couldn't tell you the guygirl ratio at this music bar cause I got too drunk.
Great all you can drink venue tho.  Wrist bands let you go to family Mart for smokes and a famichiki and come back to keep drinking. It's a pretty nice club. Say Ghost for discounted price. The staff are very nice. Cover charge of 500 yen enforced on a quiet night. Expensive drinks and inattentive staff. Rudeness aside, seems a bit pretentious. It's pretty bad... just being honest. Terrible service, they say they had Shishi but to be honest that was coal. They made me smoke coal.

Can't go back there with a straight face.

Oh and they didn't have beer, say they ran out!!! WHICH BAR DOESNT HAVE BEER

Never again!! Hard to rate it. If you speak Japanese, would give 5 stars. If you are a foreigner, I do not recommend. Staff doesn't really speak English, neither does the crowd

리뷰:
A great bar with great heavy music and friendly staff as well as a good selection of drinks. The draft beer on tap, Yebisu, is always a good start and there are non alcohol options as well. As befitting the music the design is dark and befitting the music. I had a great time meeting people and will definitely visit again. Superb Gothic metal rock bar.  Great friendly service and great drinks.  Make sure to pick up a Tshirt while you're there, awesome graphic design. A must visit place for any metal enthusiast. Kind and welcoming host, good drinks, great music, great atmosphere. What else would a metalhead ask for? Awesome space, very cool small gothic bar with great cocktails and a lovely welcoming bartender. Definitely coming back and recommending to mates If youre looking for a real Metal Bar in Osaka, you HAVE TO go to Midian
They have a good atmosphere and good beer

주소: Japan, 〒542-0082 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Shimanouchi, 1-chōme−18−８ ビルドアップ長堀橋ビル B1＆B2
리뷰:
Been there a few times. Once they charged me 15,000 entrance fee because I was a foreigner, and I had no idea until I checked my credit card the next day LOL

G2 is a good place to keep the party going a bit longer since most clubs close at 45am and G2 is open until 8am. Its not as good as your major clubs like Bambi but you cant expect too too much from a club like this at 58am. Nice place to have an after, open from 5am. The traditional night is you start at the giraffe at 10, then go the G3 until 5 then to the G2 from 5 and you have to pay only 1 time for all of these clubs and you can use your free Fri is in each one of them. Many people, mostly Japanese, 5050 girls and guys. The only bad point is the music. It's the same in all of these 3 clubs EDM.... One security guard in particular by the name of Musashi ruined the night. Very unprofessional and appeared to come to work looking for a fight. He had an altercation with my friend. Instead of appropriately retraining my friend, he pushed him down the stair and held him on the ground and punched him. We took our friend outside and was about 200m away speaking to another guard about retrieving some of stuff from the lockers and being polite and respectful. Musashi decided to walk out and approached us outside again just to fight my friend. Instead of doing his job and protecting the people inside or the club. My prospective is that he was very unprofessional, use of unreasonable force to restrain my friend appropriately, and trying to fight my friend outside even though we left the premise. this club is a good place, super crowed at 4am or 5am. I'm only giving 1 star because this member of security Musashi. I don't like to name and shame but this was my experience in g2. A bit small and confusing layout with little dance space, but great place to head to towards the early morning when everything else is closing down. Mostly a young college crowd. Small dance floor, but one of the only places open early morning for a good after. Good atmosphere, nice place to check out

리뷰: This place was the highlight of my Japan trip. If you love music oldies, city Pop, rock, reggae, and whatever falls inbetween, this is your place. Owner, Wataru, is a gem, establishment is a vibe, drinks and bar snacks were oishii delicious. If you are looking for good music, this place is for you. A million thanks for the experience here Has to be close to my favourite bar in four weeks of travelling Japan. Awesome selection of records, inexpensive drinks, all served by an awesome very cool host in a run down old art deco bank building. A must visit. everything is just perfect. remember me Im the red hair girl who listens to Amy Winehouse I will come back whenever I visit Osaka Great place for quirky local cocktails. Music is incredible. What a vibe The atmosphere of the bar was very cozy and welcoming. The bartenders were very friendly and loves interacting with tourists. The house cocktails were also creative and refreshing.

리뷰: Did this crawl both Friday and Saturday during my stay in Osaka. Ryan, Lena, and Tommy are all incredible hosts and ensured everyone was having a great time. Will definitely do this again if Im ever back in Osaka. Absolute legend. Ryan and Lena run the show, they make it so easy to get around. Ryans been 11 years as a host so he knows what he is doing! If you need a good night out then go for it Ryan and Lena is such a great tour guide. They have something going on here. I highly recommend it if your going to Osaka. Drinks are free and the crowd is very sociable  I had the greatest time. So happy I joined. Ryan and Lena were amazing! I love Leva so much!! Highly recommend. Ryan, Tommy and Brandon were absolutely amazing tonight and I have a lot of fun with them. Definitely a bar trip to do if u want to hang out in Osaka !

리뷰:
I went here for a quick drink just around 530 PM. Turns out they have a happy hour before 7PM that all drinks are 100 off. I got myself a pia colada and it was perfect. They have a pool table here and I would like to go visit again A very nice little bar, great food, good people and a really great place to relax, have some good food and drinks. An awesome band plays really good music on the weekends. Staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. The bar food menu choices are great and have a lot to choose from and prepared well. Will visit again for sure. Spent 3.5 hours there, and it felt like an hour. Also if you fancy playing pool, they got that as well, but be prepared to be good at it though Amazing place in Osaka!
If you want to go some where you feel welcome when you miss home a little check this place out! Great cold beer with a good selection and good food !
Staff are awesome and look for Kevin great guy makes you feel like long time friend! And shout to Jesse and Allen! Everyone working in the bar is really nice. Karen is really cool, friendly and fun! She always remembers my favorite drink I love herrrrrr!
Good place to go with friends or even alone. Youll meet many Japanese and international people. The atmosphere is always amazing and sometimes they have live music. Excellent atmosphere, drinks, and food! Even I just like coming here to have dinner. I've tried the fish and chips, pizza, and calamari, and they were all excellent.

I like to get the apple cider. And they have imported drinks on tap at good prices. Owner and staff are all really cool.

I went here many times when I was in Osaka. I will come again when I return to the city!

이름: PC and Retro Bar Space Station
주소: 2-chōme-13-3 Nishishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0086, Japan
리뷰:
Really nice to be if you are a gamer . The bar is small but the atmosphere is really nice. The drinks are a bit sweet for my taste but they have really funny names. The person at the bar speaks english and he is really friendly. You can play old videogames while having a drink and chill. Super fun experience Fun bar! Drinks are really cheap 800 yen each and delicious and theres loads of retro games to play. Would 100 recommend. A brilliant fun and foreigner friendly bar with so many retro video games and all for free! All the crew spoke English and were enthusiastic to chat and get people involved with games.

A very long list of unique game based cocktails and draft beer makes it a brilliant late night spot. Not tons of space so on busy nights prepare to hover for a bit, but plenty of multiplayer games to choose from to help break the ice in the city! Fun tiny bar with welcoming staff and a bunch of retro consolesgames.

We planned on passing by for a quick drink but got stuck in there having fun playing games until they closed.

Its a pretty small space so consider the timing of your visit if you prefer sitting down.

Even if you are not able to grab a seat, there is a dedicated space for you to play some consoles standing up which was also fun.

Dont expect premium alcohol. Im a massive retro gamer and this place felt like it would tick all the boxes. However, the guy working behind the bar was the most unhelpful barman ever. Far more interested in flirting with a couple of the single travellers than helping other customers. Games are free and the beer is beer. I wouldnt go back after this which is a real shame.

리뷰:
Japanese only prejudice establishment This grand cabaret was founded in 1932 and has been loved by customers for 87 years.You can play with peace of mind with clear accounting and safe rates. At Miss Osaka, approximately 200 ladies are waiting for your visit. The entrance fee is 3,500 yen, and if you want to nominate a girl you like, the nomination fee is 2,550 yen. miss osaka
It has been operating since 1933 as the grand cabaret lounge in Minami Namba, Osaka.

A while back, I was at a preview screening of a certain drama on cable TV? I went with something like that.
It seems that this kind of box is also used for events, but the usual business is cabaret  There are no cabarets in Tokyo anymore, so this is a valuable Showa heritage. A veteran hostess will take care of you

You can enjoy it at a reasonable price.
It's like traveling back in time to the Showa bubble era.

I used it with my companion at an afterparty.
It was a pleasure to guide you.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0002 Osaka, Kita Ward, Sonezakishinchi, 1-chōme−3−８ ぐらんぱれ壱番館 4階
리뷰:
Had a very good time great choreography by the girls, and  a very fun show. Was a very welcoming place reason for me not rating the food is that I basically didn't eat much smoking is only at the entrance, so shouldn't be a big problem for those who dislike cigarettes, and still available for those who smoke so you don't have to go all the way out to the street. I couldnt get the normal enjoyment plan for two shows but the VIP ticket was available so I booked it. When the bill came the extra 2000 per pax table charge applied for each show. I thought its 2000 per pax for both shows. And on top of that there is an additional 25 surcharge for VIP seats. Ended paying 30k plus instead of 20k plus for 2 pax. I went for both shows because I read reviews that each show is different. Yes they are. But its the same girls doing different dance items so they are similar. My advice is go book for one show and then decide if you want to stay for another show. It may be more expensive but at least you know what you are getting before committing. Wow, this place is a party!
The girls are very cool and friendly. They made us Americans feel very welcome too!

The dancing was incredible and so was the music. The singing was seriously awesome! One of the girls was like a rock star, her voice was 1010. I'm definitely coming back next time I'm in Osaka! Before the show I was not sure if the show was worth the money. I don't want to spoil anything, but I was laughing the entire time. It was the ultimate blend of really hot girls and quirky japanese segments. 10 out of 10. I've been to Tokyo Burlesque several times, so I visited Osaka Burlesque wondering what kind of level of business it was in.
There were many attractive dancers and the atmosphere was great, so I had a lot of fun.
It would be nice if you could choose your seats like in Tokyo.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0026 Osaka, Kita Ward, Kamiyamachō, 8−１４ 1st /Ground Floor 日宝東阪急レジャービル 1階 Down the corridor left of Bar Rise
리뷰:
This is one of the first bars that came up when we searched for fun gay bars in the area and we went to check it out. Its SO COLORFUL even from the outside! Came in as a group and it was pretty busy Friday night. Flashy and splashes of color everywhere inside. The cute cat boy bartender was awesome! Made us feel so welcome that we ended up staying longer. Definitely worth a visit in your nighttime travels! This is a very nice, tiny, quirky kitschy bar with a very good range of alcohol.  As with with all the other bars in this area, the booze is pricey because the place is small and therefore profit margins are relatively small.
I arrived very early in the evening, so the place was empty I paid Y1000 for a small beer.
Mine Australian Host was friendly  knowledgeable, having lived here for 30 years.
I introduced myself on departure. He informed me that We dont tend to exchange names here or words to that effect. The adorable, resident little rather vociferous dog, however, does allow the use of his name. Unfortunately, I cannot recall what it is Visited twice during a trip to Osaka.  Received a warm welcome from the owner Sully and his assistant bartender Amos the daschund.  Decor is wild with plenty going on to keep you interested, the theme even extends into the toilet!

Wide range of spirits available as well as beers and Saki. No cover charge and prices are reasonable.

Met a number of other tourists there during both visits and Sully was a wonderful host, encouraging conversation between solo travellers, locals and groups visiting.

Music can be whatever you want it to be as they will take requests and Karaoke was a hit with the locals.

Definitely stop by and support this bar during your visit to Osaka. No cover charge though the individual price for the beer we had was a bit steep. Had a really nice conversation with both staff members available on the day! Just a very chill vibe despite both of us not really matching the demographic of the other people there. Great Place to Enjoy in Doyama!

Ive always started my Doyama party nights here and have sometimes ended up back here later on.

Not sure about the few 1star reviews but they seem to be from people who dont understand that people in Japan carry around their own trash until they get home or stumble on a proper place to dispose of it as opposed to walking into a tiny bar and shoving your trash into the owners face so that deserves 1star.

Or people who do NOT drink in tiny Japanese bars with cover charges and more expensive prices because thats the way it is in Japan.  You dont get charged a cover here but the drinks are very similar to other places so those 1star complaints are meaningless.  Probably the 711 tourists who only eat and drink convenience store products.

I have done nighttime bar tours for years in Kyoto and sometimes added a night with cool clients to meet up in Osaka after their time in Kyoto and 100 of them had fun here.

Id say if anything, this bar is cluttered like my moms house with every decoration she has ever bought.  Im a crazy neatfreak and this bar is far, far, far from anything filthy.  Its a bar!?  And guys stand up in the toilet.  If you see some splatter at 1 a.m. its not the owners fault.  Its so dark in there so Im not sure if these complainers are sporting white gloves and running them across the tops of shelves or across countertops because its not filthy.  Its funny that these same people complaining will walk into the most disgusting, disheveled pigsty of a bar in Kyto and think its the most unique and adorable place if a Japanese man who is the same age as the owner of this place and think they have hit this amazing cultural exchange experience and never think twice when there are cockroaches on the walls.  There are MANY cool bars with cockroaches in Japan. I see them on my tours.

It used to get very smoky in this bar but that happens in EVERY tiny bar.

Dont listen to the 1star review people.

I dont even know the owners name.  He recognizes my face but Im usually there months later and not really a regular customer so Im not being asked to say all of this.

I have former clients going to Osaka and two friends from Madrid, Spain heading there this month and wanted to forward the name and location to them and saw the ignorant reviews.

I 100 agree with one of the 1star review people who said Grand Slam is fun and welcoming.  Thats my second stop after this place on an Osaka party night.  Both bars are great.

Is it Denny?  Danny?  Now thats going to bother me.  I should know his name after 9 years in Kyto.  lol

이름: Milk Bar ミルクバー Record Bar レコードバー
주소: 1-chōme-6-23-4F Higashishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0083, Japan
리뷰: Wife and I were fortunate to be let in  occupy the last two seats available on a Wednesday night, the last night of our honeymoon. It was on my bucket list of todos while in Japan. Music selection was pristine, and the speakers  surrounding atmosphere really entranced us. The bartenderDJ must also maintain the vibe and high quality experience of the sound, and that may mean not allowing certain people in, even if it isnt full. Its a small, but intentional, space. We were very grateful to be permitted entry as obvious tourists. Great cocktails  a wonderful night that we wont forget. By far the most unique experiences Ive had in Japans bar scene. People keep saying its the vinyl records, but actually its the quality of the speakers that takes you back in time. Absolutely must visit while in Osaka. dont be surprised if the Bartender whos also the d.j and the bouncer denies your entrance. I watched him for the entire night trying to figure out why he rejected more than 80 of walkins  couldnt figure it out. I guess its his show. Might be the best bar in Osaka if you want to chill and listen to music. The owner is a real artist in his music selection and skills to make cocktails. Its really small and intimate which makes it even more special. He has a huge collection of vinyls, mainly jazz I would guess. Its giving 90s Japanese Bar and we loved it! Never gonna forget this one Intimate music bar with a fine audio system and huge LP collection, style much like a classic jazz kissa ... but was all about Jack Johnson on our visit! For a actual jazz hit the nearby Bar Nakumara, which is also cheaper and friendlier. This bar is small and very cozy. It had great music, and the prices were reasonable. I recommend going, but for groups of no more than three people.

주소: Jumbo Bldg, 5F, 2-chōme-1-13 Higashishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0083, Japan
리뷰: Had a great evening here. The place is small but with a great atmosphere. They got karaoke and we had a fantastic time singing our favourite songs. The bar tenders even joined and put on the smoke machine. Great night. My buddy and I came across this bar while looking online and boy we werent disappointed. We planned to go bar hopping but we ended up going back 3 night in a row and each time we made new friends. It had an amazing atmosphere with Richard hyping up the crowd and Chris providing vocals if you cant hit the notes. Dont be afraid to sing a song because the whole bar will join you! The drinks are cheap and its a good place to chill and also meet new people. Recommend to come here if youre in Osaka alone or in a group. Ill definitely be back when I visit Osaka again thank you Chris and Richard for your hospitality.  Izzy Richards created a special spot here that I will be coming back to every time Im in Osaka. Amazing vibes, great drinks at great prices, always meet great people there I went twice while in Osaka for the week. There is also no charge fee or fee for the karaoke, he really has just made a place you can go to for a guaranteed good time. Cheers Richard  One of my favorite places in Osaka. Amazing little place to wind down the night... or maybe wind it up if you're a night owl. "Friendly" doesn't do the staff and owner justice, so do yourself a favor and add it to your must visit list. It was such a special experience. We had a great night at the Kama Sutra Karaoke Bar. Came in following a recommendation from a local tour guide and absolutely loved the place.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0085 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Shinsaibashisuji, 2-chōme−1−３２, Is・・・, 3F
리뷰:
Such a cool bar! I opted to sit at the counter seat for extra, and it was totally worth it. I was too early for the show, but the casual tricks they were doing were great. Instagramworthy cocktails and they cater to aesthetic, as well as noticing when you are taking pictures of the cocktail theyre making. Theyll move whatever is in the way so you can get a good photo which is super nice and much appreciated, especially since it wasnt even my drink! I wouldve stayed for more drinks, but this was the second cocktail bar I visited and I didnt want to get too drunk by myself. The hostess was so friendly as well, by walking with me out of the bar and calling the elevator and I appreciated her kindness and hospitality. If youre in Osaka you have GOT to come to this place. The staff are just phenomenally friendly, attentive and all round brilliant. Honestly the best display of service Ive ever seen, and we went to universal yesterday . The cocktails were out of this world and, as the name suggests, they have a library of spirits that they make IN HOUSE! At the weekend they even have a cocktail show at the bar. Honestly, just come! AMAZING!! Amazing cocktails made with an entertaining flourish. Sit at the bar if you can to watch the making. Highly recommend the Lemon Tart cocktail. The service was top notch and the drinks were really good too! Everything on the menu was so pretty and delicious! Every drink was really good and its nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle. Must go on Osaka! Cant go wrong with this place!
Ryoya, Ryosuke and Takechanman were our bartenders. Great crew that brought a lot of fun vibes! Amazing experience!
One of the best cocktails bar we had in Osaka!
Price was ok but the cocktails were amazing, perfectly made. Staff were nice.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−1−１０ 松宮ビル 1階
리뷰: Best bar I've ever been to. Anthony is top notch, did everything in the best possible way. I blacked out in the toilet by 4am, woke up the next day when the guys had already opened the place. A huge thank to Junior and that goth girl Ayla for letting me sleep it off. The cocktails are great, especially Sergei's special. All my love, not Sergei. Amazing bar for a night out in Osaka! Was vising Osaka with some friends from London and we honestly had the best time ever. Drinks are super cheap 500 each and the bartenders are very friendly. If you ask them super nicely they might even play 4 of your favourite songs ... Would recommend and will be coming back again if I'm ever back in Osaka despite the raging hangover the next morning  Hopped by here a few times on a long holiday. Surprised after coming to Osaka so many years that I only just discovered the place. Friendly English speaking staff, clear accounting of prices. Good spot to chat to other people. I absolutely love this place. Anthony is such a great host. The drinks were superb, and I can't recommend this place enough to anyone. Every time I come to Osaka from now on, I will make a visit to this wonderful establishment. Thank you, Anthony, for the hospitality and the great recommendation on what to do next on my vacation here in Japan. An awesome vibe to say the least, great staff and cheap drinks, cant ask for anything more. If your an Aussie, it makes you feel like your at home  1010 would drink here again.

주소: 2-chōme-2-3 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
Came one night after bar hopping and it was a good time. Good DJ playing some dancehall. Also lost my phone that night and I was able to retrieve it the next day when they opened. I felt safe and it was a fun memory . never come to this bar. I have been to many bars and clubs in Osaka but this is the most worst bar ever, all the staff are thieves,  especially when you drop your wallet or something here, they will take it and pretend they don't know.. Should be renamed hell. Rampant with thieves, drink spikers, and bouncers that are completely unaware and sometimes complicit in the nefariousness. Avoid this late night club if you value your dignity and health. Be very careful of this place. Fun bar when you're wasted, however theft is rampant. I lost an item last Friday night after leaving it in a corner for a few minutes.

Owner was not overly helpful when I asked about my stolen items and returned the next day. I'm not sure I would go again. First time having anything stolen in Japan. Be careful is all I will say, do not leave anything out in the open and do not take anything valuable here whatsoever. Open late but dangerous place.  Thieves steal from bags.  Staff will take your full drink from the table if you don't watch carefully.  Many fights so many security staff.  Dirty toilet, vomiting.  I met some nice customers though and it seems like a popular place.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−16−１３, Hosen Building, 1階
리뷰:
What a Great night!

I found out about the ROR Comedy Club while searching for things to do in Osaka. We rocked up to the venue a little too early but were greeted with a cool little bar with cheap cocktails, so we were set. The guys eventually welcomed us down stairs to an intimate little setting where the comedy took place. A mixed group of audience members from all around the world sat eagerly wondering what we had in store. We were not disappointed and experienced a great night of comedy that had us all laughing. Definitely recommend this to English speaking travelers who are looking for something more mainstream to do in Osaka at night.
Thanks for a great memorable night. We will be sure to attend again next time we are in Osaka. Fun nighttime activity to do in Osaka if you dont drink. Plan to come early because its at dinner time but afterwards you can explore Dotonburi since its conveniently located next to it. I wish there were more Japanese comedians that were born in Japan. Most of the people have lived in Japan for a significant amount of time. Not as vulgar as New York City, which is nice. Highly recommend. Comedians performed in English. Had an amazing time here during my first night in Osaka. The acts had me laughing so hard I was tearing.

Some things to note
Cost was very fair.
Drinks were great.
The venue was very cozy, allowing a lot of opportunities to engage with the audience. Definitely recommend! Had a great time. Saw 4 comedian and they were all good and friendly, the place is not too big so there's interaction between everyone creating a nice vibe.
Good place to spend your evening if you have no plans in Osaka. Very intimate show, but loved it! Literally and figuratively underground, good fun, great atmosphere, good English, great discovery in Osaka. And food  drinks that taste good and are easy on the budget.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−7−２０ サザンパレスビル 6F
리뷰: It's a hit or miss place tbh. The first time I went it was absolutely amazing! I had so much fun dancing with other people. The music was great as well as the lights. I loved seeing the pole dancers! The second time I went there was hardly anyone a Saturday night so no atmosphere. The drinks here are pretty good. The staff is incredibly friendly. A good place to go if you can speak English and no Japanese. This place is recommended by a lot of folks in Osaka. I hope to comeback again and with any luck on a busy night Over 50's club including the djs, and too many guys and a few burnt out singles. Some nice pole dancing but do not go for the music. Entrance seems a bit pricey for what you're getting. You'd be better off visiting one of the trendy clubs in the vicinity. It's one of the better nightclubs I've been to in Osaka. While the venue isn't huge there's a huge dance floor and decently priced drinks. I recommend that you go here on a Friday or Saturday since it's fairly empty the rest of the week compared to other places. Staff were helpful and gladly assisted in showing me how the lockers near the entrance worked. I would say the experience was just ok... It's a bit of a grimey bar with many foreigners, prawling around trying to hit on girls... Two pole bars with heavily tattooed bikini clad girls twirling around. Not a big club, yet still pretty busy at 23 am. Most drinks 700 yen which i think is reasonable. Music was mainstream pop made electro so usually good to dance to and sing along. Probably would not go again though, from my first impression Osaka has better places to go. Sam and Dave used to be the club where people used to enjoy all different kinds of music on the same night.  And now most of the djs on big nights are playing only dark hip hop.  The management needs to bring back the original Sam and Dave style international party

리뷰: I came in and tired to have conversation several times. When there were two Japanese girls came, the boss moved there and left me there. This place is definitely not friendly for foreigners. Very friendly place, handsome owner and welcoming to foreigners. I ended up singing karaoke with everyone at the bar until 2 am. What a fun night with really nice people. Very nice drinks!! Friendly boss and nice staff I had an amazing experience at this bar. The host is very friendly and handsome, drinks are very good too. I speak no Japanese and had no problems because the host speaks very good English. I would totally recommend this place and will make sure to visit if I happen to be back in Osaka. The staff is super friendly and the owner speaks English and Japanese so that helps! Great place for a groovy drink

주소: Japan, 〒542-0084 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Souemonchō, 2−３, Mimatsu Bld., 2F
리뷰: I enjoyed an evening at Magic Bar Eleven, where 5,000 covered freeflowing drinks and frontrow seats to Magician Masa's mesmerizing performances. The halfmoon table and intimate ambiance set the stage for a relaxed hangout with friends. A mustvisit for a magical night out in Osaka! Had such a fun time! Masa is so great. Impressed by all the tricks. He even went above and beyond for another guest whose bday it was and had a special cake for them! Highly recommend if you want a fun evening. His magic tricks are so good! Masa is the best! A very fun event to do with just about anyone. Def would recommend it to anyone wanting something to do in Osaka. 1110 would recommend. Very fun and enjoyable experience. Genuinely don't know how some of those tricks were pulled off. 2 drink minimum was included in the price. Provided cool Psyduck hat to wear during show. Sooooo much fun! Had such a good time, thank you Masa for being an amazing magician!

리뷰:
One of the few hookah lounges with dark tobacco. The service was excellent, definitely a must do for shisha lovers who want a great vibe Had a really great experience here after being recommended by a friend  sisha is smooth, tobacco used is great quality and the hookah used is very modern  keeps the flavor long lasting and fresh. The owner Roy is also great company, speaks English and Japanese, and was able to give us some insights on our travels around Osaka. My cocktail was also delicious  left it to the expert Roy. Thanks for a great evening in Osaka! Abare is a hidden gem in the middle of hundreds of bars. Great atmosphere and excellent service. Prices that cant be beat. Shisha and chill. Out of all the hookah lounges in Japan this was one of our favorite. Cant wait to go back in a few months. The owner is verify friendly and speaks fluent English. Definitely a must if you are visiting Osaka. Also they have a full bar and gaming console to chill and relax. I wish every hookah place in Japan was like this place.

The drinks and hookah were amazing and service is top notch. Hidden bar is a surprise. Owner was very friendly and very good at doing cocktails. Ask him what you'd like to drink and he'll make it for you. Good selections of shisha as well. Few table games available. We really enjoyed it!

주소: Japan, 〒530-0057 Osaka, Kita Ward, Sonezaki, 2-chōme−10−１５ 曽根崎センタービル 6F
리뷰:
I recently visited Blarney Stone Irish Pub in Dtonbori, Osaka, and had an exceptional experience. The atmosphere was incredibly cozy, with a welcoming vibe that made me feel right at home. The bar keep was very friendly and even allowed me to sample some of the craft beers before making my choice. I ended up ordering a couple of Baird IPAs, which were fantastic  fruity and refreshing.

The pub also offers a comfortable area where you can enjoy your drinks, play billiards, and watch various sports games on wide screens. The nachos I ordered were delicious, generously topped with cheese and very filling.

One unique aspect of Blarney Stone is that it allows smoking inside, which is rare in Osaka and particularly near Dtonbori. This feature might not be for everyone, but it certainly adds to the pub's distinctive character.

The menu is extensive, featuring a wide selection of beers, whiskeys, hard drinks, and even cocktails. Overall, Blarney Stone Irish Pub is a fantastic spot to unwind, enjoy great drinks, and have a good time. Highly recommended! Went here around the end of September on a Friday night. It was a lovely bar with pool table and theres a sport game on the TV. Great services and good drinks! I love their pia colada! A great place for a pint, good food and good times.

Located on the 6th floor elevator is on the 2nd floor

The staff here are super cool  friendly and outgoing. Very knowledgeable about beers 

On weekends they have live music  and English club on Wednesdays.

Fun for everyone. Ill definitely be back here again soon!!

Enjoy  Went there for one drink but ended up staying for more. The drinks, the kindness of the people, and the live band were on point. Cheers I came across this pub in Umeda looked interesting, but was disappointed with the management and some of the male staff. They were rude and passive aggressive the managers also were no help when I asked for help and were extremely rude. It made me think how are these incompetent people running a restaurant. Aside from that I waited a long time for my foodabout 1 hour. Honestly had a horrible experience. For the price you can definitely find better places and I don't recommend this place to anyone. If you are looking to come here I would advice you to go somewhere you will have a HORRIBLE experience.

The DJ and staff were friendly and fun! I'd love to go again when I come to Osaka!

리뷰: This place is awesome in every way. Staff are politie and attentive. You can order good quality food and drinks to your table with a barcode. And the drinks are super cheap. Awesome place, Must visit when in Osaka. Middle of the road bar not too busy, drinks okay cheap but not seriously alcoholic but considering the price you can't really expect too much. Enjoyed the cartoons while drinking  Huge cocktail menu, they serve only Asahi 12pints. 432y cover, and all drinks are 216y. The shots are more like half shots. The cocktails don't seem any stronger either. Stick to the beer and you'll be alright. Always know what youre getting at moon walk. An Osaka based chain which also has a couple of branches in Tokyo. Drinks are decent, creative, and good value. Food isnt bad either. Great as somewhere to go as your second or third destination of the night, or later as its open until 5am. Such a scam. You pay 550 yen cover charge and the drinks contain almost no alcohol. Staff is not friendly and people unsocial. Youre better off drinking a beer on the street from a Lawson.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−9−５, Mittera Hall, 4F 日宝
리뷰:
Big lively place with darts, foosball, billiards, table tennis, etc. The cocktails are good, but the food is very average. They accept only upfront cash as payment. They have Happy hours before 8pm selected drinks at 400yen, however these selected drinks originally range from 500600, so dont expect too much. The Bar is accessible through an Elevator next to a parking lot where usually some people smoke next to the entrance and look slightly annoyed when you try to pass them.

Dont worry, as soon as they realize that you are trying to enter the bar they ease up.

The bar is a quite big and is buzzing. As the name suggests the bar offers possibilities to play Billard. You can write your name on a whiteboard and enter a challenge. On one of the tables you can play against other players Winner can continue to play at that table loser has to make room for the next contender.

If youre not into Billard there is also many other activities table tennis, table football, darts and many other things.

Food was good and Service and Drinks were great!
Everything was reasonable priced!

If you have an acquaintance that smokes its possible to smoke inside Very bad service, rented a pingpong table for 30 min, after 20 min they were taken by the staff after i went to the toilet. When i came to ask tham back got yelled at to leave somewhere else, 2 bartenders came to me standing very close started pushing me like they wanted to start a fist fight A great stop to watch sports, play darts or pool while having a drink. The music is decent too.
 Although it's a sports bar they don't show football or soccer games Fun place to hangout and have a few drinks.
They have billiards and darts! Also a few games, I think.

!!!Down side!!!!
They take cash only and people can smoke inside......

Had an absolute amazing time when I was there. Aki the owner is so great.
He played some amazing concert dvds for us. He even had a very old ACDC concert from when they were in high school.
I was in Japan for 12 days and looking back this was a huge highlight. Had a really fun experience here when visiting Osaka with my friend! The owner was a really cool guy and we talked and listened to some 80's metal classics together. Absolutely recommended! Small and nice bar. If you like the old Music, this is your Place! Had an absolute blast of a night november last year  if you find yourself in Osaka and love 80s heavy metal  action film and old anime paraphernalia, Aki's your guy! Love. This. Place. Very small and we were the only ones in there but the guy who was pouring drinks was like an 80's metal brother to me. He liked all the stuff I did and was playing great 80's metal. Very good English and he understood everything I said.  He also listened to me and would play songs without me knowing and it's like hey we talked bout that. So good this place is. Don't know if they have food or not so I couldn't rate it. I'll def come back here while in Osaka

Great times! Nice venue and friendly staff. Good chicken wings!! We were very well received and looked after by the amazing crew at the roo bar. We were fortunate to be regulars there during our 3 week visit to Osaka. Definitely going back there someday! Must visit bar! 
Staff speaks English and the drinks are good and at a reasonable price.

You can meet interesting people from around the world.

Cheers from your German friends! It's difficult to put a so so review because the service is profoundly awesome and the food is good, not the best, but good enough to enjoy solo or with a group. The problem is the atmosphere. Like many bars in Japan, this one allows smoking everywhere in the bar. So many people were smoking cigarettes, even the employees. It made me sick. Smoking is a disgusting habit that shouldn't be encouraged by bar owners. Putting cigarette smoke and emissions into the sky is poisoning the planet and its inhabitants. Bars that enable this horrible behavior should be told that what they are allowing is poisoning others. I will not go back here until they control the smoking issue better. The bar smells like an ashtray. I can't believe so many people gathered there and smoked like that. You might as well burn your money. It's less poisonous to everyone else. Super cool bar. Lots of punk music, great crowd. Good bar food in a great bar atmosphere.  The signs on the decor is incredible, it's from every corner of the world. Definitely recommended. drinks were great, it was amazing, staff was so kind and funny, music was really good and the best people everywhere. didnt try the food but heard its amazing as well!

주소: 1-23 Nagaikōen, Higashisumiyoshi Ward, Osaka, 546-0034, Japan
리뷰:
A wonderful place to spend 2 hours in a hot summer day.
I went there for their Cat Special Exhibition . Interesting exhibition with a great amount of knowledge about Felidae, not only domestic cats, but wild cats as well. I especially enjoy the section which explains how cats look differently when they are angry or feared. Also, the part regarding ways in which genes of cats influence their fur color is another fun part.
The museum itself is not big and it also comes with an outside botanical garden, which now, hosts many sunflowers.
It is a good place to visit, learn, or just chill. An amazing museum filled with incredibly detailed information. There is limited english signage, but if you have a translation app, you can get around this.  There are also many interactive exhibits and is ideal for young children and adults alike. Wonderful place to visit with or without kids. Just so incredible to see so many skeletons of dinosaures and the kids could even touch some of the bones. Many other thing to learn about too. I appreciate the amazing artifacts and knowledge this museum presents. The large scale bones in the center are incredible. However I feel this museum is in need of an interior upgrade. I would still take advantage of seeing this with the Osaka amazing pass and check out the museum and walk around the park nearby it. Nice museum connected to the botanical gardens. I enjoy going when they have special exhibits, just as one about dinosaurs many years ago, or the current cat one. In the information center, there is a cafe and a free section about Osakas nature. The cost to enter the rest of the museum is very reasonable. The gardens are also lovely

주소: 1 Chome-1 Nakanoshima, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0005, Japan
리뷰:
Nakanoshima Park  is a serene oasis in the heart of Osaka, offering a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The park is beautifully landscaped with lush greenery, seasonal flowers, and wide open spaces that make it ideal for a leisurely walk or a peaceful afternoon. The paths are wellmaintained and provide lovely views of the river on both sides, with plenty of benches to sit and relax while watching the boats go by.

For those looking to unwind, the park has a calm and tranquil atmosphere, making it a great spot for a quiet stroll or even a picnic. Its especially lovely during spring when the roses are in full bloom at the rose garden. The blend of natural beauty and urban surroundings creates a relaxing environment that is perfect for couples, families, or anyone needing a break. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Osaka and seeking a peaceful retreat in the middle of the city! During my stay at Conrad Osaka, on Nakanoshima, I took pleasure in morning strolls through Nakanoshima Park, a charming public park offering views of the Tosabori and Dojima rivers. The park is affectionately called 'the rose park' by locals for its varied rose collection. This park seems to be popular among families with young children and athletes. Theres a lot of sitting areas and trees to provide shade from the sun. There werent a lot of roses in bloom, but I believe it would be beautiful during roses season.  Nice to look at the sights, buildings, and a calm walk by the river. Amazing collection of rose bushes from all around the world and through at least a century. Nicely landed and perfectly maintained in pretty good blooming even in early October and lots of new vegetation and blossoms. Roses planted by years of invention. Unspoken variety of colors, shapes and sizes. Convenient location close to business part of downtown. 20 min walk to Osaka Castle. Metro station brown line is very close. I'm a flower lover, this place couldn't be left off my list, but was a bit disappointed that we came when all the roses weren't in bloom. But this place is very pretty, we sat for a while to feel the park in the city center, we saw some ducks swimming beside the lake

Picture is taken in 230323. When I went to this park, there was an event called Team Lab famous for its outdoor interactive exhibitions. You can see the art immersed with the natural perfectly and enjoy the relaxing moment. Reminder Don't went to this park during rain day, otherwise you shoe will soiled by mud! Very local park with positive ambience equipped with futsal grounds and a baseball stadium. Get to experience and observe a more local daily lives away from the touristy location. Visited TeamLab Osaka in the botanical garden situated within the park. Perfect park for those who love sports and just basically to rest and be stressfree. Near many restuarants and food shops. Love the location. We went hear 3 times during our stay in Osaka. It is so refreshing for us who does not have parks like this back at home, that is easily accessible. The park offers a lot of activities for the family. It is a few minutes walk from the station. This is the space for teamLAB osaka in the evening. You can come earlier to enjoy the park. We were not able to get inside the botanical garden which closes at 5pm. It was cherry blossom season so we were happy to see the blooms in the park. Food options are available. Life supermarket is across the street. Rose garden in Botanical Garden is beautiful.
Museum of natural history has a lot of knowledge of animals, plants and insects.

For garden entrance fee is 200 yen
Garden  Museum is 300 yen

리뷰: What a surprise visit! Would recommend if youre looking for some pleasant walk into the nature! The place is larger than we expected. Great view, well maintained paths, and spacious room to explore the garden. Very pleasant walk. We spent around 4 hours in the botanical garden and the Natural History Museum. There are also cafe and dining places for some snacks and meal. Incredible experience we attended the venue for the Team Labs Osaka ArtLight exhibition. Its a large event and covers close to 5 miles, so wear comfortable shoes. It was beautiful and fun! A very nice botanical garden. We visited in the evening during a special teamLab event. Very beautiful. I absolutely love botanical gardens, big, small or otherwise, not sure about this one. The gardens themselves appeared to be very well maintained by the people working there. Its seemed very bushy and the botanical plants had long gone, taken over by age or weeds. The ponds and paths were lovely to walk around as with many gardens, but there were many areas that required replanting and new life. Still worth a wander into nature. Went to the team labs experience they hold here after 745 and it was beautiful! Such gorgeous music and exhibits.

리뷰: From a birder's perspective, 5 out of 5 stars. Great views from the main building, plus people were nice even though I didn't speak Japanese. Both times I entered the building, a birder would come up and point out the Blackfaced Spoonbill. There are places to sit if you want to take pictures, and a drink vending machine inside. There are numerous infographics around, though I needed a translation tool to translate to English. There are bathrooms outside the main building, and down a path. The ealking paths were short but pleasant. Very good place to watch birds.  Check though whether the main part is openwas closed today on a Wednesday.  There is part you can get into though which is further N, and that had Narcissus, Blueandwhite and Asian Brown Flycatchers today April 17. Came back here after visiting last year too and it was equally charming this time!! I got to see a lot of different ducks and a blueandwhite flycatcher, which was definetly the highlight!! There are plenty of seats in the observatory where you can look out the windows. A treasure in the city. We wanted to get a bit closer to the birds, but the facilities are very comfortable, and the staff super kind. A good place to watch birds. The number of species is good with several rarities visiting and there is an enclosed viewing area which is frequently open early. Vending machines are available for drinks only.

It's a rainy day today, so few people were around. This is a great place for Sakura sightseeing. People usually gather around the trees and have picnics all day long during summer. Gardens are well maintained, look stunning, and everything about the area is nice.

리뷰:
Nice park in the middle of Osaka. Walked through the park to get to Abeno Harukas building. Many people on public holiday with their children. Restaurants available. The park is definitely big, a star was lost because a lot of areas were either closed zoo or under construction museum when I visited, so I didn't get to experience everything to the fullest.

It was nice to walk around and had a lot of picnic areas where people were enjoying themselves and having fun. Hoping to see the park to its fullest whenever I visit next time! Peaceful, calm and serene park that accommodates an array of flora and fauna within Tennoji. Walking around here while breathing in the fresh air and enjoying the environment is very refreshing for the mind and body. There is a lake nearby where you csn do some birdwatching as there were a few species around when we were there. To think that such a beautiful location exists in the heart of Osaka... Expect to see some breathtaking sceneries here, especially at dusk like when I was there.  You can really feel from this area how much love and care they placed to make it as beautiful as it is.  For anyone visiting Osaka, this is one place that I would recommend to everyone.  A stroll through this park will bring a smile to anyone's face. The entrance ticket is only 500 yen per person. However the animal's variety is quite diverse and complete. The zoo it self is in a good and clean conditions. I think this zoo is very worth it to visit

리뷰:
So fun! It was my first time in a zoo in probably 10 years and I absolutely loved it. Everything was maintained well and we could get good views of the animals. They seemed to be taken good care of, which was important. I'm sure there are fancier zoos but this scratched the itch to see animals and it was a great experience. 500 yen per adult to enter.

The zoo is nice if you want to see animals and it's not crowded with "loud tourists" just make sure you don't throw foods into the cage's animals can't eat and digest what we humans consider food....

Nice little half day trip away from all the crowded tourist areas. Some animals appear to be suffering from the heat, but the zoo is wellmaintained with excellent facilities and cleanliness. The food options are good, and the food vending machines are easy to use. There are food trucks throughout the park.
Very affordable price! Only 500 The animals looked depressed and sad, a lot of them clawing at the doors desperate to get out pictures attached. One of the animals' underbelly was covered in sores picture attached. The enclosures are too small. I was quite sad after watching them desperate to escape. They shouldn't be in there. It was clean with clear paths and lots of toilets throughout that park. Staff were nice. The matcha dipping dots were nice. We really enjoyed this zoo. Our toddler was able to see a lot of different animals. The food options were good and it is close to tsutenaku tower and the surrounding shops and restaurants.

주소: 4 Chome Chikkoshinmachi, Nishi Ward, Sakai, Osaka 592-8331, Japan
리뷰:
You can cross by ferry departing from Dejima Fishing Port.
However, there is a fence so you cannot go inside, and you can only fish or walk on the outer embankment.
There are many raccoon dogs inside the fence.
They also appear outside the fence.
Since it is a reclaimed land, it can be accessed from land, but there is a gate in the middle so the general public cannot enter.
It's a landfill that I don't know what to do with. We have been holding a treeplanting festival every year for over 10 years.
The trees have not taken root at all. Even if you plant trees, they will just wither! Is it a waste of tax money? You can enjoy fishing that is different from the new wharf on the offshore embankment, such as dropin fishing, shark fishing, shrimp fishing, and octopus fishing, all year round. It is especially famous as a sacred place for dropin fishing. Although it is connected to the land, the area along the way is a nogo area,'' so you can only get there by ferry.There are many regulars, and it is a fishing spot that is cherished by everyone, such as cleaning up the surrounding garbage.

However, I occasionally see people coming by bicycle, but it is clearly trespassing'' so I would like them to stop. It is nothing but a nuisance for those who come by the official method.
And since the area where these people come is littered with garbage compared to the surrounding area, it is easy to understand why the number of places where fishing is prohibited is increasing due to the garbage problem caused by illmannered anglers, which is often heard recently. .

"No Trespassing" signs are posted everywhere, and you should be aware that you are doing something illegal when you have to climb over a high fence.

If we see it, we will take appropriate measures. We do a variety of things such as tree planting, vegetation management, surveys, and reporting.
Participation is currently limited to one person in a passenger car to avoid crowding due to the coronavirus pandemic, such as thinning bamboo forests, mowing grass at tree planting sites, and thinning trees. General public is prohibited from entering.
Occasionally it is brought in for maintenance such as mowing grass.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 2-163 Ryokuchikōen, Tsurumi Ward, Osaka, 538-0036, Japan
리뷰:
Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park is a wonderful place for a family day out! The park is expansive and beautifully maintained, offering plenty of green space to relax and enjoy nature. In the summer, there's a fantastic pool where kids can play and cool off, making it a perfect spot for hot days. Weekends are especially lively with a variety of food carts offering delicious treats, adding to the fun and festive atmosphere.

The park also features a big exhibition space, hosting various events and activities throughout the year, which is a great bonus. While it's a fantastic spot for families, it can get quite crowded on weekends. Nonetheless, Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park is a delightful destination for a day of fun and relaxation. Highly recommend for families looking to spend quality time outdoors! The rose gardens are pretty with lots of flowers and the area at the windmill has nemophilas in bloom.  Its a very big park with lots of resting areas. However the park could be better kept. Over grown grasses in much of the areas. Now Hydrangea is at their best in Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park Flower Valley. Better visit here before the temperature becomes higher. Osaka Metro to KadomaMinami direction, one station prior, is the most convenient traffic. In addition to the greenhouse "Sakuya KonohanaKan",  visitors would enjoy here all day long. No gate of the park is formed, so shooting photo early in the morning is available. About food and drink, Lawson at the Western end of the station would be helpful. Went there last Friday. Only few sakura trees scattered near the entrance. But the usual sakura tree range near the mountain area were not growing buds yet. Plum flowers were still there but a week or two passed the peak. Most places look deserted and under renovation as its not the season for flowers. Botanical House is a cafe with a very nice view. A bit cold when we went there. Fairly nice and peaceful. I went during summer so there were not any flowers blooming then. Check my photo to see how it looks like. I am not sure of the best season to go as this is my first time.

주소: 1-18 Minookōen, Minoh, Osaka 562-0002, Japan
리뷰:
You have to come visit this park for its incredible forest, especially this specie of tall straight trees that reminds me of sequoias! They are gigantic and so beautiful  you dont see too many of these if you come from Europe as we have. Theres delicious fried chicken along the way, we were very interested in some roasted chestnuts  but unfortunately nobody was doing them. We only saw one lady selling them raw. Dont go too early, now many shops are open. Exceeded all expectations, the trail from station to Minoh Falls is not just spectacular but also therapeutic as you fallow the path past streams, gorges, temples and beautiful landscapes. Path is sealed and easy to follow. Amazing park that's very accessible from the city. The walk to the falls takes about 30 minutes and is pretty easy. The scenery is beautiful and it's a great way to take a break from the city. a really beautiful walk! if youre starting from minoo station, be careful to take the route with a smaller incline we chose the route with a shrine, and it was quite bad . once your in the park, its an easy walk, lot of families with kids and older folks! lots to see on your way to the waterfall, plenty of shops too but fancy riverside restaurants will require sufficient funds and probably a reservation as well.

id recommend holding out on buying anything till you reach the falls, so you can munch and admire the view.

even in summer it was pretty cooling, especially near the falls! but still, bring a UV umbrella and an electric fan to beat the heat in the unshaded parts of the trail. If youre staying in Osaka, Minoh is the perfect day trip to go connect with nature! Beautiful views, hiking options of varying levels, and fresh stream water. The nearby Minookoen village is a great place to support the locals by purchasing fried maple leaves and souvenirs. This place will live in my heart!

There was also a peach tree with white, pink, and red flowers blooming on a single tree, giving it a different beauty than plums or cherry blossoms.

리뷰:
Riverside park, good place to job or take a stroll.  Quiet. I get really annoyed when people don't have their dogs on a leash. I'm not good with dogs, but it's not uncommon for me to come across someone once or twice on my twicedaily walks who want to keep their dogs on too long leashes or let them run wild. I understand the feeling that pets are family. That's why I sincerely hope that everyone can enjoy the promenade by following the rules. You can walk along the Dojima River, which runs along the north side of Nakanoshima.
It's a nice walking course... Nakanoshima PromenadeScenery along the Dojima River as seen on the way to the National Museum of Art, Osaka about 10 years ago
The blue Fuji Electric FeFurukawa Kikai Metals signboard and the spire of the now defunct Dojima Hotel can be seen in the back of the NTT Telepark Dojima buildings, and the Daibiru main building is on the opposite bank.
In the NTT 2nd Building, there are the monuments of the Omura Domain's warehouse residence, the Godai Tomoatsu Seiranjo Nishichoyokan ruins, and the monument of Meiji Emperor Seifu.
no bikes allowed! Riding bicycles is prohibited! And because it's in an office area, it's relaxing on weekends. A walk along the river.
On Saturdays and Sundays, there are almost no people and you can take a leisurely stroll.

주소: 5 Chome-12 Nakanocho, Miyakojima Ward, Osaka, 534-0027, Japan
리뷰:
Came here today4424. Cherry blossom in full bloom.  Beautiful cherry blossom along the Okawa river . Not crowded with tourists.  Easily catch nice shots of pictures.  Bring your picnic mat to have a picnic and relax here. This charming, spacious park in a quiet, nontouristy part of Osaka is a hidden gem. I loved hearing the gentle sounds of trains passing, crows cawing, and the calming ambiance of nature. Its perfect for morning jogs and offers a peaceful escape from the citys hustle and bustle. The neighborhood is equally nontouristy, adding to the parks serene vibe. I can only imagine how beautiful it must look during Sakura season! Beautiful with sakuras during spring!  Was there today on a thursday at 1pm and was not crowded. It is almost fully bloomed as you can see from my photos.

It was raining almost all day yesterday till night at an area several kilometres from the park so I didn't go and am glad today it still looked lovely! 

There is also a river view and there were food stands. There is also a convenience store right by the station.
The toilets are near the entrance if you're coming from the nearest station.

You can bring a picnic matportable chair if you'd like to sit there for a long time! 

Went there again at 7pm to see what its like at night, several night stands were still open with people around.

God's creation is so beautiful


04.04.24 I visited the place during Tenjin Matsuri, the place is beside Okawa river and line with cherry blossom trees although it wasnt season at that time but must be good to visit during its season.  It was teeming with streetfood and beers along the path. I will revisit during the day and less crowd. Spring is here! The sakura tree blooms around 95. There are people on picnic mats doing hanami flower watching. The river, boats and bridges really elevate the experience surrounded by beautiful blooms. I believe April 6 onwards would be the best viewing dates but starting last April 5, 2024 you could definitely enjoy hanami here. Depending on the weather if it continues to be sunny and not windy this could last a week until the blooms start to fall.

If you want more latest Sakura bloom and Japan updates and travel inspirations this year follow us on instagram jiji.wanders
