Wish it was a little more clean. Don't recommend kids because there is a lot of trash. A lot of dead fish  At the request of a volunteer on Twitter, I participated in a volunteer cleaning activity today.
I had heard on the news about trash washing up on the beach and about microplastics, but seeing it with my own eyes and feeling it was really important.
Large items are still easy to collect, but there are a lot of straws and product packaging films, and it takes a lot of effort to collect them all. I was embarrassed to finally understand the importance of switching to materials that decompose naturally.
This beach is said to have a terrain where a large amount of garbage washes up from the neighboring river after heavy rain.
I would like to participate again when it is convenient. Summer is smelly and guttery!
The scenery isn't bad though. .
There is a beach volleyball net.
It was twilight in the evening...lol
Surprisingly, the fish are jumping  The coast is clean no matter what time you come. I was cleaning it today, but it feels like water on the burnt stone. It was a sunny day off, but no one was there. There is only garbage. The beach volleyball coast is crying. I'm not coming to play.

주소: Japan, 〒546-0034 Osaka, Higashisumiyoshi Ward, Nagaikōen, 1−２３ 内
리뷰:
The Nature Hall is large and has many projects, not just plants, that betray the image of a natural history museum.
On April 18, 2023, I went to see an exhibit called "Poison." The period is until May 28th. Even though it was a weekday, it was so popular that it took us a while to tour. But it was interesting. You need to buy a ticket at the entrance, and the sameday ticket costs 1,800 yen for adults, which is not cheap. A special museum shop is being held, and the location and contents are different from the regular shops.

Although it is a separate building from the City Museum of Natural History, it is considered to be part of the Natural History Museum. Facilities include a nature hall, exhibition rooms 1 to 5, an atrium, a coffee corner, and a museum shop. Tickets for the Natural History Museum can be purchased at the reception. You can also enter the botanical garden.

There are many events going on especially on holidays, so you can enjoy them if you target them on their website. Intense exhibitions are sometimes held in collaboration with private companies or other local governments, and may incur an admission fee. The MAKINO Exhibition, which introduces the life and achievements of botanist Dr. Tomitaro Makino, is currently being held at Hifumi Hall on the 1st floor. As you all know, Dr. Tomitaro Makino is the model for the main character of the currently airing morning drama Ranman.'' As this is a visiting room for Kochi Prefecture, the exhibits are not that large, but in addition to the local area of Kochi that is associated with Dr. Makino, there are also plant specimens and historical materials associated with Osaka. Even so, when I look at the photographs and historical materials, I get the strong feeling that Dr. Makino was literally an innocent person. I'm looking forward to the future development of the drama.
Also, in the entrance area, there are plants related to Dr. Makino, such as Baika's orensis and Musinamo, so don't miss them. Adjacent to Nagai Botanical Garden and Natural History Museum in Nagai Park
The Flower, Green, and Nature Information Center has information exhibits about Osaka's nature,
There are restaurants such as Forest'' where you can enjoy light meals.
Admission to the information center is free.

This place alone feels like a museum and is worth seeing.

Nature Square Osaka's natural magazine
Aerial photo of Osaka Bay
Undersea topography of Osaka Bay
Osaka's shrine and temple forest
Aerial photo of Kansai
stand

It's free up to this point, and from here onwards, the Nagai Botanical Garden is 200 yen,
The Nagai Botanical Garden and Natural History Museum set costs 300 yen.
There is a 10 yen PITAPA discount. There is a slow jogging class once a month on Monday. I participated for the first time yesterday. I can't understand it even after watching it on You Tube.
The curator will explain the various plants. The comfort of the wind blowing through the trees.

It all started with my diet, but when I measured my blood pressure this morning, it was in the upper 120s and in the lower 70s. I am taking medication for high blood pressure. It was hot yesterday and the onehour class was pretty tough, but it was worth it! is. My calves are tense, but I've started slow jogging again today. The sunflowers were in full bloom the other day and it was beautiful. Today, most of the flowers had fallen due to yesterday's wind and rain. Here you can see the trees and flowers of each season. Free for those over 65.

주소: 1-chōme-1 Hattoriryokuchi, Toyonaka, Osaka 561-0873, Japan
리뷰:
Nice park with a lot of different spots to chill, walk, relax and enjoy a nature break. Amazing colors during the Fall, I specially liked the lights in the Gingko and Bamboo trees.
Pay a visit to the open air Farm Museum nearby, really good experience there aswell. Wide open area of greenery in the middle of Osaka. Lots of people and family in the weekend but you will not find it is packed since the area is so wide. Fun activities can be found here such as street bazaar, gardens, campings, barbeque, children playground, and many more. Very recommended place to have a healing. The Japanese Folk Houses Museum in Hattori Ryokuchi Park is an architectural and cultural museum that relocates and exhibits typical 'minka' houses from the northeast to the south of Japan. Minka refers to the houses of the common people. Most of the houses on display here are farmhouses. Due to the long length of the Japanese archipelago, the climate differs greatly between the southern and northern parts of the country. As a result, the shapes of minka and the construction methods used vary greatly from region to region. In this minka garden, visitors can compare and learn about these regional differences.
Minka is not very decorative, but you can feel the Japanese view of nature in the primitive and elegant appearance of the wooden structure. Pretty large and good park for most things... But, the recent remake of an open play field into a rental sports field is really unfortunate. Now there is no real good place to play and throw balls and such, meaning people play on the walk ways, making it more crowded and with a slight chance of getting a ball or such in your head mostly on weekends.
There is also a large bamboo area that could be really beautiful, but unfortunately it is mostly blocked off. It was different before. a lovely place! Clean, safe, and relaxing, with a park for children to play. Having a Starbucks inside adds to the convenience, and the beauty of the sakura and flowers during their season must make it even more wonderful.

주소: 3192-1 Kisabe, Katano, Osaka 576-0002, Japan
리뷰:
Good hiking place, has BBQ spot. A little less "managed" than other hiking trails in Japan. Easy hiking in peaceful surroundings. Pay parking in all seasons except winter. I went to see the skunk cabbage, but I couldn't see it blooming probably because the time was not right. I was able to see Rakusho. Katakuri flowers were blooming again. There is a free parking lot, and it is close to Osaka city, so it seems easy to go there. Gates open from 9am It is a large garden with a Kurondo pond.
There are camping facilities at Kurondo Pond, and many people also fish there.
The course along the river that connects Kurondo Pond to Hoshidaenchi is soothing.
It's also fun to stroll around the park, including the daffodil pond, Yatsuhashi Bridge where skunk cabbage grows, and the observation deck with a great view.
There is also a free parking lot, so I think it is perfect for families. First and foremost, set Google Maps to the parking lot!
You'll be guided to the edge of a residential area that has nothing to do with you lol
The parking lot fee is a bit high at 800 yen, but if you are going to play for a day, there is no problem at all 
There are many shops and restaurants inside, you can take a boat ride around the pond, and you can also enjoy fishing, so I think it's a fulfilling place for those who like it 
The hiking courses are also quite difficult to understand, but they are divided into different courses, such as 15minute courses and 30minute courses, with some ups and downs that are easy for beginners to enjoy.
The course runs around the perimeter of the park so that even beginners can feel at ease, so it feels like you can deviate from the course and return to the park at any time.
Fully stocked with vending machines, ice cream, and snacks, as well as camping and a daytrip BBQ area, it feels like a comprehensive facility that is very safe for outdoor beginners  
I think each price is a good deal if you can play this much.

리뷰:
In an ordinary park, there is a huge stone pillar from the ruins of Tenjin Shrine.
Apparently there used to be a shrine here, but it seems to have disappeared after being enshrined with Kaguhasi Shrine. Thanks to the neighbors who always keep the house clean, we are able to use it comfortably. Despite this, some people go out of their way to leave behind cigarette butts and food waste when they return home. The park is not a garbage dump, so please take your garbage home with you. I use it all the time with my kids.
Today, my daughter asked me to use it even though I was suffering from a cold.

My second daughter became friends with her brother who came with her mom.

Even though I'm brazenly borrowing the boy's bicycle, I enjoy riding it around as if it were my own.

Eventually, my eldest daughter also joined in and started playing in the mud! !
Everyone was having fun while getting muddy.

The older brother who lent me his bicycle also
My mom also kindly agreed.
Thank you very much.

If we meet again, let's play together! !  It's a small park where families, children, and sometimes office workers take a break.It's surrounded by residential areas and apartments, and there are many people living nearby. You can feel free to respond even if you call out to us. It's nice to have a swing that even small children can ride on, but there is water to wash their hands.
It's a little inconvenient because there's no toilet, but there's a Family Mart right after you pass through the railroad tracks, which is nice.

주소: 1-23 Nagaikōen, Higashisumiyoshi Ward, Osaka, 546-0034, Japan
리뷰:
A great, unusual sounds and light show. It was 29 degrees during the day and the evening temperature made the visit very enjoyable.
Despite being a festive day  sports day  yesterday,there was not many people and not noisy.
Try to book ahead and be respectful of others by not speaking loudly,in order to absorb the lovely psychedelic music effects and the combination with nature.
The pond and waterlilies, with those glowing floating marshmallows shapes was hypnotic.
There was no caf open, nowhere to enjoy a drink or small food around, what a real shame.
We were really hungry and tired as it's quite a long walk from Nagai station,at the end of an excursion day.
Please be more aware of visitors need! Inspiring and Beautiful!

TeamLab Garden in Osaka was an inspiring and unique experience! The blend of art, nature, and technology was beautifully done, with creative and exciting installations. The organization was smooth, making the experience even more enjoyable. A mustsee for anyone seeking something truly special! I love it. So far the best attraction Ive been to in Japan. Def recommend for anyone who love interacting with artworks, or anyone who enjoys nature.

We spent around 1 and a half hour to finish all the zone. But it was raining so we were in a bit of a rush. Buy ticket in advance and come a bit early if you want to be one of the first to enter. Very nice garden and the lighting makes it a very special place in the evening. It spreads out well with the visitors and is not too crowded. I would buy tickets online in advance to be on the safe side, I don't know if they refuse further admission once a certain number of visitors have entered in order to maintain the pleasant atmosphere. Always a fan of teamLabs, but this was a special experience. Most are inside, and taking this outdoors made it a bit magical. I was kind of sad the whole day, and this just brightened it up.

They had about four exhibits to see, all with their own meaning. They included Japanese and English narration, so no one gets confused. You can walk through this beautiful park with family, friends, or a loved one. I saw a lot of couples and families with kids, all with smiles and wonder in their eyes.

Would definitely recommend this lovely experience, especially for such a reasonable price!

주소: 2-２ Minookōen, Minoh, Osaka 562-0002, Japan
리뷰:
Visited some time back. The autumn foliage was simply incredible. The trail to the waterfall was quite the walk 45mins to and fro, total 2hrs, but definitely worth it. Highly recommend if you're one for mother nature. Be sure to get the fried maple leaves when you're there! This waterfalls is so nice. The view is really relaxing. Though you just need to take like a 30mins to 40 mins walk on a public trail from the bus and train station. But its worth it after all. So nice!! Easy walk to the waterfalls. There are some nice side hikes if you want to extend your journey. It will look spectacular when the leaves change but I'm sure it will be mobbed. Perfect quick hike, there a direct train to the trailhead the hankyu line. If you want to escape the city and be with nature, this is the perfect spot. Easy river trail although I havent tried the mountain trail.  Its paved all the way to the waterfalls and you can sit there infront of the falls, you cant swim. There are stores selling beers, ice cream and meals but there are machines also if they are closed already. You will pass along temple and houses going up. Theres no fee to hike up also. Easy to reach with paving street, could bring stroller or wheelchair! but cannot going down into the water.
There's stall besides the location, can sit down while enjoy food or snack.

This park is very peaceful. Especially the tiny island inside the pond. You can take relief from the city chaos by spending some time here. So pretty and nice and friendly and relaxing. And so much beautiful wildlife! A true oasis. It's a relaxing place outside the main city and a good resting point if you plan to go down south. Nice place to stay. there is a bench center of the pond, you can enjoy calmness on there. Nice park with a fair amount of fish and other animals living in the pond. Quite a peaceful place.
Two kids playgrounds are available sandpit, swings, etc., as well as a running track around the park.
Recommended visiting during Cherry blossom season.

주소: 1-chōme-1-43 Abenosuji, Abeno Ward, Osaka, 545-0052, Japan
리뷰:
No regrets coming here. Best part is the whole floor is all glass totally unblocked great view at Harukas 300 observatory!  I literally said out loud WOW! the moment the lift door opened at 60th level. Stunning overview of Osaka and the buildings looked like Lego from this height and cars like toy cars I spent a few hours here. There is a cafeteria and a souvenir shop at level 5958. Amazing place to see the city. Every place I go zone or my favorite things to do is view points! This one was not an exception with fantastic 360 views! Absolutely worth coming and paying to go. Great views, quite high up, highest view in Osaka. Has some food options at the top as well, but they looked very busy and long lines. Some seating available on the dining floor, but most were taken for a long time. Sunset view was quite nice, but not facing the busy sides of Osaka.

Queue to leave at 8pm was very long. Harukas 300 offers an impressive view of Osaka, Kyoto, and Kobe. The ride to the 60th floor is thrilling, and the modern glass architecture lets in plenty of light. Once at the top, you can quietly take in the vastness of Japan. It's a place that invites reflection and leaves unforgettable impressions. Buy your tickets ahead of time online and make sure to go at sunset to watch the city lights come on! You will check in on the 16th floor and be led into an elevator that will take you to the 60th floor where the observation deck is. We went around 8pm on a Monday and had no wait time at all to enter. The view up there is amazing. The massive windows allow for 360 degree non disruptive views of Osaka. The city spans for miles towards the mountains. We had some food at the cafe on the top floors and enjoyed the night time views at a window table. Food was delicious and not too expensive. A must do experience in Osaka that is super cheap. Entrance fee is only about 12 USD and 500 worth the money for the views. Youre not allowed to bring any outside food or drinks inside so make sure to throw it out on the 16th floor before checking in.

주소: 2 Ryokuchikoen, Tsurumi Ward, Osaka, 538-0036, Japan
리뷰:
The observation garden is divided into seven areas.
They are paddy fields'', wetlands'', near waterways'', wildflower plazas'', fields'', Hasuda reservoirs'', and coppice and seedling forests''.
Open all year round, free admission
April to October 900 a.m. to 530 p.m.
November to March 900 a.m. to 430 p.m.
Regarding the animals that live there, we divide them into foreign animals and ancient Japanese animals.
We do not exterminate aquatic alien species, but we do raise them in separate aquariums. Insects and mammals are quite difficult to understand. Plants may be exterminated depending on the purpose of the location, even if they are not invasive species.
It's bad to have miscellaneous trees growing in wildflower fields, fields, and walkways. We exterminate them from fall to spring, when the work efficiency is relatively good, but it is a work that has to be done and requires effort, but it is tiring and not fun. To be honest, when the observation garden was set up, I had no idea how difficult it would be to get rid of miscellaneous trees.
If the wildflower field is left alone without much thought, the invasive goldenrod will definitely flourish. Since Senboku New Town is a developed area, goldenrod flourished, but Japanese kuzu'' kuzu overcame it. Kudzu is a more troublesome plant than goldenrod, and it is said to be impossible to get rid of because its roots are deep and it stores starch. To prevent this from happening, I mow the grass well and make sure that I can see things that bloom cute flowers a member of the Japanese lizard family...I don't know if this is also an invasive species, but it's difficult to get rid of it, but it blooms beautiful flowers this time of year. , intensively mowing tall weeds to make rare plants stand out. Although it is not Urasenke or Omotesenke, it does produce a certain kind of beauty with sensitivity. Yes.

2024.5.4 The wetland was filled with water, and a pair of hybrid ducks had arrived. I was there last year too. They are very accustomed to people and will not try to run away even if you approach them. It seems like they are asking for food. But but. I can't ask the pair of ducks that have come to visit me to leave and go somewhere else, so I would be very happy if they could make a small living there and raise their young. I felt a strange emotion. However, last year's egg ended up in the digestive system of a raccoonlike mammal. In June, the lotus leaves are so thick that you can't see the water surface.

In February 2024, I dug lotus roots. Normally, I don't want to dig lotus roots in the cold winter. The event was scheduled to be held in November, but due to prolonged rain, nearly 50 people were unable to attend. Wearing raincoats and rain boots was too unfortunate for ordinary people. So, a small group of people tried to dig with ecomullets, but they were unable to dig all the way with the tongwa. On this day, a woman was very active, and when she used a hoe, a white lotus root appeared. A truly lucky girl. Girl? We hope that many members of the public will come to dig lotus roots next year. I found out about this place in Tsurumi Ryokuchi before this summer. It's already been 29 years since the Flower Expo was opened in 1990, and I've been here many times since it's in my neighborhood, so I wonder why I never knew about such a relaxing place. About 40 years ago, rice fields, fields, and lotus fields could be seen everywhere in this area. I was able to see a variety of aquatic creatures, insects, and other creatures for the first time in a while. I think I will come here every year to take pictures of the flora and fauna. From the entrance on Hanahaku Street, go up a slight slope and turn left and then right until you reach the large flower bed in front of the windmill. The lotus flowers were blooming beautifully. It feels like you've come to a peaceful countryside.
Walking through the footpaths will make you feel like you are in the Japanese countryside.
I'm sure anyone will feel healed.

이름: 大阪ふれあいの水辺(自然再生ゾーン)
주소: 4-chōme-5-5 Nakanochō, Miyakojima Ward, Osaka, 534-0027, Japan
리뷰:
Osaka Fureai no Mizube Natural Restoration Zone is a hidden gem in the heart of Osaka, offering a peaceful and ecologically rich riverside experience. This area is part of an environmental restoration effort, designed to bring nature back into the urban landscape. With its lush greenery, native plants, and revitalized natural habitats, its a serene spot for nature lovers to enjoy a walk or relax by the water.

The zones walking paths wind through areas that are teeming with wildlife, providing a rare chance to observe birds and other animals in their natural environment, right in the middle of the city. Its a wonderful spot for anyone looking to escape the urban hustle and reconnect with nature, making it perfect for families, birdwatchers, or those just looking to enjoy some peace and quiet. Unlike the sandy beach zone, it is full of water, but if the water quality were to improve, I wonder if more aquatic creatures would settle there.
You can see waterfowl. And did someone let it go? Or is it a descendant that is said to have been brought over during the Great War? You can also see nutria.

It's a must in your trip in Kansai.

주소: 2921 Kubo, Kumatori, Sennan District, Osaka 590-0441, Japan
리뷰:
A beautiful nature preserve. Perfect to visit in any season I prefer fall. The place is also clean and perfect for families to visit. Nature very beautiful Quiet lovely park and pond. I went to the park at midnight to see the Perseid meteor shower and saw some very beautiful meteors.
Halfway through, a group of older people came to the same spot, and as if to disturb us, whose eyes were getting used to the darkness, they lit up the area with flashlights and smartphones, making their way to the depths of the mountain to avoid light and catch meteors. Are you an idiot for coming here to have fun?
Yeah, I'm getting older...I should act with a little more consideration for the inconvenience to those around me!
I think the location is a very good place for astronomical observation in Osaka Prefecture.
Although it is maintained, it is on a slope, so be careful where you step! I was surprised at how little physical strength I had after getting sick! 
I made a Uturn at RokumachiThis time I will aim for the top. The left side of my body was paralyzed, but even if I recover completely, my physical strength will be different.

Not bad just abit far from Osaka. Good for family to spend time Pinic and feed animals. Do note the activities inside need to pay extra. Feeding is 200yen which is not expensive. Came for capybara.if take public transport the bus is at fixed timing. Go to bus terminal for stop 6. Bus is 225 or 225V. We went here to visit Sullivan Park and it was soooo worth it. Both my daughters and I grew up playing with calico critters which is what they are called in the US and it was so cool to go into the life size houses. To be a kid again.

The animal attractions will definitely bring delight to the kids.

Plentiful of eye catching floral for photo memory for the family too.

Last of all the attraction friendly staff is another bonus to the already overwhelming attraction.

Will definitely revisit this wonderful place again in my next Japan trip.

Parent this is a definite visit with your lovely kids , so do not give it a miss. Nice park but too expensive for a day visit. World Ranch is better value for money. A yearly ticket is good value for money, I know people who have 1 and go there on a regular basis. The restaurants are nice with a great variety. 리뷰:
Really nice hiking place with beautiful view of the city. Ride your bycicle or bring it beyond the gate is prohibited so i have to walk from the parking area and that's a bummer. So nice Nice hiking course The wide asphalt road has a gentle climb and is easy to walk. No cars are allowed to pass except for those under management, so it's perfect for people of all ages to take a leisurely stroll.
In the summer, the trees cast shadows on the road, allowing you to avoid direct sunlight, and even at low altitudes it's a little cooler than the area below. If you go east at the Rokumanji Higashi intersection on National Route 170, you will arrive at the Fumin no Mori Narukawa Parking Lot. During the azalea season, the parking lot gets very crowded with people coming to see the azalea rolls, so be careful.

리뷰:
Beautiful architecture, awesome library. Has English books also. The Matsubara Citizen Library Reading Forest appears to be floating above the Taijo Imaike Water Park.
There is also a bench in the shade of a tree, so you can read while looking at the fountain.
I have uploaded photos, so please use them as a reference when you visit. This is more of a Matsubara City library than a park.
Imaike exists, but a library building is built floating in the pond.
The previous library was outdated, so it was rebuilt here.
It is also named Reading Forest.

In the past, it was probably a reservoir that supplied water to the fields.
There are many books on display, and it seems to be a place of relaxation for book lovers. It is a civic park with a pond, greenery, and the city library, making it the perfect environment for a walk. Above this park stands the Matsubara Citizen Library and Reading Forest, which feels like a floating library.
There is also a fountain  and benches in the shade of the trees, so it is recommended when the lotus flowers bloom.
How about reading on a bench while being blown by the wind?
There is a Sakura Coffee shop nearby, and Matsubara Central Park has a plaza within the park with plenty of play equipment and is crowded with many local residents and families with their children.
Just a short walk away are Daily Qanat Izumiya, Matsubara Chuo store, and Fujiya Kawachi Matsubara store. Pekochan is at the store.
While shopping, you can play in the park or borrow books.
I have uploaded photos, so please use them as a reference when you visit.

A river cruise operates from dojima River. The walk along the Dojima River is recommended as a walking course.

The WHO's FOODS FES. executive committee, which operates "Kitchen Car Koshien," started this event in September 2022 with the desire to provide a place where students who want to start their own businesses after graduation and students who want to challenge themselves to realize what they want to do can do so. The event was launched in September 2022. Although students play a leading role in this event, many of them have experience in opening stores at events or have already established their own stores, and the quality of the food is as good as that of professionals.

The winner of "Kitchen Car Koshien," held on September 28 and 29, was decided fairly by sales, which were determined by purchases from visitors. This year's event, the 3rd edition of the Kitchen Car Koshien, will feature a record number of student exhibitors 13, and is expected to be a very exciting event for everyone. Yodogawa River Park is a beautiful urban park located in the heart of Osaka, Japan. It's a popular destination for locals and tourists alike, offering a scenic escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.

One of the highlights of the park is the Yodogawa River itself, which winds its way through the heart of the park. Visitors can stroll along the riverbanks, taking in the picturesque scenery and enjoying the peaceful sound of flowing water.

In addition to the river, the park offers a range of other attractions and amenities. There are several large bridges that cross the river, providing excellent views of the surrounding area. The Umeda Sky Building, a towering skyscraper that's one of the most recognizable landmarks in Osaka, can also be seen from the park.

The Nakatsu Reed Beds, located near the park's western edge, are another popular attraction. These wetlands provide a unique ecosystem for a variety of plants and animals, making them a fascinating destination for nature lovers.

For those who want to get even closer to nature, the park offers several urban campsites. These sites provide a unique opportunity to experience the great outdoors in the heart of the city.

One thing to keep in mind when visiting Yodogawa River Park is that the terrain can be a bit uneven in places. This can make walking or cycling a bit challenging at times, but it's all part of the park's charm. nicest palce to spend some quality time in peace and calmness beautiful view and spacy place to ride you bicycle and do some jogging and excercise and spend the leisure time. Amazing place Really relaxing riverside park to take walk and make city view pictures.

Minamitenma Park is a tranquil riverside park in Osaka, offering a peaceful escape from the citys urban energy. Situated along the Okawa River, the park features lush greenery, open lawns, and scenic walking paths, making it perfect for a relaxing stroll or a quiet afternoon with a book. The park is a local favorite, especially during cherry blossom season when the trees lining the river create a stunning pink canopy.

The parks calm atmosphere makes it ideal for picnics, jogging, or simply enjoying the natural surroundings. Its also conveniently located near several historical sites and cultural spots, so you can easily combine a visit to the park with some sightseeing. If youre looking for a serene spot to unwind in Osaka, Minamitenma Park is a hidden gem that offers beautiful views and a peaceful environment right by the water. A Delightful Winter Escape with Golden Leaves and Family Fun

I recently visited Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park in early December and was enchanted by its beauty even in the winter season. The park still showcased a stunning display of golden and red leaves, creating a picturesque and serene atmosphere.

What impressed me the most was how kidfriendly the park is. They offer trolleys for little ones, making it convenient for families to explore the park together. There are ample spaces with tables where families can relax and enjoy a peaceful picnic amidst nature's charm.

One of the highlights of my visit was the rose garden. Despite the time of year, the roses were in bloom, and their vibrant colors added a touch of elegance to the surroundings. It was a delightful sight that left me in awe.

If you visit Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park on the weekend, don't miss the food market. I highly recommend trying the delicious pizza available there. It's the perfect treat to satisfy your taste buds while enjoying the park's ambiance.

Moreover, Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park is a delightful winter escape that offers a mesmerizing display of golden and red leaves. it's worth noting that the park's pathways are flat and suitable for trolleys. Families with young children can bring their own trolleys or strollers to navigate the park comfortably.

Tsurumi Ryokuchi Park's proximity to the subway station, the availability of a convenience store, and the accessibility for trolleys make it a convenient and familyfriendly destination. Enjoy a seamless visit to the park and make the most of your time surrounded by nature's beauty.

. The rose garden is a mustvisit, and the weekend food market, particularly the pizza, is a delectable treat. Don't miss the chance to experience the park's beauty and enjoy a memorable outing with your loved ones. The Windmill is fake, it is powered by electricity not wind. The unique building design creates a great experience as you make your way up each floor while walking through the garden. Namba Parks in Osaka is an impressive blend of nature and modern architecture. The multilevel complex features a beautiful rooftop garden with waterfalls, rock formations, and lush greenery, providing a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The shopping here is topnotch, with a variety of highend and specialty stores, trendy boutiques, and diverse dining options. The cinema and entertainment facilities add to its appeal, making it a great destination for all ages. Conveniently connected to Namba Station, Namba Parks is easily accessible. Whether you're shopping, dining, or enjoying the gardens, it's a mustvisit spot in Osaka. This shopping centre also connects Namba station to our hotel in Osaka. A beautiful mall! The aesthetics were on point both outdoor and indoor, and they have a wide variety of stores, with most of them being more on the expensive side. They also have a big food court but unfortunately no quick bites to grab from a counter as all were seated restaurants. We nevertheless had a great time walking around and shopping. Relaxing space within the city center. Green spaces on the top floors with city view. Could spend a few hours here. There were even seating to relax under the shade. Very peaceful and a good break from the hectics of people going on down the streets Nice view and atmosphere, it's relaxing compared to. There are a lot of shops which are good enough for you in the whole day

리뷰:
Big, clean and cozy park. Kids can enjoy in the fountain, in the pond. ThereS amusement park too where kids could enjoy climbing, sliding and alot more. You can do picnic under sakura trees.
ThereS a fishing area too. There's softball and rugby field, where you can watch them practice. There's a big field for runing too. Very interesting venue with great sports ground and playground for kids! A bit far from downtown unfortunately but no shortage of tourists there. The play ground is very well organized and also safe. From 3years old to 9 years old kids love to play 3hours. Three Parking lots are bit small comparing size of facilities Visited for rugby worl cup game.  20 minute walk from station.  As an outdoor stadium, it was hot.   Locals had towels on heads or hats to keep themselves cool.   I liked the stadium though Went with a small group of children to see the show in the planetarium, it was really good although for the younger aged children 5year olds a little bit long so they got bored quickly.
Outside there is a great big play area that is just perfect for children to spend so much time enjoying the freedom to run, climb and just be silly. The only downside is there are no toilets close by you need to go to the main building.
Inside the main building on the 3rd floor is a play area where the children can play on a number of indoor equipment such as mats, rope climbing, and more.

주소: 4 Chome-5 Nakanocho, Miyakojima Ward, Osaka, 534-0027, Japan
리뷰:
Osaka Waterfront Park, also known as Sakuranomiya Beach, is a beautiful riverside spot offering a peaceful escape with stunning views of the Okawa River. Famous for its long stretch of cherry blossom trees, the park becomes a popular destination in the spring when the trees burst into bloom, creating a breathtaking pink canopy over the area. Its a perfect place for hanami flower viewing picnics, drawing both locals and tourists.

Aside from cherry blossom season, Sakuranomiya Beach offers a relaxing environment yearround, with plenty of open space to walk, jog, or simply sit by the river and take in the scenery. The waterfront area has a serene ambiance, ideal for unwinding or spending time with family and friends. Its location along the riverbank also provides excellent views of the surrounding bridges and parks, making it a great spot for photography. The beach was really fun, but unfortunately, tourists had thrown a lot of trash around in the garden areas. We saw beautiful koi under lily pads so big that they made the koi seem small, many different species of birds, and even a family of muskrats. The flowers were in bloom, and several species of butterfly were there, but I could not get a picture of those. You can join kayak tour and see deep Osaka .
You can get uniq activity . Randomly walked through the area on our way to Osaka Castle, saw one Heron, multiple turtles and one very friendly capybara! What a surprise Beautiful park with nice walking and cycling paths, lovely beach in the middle of the city! We sat on a bench on the small island in the river, would visit again

Grab a hot chicken reddo, a sando and a rokku cha from nearby Lawson and sit under the canopy for a great picnic! Itadakimasu! 201987 Nakae Bon Dance Festival is very good! You can enjoy the traditional Japanese summer festival very well! There is one night market surrounding the park. Many people buy the foods and kids play around. Nice quiet park near Osaka Castle with cherry trees and a playground for kids.
Also a variety of flowers. great saturday vibes with kids playing baseball in the field and the elderly playing their sports

The area along the Okawa River is lined with cherry blossom trees, and is crowded with people during the spring cherry blossom viewing season. However, there is Osaka Castle Park nearby and people tend to go there, so I think it's a littleknown spot for cherry blossom viewing. Since the area is large, there is no need to reserve a spot for cherry blossom viewing, and even if you go on the same day, you can easily find a good spot. a small, rather neglected, poorly maintained park The park is visited by many people even outside of the cherry blossom season. Most of the people are taking walks early in the morning. This is a spot where you can clearly see the fireworks of the Tenjin Festival. It's beautiful during cherry blossom season.
Also, the cherry blossoms along the river from Miyakojima Bridge to here are beautiful.

주소: 1-chōme-9-9 Utsubohonmachi, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0004, Japan
리뷰:
My wife and I always find time to enjoy the beautiful things in life, so we often visit botanical or flower gardens at the locations we visit. The rose garden in Osaka was one of the best experiences we've had. There's a beauty in the serenity that this place provides. We went during lunchtime and saw many people quietly enjoying their lunches while admiring the beauty around them. There are many different roses here with cards explaining their origins and planting dates. The area is free to enter and provides a better view than some of the locations we've paid for. If you want to see some beautiful flowers while enjoying a peaceful stroll, I highly recommend that you find the opportunity to spend some time here. Visited last June 26 with my senior mom. A few roses were already in bloom.

The park is big enough for walks and runs, even for strolling around with friends and family. They also have benches around the park for those that prefer to pass some time. Great place to relax and was one of my last spots! The fountains and overall vibe is great. Feel free to stop here and sip on a refreshment and take it all in! A fantastic rose garden. Went during Golden Week so there were lots of families and even some sunbathers 

Edit August 4, not much to see at the moment. Garden is mostly overrun with with weeds and grass You won't believe riees like these even possibly exist. Very nicely planned rose garden with a waterfall and a creek running through. Great variety of tea rose hybrids from all the world. In October little poor blooming, however every bush has some flowers. Nice fountain at the entrance. Popular place to photograph kinds and microscopic dogs. Seems August is ghr best time to visit, but still very enjoyable in Early October as well. Punlic access free, toilets at the entrance.

There are two sections to the play area, a large structure with several slides and a smaller area for younger kids. Lots of parents with school kids here after school hours. As a tourist who lives in a country without a lot of shared, public play spaces I found this place amazing. My kids really loved it here. Great park, easily accessible from the metro. Visiting families will find this a nice break from tourist itineraries. Nice park for kids to run around and get some exercise and fun  Large park with various play equipment. Just a short 510 minute walk from Esaka Station. There were a few  food trucks there as well offering different food such as french fries and sweets. A lot of benches to sit and relax while your little ones play. Public restrooms aslo in the park but not as clean as most public restrooms in Japan.

리뷰:
A beautiful urban oasis in Utsubohonmachi, Nishi Ward, Osaka . A relaxing place to have a late morning walk or light exercise before an early delicious lunch at either of the two Michelin Star restaurants 1 Chome1612
that are only 3 minutes walking distance away on the southern side of the East garden . make america great again After the end of the war, it was used as an airfield for the U.S. military stationed there, and when it was returned, it was developed into a park, and with the opening of Yotsubashisuji, it became a long park that was divided into east and west.

Unlike the sports corner in the west garden, the east garden is a calm space with welltended flowers.

However, please don't wake up Heihachiro Oshio, whose dream came to an end in this place, once again in order to correct modern political corruption.

Politicians, please straighten up and stop drowning in your own interests! Utsubo Park is famous for its rose garden, and the Higashien garden near Yotsubashisuji Street has many benches and is a place where you can relax.
On weekdays, many people from nearby offices take their lunch break here, and on weekends, it's crowded with families.
There are many restaurants in Yotsubashisuji, and there are many types of takeout options, so it's best when it's nice outside 
There are no trash cans in Utsubo Park, so please take your trash home with you.
The sidewalk that enters from Yotsubashisuji, passes through Higashien, and exits to Naniwasuji is popular with many people jogging and walking their dogs.
Osaka's Central Park is an oasis in the city. 2022.11.13
Autumn leaves  are in full bloom.
After the rain, the fallen leaves are nice and moist.

Frost leaves are redder than February flowers Tang Morimaki
From 11.15 Tensei Jingo

주소: 1 Chome-1 Nakanoshima, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0005, Japan
리뷰:
A nice place near central Osaka. Spaces to sit and enjoy the flowers. Each is marked with the name of the rose, which helps to find them should the display encourage ideas for gardening at home. The area also has subway station access, as well as a cafe, vending machine and restrooms. There is also seating to enjoy the flowers. I visited in mid October and was surprised but the lushness of this park. The flowers are beautiful and wellcared for.
It's free, so if you have time, you should check it out! My wife and I have come to Japan quite a few times for the fall colours but this year, the trees were still green. So I was looking for alternative outdoor sightseeing places and chanced on this Rose garden. The latest review was just a day ago the weekend and said the roses were in bloom.

Pleasant half hour walk from our hotel with a detour to buy umbrellas as it started raining. Nevertheless, the garden was lovely and the drops of water on the petals and leaves look really nice in the photos. Lots of variety and I think the name of the varietals were one tags under each plant.

The Rose garden is on an island and the views of the water is also great, as was walking on the bridges. It's really a nice park and it's good to retrace your steps as they're are new views of the roses from a different direction.

It was raining half way through our visit there but it was enjoyable nevertheless. We did take the subway back instead of walking though . A large rose garden in the middle of a major urban area. Whats there not to like? The different varieties are tagged with a little info like species, year developed and general type e.g. hybrid tea etc. but not much information beyond that. One section of the garden has roses developed by each decade 1900s, 1910s up to the 1950s. Other parts of the garden of course include roses developed after that. There are lots of benches and places to sit. This appears to be a nonorganic garden. Roses show signs of spraying so dont eat the roses This is a free public garden opened to all, right in the middle of the Tosahori river. As the weather was warm, the roses were still in bloom. There was a light shower when we arrived, and the rain drops on the roses created fantastic photography opportunities. The riverside landscape also has many interesting characters to provide plenty of photo ops.

Went to this shop as i was exploring the Umeda area. Found the shoe that i wanted ask for a new pair and the female staff was helpful  friendly. She told me thats the new pair that im trying on . I check the shoe and satisfy with it  wear it straight away . The shoe is super comfy and i love it . The price is also good . The first atmos store I visited when I landed today in Osaka. I frequent the stores in Tokyo, but despite it being small, the staff were super friendly and helpful. Shoutout to the staff today, he approached me and miraculously found a size XXL tee for me. I normally can't find it at all in tokyo, this really made my day today, kudos to him! The staff are very rude. Sport Lab by Atmos Tokyo.
Legendary Sneakers Chain
Cool and kind staff. Exclusive deals and exclusive for Atmos only releases.
A place to visit if you are a sneakers lover or so called sneakerhead!
Be extra sure to check every possible information on the web when big releases are planned. They usually make a raffle and given the number of people lining up every time you need to be lucky, but more than that, patient.
On normal planned releases the shop open at 10am, but also when the staff didn't plan any raffle it might be possible to find people lining up and waiting way before the opening time.

리뷰:
I would also like to see a Westernstyle men's restroom installed. The Japanese style is painful after overusing your knees. I am grateful that the air conditioning has been turned on since May. From now on, I would like to turn on the air conditioning so that I don't skimp on my electricity bill as we head into summer. It is now a vaccination site.
Some measures have been taken, such as restricting entry, but since the elevator is shared with the library and sports facilities on different floors of the building, staff should be placed near the elevator to limit the number of people, or other facilities should be closed. I thought.
I don't know if it's from Osaka City or Osaka Prefecture, but I can't deny that the filling is sweet.

After all, those who have been vaccinated will have priority now, right? I went to get the vaccine injection with my eldest son who is a student taking the exam. I arrived earlier than my scheduled appointment time, but the injection was only given at my scheduled appointment time.
I think it would be a good idea to arrive a little before your appointment time for the vaccine injection. The venue is on the 5th floor, and there is an elevator that takes you up to the elevator, but since there are only four people riding each, we had to wait in line for a while. I accompanied a child high school student to get vaccinated.
By the way, I was vaccinated at the SelfDefense Forces venue, so I can't help but compare it to the swift and smooth SDF venue, but overall the flow was poor.
I arrived 10 minutes before my reservation time, and it took about 50 minutes, including waiting time after vaccination.
Each person was kind and helpful, but it was still relatively new as a vaccination site, so even though there were a lot of staff, it felt a bit sluggish.
At the SelfDefense Force venue, if you knew in advance that it would be inconvenient to make a second reservation, you could change it on the spot, but in this case, you will have to call.
As a side note, those who had only brought their preexamination ticket and forgot their vaccination ticket were asked to reschedule their appointment. Please be careful not to forget anything. Visit a vaccination site.
Vaccinations will go directly to the 5th floor.
The 4th and 5th floors of Osaka Central Hall Community Center were the sports center, the 3rd floor was the library, and the 1st and 2nd floors were the Otoshiyori Health Center.
For those who don't use it regularly, it was a little difficult to understand the flow.

The Oat Milk Lattes here are wonderful! They offer the best coffee, including some flavored options, in addition to a good ambiance. I hadn't expected to find such smooth and creamy coffee in Japan. Although the prices are relatively high, once you taste it, you understand why. If you're in the mood for tasty coffee, this place is a mustvisit. Highly recommended! My order Cafe Latte 12oz with oat milk
Fooddrinks when I say this was one of the best coffees I have ever had yall.. The way it feels in your mouth was just I dont even know how to explain but so smooth. I feel like you need to drink it to understand. They use beans crafted by the first world champion from Asiaa Japanese person! and use milk exported from the UK. See I had to go back and ask all this because it was just so good.
Atmosphere I came around 4pm and the place was not crowded at all. They only seem to have outside seating and have a little retail shop inside.
Service the staff was very nice with answering all of our questions and took care of us quite well.
Overall i personally reaaaaaally loved this place and would recommend it to anyone going to Namba in Osaka. I wish I lived closer so I could get coffee here everyday.  Coolest place and most delicious iced latte with oat milk, and normal latte. Melbournites order an extra shot and it is DELICIOUS theyre super nice too.  best coffee around Osaka. Good coffee good atmosphere! I was walking around and found this interesting coffee shop. Staff members are nice and friendly. Nice place, we met with a Japanese friend and he brought his dog there is an open terrace pet friendly, we had a good moment here. This is a mix between a coffee shop and sport clothes shop. The atmosphere is very friendly, they even lend you blankets covers while you are sitting, in case you feel cold.

주소: 3-chōme-8-8 Nanbanaka, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0011, Japan
리뷰:
Amazing facility with terrifically great staff! Super convenient location close to Namba Station. There's an ice rink downstairs, a pool upstairs and sports gyms in the middle. Pretty much all sports are available to play from futsal to volleyball to badminton, etc. Would highly recommend this sports facility to anyone. Really great gym for 600 yen. If you don't bring a separate pair of shoes for the gym you will need to rent a pair from the 6F reception, of which the largest size was 29cm US 11.

Mainly machines  there's one set of barbells and one free weight bench press that can also be used for squats. 20 minute sessions can be reserved but you have to write your name on the queue sheet. Great small gym for a relatively cheap entrance fee. If you dont need a lot of special machines and heavy dumbbells, I can definitely recommend this place A bit more expensive than other swimming pools in Japan.  Seems that you can also use the gym with the entrance fee though. Very nice though that you can go swimming in the city center.  Great local experience with walking lanes  and different types of swimming lanes depending on your speed.
Opening hours do not always correspond with what is mentioned by google.  Better to check on their website if you understand Japanese or come before 5 pm. I went here for the small gym. Buy ticket on the 5th floor for 600 yen and hand it to the front desk on the same door for a plastic card and give it to the 6th floor staff thats where the gym is at. Besides some weight and cardio machines, they also have 1 squat rack and 1 smith machine with a 20 minutes timer and a waitlistqueue board to write your name down to use the rack. The locker has a 100 yen deposit. Shower is small and doesnt have shampoo or soap so bring your own. Also need indoor shoes.

Patagonia might be friendly to environment, but the Osaka shop is not friendly to pregnant woman. The young male SA with tan skin color asked me, a 6month pregnant and unable to carry heavy things yesterday, to REMOVE the big shop bags her companions left aside NOW, and he almost cannot even wait me finding help. Though I complied, but still cannot made him happy obviously. While I was standing and leaned to the counter a little bit, waiting my family do the shopping upstairs, the arrogant and rude SA asked impolitely not to even I am not blocking or affecting anyone in this empty shop. This metal cashier counter is the noblest that cannot accept a pregnant womans slightly leanon and I would suggest Osaka shop put a sign beside to address its fragility. And the tanned SA is the worst person I have ever met in my three times visit to Japan. Great stuff and product but worse staff. They didnt allow you to buy the same size for same shirt at once, even you are coming to buy this with your friend. The worse part is, Im coming to this store twice a day to buy DIFFERENT THINGS, but they not allowed you to buy another reusable bag, she said one customer only eligible for buying this things once. What a weird rules The staff in this store are extremely terrifying. They are racist, have terrible attitudes, and their twofaced behavior is disgusting. I don't understand why this brand would hire such people to manage their store.There's no need to act this way and discriminate against nonJapanese people. Sales personal on the mens 2nd floor are very rude, my wife was waiting me on a couch they have on the mens area with a short she wanted , she put the short on the table they have in this area and this guy told her VERY RUDE to do not put the short there, we were about to buy several stuff for our kids and ourselves qnd because of this we decided not to do it, we have been in Japan traveling for 20 days and its the first time some we find someone rude like this guy. It was a very bad experience.

주소: 2-chōme-7-6 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰: Went to Atmos at 10 am  to buy sneakers because our feet were hurt after long walks the night before. There was a queue in front of the store and we thought it was the line to enter the shop. Suddenly, this rude staff tapped my husband's back and told us to leave! He said the store opens at 11. I told him, ok we will come back later, and ask whether this Atmos sells On Running shoes. He looked very upset and spoke to us loudly and in a very rude manner. He insisted for us to leave the premises, and this happened in front of everyone who was queuing. I even showed him google Translate so he understands what I meant!  It was clear that this staff didn't want our business at all. We left, went to Hankyu, found On Running, and bought 3 pairs worth around 60,000 JPY. All  the staff in Hankyu were very accommodating, polite, and very helpful! So, I am telling everyone reading this review, believe us and everyone giving this store a 1 star that it's all true about their rudeness, unhelpful, not polite manner, etc. Just go to another store where you will be treated the way you deserve. Don't let our experience happen to you and ruin your day. I think Atmos just hates foreigners. Otherwise, there is no way the owner will let employees like this still be employed. It's really funny how different this situation was to a department store like Hankyu, Hanshin, Daimaru, etc, where tourists will receive great service, a 5 discount, and a taxfree discount. Honestly, I am still confused if people still want to come to the store. Don't buy here. I get a pair of New balance and when I tried in the atore was okay, next day I used it and they felt really uncomfortable in the right side, it have like a rock, obviously from factory defect. The store didnt help me and they dont do changes. Just lost 150 usd because right side is impossible to use. Better buy it directly from the brand store If i can give zero  for reviews you will got that. Some of you doing like you dont want to sell any shoe. Never get any service like this. Bad place to looking for a good shoe.  Much easier to find sizes and rare kicks compared to their other locations. Dedicated staff especially with the store manager, Joseph who speaks fluent English. Nevertheless, the rest of the staff are friendly and helped me find a pair of nice Asics Japan only editions since it is tough for me to find a good fit with my flat feet. No doubt I would recommend any sneaker heads to come to this spot, all day! Good price, have my shoes size. Thank you

리뷰:
I received a gift from this store that didn't fit correctly. When I went to the store to exchange it for a better size they refused to exchange the merchandise because the price tag had been ripped. The item had never been used and I had a valid receipt. The staff were unapologetic and seemed indifferent even when I told them that I would never shop at their store again. You'd be much better off shopping elsewhere. Trekking goods of great quality. If you ever wanted to start hikingtrekking around Kansai without any previous experience or knowledge, this is the place to go. The staff here will help you choose your shoes, outfit, gear, and the best place to begin hiking. And it's so close to Umeda station. Just take a few minutes to stop by, and you'll definitely have a good start. Very well equipped shop and extremely prepared and available sales team. I guess it depends on the clerk, but I guess I didn't listen well or she seemed angry and it was hard to talk to her. I didn't end up making a purchase because I wanted to discuss various things. I thought other mountaineering equipment stores were more friendly. Exquisitely exciting mountaineering goods shop
There are core items as well as products from core manufacturers.
There's also the store staff's evaluation, but I'm sure if you ask, they'll give you a lot of advice, and if you don't ask, they'll leave you alone lol.
The shoe display looks like all the sizes that are out of stock are lined up, so I wonder how many of these shoes are in stock! I was surprised lol
It has a big impact and gets you excited.
North has a wide variety of apparel, including down jackets from Bartolo!
I have never seen a store with so many winter gear such as ice axes, crampons, waders, snowshoes, and shoes on display!
It was a truly core store.
I wish there was one in Kanto too.
They have created a store that you want to visit and see even if you don't have anything to do.
Personally, I thought it was more of a mountain climbing goods store than a camp!

주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 1−１ ヨドバシ梅田タワ 6階
리뷰:
I needed to buy some hiking shoes at short notice in Osaka, which was a bit tricky since my shoe size is a bit bigger than many places stock US 12.  Ishii Sports came through with a really good range of outdoor shoes including larger sizes.  Very friendly and helpful staff as well! Among many bad reviews about staff here, I got the best service from a woman staff short hair woman staff. I went to find a pair of hiking shoes, she came and asked me if I have would like to try just let her know, she didn't even speak a word of english but trying to communicate with me by google translate. She was very polite and funny. I wish every staff could be like her. The employee at this store is the worst I have ever encountered in Japan, he is extremely rude! I asked him if I could try the jacket on and he ignored me. After being reminded by others, he finally unlocked the clothes. Yes, the clothes in this store are locked! The lock must be opened before you can try it on.

After trying it on, I found that the size was a bit small. I tried to ask the staff if they had a larger one, but he didnt even look at me. He rudely took the clothes away and said there were no more!Yes, he understands English, but he just doesnt want to service foreign guests! Then lock up the clothes again! To be honest, the first time I saw North Faces clothes were locked! Is this a luxury product?

The quality of the man was so poor, I saw other customers being turned away by his quality. I really had no interest in staying in this store anymore, so I had to leave! Its hard to understand why North Face would hire such unqualified employees!

If you do not want to service people who comes from overseas, please write a notice clearly at the door of your store and we will not enter your store!

This store doesnt even deserve any star The products in this store are satisfactory, and the female shopping guide who helps to try on shoes is also very polite. However, the man at the checkout mr.was extremely unprofessional and rude. His attitude was cold, he didn't use any polite words, and he deliberately glanced at foreign customers with hostile eyes. It was inexplicable. It was something we encountered during our tour in Osaka The only one with such poor service. Does the store intend to treat tourists from other countries differently? Bought a pair of shoes that did not fit well which I sadly only realized after a short walk. Came back to the store to change the pair but the staff refused to change them with another one since it was visible that I had tried them. However, it is worth noting that the shoes were still in perfect condition for selling.

This is not good customer service if you cannot try the items you bought and switch them if necessary. Will not go again.

리뷰:
Clean, easy to navigate, and contains a good array of products. The staff were super polite and helpful when it came to trying on products. Touristfriendly and effective considering it's one of the few UAs in saka and by extension one of the only sportswear shops that carry "sports bras" clothing as far as feminine clothing is concerned Look for a tourist coming from Australia this place was good had certain things in colours that we dont have, service is good but the range was pretty standard. Size wise limited too. It a good store for the sneakers and getting other colour bags but clothes was a different story for us. Modern design with the latest product. Shopkeepers are so polite and nice. No pressure shopping. You can browse and try on what you like. With Currys photos and promotion, this brand has been on the rise.

I love this place, unlike other places, it is like flagship store with several floors of displace area. Glass building exterior that makes it look super modern and clean.

Location is super convenient, and others brands are also in the same area. You can just walk through one by one and find what you like. Japan is really heaven. If your a tourist must visit this store good quality of product and friendly staff .don't rely on Google maps the arrow is going crazy .it's inside of grand font osaka mall 5th floors Wow, what amazing customer service. I did the under armor upgrade where they take your old shoes! 30 off and the young man was extremely polite and helpful. Excellent service, highly recommend going here!!

리뷰:
2023.11.1412.07
Sale has started again this year

2021.11.12 sale has started! o

Moved from Shinsaibashi to the 1st floor of the Nishinakajima headquarters building in October last year.
The store is spacious and spacious, with a wide selection of products, making it easier for customers to shop around. 

My personal recommendation is that the Yaru Techno GTX approach shoesIt's light and has good grip, so you can climb anywhere for 3 seasons with just one.

The newly released base layer is also quite good. I think it was made to imitate Millet and Fine Track, but this season's version is closer to Fine Track
However, when it feels soft and dry, I wonder, Oh, are you sweating?  and then it returns to a pleasant texture.

The pants are great too
Not only are they durable and water repellent, but they are also 3Dcut to suit your movements, and each pair of pants uses multiple fabrics with the right material in the right place.
And what I like about it is that the design and slim pants are cool

Other great items include merino shirts and fleece. Having the right material in the right place is a given, and for winter mountain climbing, focus on wind protection during the peak season and breathability during the peak season.

The drawback is the price, but cheaper versions and late models are often cheaper, so if you aim for those, it will be easier to experience highquality mountaineering wear!

This month 2021.10, there are several events in collaboration with JTB, and there is also a base layer gift  that is about the same as the participation fee o

I have to go buy everything for winter mountain climbing ov The store staff had great customer service and I was able to shop comfortably.
Although it is a little expensive, it is extremely comfortable to wear! We especially recommend pants.
Due to its location, you won't be able to stop by while shopping, but if you are interested in the outdoors, please give it a try. The shoes were carefully fitted. This is a valuable shop where you can try Montura and Fitwell. It was especially nice that they had Fitwell winter shoes.
Old model sales are also worth a look. I was able to actually try it on and the Montular was really nice. I heard that it's more expensive, but it's more durable and lasts a long time.

리뷰:
Great deals, lots of options for sports equipment and clothing. Great store with an incredible selection of sporting goods at very reasonable prices. Past seasons gear is almost always steeply discounted by at least 20!

Location is decent because its just a stones throw away from Abeno Harukas which is well connected by metro and bus services.

A real sports enthusiasts dream. Can easily spend one or two hours just browsing and hunting for bargains. Had my tennis racquet strung here.  A mistake was made in the string pattern  not enough cross strings were used.  The department head was extremely apologetic and refunded me my total bill plus an additional 2000 yen.  Amazing sense of accountability.  I will definitely continue to shop here.  Excellent customer service! This place is well stocked but otherwise the same as most Sports Depot. It's a little tricky to approach by car from the west or north because the entrance is on a road with a central divider. Check Google maps before driving there ! Good place to find your sporting goods, so many choice from different brands.

리뷰:
Enough collection, excellent service for foreigner, and good simple english for communication I am here on May 19, 2024 at 300 p.m. I left the store at 300 p.m. The male clerk inside the store hair curly hair had a very unfriendly attitude toward foreigners, was extremely arrogant, and completely understood my own thoughts, slanderous questions, etc. Written by Rin and Tadashi, the Japanese customers in the store are completely unsuitable for the foreign staff in the meeting, and how the previous study is compared to the work done by the people who come back!

We went to the store at 3pm on May 19, 2024. The male clerk at the store curly hair had a very unfriendly attitude towards foreigners and was not willing to pay any attention to us. I think the right thing to do for these employees who are discriminatory against foreigners and only care about chatting with Japanese customers in the store is to learn some manners before coming to work. I have shopped at this store twice so far.
The male clerk serves customers very kindly and politely. When I purchased the backpack, I was given detailed product explanations and care instructions.
I met the female store clerk maybe the store manager? both times when I went to make purchases, and both times she made me feel bad about something. It's only handled by one or two staff members, so I can understand why people get annoyed when they're being rushed around, but I think they should stop talking to customers in a condescending way... This is my personal feelingopinion... When the person who was with me heard the way the female store clerk spoke, she said, I felt disgusted and angry.I don't want to shop at a store like that.'' It was located at the "LUCUA OUTDOOR from ALBi" corner on the 6th floor of LUCUA. We have a full lineup of classic Kanken bags. They also do original processing.First of all, when you look at the product selection, the customer service filled with hospitality will make you decide. This store has a lot of styles, and I happily bought two bags to give away. As a result, the clerk used the wrong card and charged more than 200,000 yen. She also apologized. I understand that this was accidental, but the subsequent purchases were It was so small that she didnt remind her... nor did she put it in the bag... only to find it was gone when she got in the car... it was later confirmed that the clerk had placed it in the bag

The above has been confirmed by a friend who told me that it has been found on the ground floor. Thank you to the store for your considerate and patient reply. I would like to apologize to the store! There may be misunderstandings due to language barriers. I am sorry and thank you.

주소: 2-chōme-1-4 Shikitsuhigashi, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0012, Japan
리뷰:
Not sure what is up with all the disgruntled japanese reviews here but I guess if you are a foriegner you don't get the same issue as they can't talk much. I bought the warmest most pimpin jacket here that saved my holiday and kept me toasty warm and dry for my week. It was pure joy getting such a warm jacket after being so cold and finding only pissy little options around osaka. The clerk and me had a language barrier but he knew a few words and was friendly and smiley enough. I would give 5 stars but the issue I had was although they have 2 prices on the tags taxno tax I still paid full price. There was no receipt given for a 300 dollar jacket. Just a card payment slip. I didn't realise until I got home that I was not able to claim a considerabe amount of tax as they gace no reciept or assistance in the matter. That was my only issue This is the second time contact. I bought Burton snowboard step on shoes Ritual black color on Oct 223 and never use it. I just found out that the left size is 245 while right size is 240. I would like to change to 240 size. Can we exchange this. I will be in Tokyo in Jan202123. Really cool store amazing set up and immaculate vibe the music was great and I didn't mind the trains passing overhead to top it off great products but staff were so unfriendly I kept waiting for some kind of greeting or service I wanted to buy something but I just felt so unwelcome Not much choices and variety to buy.

Location is far from Shinsaibashi. Found an outdoor store near Namba, Osaka
Mainly skiingsurfing. The store is very large and has a wide range of varieties 
As soon as I entered the door, I saw neatly arranged snowboards of different lengths and patterns.
The pattern is super nice! Snow suits, armor, helmets, goggles, bindings, ski boots and various accessories, ski warm gloves, masks, there are several cabinets full of them. You can really get it all in one step. It is more comprehensive than the outdoor products store I went to before.

The store clerks are also very professional. You can try on snow clothes and snowshoes. It doesnt matter if you are a novice. The store clerks will help you get it done. However, it may be because of the location that there are almost no tourists. In terms of language, it should only be in Japanese

Japanese people really like outdoor sports. Skiing, surfing and golf are their daily sports. The equipment is also very complete. You can try it out and choose the one that suits you Party R

주소: Mittera Galaxie building 2-B1-A ,Soemon-cho, ５丁目-５-30 B1, 中央区 大阪市 大阪府 542-0084, Japan
리뷰:
Great place for delicious Rum, rugbyisland atmosphere and a good time!
Not a fan that smoking is permitted in the small bar but the owner, Yogi, is super friendly, social and willing to accommodate most requests! Dropped into this bar late, and the owner was very friendly.  Made sure I tried Fiji beer, something you cannot get in the states.  A once in a lifetime chance unless you fly to Fuji.  Great bar to pass the time, and especially great bar to watch Rugby! A family run sports bar in Osaka with a huge drink selection and amazing homemade food! We popped in to watch the RWC semifinal and the atmosphere was amazing. It is a great place to meet people from different nationalities and very welcoming. 5 stars! Beautiful owner who takes care of his customers.  This place is often filled with both regulars and newcomers.
The bar offers a vast selection of Fijian beer, rum, and the like, as well as cocktails and Japanese selections.   The food menu compliments to drinks well.
Though I am not a big rugby fan, this place isn't very intimidating being that this is a rugby themed place.  Both the owner and his patrons are very welcoming. Came here during the 2019 world cup and had to come back in 2023 when visiting Osaka with my family. Really friendly place with a great atmosphere. Also the place to go if you want to catch a rugby game.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 1-chōme-3-24 Taishi, Nishinari Ward, Osaka, 557-0002, Japan
리뷰: The vibes of this place are great! Nice City Pop with some nerdy decorations and a headboard covered in notes from fellow travelers. We got vegan versions of the taco and taco rice and they were great! The highlight for me was their inhouse salsa. The owner was super friendly and asked us where we were from and talked with us about where we were heading after Osaka. Thank you! Long day, walking back to the hotel, happens to be Tuesday. What's this a Taco place? And what a Taco place. I live amongst a large Mexican American population at home so I have no shortage of good tacos and love to try the local fair when traveling. These do not disappoint, amazing, home made Salsa was great to boot. If you are craving a Taco in Osaka I doubt you are going to find better you might not find better back home either. Really great place, amazing friendly staff, and a great bar to just wind down and enjoy a drink and a cigarette. The nachos are decently good , but the tacos are pretty amazing. They're essentially tacos dorrados, combine with the salsa and cholula sauce, and this pairs great with the alcohol.  Got my hispanic Texan approval. Excellent tacos! Slightly small, as it's only one taco for 800yen, I had 2 and they were really good. The bar has a good atmosphere and friendly local regulars. The bartenders don't speak great English but tried their best and we're very polite Amazing bar with the best atmosphere, the bar tenders are extremely friendly, speak good English and will introduce you to everyone around. The food is great and they have an N64 and SNES in the back you can play. Just a great bar to hang out in

주소: Japan, 〒542-0076 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Namba, 1-chōme−7−１６ 現代こいさんビル 2F
리뷰:
We had to wait about an hour at 3pm, but it was so worth it! The seats are benches with storage for your bags and jackets to not get the smoky smell. The workers make the okonomiyaki in front of you and thoroughly warn you not to touch it until its ready. We got the B set, the butter soy sauce scallops, and takoyaki for 3 ppl and was quite filling. Highly recommend the set and the takoyaki. This place is the real deal Holyfield!. We arrived around 445 pm, and waited for an hour. I usually wouldnt wait on a queue, but I have to say it was worth it. This was the best meal we had in Japan.We ordered the fried noodle , and the Ajinoyas mix okonimiyaki. Do yourself a favor and order both. Wowwwwww Showed up on a Saturday around lunch time and was seated in less then 30min. Google doesnt show the precise location but if you see a line heading to 2nd floor you arrived. Staff takes order while you wait in line. Food is prep fresh in front of you. I tried the yakisoba and it was delicious and the regular portion was very generous. They serve you water in case you dont want a drink. Highly recommended!! Cash only! We made reservations, but there was no way to differentiate walk ins from reservations so make sure you walk up too regardless of the line if you have reservation. We almost missed ours waiting in the line.
The okonomiyaki is pretty filling. We ordered two to share and couldn't finish it all. We prefered the seafood to the bacon. Place opened at 11am. Got there at 1030am on a Tuesday morning and was third in line. Got the mixed okonomiyaji with beef octopus and corn with every sauce offered. This was so damn good. We also ordered the negiyaki and the beef and octopus yakisoba which were both equally delicious. Pro tip if you let it sit on the grill for a bit, you get some nice crispy caramelized noodle pieces which are awesome. Definitely recommended but try to get there early to cut the wait cuz you'll still have to wait. There's a sign at the end of the queue that says 90minutes so heads up on that.

이름: A5 Wagyu Yakiniku Osaka PANGA | Osaka halal restaurant
주소: 2-chōme-3-31 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
Wonderful place to have a quality Japanese meal! I am a Muslim revert and had tried nonhalal Japanese food before. This restaurant is authentically Japanese. We had the waygu set, and it was scrumptious! Muslim or not, everyone should come here. The staff were extremely friendly and spoke good English! We will definitely be back in the future! Absolutely amazing food, the wagyu cubes are one of the best meats iv ever tried in my life. Staff are so nice and accommodating and the pricing is very reasonable for the exceptional quality. Highly highly recommend this place oh and it's halal! Hands down the best Wagyu I've had! This is one of the few halal Wagyu restaurants in Japan, and it's better if you book in advance. At the time we went, there was already a crowd waiting outside, thankfully we've made our reservations earlier.

We ordered the biggest cut of the A5 Wagyu set. The beef melts in my mouth! The saucemarinade they prepared was also delicious, which went well with the beef. Even though the food is halal, they also serve alcohol here.

The staff was efficient and served us promptly. This was probably one of the food highlights of my trip in Osaka. Honestly, this place was for sure 1010. The meat was really tender and super tasty. They give everything hot and they bring everything to super fast. The customer service was amazing, they were super kind and also was super interactive with us. Only issue you might have when visiting here is the place is always packed so make sure to make reservations, if ur lucky you might able to come in if theres an empty spot. This was the most incredible experience we had. Nothing compares to how good this meat is! It has ruined all other food for us! The service was wonderful too. Such lovely friendly staff. Also the .eat comes out super fast which is great when your hungry!
