주소: 1-chōme-10-12 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
By far the best halal food I have ever had in Japan and maybe ever. Every dish ordered was fresh and delicious. Hummus with pita was incredible and the schwarma plate was out of this world. Combining both dishes with pita and hummus was a winning combination. Reasonably priced and the owner, Ali is an amazing person. His restaurant is professionally run and he has taken the time to understand Japanese culture and accommodates all patrons. I recommend anyone visiting Osaka to try out the food here if they want a change of pace from the food normally served in larger Japanese cities. It was truly an experience. Had lunch today, set meal chicken biriyani came with a free drink, I chose hot coffee. Food was good, place is a bit cramped but this is expected in Japan. Good food, great value for money. Server girls were very polite
Stairs are very steep, but can take lift Ali's Kitchen in Osaka was a bit disappointing, to be honest. The food was okay, nothing really stood out, and considering the prices, I expected more. If you're in the mood for a memorable meal, you might want to explore other places in Osaka instead. The food wasn't so bad but the spices were too much more than the rice, also they used too much oil in all dishes no dry tissues on any of the tables the place was cozy and warm they are good welcoming with a good smile Promoting HalalFriendly, Kyoto, Osaka

Ali's Kitchen

On my third day in the area, I finally had the chance to visit the renowned Ali's Kitchen, and I'm so glad I did. From the moment I stepped through the doors, I was enveloped in a warm, inviting atmosphere that set the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.

This establishment's accolades are welldeserved, as evidenced by its Trip Advisor Excellence award for several consecutive years and the prestigious Michelin star it has been awarded. These distinctions prove the uncompromising commitment to quality and the extraordinary culinary talent permeating every aspect of Ali's Kitchen.

The show's true stars were the dishes I enjoyed sampling. The mixed beef and mutton Tikka was an absolute delight, earning a welldeserved 4star rating from me. The expertly seasoned and grilled meats were a flavour revelation, accompanied by perfectly paired sauces that enhanced the experience.

However, the true standout was the Mutton Biryani, which I would unhesitatingly rate a full five stars. This dish's depth of flavour was astounding, with the tender, aromatic meat complemented by a perfectly spiced and fragrant rice blend. It was a culinary masterpiece that left me utterly captivated.

While the milk tea didn't quite reach the same lofty heights, with a 3star rating from me, it was still a refreshing and enjoyable accompaniment to the meal.

If you find yourself in the area, visiting Ali's Kitchen should be on your list!

주소: 2-chōme-7-22 Nishishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0086, Japan
리뷰:
I was recommended to come here by a friend from Australia,  as she knew I was vegetarian.  Trying thr vegetarian spicy ramen and the vegetarian spring rolls, they were amazing and was very well priced for what I ordered.  I also got the matcha ice cream desert. Definitely need to buy this item after your meal. If your in Osaka and vegetarian,  please try this place out. One of the better halal options in Japan. A few of the other places I have been are overated but this was spot on. It's a shame I only found this place on my last day here but definitely worth a try.
Service was prompt, nice calm environment and we weren't rushed.

Food was a little pricier than other options but in line with other halal places we have been, so overall not bad for what you get.

I felt the portions sizes were good and it was easy to find. Customer service needs much improvement, it's missing the usual Japanese warmth and hospitality my experience as follows  One staff assigned me one table, in a min another staff came and requested me to move to another table My ordered Wagyu Steak was being served on another table before I drew attention of the staff Requested drink was served with ice whereas I clearly mentioned not to put ice in it due to cold Had to wait at the counter a min before someone came to settle the bills completely confused about my table number...
Food was decent, nothing exceptional though. However, I don't recommend the Gyoza, it was deep fried and too dry.
The restaurant was spacious enough for a group.
The wait time was short too even during the busy lunch hour. The rice bowl was amazing. Wagyu bowl rice and chicken curry rice was delicious.
Opt for set with karaage and drinks ice cream.
Clean place and quite spacious.
However need sometime to take the waiter attention for ordering.
Maybe during that time short of manpower.
But this is one of the halal food recommended for those who come to Osaka Impressed with the halal ramen taste here. Especially cos the chicken is like charcoal grilled so its really tasty. Wagyu ramen is good too just that cos the meat is shredded you cant really tell its wagyu, or just tender meat. Then we got wagyu steak slices which are amazing. It literally jiggles. However restaurant aircon is not good and it was summer and we were just sweating while eating. Toilet had some issues too.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0017 Osaka, Kita Ward, Kakudachō, 9−２６ 大阪新梅田食道街 １階
리뷰:
Hanadako is a popular takoyaki shop located in the Osaka New Umeda Shokudogai, conveniently situated next to the train station. The shop constantly attracts crowds of people eager to enjoy their delicious takoyaki.

You have the option to dine in or take out, with takeout typically being faster. For dinein, youll have to wait until seats are available. The seating is limited to a small standing counter that accommodates 89 people. After placing your order, you can enjoy your takoyaki while watching the chef skillfully prepare them, creating a lively atmosphere.

We ordered 10 takoyaki for just 1050 yen, which is very affordable. The takoyaki comes topped with a generous amount of green onions and mayonnaise, forming a literal mountain of toppings. The takoyaki themselves are delicious  crispy on the outside, soft and gooey on the inside, with tender, chewy octopus pieces. You can also add chili powder which isnt too spicy for an extra kick, transforming the flavor in a delightful way.

Overall, this is a highly recommended spot, and its clear why its so popular! A famous Takoyaki shop in this area. There are quite a few people, but the wait is not too long. There is a counter bar in front of the shop where you can eat. The price is not expensive, but to be honest, the taste is not much different from other shops. This place has queue all the time. Nice and big tokoyakis. I enjoyed until the last bite. They have only 4 places for dine in and its standing only. You can also takeaway. We came around lunch time, and there was a queue. We waited around 1520 minutes and it was our turn to order. Dine in space was limited, with only standing space available.

BUT IT WAS WORTH IT! We ordered 6 pieces of the takoyaki loaded with chives and mayo, and it was delicious. Its definitely worth queueing and eating! Would highly recommend it! Really good takoyaki  the line went fast, if you do take out.
You can really feel and taste the octopus
Super good value for money!
The only thing to know is that you need to walk a bit around to eat it, as you cannot stay there

주소: 1-chōme-7-26 Sonezakishinchi, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0002, Japan
리뷰:
What a beautiful meal! We took my sister here to celebrate her 30th birthday. The fish was so fresh that it melted in your mouth and the wagyu beef was unbelievable. We didnt speak any Japanese but we managed to communicate with the lovely staff through a fun game of charades. Also the sale was delicious. Great value for such a beautiful meal. Excellent izakaya. Hard to reserve as they dont speak English, but well worth the effort, excellent sashimi, mushroom tempura, sardines and other fish dishes. Super helpful service, despite the language barrier. He who dares, wins! If you dare go in here as a foreigner, bring your love for the cuisine and some understanding of the language and the patrons will make sure you have a great meal. Everything in this place is well thought out, from the pottery to the dishes. Well balanced, very high quality and great ambiance. A true, somewhat fancy, izakaya experience. This review is strictly for their customer service that I received over the phone. I haven't tried this restaurant because they refused to take a reservation. They were very rude to us over the phone. We were willing to take any time available but we got a simple no. I got the impression that they are picky with selecting their customers. I would assume that this is due to their popularity.  very good food
 very friendly and helpful staff
 huge sake glasses 

 quite small dishes
 quite expensive

주소: Japan, 〒550-0002 Osaka, Nishi Ward, Edobori, 1-chōme−9−１１ アイ・プラス江戸堀 １F
리뷰:
Worth it! Probably the best restaurant I have ever been to. The chef is an artist. Hes a poet. Hes very skilled in his profession. The personalized touches he adds to the restaurant like artwork makes this place so much more appreciated. The food was gastronomical, tasty, creative and so perfect! We loved our experience here. Sake pairing was amazing! If you have the chance, this is 100 worth it. We were SO full at the end we could barely breathe! Hajime is one of the top restaurants my partner and I have been to. We travel the world and always make it a point to go to 3 Michelinstarred restaurants, and to say this was, by far, our favorite, would be an understatement. The atmosphere is moody and romantic. The service staff is absolutely exceptional. Each individual goes above and beyond to make sure you're enjoying your stay. The menu was so delicious and intentional. Each menu title corresponded perfectly with its meal. My husband and I are celebrating our honeymoon with 3 weeks in Japan and to say the staff went out of their way to show us love would be an understatement. We will 100 be coming back, and will recommend to any and every person to make a trip to Osaka just to come to Hajime.

Thank you, Hajime, and Etsu our server extraordinaire for making this my favorite dining experience!!! And thank you for getting us out quickly and safely, when we almost missed our train back to Kyoto. Just a year and a half after opening in 2008, Hajime achieved 3 Michelin stars for excellence in French cuisine  the fastest rise in recorded history. After they transitioned to creative cuisine in 2012, Hajime was awarded 3 Michelin stars again in 2017.

The restaurant has a tasting menu with 3 price levels 60,500 minimalist version, 67,100 with vegan ingredients, and 71,500 as their standard menu. My mom and I chose the Tasting Menu Standard at 71,500 price excludes 15 service charge per person.

The restaurant is founded and run by Chef Hajime Yoneda. There are those who follow the crowd, and there are those who take the road less traveled and find their own success. Like Mr. Hajime Yoneda, he dared to do something different  choosing to quit his highpaying job as a design engineer at the age of 26 to become a chef. His years of hard work paid off when he was awarded 3 Michelin stars in 2009  all in just 17 months  a feat that no other restaurant in the world has achieved so quickly.

The dining experience at Hajime is like a culinary art. Having eaten at many Michelinstarred restaurants before, I always had high expectations, but the food here really overwhelmed me. The moment you step into the minimalist room, the darkness makes everything very mysterious. Chef Hajimes creations are not only well conceived but also well executed, truly worthy of 3 Michelin stars. The art based cuisine is very sophisticated and the featured dish Planet Earth has a range of ingredients that I never imagined coming together but wow  its incredible. Definitely a worthwhile experience and one that you will remember. I had the pleasure of experiencing Hajime dining with my mother.

82,225  1 person  13 million VND US510 Hajime artistically executes an innovative dining experience that takes people on a journey across the earth, exploring the abundance of oceans, rivers, skies and fields.

This is a mustvisit destination for anyone visiting Japan. My husband and I were treated to a wonderful evening for our 10th anniversary.

Thank you Chef Hajime Yoneda, Etsu, and the entire team for the privilege of dining here. We will remember this experience of a lifetime! Arigatou gozaimasu. Worldclass restaurant. It is deserving of its three Michelin stars. Service was impeccable.

Id let the pictures and videos speak for this exquisite gastronomic experience. Be prepared to be blown away by the flavours and the philosophy all at the same time.

The entire course runs for over three hours, and there is so much to consume, so come prepared with an empty stomach. Id recommend the short pairing option, which covers the starters to the main course. It was just the right amount of alcohol and liquids in general to help you get through the course. I imagine youd be bloated if you took the half or standard pairing 

Last but not least, this was the New Years
menu, so it was extra pricey. Was it worth it? Yes, it is genuinely an allrounded dining experience.

주소: Japan, 〒541-0046 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Hiranomachi, 4-chōme−2−３, Obic Midosuji Building, 1F
리뷰:
Wow! We highly recommend this place!! We just happened to find this because we are staying in Royal Park Iconic Osaka hotel. Its light jazzy type music, low lighting and friendly greeting as you arrive is so warm and cozy. But the food is out of this world. Weve only been to two other Teppanyaki restaurants in Japan so far but this is the best by far! Food is so fresh and delicious. Personnel is professional, and quick and helpful! Even though we do not speak Japanese. They were understanding and accommodating. English menu and made sure the ingredients were okaywhat we wanted for each course. The food is high quality and filling. Go there hungry and you wont be disappointed. P.s. steak was so good we forgot to take a photo of that. Exquisite dining and lunching. Best steak we ever had. Also amazing starters and Japanese curry.
We tried both Kobe beef and a tenderloin stake, and I honestly cannot say which one was better they were very different, but were both of the highest quality and cooked to perfection.
If I am ever back to Osaka, Rio will be on my absolute mustvisit list.
Not to mention the great service and beauty of the place, but of course the standards are already high on Japan.
And last important point to mention you can go for the most expensive option on the menu like we did for one person, but cheaper versions are are also amazingly delicious and of highest quality. So value for money in RIO is also above charts  Had an amazing culinary experience on my wife's birthday, chef Ishikawa was an absolute delight as both a host and our personal chef, not a single dish was anything but great if I had the space I'd do the whole meal again! Kobe Teppanyaki Rio is amazing. Located in the foyer of the Royal Park hotel, my partner and I went for lunch on our last day in Osaka.
We were greeted by lovely staff with great English and an English menu.
The chef introduced themself, greeted us and then cooked us one of the best steaks we have eaten. They even told us when to get the camera ready for the flame to sear the steaks. We had the set lunch steak, salad, rice and soup and washed it down with a nice glass of Red.

Definitely recommend trying out this restaurant. The price was very reasonable as well.
Thank you team. Visited in November 2023, and it was really an amazing place to try kobe beef for the first time! The chef knew what he was doing and gave us a little performance. So far a superb experience. Will be back if I go to Osaka!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−6−１９ ロイヤル中家 １階
리뷰:
This place is amazing! We got the Bamboo Course which contains 7 courses  1 main dish  1 dessert. We were here on the 24th of November.

I cannot sound my amazement of the process since this is my first Kaiseki experience. The chefs are making food in front of you yes we're by the counter by choice.

Got the dishes, tasted our first Fugu, desserts were great, the food were pretty, tasted good, we're full because it has proper main dish, all of it are really amazing.

We reserved from our hotel concierge a day before so you can try that too. Really good. Went because of the raving reviews. Did not reserve so went at 5.15pm. Place starts getting busy at about 6.15pm. Husband does not eat sashimi but the chefs were accommodating. Fabulous end with the jelly in black sugar syrup and soy flour.

Experience legitimised and affirmed by the constant flow of elders aged 45 and above, and you would agree this is a strong sign of the authencity of traditional cuisine. The restaurant usually full and recommend make reservation. An open kitchen concept and able to watch crews working. We order the second highest price omakase set. Sake taste good. The set was amazing and cooked with care and good presentation. Fabulous meal end with wonderful dessert. Server was friendly and explained each dish while serving. Ownerchef came and said hello to us. Considering the quality of food, services and the ambiance, it was a value for money. 2023 Still, without a doubt, my favorite dining experience in Osaka.

2020 This is my happy place in Osaka. Carefully prepared food, phenomenal service. The staff really takes care of you.

I sometimes get the courses, love love the maguro, tempura, lotus root dumpling and scallops. Don't be afraid to ask for recommendations even if your Japanese is embarrassingly basic like mine. Have Dassai sake with fish, if you can.

Sit at the counter, order a yuzu liqueur with soda and watch the welloiled machine at work. I couldnt make a reservation so went at 500 pm. Had the shortest Omakaze but still 7 dishes, 8800 yen and it was very fresh and delicious. The staff explained the cuisine very kindly in English. A lot of seafood menu interpreted into Osaka style. It was open kitchen, very interesting to watch the cooks including the owner chef working to make the best dishes.

주소: 1F Sanei Moor Building ３丁目 ８ 7 ８, ３丁目-８ 南船場 中央区 大阪市 大阪府 542-0081, Japan
리뷰:
This brunchbreakfast spot is an absolute gem with super yummy food and a lovely atmosphere!
We had to wait a bit, as they were short staffed due to illness, but it was absolutely worth the wait. We ordered the smashed avocado with bacon, that was cooked to perfection with a slightly runny yolk. The almond chai latte and flat white were excellent, and the atmosphere was fun and trendy, with relaxedchill music.
Colin, the owner, was super lovely and even gave us lots of tips for bars in Osaka and for our next stop in Kyoto. Highly recommend giving it a try! A great little breakfastbrunch place. Relaxed atmosphere and really great service. The chai latte is fantastic, be careful with that first sip though, nearly competed in the cinnamon challenge when I accidentally breathed in . The bread is great here, got the full rugby and the portions are indeed for a rugby player.  If you are looking for great portions for your dollar that's an excellent choice. Tons of fresh veg. Can't recommend it enough, worth a stop. Visited from Georgia, USA and found this place on a whim near our hotel since we wanted coffee and a healthy snack. This place does not disappoint! Amazing food and a more amazing staff! Im beyond grateful for their hospitality and recommend this place! Vibe was cozy and chill nice playlist and the staff were super friendly. My coffee was nice and strong yet super smooth. My wife and kids had smoothies and they were delicious too. A little thinner than what we are use to but rest assured nothing went to waste.
My kids have food allergies and they took the time to make sure what we ordered was safe for them to eat. We went with scrambled eggs over toasted gluten free toast with smoked salmon, sauted veggies with smashed avocado for the kids and egg, cheese and tomato toasties for my wife and I.
All the food was delicious and we are already planning to come back tomorrow for breakfast.
 Very relaxed place with a lighthearted fun ambience, incredibly friendly service, and the food is incredible. I love ham and sausage, so I went with "The Full Rugby", and it far surpassed expectations.

55, highly recommended for anyone looking for a delicious breakfast place with great coffee.

주소: 1-chōme-4-15 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
Absolutely delicious and worth the wait.

I lined up for about 35 minutes at lunch time, which I think is typical for this restaurant. As other reviewers have noted, you make your order in the queue and can't add more once you're inside. But if you know these things ahead of time, it's definitely worth a visit. I got a mini sized okonomoyaki and it was enough to fill me up, but if you're not sure, I'd suggest ordering any of the full size dishes.

They are very efficient and start cooking your meal before you get to your seat, but they will finish it off in front of you. Nice to find an oknomiyaki place that offer vegetarian option. You can even add noodle to your oknomiyaki. Queue is decent when we visit. You will have to place your order while in the queue. Once you are seated, you cant add order. Level 1 is counter seating. Level 2 has tables and suit for 36 persons. Service at level 1 seems to be better than level 2. Level 2 staff is just trying to rush to cook your food and serve it to you. Maybe the heat of cooking plus serving isnt something they enjoy. Food wise, pretty tasty food. Only thing I dont understand, they cook raw food with fully cooked food on the same hot plate and close together. OSAKA! A michelin recommended Okonomiyaki Osaka pancake. They have a lot of options!! But! We need to order everything while waiting, cant order anything more after we get in. So we ordered a lot,  but we just wanted to try.

We chose 3 signature pancakes, and one fried noodles. These I recommend. They make it in front of you. The atmosphere is hard to say because its a street food kind.

For 2 people, I think 2 pancakes are totally enough. Because takeout doesnt taste good. Luckily, we were able to get the table right away around 3pm. We have high expectation given the restaurant has got Michellin guide for so many years! Unfortunately, it was not as exceptional as many reviews said. The Okonomiyaki itself is decent freshlycooked right in front of us and ingredients used are fresh, but personally I think the taste is not that rich. I firstly know this restaurant from Drama Kodoku no Gurume Solitary Gourmet, on Netflix. Now, this restaurant has won Michelin recommendations on consecutive years and thus becomes super popular. It always has a line outside.
I waited for 30 mins around. Staff will give you a menu and take your order when you are in the line. Note that you cannot order more food once inside, so you need to decide and order everything you want while in line you can still order drink once being seated.
I tried two mini size okonomiyaki.
Yamaimo Okonomiyaki, which is completely flourless since it made of yamaimo mountain yam. You can have to ur own protein option and I chose pork belly. I see they roasted pork belly on both side, and add batter onto it. Once done, its served with their special sauce, mustard, and mayonnaise. It was so delicious! Chewy, savory, sweet, every single bite is packed with flavor and texture.
Mizuno okonomiyaki, which is their signature dish, consists of various protein that cooked together with batter and served with their special sauce, mustard, and mayonnaise. Its still good but I would say yamaimo okonomiyaki definitely wins.
For yamaimo okonomiyaki, a 30min wait is fine, but anything longer than 45 mins would be a disaster under summer weather.

주소: 1-chōme-23-9 Chiyozaki, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0023, Japan
리뷰:
The portions size is huge, which is great because you won't want to stop eating! Deliciously spicy Sri Lankan food. Great staff. Well worth a visit. I would give a 5 stars for this restaurant. I wasn't much educated of Sri Lankan cuisine so I always asked for recommendations from them. They always find out my liking of meat and recommended me the dish. Not only that they also educated me how to actually eat it to get the best flavors of their dishes. The good is very good and totally blew me out. Maybe a little spicy for a lot of people but trust me it's worth a try. The service is impeccable here, the hospitality and the friendliness is really something that's really worth it. I will go back for more. I have been to this place of and on for the past couple of years.
The food has been consistently great.
To his time though due to the rise in popularity in Sri Lankan cuisine I think the owners are getting carried aware a bit.
I ordered the 1500 lunch and treated myself to an additional chicken curry.
My fault I did not ask the price of the additional curry but 1200 for two pieces of chicken drumsticks!!! Then I expect the curry to blow my mind or at least have white table cloths when you serve a small curry for that price.!!! It feels like daylight robbery I could have paid 200 more and had a second plate of whole lunch.
I guess Ceylon curry beats them anytime. The meal was a little on the expensive side, however it was completely worth it for the massive amount of flavour in every bite. Highly recommend the boar or mutton and a Sri Lankan ginger beer. The food is very spicy which is AWESOME. This my first time eating Sri Lankan cuisine and has given me an excellent first impression! The most authentic Srilankan meal Ive had. Everything was fresh, the quality was incredible, and The staff are the friendliest people. Truly a great spicy meal, worth every penny.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0085 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Shinsaibashisuji, 2-chōme−6−１８ 早川ビル Ｂ１
리뷰:
Take the stairs down one floor to enter a quaint, frenchinspired restaurant with oldschool posters and decor. Most importantly the food was good and value for money! We ordered the Lunch "Bistrot Set" 2,500yen, Chicken roast spice sauce was delicious and the Duck roast black pepper sauce was presented beautifully. We upgraded one of the desserts to the peach melba which to our surprise was made with Japanese peaches not the canned kind. The service ended with coffee and tea, a delightful meal indeed The dinner dishes are really good. My friend and I ordered the dinner course with red wine. The price is reasonable with the food quality. All staff are friendly and really nice to explain all the plates that we ordered. The restaurant environment is cozy. English menu is not available but staff are kindly help to order the food The food was as expected but not exceptional. The price of the set menu was also amenable and not too pricey.
The service, though, was not as i expected for a french bistro. Servers were not as attentive as I'd like them to be. Since it was our anniversary dinner, picked out the oldest and most trusted bistro in Osaka. Unfortunate, but nonetheless we had a good time. Good place for light eating, the food has fine dining vibe but I think the place is more interesting for people who would enjoy drinking In Osaka for 2 weeks and sampling the French restaurants in the area. So far, the Bistrot dAnjou is the winner. Add the duck for lunch with a carafe of red. This just hit the spot. Loved it. Glad to see the restaurant busy at noon.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 1-chōme−3−１ 大阪駅前第１ビル
리뷰:
You have to experience this place in order to enjoy it. Quick turnaround as people come enjoy their drink a good conversation and awesome food!

Love it and will definitely return!!

Couple things to note
1 Standing only
2 Have to queue
3 All Japanese menu so do take note.. translate app DOES NOT do the menu justice!!! Just bring a friend that can read Japanese!  We went here during the rush hour on our second day in Osaka. So calculate to wait a bit when u came arround 800 pm. The waiter was kind, the atmosphere as I expected, great! This feeling, you go in the Metro station and there is a whole street of restaurants and bars and people drink, eat, smoke and enjoy life is great. The food was damn good. I went here because of a youtuber Lukas and I really need to say he made a good job! It was the best fresh made fry chicken I had in Japan so far still some days left. Also the raw beef was great. I can really recommand that place. And you should order a Saporo  good beer in Japan  This spot is a legend. Standing izakaya with outrageously delicious food for great prices. It is clearly loved by locals. Good for a quick hangout , roast beef , katsuo tataki and tofu  recommend, Came here on the recommendation of one of my japanese friends, and had absolutely no regrets. It is slightly difficult to order because there is no english menu, and the patrons are mostly local. But we managed fine with google translate. Kind of want to gatekeep this, because the quality of the food is far beyond what they are charging. My favourites are the beef tataki, fried shrimp, and the fried oysters. However, everything on the menu is good. Will definitely be revisting next time im in osaka.

주소: 2-chōme-4-14 Yariyamachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0027, Japan
리뷰:
Food taste pretty nice plus nicely presented.   The master chief is super thoughtful,  make me feel very welcomed gain back most of the score .

But honestly,  as a Michelin 2 starred restaurant, I do expect more variety on their wine list....
Understand nothingno one can gain everyone's heart, not even GOD, but the Japanese white wine i'd order is really really NOT my favour.... like drinking perfume...

Not sure if i am too picky p , the lady serving my table seems urging me to order wine even when I am still discussing with my hubby whether to order a bottle,  by glass or wine pairing set,  this part can improve.

Overall, I do recommend to give a try q A place truly worthy of Michelin stars! The dishes are wonderful, a course menu with Spanish and Japanese influence using the best ingredients from parts of Japan. The staffs are also attentive and informative, and the chef is very friendly and is willing to send everyone back home safely after finishing the meal. Had high expectations for this restaurant because of its Michelin rating. Upon our arrival, we were welcomed into a small dimly lit waiting area with 2 other parties. The seats were an awkward height to the table, and the space was not all that comfortable of the tight quarters. We noticed the party next to us had a guest wearing casual jeans and a hoodie, but the restaurant didnt seem to mind. The hostess brought out welcome drinks for the party next to us, and ours didnt arrive until 5 minutes later, even though we all arrived at the same time. We werent actually seated in the restaurant until 10 mins later, when we were led up the stairs, passing the chefs who welcomed us on the way in. The restaurant is a renovated apartment building, beautifully designed with 45 tables per floor. We sat at our table for another 10 min before we were finally served water, and the first part of dinner seemed like the staff was playing catch up because they seated too many tables at the same time. Service was polite,  but not particularly personable, and everyone spoke English well. Food was actually quite delicious, although Im not sure I saw any Spanish influence in particular. The Chef had trained in Modena, Italy and a wasabi pasta in particular was excellent. The menu was very fallinspired we loved the airy pumpkin bread, the toasted brown rice risotto, and the roasted chestnuts that really invited all senses into the Japanese countryside. There was also a few seafood presentations from Hokkaido such as an Amberjack that was beautifully plated, just lightly seared. At the end of the night, one of the chefs walked us out and gave us a very warm send off. For a 2 star restaurant it used to have 3, Fujiya is very reasonable priced, and the food is simple and delicious. It is unfortunate that the night did not start off the same way it ended. For a 2 michelin starred restaurant the price you're paying is considered reasonable per say. I made my reservation 2 months in advance. Reservations are a must as the restaurant has really limited seats. I requested for a more private table and they gave me what I asked for. The staff were really friendly and service was excellent. The dining experience itself was exceptional and the chef himself Fujiwarasan came and served us the main course. Nestled between two buildings with a discrete entrance, Fujiya 1935 is a Three Star Michelin restaurant serving contemporary European influenced dishes prepared with seasonal Japanese ingredients. The interior of the restaurant is elegant and understated with a minimalist decor accentuated by natural lighting. Dishes are expertly cooked and presented beautifully. Service was flawless, with staff taking the time to explain each course in detail. Most surprising of all was the fact that Chef Fujiwara personally came by to talk to us at the end of the service to ask us about our experience. For us, Fujiwara 1935 represents a musttry for those in the Osaka area. Unlike many establishments of this calibre, we found the experience to be warm and inviting offering a personal connection between the food and the establishment.

주소: 3-chōme-2-26 Higashinodamachi, Miyakojima Ward, Osaka, 534-0024, Japan
리뷰: Must do in Osaka! The seafood was fresh, the atmosphere and service was excellent! Prices were reasonable with unlimited cold tea available to help beat the heat. The unagi was incredibly tasty  get it! Dont be deterred by the long line. It moves fairly quickly. Not many options on the menu but you don't need it. Get what they're known for. This is paradise for seafood enjoyers. You will wait in line but its worth it. They manage the line well. You will also share a table with someone and be standing up. Also worth it. Toyo does a cool thing with a torch, ice water, and tuna chunks. We've all seen the tiktok. Luckily its not just for the show, the food is killer. Although the wait was about an hour long in hot and humid weather, the wait was worth it since the fatty tuna very delicious. The lean tuna and the tuna cheek stirfry were also delicious but not as good as the fatty tuna. The grilled eel roll was also yummy and full of flavor. Beware that the tuna cheeks take a while to cook but it's worth trying at least once. It was my dream to get to meet him and not only did I get to do that and get a selfie and see his performance, but the food is truly remarkable. He is so hospitable and does a performance regularly for all of the diners. Honestly worth the wait, but I didnt more than 10 minutes. I arrived at 1230 and got a table quickly. The fresh tuna sushi and sashimi were delicious, and the creamy sea urchin was a highlight. I recommend the broiled tuna cheek meat too.

주소: 2-chōme-4-14 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
We stumbled upon Gyozaoh while looking for a place to eat near Dotonbori, and it turned out to be a great find! The staff was incredibly welcoming and made us feel right at home. We tried a variety of gyozas, salads, chicken, and even some unique dishes like ostrich balls.

The menu had a wide range of Japanese dishes to choose from. One of the highlights was the Umeshu plum wine tastingwe got to sample all the different varieties they offered, and each one was excellent.

Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience, and I highly recommend it if youre in the area! A very popular among tourists restaurant serving traditional Japanese food and a rare find in Osaka! offering a variety of vegetarian and vegan options! The staff speaks good English, the service is quick, the prices are very reasonable and the food is tasty. My wife and I had heard great things about this place, so we decided to check it out. It's close to Dotonbori but still far enough away to not draw a huge crowd like other places. We waited about 30 minutes to get inside. The restaurant is small and there seems to be only one cook, which is why the service is a little slow. However, the wait is completely worth it. Their service is exceptional and this was some of the most delicious food that we ate during our stay in Japan.

We ordered the panfried gyozas, Japanese fried chicken, and another dish whose name I've forgotten. Everything was perfect. We also tried the brandy plum wine, which we loved so much that we decided to buy a bottle to take home. If you're in the area, make sure  that you eat at this restaurant. The wait for the delicious food will be worth it. Great food, very uncomplicated. They have gyoza, but also regional specialities such as skewers and classics like Karage chicken. We took a bit of everything and never regretted that decision. Service was kinda quick and the whole experience was very nice. We came here for dinner in the evening, be prepared to wait, we waited for an hour. The cucumber and fried tofu were good, nice and refreshing. We tried the vegetarian ramen and gyoza also the normal ramen and gyoza too. The food was great, lived up to its reputation. Would recommend coming here to eat.

주소: 3-chōme-2-4 Nakanoshima, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0005, Japan
리뷰:
A special teppanyaki experience above the rooftops of Osaka. KURA is located on the 40th floor of the Conrad Hotel. It serves grilled meat and sushi. My lunch menu was varied and very tasty. I was impressed by the choice of meat. The team was extremely courteous and friendly. The prices were fair. I can highly recommend a visit. Delicious teppanyaki with spectacular view! Conveniently located near metro. This teppanyaki uses a lot of fresh ingredient, but nothing special to offer special sauce,plating, etc. Id prefer something more creative at this price point almost 200 USD. Plus, there are manyyyyy good wagyu in Osaka. Prob wont come back again. An unforgettable dining experience at KURA  Teppanyaki  Sushi in Conrad Osaka! The ingredients were fresh, the presentation was exquisite, and every dish was perfectly prepared. The teppanyaki was a true highlight, cooked with precision right in front of us. The ambiance and city views made it even more special. Highly recommended for sushi and teppanyaki lovers! Best teppantaki in Osaka!
The food was so delicious, and very high quality. The cooking and show were a highlight! The chef shows incredible knife skills when he cut a Kuruma ebi. Our visit to Japan will forever hold a special place in our hearts, and one of the most unforgettable experiences was dining at this incredible restaurant. From the moment we stepped in, we were welcomed with the warmth, grace, and precision that symbolize Japanese culture. The food was not only delicious but presented with such care and artistry that it felt like an extension of the countrys deeprooted traditions. This was more than just a mealit was an experience that captured the beauty and honor Japan has to offer. A true lifetime memory for our family!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0084 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Souemonchō, 6−２６ タムラビル 1階
리뷰: Shop opens at 6pm and we are the first one dine in without reservation. People come here more than half arent local. Indeed food here is above average but a bit priced. Waygu is melty and beef tongue is nicely tasted. Normally a main chef is here cooking which is more entertaining yet chefs here collectively cook different dishes in same teppan. However its still a nice teppanyaki recommended. The food, service and ambiance were all great. The only setback is that the restaurant was a little small. There were only bar seats and two tables of four seaters. There were 5 of us and we had to squeeze in a table for four pax. Nevertheless, we still enjoy the food and services.  Excellent place. We loved it and even visited twice. Only meat is a bit expensive but i believe is what you expect fron a5 kobewagyu meat. Staff and menu English speaking, very friendly and cooking in front of you, so very clean place also. Many options besides meat and would come back again if we can. This place is amazing!  We loved the Wagyu beef and sides.  It is in a quiet street close to Dotonburi street, away from the crowds, but close enough to all the action.  I had dinner here, in this family friendly restaurant.  Not to be missed!!! In the rainy day. I random  restaurant for dinner. I found this place. Atmosphere is great. And  food like curry rice is the best. Wagyu good quality tasty and juicy

리뷰:
Delicious okonomiyaki with options for pescatarian. No point waiting for an hour in dontonbori when you can find a great place like this that I local and delicious , also full English menu for those that need . Hidden gem for having good price and good quality okonomiyaki.

Place just near the station.

Ordered the special onion and pork. And ita super delicious !! And the place was not to crowded Its a little event restaurant. You can see how your Okonomiyaki is made.   Ever order you make all seem to hail it. The food was delicious.  Just order the classic Okonomiyaki. You wont be disappointed. As appetizer I had the grilled chicken skin. Awesome.   Enjoy  Very authentic Osaka style okonomiyaki. You can also get it in seafood  squid and shrimp. A must try food in Osaka. Very tasty Okonomiyaki. It was full house so I have to buy togo. It was so good, no wonder full house.

주소: 1-chōme-5-12 Fukushima, Fukushima Ward, Osaka, 553-0003, Japan
리뷰:
Wonderful teppanyaki restaurant. Very intimate and personal service. The entire restaurant only has 7 seats, so if you are a larger party, it's almost guaranteed you will have the entire restaurant to yourself. Also, the chef orders and buys the ingredients depending on what menu you book, so it's guaranteed to be super fresh. The menu is great value and everything was beyond my expectations. Highly recommended! The Village Osaka was wonderful! The chef and staff are so very friendly. They make a show out of the meal and are very attentive and really care about the food and the experience. Even the other customers were very friendly! We were greeted outside the restaurant by name when we arrived and had the best steak weve had in Japan so far. Highly highly recommended! Awesome experience with great food in Osaka. Chef Kasai and his staff were super friendly, welcoming and attentive during the entire experience. I took my partner to The Village restaurant for his 30th birthday. We had the best experience, from start to finish. All staff were welcoming and friendly and made the effort to try get to know us despite the language barrier. The food was 1010 , no complaints whatsoever  we couldnt recommend this restaurant anymore!
As a surprise, at the end the gentlemen brought my partner out a dessert cake with candles to celebrate his birthday.
Lovely evening, lovely food and lovely company. Many thanks Very good teppanyaki restaurant, a couple of people speak limited English, but we made it work, top notch food and great services, I recommend them to have online reservations and English menu, will come again.

주소: Japan, 〒555-0032 Osaka, Nishiyodogawa Ward, Ōwada, 4-chōme−13−２ 恩地マンション １階
리뷰:
Halal restaurant in front of Osaka Masjid. Been here on Friday and they served buffet of biryani rice, mutton curry, chicken curry, salad, and lassi for only 1500 yen per person. The taste was good, coming around 11.30 and it was already full of people. We ate more than two plates as it was really tasty. Not only Muslims, many Japanese also come to have lunch here. I was skeptic before going because some of the reviews here says their behavior is not nice. Well there behavior is not up to the standards of Japanese waiters for sure but if you are from south east Asia youll find there behavior just okay. Thats how they behave in the local restaurants.

I tried their set A. According to me food cant taste any better with in the price they are offering. The nan was freshly baked. It was soft enough to take bites easily. The dal curry was best.

Highly recommended if you visit the area. I was visiting Osaka from out of town, and since theres a mosque nearby my Airbnb, I thought Id try some halal food with my boyfriend. We visited right at 5 and were the first customers for dinner. The reviews mentioning rude staff must be outdated, because the service we got from the two gentlemen were nothing but nice. They greeted us energetically upon our arrival and checked in on us throughout our meal. I know theres a few places around the area that serve the same cuisine for similar prices, but this one is IT! I seriously cant describe how good my meal was. Absolutely incredible. The best food Ive had in Japan. Ill be thinking about my meal for weeks to come! Second time I've been there. The staff is always very nice, the food is good and portions, depending on what you order, big.
Today we had a special meal! Maklube. So delicious, nice looking and a lot.
Try Maklube but don't forget to make a reservation ahead as it's not on the regular menu. Homefood hungerpangs led us to this restaurant, which we found through google.  The food was awesome, just the right spices. The service was even better. The server was kind and attentive. They also gave us complimentary sweets and chai lassi. Overall, I would certainly recommend this place for people craving Indian Pakistani Arabic cuisine. Thank you!

주소: 大阪市中央区 東心斎橋 ２－６－５ エイトワンビル 4 FLOOR Osaka Shi , Chuo Ku Higashi Shinsaibashi 2 - 6 - 5, EIGHT ONE BLDG, 4FLOOR, ２丁目-６ 東心斎橋 中央区 大阪市 大阪府 542-0083, Japan
리뷰:
Fantastic, authentic Filipino food.  My Filipina partner especially enjoyed how tasty everything was and the owners were very kind and welcoming.

Live music on Friday Saturdays.  The fried tilapia with some kind of coconut milk sauce was crazy good . Take the stairs up to the second floor then the elevator up to the 4th floor from there. Great Filipino food at reasonable prices!  Owners are super friendly and helpful!  Food is traditional but not greasy as other places may be.  Had the adobo, whole fried chicken, fried rice, lechn kawali and bangus milkfish belly.  All super delicious! As a fellow Bisaya, the experience was great! Ate and kuya was really hospitable. The food was great. Which one would you pick? The Lechon Kawali? Chicharon Bulaklak or the fried rice. Omg! ofc, ALL!!!!!! Got my cravings covered! Try other filipino dishes here in Bamboo Restaurant that would probably satisfy your cravings. Had Dinner last night here at Bamboo and the service was incredible. The Owners made me feel right at home and chatted with us throughout the night. My friend and I ordered Lumpia Shanghai, Lechon Kawali, Chicken Adobo, Pancit Canton. All the food tasted amazing, my favourite was the Lechon Kawali. 1010 for the food and service.

If you want a taste of the Philippines in Osaka, Bamboo is the place to be.

Will definitely be going back there when im in Osaka next.

주소: 4-chōme-1-9 Minamisenba, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0081, Japan
리뷰:
Make a reservation prior to heading down. When checked in the morning, there were Open slots for 11am, 12pm, and 130pm. You have the option of alacarte or to order one of their sets. We took the set and it was pretty good! The chef was friendly as well. I came without expectation because its a hotel restaurant. I was blown away at how good it was. My dinner was excellent. I had a set menu with the Wagyu A5 option. It was perfectly prepared and cooked by an awesome chef who even spoke some French. Visited during my visit last November when I was staying at W Osaka. Good food but not too standout, loved the service though. Also they will give you a pair of chopsticks as souvenir after the visit. A most beautiful experience that we had tonight! It's our first time in Japan and we wanted to try out the wagyuu beef at least once. Many restaurants were already fully booked, but this one, despite needing to book way in advance, welcomed us! We had to wait for 30 minutes but it was our bad so having to wait ONLY for 30 minutes was perfect! I would like to thank Ruka and the manager Nami who didn't hesitate to accomodate us.
The service was absolutely top notch, as Ruka, Nami and Kyohana were here to serve us with a lot of professionalism and good vibes. They never hesitated to assist us in any way possible and were always there may we require anything. They even do some conversations and smalltalk, which is greatly appreciated.
Of course, the diner wouldn't have been this beautiful without the chef Tsuminoe. Who introduced us to each meal and did his best despite the language barrier.

We ordered the Soup with bamboo shoot, absolutely delicious and not too heavy as to have space left. And then the Miyazaki and Wagyuu meat that they shared in two for my partner and I, so well cooked and seasoned. This experience of wagyuu was a wonderful first time for us.

The cost of the dinner was completely worth it, it's a must do if you want to have a good first experience of wagyuu.

Thank you again, Nami, Ruka, Kyohana and Tsuminoe for everything, you made our first time in Japan even more wonderful and you saved our evening, we will come back for sure! And this time with a reservation! My man Shoki had me and my wife in amazement by his culinary precision. For someone who looked quite young, he was skilled and experienced.
The Midou course was deliciousOishiii and offered a variety of different courses. We went on a weekday night around 6pm, and didn't need a booking! Our waiter was honestly very accommodating too and took a photo of us for the memories.
It's a bit more expensive than street food  but, the slower more sociable experience was worth it for us.

주소: 2-chōme-6-4 Fushimimachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 541-0044, Japan
리뷰:
A very nice restaurant with a warm atmosphere and exceptionally friendly and polite staff! We have visited it twice already, most likely we will come again and recommend it to others. Very good food from quality ingredients at quite affordable prices, excellent selection. Warmest wishes from Kazakhstan and many thanks to all the staff for a great dining experience during our trip. An outstanding sushi restaurant that's very unpretentious and serves delicious dishes. It was right by our hotel and after going on two nights and not finding a seat, we finally made it! It was so worth it. Get the fatty tuna sushi roll with green onions. You won't regret it. Awesome sushi at a reasonable price.  Ingredients make the food and the Wasabi, soysause and rice were special and complemented the excellent fish.
There are English menues. Service was excellent.
Lunch set was great and looking forward to dinner. Great atmosphere , amazing sushi , interactions with the staff chefs and other guests were unforgettable! Make sure to get a seat at the bar to see and interact with the chefs! Family run business! Fresh fish which you can taste! Best sushi in Osaka! Spoiler alert! We had the best time in Sushi Hayata!

I'm sad I didn't get the chef's name and everyone else. Their team consisted of four chefs at the sushi station, 3 gorgeous women at receiving.

We came in just slightly hungry because of all the vending mac drinks we consumed, so we decided to walk aro oir hotel neighborhood and along the way we pictured to eat some light meal with sushi to end our evening.

We tried to express to the chef and receptionist that we are entrust them to feed their recommendations. They could not get it at first, but in the end they seemed to enjoy feeding us.

We had sushi assortment, I'm not sure what they were exa but I will try my best to provide caption the sushi names what I remember.

My boyfriend ordered a nice sweet fruity plum wine with soda and I made a mistake of ordering a strong potato shochu on the rocks "kurokirishima" and they were all laughing at my reaction after taking a small sip. In the end my boyfriend and I exchanged. Aside from that, he ordered oolong tea and unexpectedly it was iced.

For the main events!!! The special sushi selections. I want to think they made it very special only for us.

We ordered chef recommended sushi assortment, and the others were just "omakase"!!!  He told us which one to dip and not dip in the soy sauce. Mostly the ones he made separately from the sushi assortment don't need soy sauce dipping.

We both love sushi and we didn't know that fresh Japanese sushi should be tasting this good!!! Every bite and texture contributes to the flavor and whole experience.

We were recommended to eat white fish or the ones with "lighter flavor" first and the rest is fine to eat next, eat the fatty tuna and grilled mackerel last as they had "heavier flavor". We ate the tamago at the very last part.

TO SUMMARIZE EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD, PERFECT EXPERIENCE FOR US, BEST PLOT TWIST AND SURPRISE DINNER.

Squid "ika" sushi was a combination of crunchy and chewy texture that has bland but tasty flavor at the same time.

Sweet shrimp "ama ebi" sushi is so fresh and naturally sweet. An easy favorite!

All of tuna "maguro" sushi were excellent. It's our first time to try legitimate very fatty "otoro" sushi and my gosh they were melting in the mouth but without the "oily" feel of other fatty foods.

Grilled mackerel "saba shioyaki" was exceptional for my boyfriend and I found it the same too. Unlike other grilled fish sushi I've had before.

Sea urchin "uni" sushi is something I was unsure of because I'm not a big fan of sea urchin, which some friends and family are and I never understood why but after this one I'm converted! It has a mushy texture as expected but the flavor was very fresh, rich and creamy!

ALL OF THEM had balanced flavor, SUPER FRESH, no need for extra wasabi because it's already just perfectly incorporated in the sushi. The pickled ginger was also just right, strong but not overpowering and not chemicallike taste.

Visit date 24 July 2024 Dinner
Paid about 1518kJPY I forgot

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 2-chōme−5−２５ ザ・リッツ・カールトン大阪5階
리뷰:
I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant. The setting is elegantly palatial, making you feel as if youre inside a European castle. The Michelinlevel feast was exquisite, with every dish meticulously prepared and delicious. As we left, the French head chef personally came out to thank us, bowing as he saw us off  a gesture that showed the utmost courtesy and attentiveness.

I would love to come back and try the other menus here if I get the chance.
Highly recommended. Nestled within The RitzCarlton, La Baie is a sanctuary of French gastronomy.  Experience unparalleled luxury with sophisticated ambiance featuring rich wood paneling, classic chandeliers, and elegant artwork.  Visually stunning plates and impeccable service create a truly exclusive and unforgettable dining experience. Celebrated birthday here went for the most expensive menu, good execution on all dishes, lobster outstanding. Wine pairing is good, but mostly white, we liked more red.
The whole dinner is about 130,000yen for 2 with wine pairing. Ordered the Elegant course with Wine paring tonight.
Food is delicious, and service is amazing.     Only fish dish is kind of too salty to me so will ask for light salt next time. The best fine dining in the Kansai area by far. La Baie, located in the Ritz Carlton is a great French restaurant with Japanese influences. The menu changes with the seasons and is always fantastic. I have been coming here with my wife for many years, and with fine Michelin star  experiences, the service is on another level. They know my food likes and dislikes, allergies, and know I am left handed. Most of this comes from observation rather than request. We will be back. Many more times.

주소: Japan, 〒556-0011 Osaka, Naniwa Ward, Nanbanaka, 2-chōme−2−２１ 3F
리뷰:
Yeah, really wish I could go back and tell myself not to go here. Went bc we thought it might be funny, but it was pretty depressing. We were largely ignored, lots of additional charges, and a ton of period blood in the bathroom. It was also super empty in there. Left awkwardly cry laughing. Parfait was good though, just really expensive. Maid cafe was a fun experience, MOE MOE KAWAIIII. I am a baka gaijin, but the staff were very kind to us  recommended to come and experience Wouldnt go back again. Ordinary food but you pay more than any other restaurants. They charged you 880 yen for admission fee at the start and charge more for taking pictures with those maids. And you need to pay more for entertainment such as dancing.
Th place is just like an office in an old building. Its not what I expected when I go to a restaurant.
Wont recommend to any friends. Very cute maid cafe. It was the first Id been to, so I didnt know what to expect.
The cafe is located on the third floor and you have to take an elevator.
The menu is streamlined in that you scan a QR and the whole menu comes up.
I will note that you will not be having many conversations if you cant speak any Japanese, however, the experience was still very cute nonetheless.
Most people come to cafes like this for the novelty, so dont expect 4 food.
All the maids here are very cute Amazing experience with sweet ladies and good vibes. We may have had to use a translator a few times since we speak English but they were so sweet about it and helpful! The dessert is delicious overall and very cute! A little pricey but worth it for all the things that come in a set! We got the dessert set, which included one dessert, one drink, one picture, and the choice of a gift a folder or animal headband. Would love to come back one day!

주소: 1-chōme-6-2 Higashishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0083, Japan
리뷰:
It has a great reputation and it delivers! Really solid food, tasty homecooked style. The frying is soft and flavoursome, the cuts of pork are spot on. Its about as good as youd expect from a place like this. Does it exceed my expectations? No. But its definitely worth coming to. They do a fullhouse style service where the new group of clients all sit together and they dont let new people in until the place is cleared. This can mean an hour wait for every 1012 people in the queue. I waited for an hour and it was worth it. If theres a queue, each sitting takes about an hour to clear. There are tables that seat 4144 and counter seats that seat 4. But its great that they dont squeeze folks in. If there might be just a couple sitting in the table for 4. Be the first 10 in the queue when it opens saves the hour wait. We ordered a 250g loin set and an mos set with white fish and prawn and loin. I think the fish was the yummiest. So good we lined up twice!

Food was utterly delicious. Bib Gourmand 3 years running. On our first visit we had the pork fillet and the pork shoulder the fattier cut both were absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked, juicy, flavoursome, crisp outer layer and so tender. Meals are accompanied by rice, pickles and a cabbage salad with 2 sauces for dipping which were amazing for cutting through the rich meat. On our second visit we again had the pork fillet, but also wanted to try the curry which was delicious with a perfect amount of heat.

Service was also very good. Husband and wife team work seamlessly together. The chef making sure to visit each table and have small interactions which I observed the tables around me to enjoy. We were the last ones in the restaurant last night and both were happy to have a chat and talk to us about their business and life in Osaka. Very pleasant indeed.

We arrived on the first occasion right on 530 and had a short wait around 30 minutes, but arrived much later into service the second visit around 1920 so was waiting a little over an hour in the line. Again the owner came out to check on the line and update on waiting times regularly. 1000 worth the wait. This was my second time at Daiki and it was even better than the last. The commitment to quality is unparalleled. Yes, you will likely have to wait because the restaurant has few tables and the owner does not want to overcrowd or reduce quality. He was even honest and helpful to people who were in line about the length of time and directed them to other restaurants when they balked at the time. But once youre in, youll soon have one of the best meals in Osaka. The meat is perfectly prepared the breading is crisp and welltextured. The drinks are ice cold and available in stylish glass bottles.

Finally, I appreciate the personal touch the owner put in with every customer, coming and speaking with them between meal preps and offering advice and answering questions. What a pro! I will definitely be back. Although we had to wait a quite a long time to be seated, it was totally worth it. My boyfriend absolutely loved it and is still talking about it. We had tonkatsu many times on our trip my bf doesnt like seafood and this was easily the best we had.
There are two people working there, the chef also doubles as a server. He spoke in English which we were grateful for. Thanks again

주소: Japan, 〒530-0042 Osaka, Kita Ward, Tenmabashi, 1-chōme−8−５０ 帝国ホテル大阪
리뷰:
Wonderful food and ever so flexible with customer's needs The night view was amazing.
The presentation was so beautiful that you could taste it with your eyes. Visited on the night of my stay.
Located on the 24th floor of the Imperial Hotel, the view was great. It was also the harvest moon of midautumn, so I was able to eat while watching the moon rising from Mt. Ikoma.

Although it was a course meal, there were several options to choose from.

The food was delicious, but it wasn't a particularly elaborate menu. My teenager was also eating with me, but I guess the taste was bland I can't help it since it's Japanese food, but I left some of the food behind.

Drinks were expensive since it was a hotel.
Beer is around 1,100 yen, and juices are around 800 yen.

I had made a reservation for 6 people, but even though I had not specified a private room, I was given a private room and charged a 5,000 yen private room fee. When I was paying, my mother grumbled, I thought you said you didn't need a private room.'' I wish I could have told you a few words when I entered the store.

Although it was a private room, the lights were in the wrong direction and my mother's seat was dark, so I pointed this out, but they didn't fix it. I think there were probably 4 people who were using the private room before, and the lighting was still adjusted for 4 people. Since I'm paying a lot of money, I wish they had adjusted the lighting in the room in advance. Throughout the meal, I kept saying that I was disappointed that the food looked so dark.

The payment was about 20,000 yen per person. I was looking forward to eating at a highend restaurant in Nadaman, but other restaurants in Kitashinchi have better service and more elaborate dishes. I don't think I will visit just for this store. We recommend eating outside the hotel even if you are staying overnight. First visit to Nadaman on the 24th floor of the Imperial Hotel in Osaka!
This is my second time with Nadaman 

The first time I went to Nadaman at Rihga Royal Hotel.
This time we went to the Imperial Hotel!

I went to lunch at my mom's request!

Lunch while looking at the view from the 24th floor is the best!
The window seat is definitely popular!
I went with a reservation for just a seat, but there happened to be an empty window seat.
I was given a tour! happy

What I asked for today
Lunch meal 7590 yen
is.

Advanced
Hot dishes
Structure
First meal
side dish
meal
Dessert
is.

For the first meal, you can choose between grilled fish or tempura.
For the second set, you can choose between beef or pork dishes.

This time we both ordered different things and shared them 

After all, Japanese food is the most delicious! I will reconfirm when I go to Tonadaman.
Too delicious...
The taste of this soup is indescribable, neither thin nor thick.
The sashimi is plump and the tempura is crispy.
There is nothing to complain about with all the dishes.

I want to eat Japanese food! If so, I definitely recommend Nadaman!
There are also multiple stores.

The restaurant in the hotel has great customer service! Something like that
It's amazing how thoughtful you were about what you were about to say.
A space where you can relax and enjoy your meal with hospitality.
I felt it was really nice.

I think I'll try it for dinner next time!
Thank you for the meal! It was so delicious! ! In December 2023, I ordered a 35,000 yen gift certificate course per person.
Everything was delicious, but the prices were high, including service charges and private room charges.
The sashimi was delicious.

주소: Japan, 〒541-0053 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Honmachi, 3-chōme−6−１２ セント レジス ホテル 大阪 12F
리뷰: My girlfriend and I came here to have a really nice dinner with good food and atmosphere. The restaurant did not disappoint. We had the villa course and every dish that came out tasted amazing. The portion sizes were also perfect for us and we both left perfectly satisfied. I also proposed to my girlfriend and the restaurant even got us a nice cake and champagne for free after our meal was over. Both my fiance and I want to come back some day and eat the delicious food again! Indulging in breakfast at St. Regis Osaka's La Veduta is an experience worth savoring. From the moment you step into the opulent dining space, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of luxury and refinement. The Japanese set menu offers a tantalizing array of culinary delights, each dish meticulously prepared to perfection. Whether it's the delicate flavors of freshly made sushi or the comforting warmth of traditional miso soup, every bite is a journey through the rich tapestry of Japanese cuisine.During my stay at the hotel, I found myself drawn to La Veduta each morning, eager to start my day with a memorable dining experience. The attentive service and elegant ambiance only enhanced the enjoyment of the meal. As I lingered over breakfast, soaking in the serene surroundings, I couldn't help but appreciate the attention to detail that went into every aspect of the dining experience. It was a moment of tranquility amidst the bustling energy of Osaka, setting the tone for a day of exploration and discovery in this vibrant city. Good ambience though lights are a bit bright.  Amazing and attentive staff and good food Tall ceilings, spacious surrounds, professional servers. Went there with 8 adults and one child 1.5yrs. They placed us in a separate area but still connected. Food was served at the right quantity and frequency. Wine list that I saw was heavy on Bordeaux and Burgundy, some good Italian wines better value and a smaller selection of others.  For a group, the setting worked. Bonus was the 1.5 year old was very well behaved. They prepared a simple meal for him. We went there for breakfast and lunch. The breakfast was great. There are quite many dishes that can be chosen from, and there is also a a la carte menu. But something was burnt and the smells was strong in whole restaurant. The lunch was also good, but the we both think the entrees are better than main dishes. The tiramisu was so delicious.

주소: 1-chōme-20-10 Higashinakajima, Higashiyodogawa Ward, Osaka, 533-0033, Japan
리뷰:
Conveniently located opposite East exit of Shin Osaka station. Affordable breakfast and curry sets frequented by Jap workers and nearby train crew. Costs between 500 to 800 yen for a set and it's a very satisfying and full meal to last us half a day to travel to other cities.

Shop opens early and closes late. Food is relatively cheap and service is quick. The menus on the tables are not complete, there are more options on the ordering machine. There are 2 ordering machines, one accepts cash and the other one doesnt Cheap, fast and good . Accepts cash and jcoinppayday. I rather come here than yoshinoya!

It is near the train station  outside. Ordering is done via tablet that has English.  The English menu made sense for most parts.

cons
Not many healthy options  deep fried items and rice  heavy carbs
Doesn't accept visa Forget to take a picture because very hungry at 2215
All Self service but have english menu at the machine  Not complicate and easy to use 
Taste is good compare to price for tonkatsux2 and large sizes rice bowl with miso soup for 880 yen with free tea Taste good. Just opposite Shin Osaka station. Would be great if its a little more spicy.

주소: 2-chōme-5-2 Kōraibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 541-0043, Japan
리뷰:
We are lucky to find a seat as didnt make an appointment. Environment was great, we bought a whole eel to share for 2 of us served in the box.
Eventually we felt we should eat more so we proceed to order their Ala carte whole eel to enjoy again. Total cost spent for 2 whole eels was about SGD 130. Which is worth the experience.

Shop was easy to locate, just use your google map and can find it. 55! What an experience! The food was amazing and the workers were unbelievably friendly and sweet. You can choose between a table and chair or tatami. I recommend tatami for the full experience! After eating you go back downstairs to pay. Run by the 15th generation and opened in the 1700s, love the Kansai way of cooking unagi. Went there during off hours after 2pm, much quieter. Make sure not to wear perfumes, you may get refused to enter. We went there around 1130am on Tuesday and there was no wait at all. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor and seems like it is in a residential building rather than a commercial building. We have to remove our coat and place them in a plastic bag and carry it up with you but didnt really understand the logic even though they explained that is because the place was small. There are a total of 6 tables with 4 seats each. Food and service were good but prices are  on the high side. When we finished our lunch at around 1230 there wasnt any crowd at all which was not what i expected. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. We went around 1pm and was greeted by the most amazing ladies who paid full attention to us from the start despite their limited but just enough english. They had an English menu and we ordered with no problems.
The food was absolutely delicious and had no complaints. It was definitely a highlight for a visit to Osaka.
The room is very small but we are given tatmu mats to sit on but the option for chairs was available. There were 3 tables in the whole room so there wasn't much space. The price was a bit steep as expected of proper unagi but everything we experienced justified the price.
Overall, it was an amazing experience that I would do again. Please give it a try and meet the amazing ladies who gave the best service I've seen combined with unforgettable food.

이름: MOMO’s Cafe & Restaurant Osaka Halal Restaurant
주소: 2-chōme-3-31 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰: Nice beef and chicken biryani. The meat is tender. Fluffy rice and flavourful  Worth the price. Should try their honey cheese naan and mango lassi  Look at the variety of food available! Delicious halal food and reminds you of home if you ever miss it. All of these are recommended. No regrets  I really have nothing to claim about. I love all of the food I ate, the manager and staff are nice also. I'll come back for that Bangladesh food. One of few places that serve halal south Asian food in Osaka. The biryani was okay, nothing fancy. Other dishes like butter chicken tasted okay, though the chicken portion was quite small. Pricey as compared to other places. Proper Asian Indian halal food. Central location and really tasty.  Choose the chicken biryani.  Its very good.   Alhamdulillah for the background Quraan recitation.   Clean ablutions.  Fair price.

주소: 2-chōme-10-11 Shimanouchi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0082, Japan
리뷰:
super good place!! the food here, especially the chicken, is really good. atmosphere is very welcoming, especially the owner! hes very friendly and chatty. its a great refresher after a long day. Went here with my wife. Chicken was the best and Itarosan was awesome! Would go there again when we're in Osaka. Itaro owner has an awesome personality. He will make you feel like home while serving up your meal. It's a barrestaurant with limited seating, so, be prepared to wait a little. We order his delicious whole rotisserie chicken which was enough for 3 people. He does run out of chicken. But, the other items taste great, especially his roll with pic de gallo. He is from Per and knows how to cook. A super cosy and intimate atmosphere. The owner was very kind and accommodating to foreign customers. The food was delicious!! The chicken was so moist and all of the food was so fresh. There is only one person cooking the food, so if youre okay with hanging out and having a few drinks while waiting for the food, this is the place to be!

Love from Australia What an amazing hidden gem in Osaka. The food was superb. The owner was super friendly and the music! LA MUSICA!
It was a very good dinner I had. So glad I stopped by! You must try their roasted chicken!

주소: 2-chōme-2-10 Tokuichō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0025, Japan
리뷰: One of my most favorite restaurants in Osaka, and I only have a few. I got the nasi padang and sate ayam. All were delicious, but what stood out is the beef rendang included in the nasi padang, and the sate ayam. The price was reasonable given the volume and quality of the dish. The staff were also really friendly. The ambience, although a bit dark, was classy while not being intimidating. I will bring my friends here next time. Will come back for more! A taste of Indonesia in the heart of Osaka. From mouthwatering rendang to fragrant nasi goreng, every bite is authentic and delicious. But what really makes it special? The incredibly friendly staff who make you feel at home from the moment you walk in. First time to try Indonesian food recommended by my Indonesian friend. Food is very tasty, reasonable price, nice decorations, and friendly staffs.  Definitely will come back again. Delicious Indonesian food with wonderful service. The chicken was so soft and fell off the bone. The fish was also very tasty. Highly recommend! They also take credit card, speak english, and have an english menu. Very convenient place in Osaka. Good food and taste authentic Indonesian. Service abit slow and sometimes can be forgetful on orders maybe lacking of service staffs. Must try if you want to ease cravings.

주소: Japan, 〒532-0003 Osaka, Yodogawa Ward, Miyahara, 1-chōme−1−１, Shin Osaka Hankyu Building, 2F
리뷰:
We ordered here 
 tomato pork mozarella okonomiyaki one of their in house speciality  very delicious
 avocado yakisoba one of their house speciality  topping pork  looks not promising at first but tastes really good. Dont miss it!
 fried rice  good taste and nice for kids
 thigh chicken skewer  always good friend for okonomiyaki and yakisoba

Location 
Shin osaka station same floor with subway station or down from JR gate

Note 
 Have english menu Tomato seafoods okonomiyaki was delicious. The cabbage are chopped finely. Big prawns n cuttlefish. Normal pork okonomiyaki was good and delicious too. Sauce and mayonnaise are perfect combination. Sausages are yummy. Omelette roll was soft and delicious. We even reordered it. Kimchi pork was delicious but not spicy and sour. Chicken yakitori are tender and juicy. Recommend. Food is great! We ordered cheese lotus, garlic rice, dashi egg rolls and two okonomiyaki. I personally love the garlic rice, though it sound like a simple dish but they are cooked to perfection. Kyoto locations offer much better Okonomiyaki and has other options.. I had to try Okonomiyaki while in Osaka, and this place was within 5 minutes walking distance from my hotel. I opted for a seafood okonomiyaki with soba noodle option, and I had them make one. Shrimps tasted very fresh with nice texture. I went there alone for a late lunch about 2 pm, and it wasnt clouded yet. I also had their specialty drink made with tomato juice golden tomato juice that is not red, and it hot the right spot for me!

주소: Japan, 〒530-0002 Osaka, Kita Ward, Sonezakishinchi, 1-chōme−5, 曽根崎新地１−５−２ 大川ビル本館２F
리뷰:
What a wonderful experience. Came in having a bad day. Couldn't help but smile. The service was phenomenal the atmosphere was intimate. They cook right across the counter from. It felt like a dinner with friends. The food was amazing I had the tendon with prawns. Best meal I've had in osaka. Loved it. 5
stars hands down. Easily the best tempura Ive tasted in Japan. The ebi, fish, and yasai tempura were cooked to perfection, complemented by the sauce. They have an English menu, and the owners are very friendly. Will definitely comeback to try the dinner course. We knew we were in the right place when we stepped in and the entire counter was occupied by Japanese customers. There were three ladies in their kimonos! We had the tempura course. The batter was light and crispy. Each piece was nicely fried. One of the best tempura courses that we have had. We had a hint that we will be in for a treat when we were served curry powder salt as one of the condiments. True enough. We had the staple tempura pieces but some of the most memorable ones for me were the more unusual items. I have had tempura mochi or cheese before, and I plan to come back again soon to have these again. They were really good. I also liked their fried prawn wrapped in shiso leaf. The scent of the shiso gives a welcomed lift. We capped off our meal with the tencha, which was again a first for us. Really enjoyed the broth. It was a great way to cap the meal. Went in for dinner. They had a course menu but also had their lunch bowls. I think because it was a less busy week night.

Food was incredible, we had the lunch don bowls.
Staff was very attentive, if you are from the US this might seem overwhelming, but it's done kindly to be super helpful. Chef came over at the end of our meal to ask where we were from. Would recommend this place for a nice dinner.

Was a little hard to find. Go up stairs of the white building and it's the wooden door. Dinner was on the set menu with appetiser, salad, and desert included.

The excellent chef and friendly staff served us a variety of tempuras, ranging from seafood and vegetables to cheese and sweets. Everything was fresh and delicious and the chef choices were quite unique.

They did an excellent job teaching us the best spice or sauce to use with each tempura. I couldn't believe I can take such a massive amount of food without feeling bloated.

It was a random choice that turned out to be my best tempura experience.
