리뷰: On the search for tasty Sushi we became attentive to this restaurant. With a view of the fresh fish counter and over Osaka we were presented with a well illustrated menu that was understandable for the English speaking guest. For special wishes I recommend Japanese basic knowledge. The food was very tasty and sufficient for me as an inexperienced sushi connoisseur. In addition, a Matcha tea was given to us by the chef and another free miso soup was provided. After the meal, the chef inquired whether we liked it and we left this upscale but very tasty restaurant happy and sated. We were starving after our trip on the train from kyoto. It was delicious, fresh and generous and also incredible value for Australians. Highly recommend Really good sushi although a bit spicy and great attention from the waiters. Totally would recommend. Really great food and amazing service, the waiter was very knowledgeable and great with suggestions, I recommend the rock salt beef and the fatty tuna. They also have an English menu. If youre trying to find it, its on the 16th floor in the corner. Fresh sushi, great service. English menu available

주소: Japan, 〒2F Osaka, Kita Ward, Nakanoshima, 3-chōme−2−4 3 2-4 JP 530-0005
리뷰:
Exquisite sushi omakase experience! We appreciated the amazing service, the staff speaks English and even made us an expedited lunch because we had only 1 hour to eat. The fish was of the freshest quality, and the chef was very skilled and talented. We will come back every time we come to Osaka, and I highly recommend for a memorable sushi experience. In a very surprising location, you find something very traditional. The chef was very dedicated and patient with us, informing us of every dish served. Every piece was exquisite and delicately shaped before our eyes. A great experience and set of flavors I highly recommend. My friends and I have never tried Omakase before so we decided to try this place after seeing its high reviews.

Its high reviews are welldeserved.

Food was great from the first bite to the last, and the chefs were kind enough try and explain the dishes to us in English, even pulling out their translator at times to field our curious questions.

The dishes served were really amazing, and we'd have loved to go for another round if we had the time and money.

Customer service was 1010, and the sake that was recommended to us was great too.

Only pity was that we didn't manage to get counter seats, but that's on us because we didn't manage to book early enough. Book earlier, guys!

TLDR mustgo dining experience in Osaka. Was surprised to find a restaurant that take a 1 person booking  as I had a lot of difficulty booking other places in.

Restaurant was easy for find if you take the escalator from the metro exit, takes you straight to 2F of the Festival Tower West.

The dinner started off with scallops sitting in a beautiful bowl of flowers. Every piece of fish was so fresh, I really enjoyed the omakase set ! I especially loved the uni, kohada, chuturo and the spanish mackerel. The egg omelette was cooked beautifully, not sure how they could achieve the spongy texture. The clear soup and dessert were a good ending to the dinner.

Top notch service by their friendly staff  everyone was so polite and smiley. Chef  couldnt speak a lot of English, but he still engaged with me. He also brought out a table with the english translations of the fish, which was a nice touch by the restaurant and himself.

Great dining experience! This was a fine sushifocused omakase, with a friendly chef.  He spoke a little English, is very skilled, and made great nigiri.  It was a good value and very tasty, but also not transcendental like the best sushi omakase experiences can be.

주소: 2-chōme-1-3 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
7 minutes walk from Shinsaibashi subway station. A Japanese cuisine restaurant with 9 seats at the counter that requires reservations. This popular restaurant is fully booked all year round, where you can enjoy the simple deliciousness of seasonal ingredients and each carefully prepared dish.

Omakase course
Steamed abalone and soft white seaweed
Nutaai of Tori shellfish
Sea bream and jade eggplant
Shirayaki conger eel
Seared bonito with Harimyoga
Takonankin
Fried young sweetfish
Dashirolled egg set meal
Fuki miso soup, pickles, rice
Mango and watermelon
Estimated budget including drinks is around 25,000 yen

I heard from people around me that this is a Japanese restaurant that you should try at least once, so I decided to visit. We are satisfied with the recommendations of those around us with the many elegant and beautiful dishes that bring out the deliciousness of the ingredients. The exquisite dashimaki egg had an impressive taste. I can once again feel the deliciousness of Japanese cuisine. How can I make a reservation?

I was lucky enough to go to a store I had always wanted to go to!
It's about an 8minute walk from Shinsaibashi Station, on a street where there are many famous restaurants in Shinsaibashi, also known as Michelin Street.

It's crab season and it's super delicious!
Mmm, it was the best taste in the best space along with the sake! Momen is located on Michelin Street in Shinsaibashi!

I was able to go because of good luck.

delicious! !

The degree of perfection of each item is amazing

The dignified atmosphere unique to kaiseki restaurants is just right.

At the end, the rice, fish, and soup were stained.

It was a blissful time as I was given plenty of alcohol to drink.

I was wondering why it was difficult to make reservations at this restaurant, but I was satisfied.

This is one of the stores I would like to visit again and again if I have the chance.

It was a feast! It's delicious and I want to come back more, but it's difficult to make reservations.

The young sweetfish that were swimming in front of me just now
I received a delicious life.

In addition to the seasonal ingredients, the thin somen noodles and yolks were delicious! The general's personality, story, smile,
The food was elegant and very delicious!

주소: 2-chōme-14-29 Sonezaki, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0057, Japan
리뷰:
This is the boss and master of Tuna! 53 years of making sushi and it absolutely shows. Every piece of sushi was hand cut and perfectly made. Such a great, traditional way of making sushi that sets Sushi Daigo apart. This is a small traditional sushi spot run by the chef and his mother. If you'd like a true Japanese sushi experience, this is the place to go. The space is small with 10 seatings. Regulars will move in the middle of their meal to create space for you.  None of us spoke Japanese, but the chef was very friendly and tried everything to accommodate us.

The sushi was very good. Top quality fish with proper amount of rice. Very consistent portion of rice with air gaps which shows the years experience of the chef.

Keep in mind this place is cash only. I have been here twice and I would go a hundred more times if I could. This man is a sushi wizardthe inside of this place looks straight out of a Ghibli filmrandom boxes tucked away full of seaweed or random herbs. An oven that lost its door some time long ago, now replaced by a piece of tin foil. Pots with no handles brewing questionable looking pots of soup? Omakase runs around 5000 per person and I could not recommend it enough. Each piece of sushi was a masterpiece and it is a meal I will not soon forget. This place was beyond wonderful! The sushi was delicious, and prepared by a wonderful man who clearly was a master of his craft. The atmosphere was wonderful and we quickly bonded with the chef and the other patrons, with some of the best sushi we have ever had, at a very good price. There is no menu that we saw and very limited English, but a lot of delicious sushi and two drinks for two people came to less than 10,000 yen, and would absolutely come again! In love with this place!!!! This is a typical Japanese place where foreigners are ripped off completely and outrageously. There is basically no service staff, the owner does everything himself and serves a few sushi variations. For a few nigiris and sushi I paid over 7.000 yen as a single person, which is almost twice as much as at good restaurants in Tokyo, and they didn't even have the best tuna here.
If you're a bit clinically picky, you should also give the place a wide berth! Avoid it at all costs and look for a real restaurant to eat in!

리뷰:
Excellent service! Hidden gem near Conrad hotel. The food was fantastic  great quality. Especially loved their steamed fish soup that came in a wooden basket, and their sea bream rice! My first time to Japan and the tempura is so good! I used to feel a bit weird about raw fish, but the sashimi here suits my taste  All of the staffs are helpful and attentive to their customers.
The courses started from appetizer to dessert are all delicious! I love the tempura set and rice with sea bream mainly.
The place is surprisingly quite cozy and chill. Definitely will come back again! We went here for lunch and it was an amazing experience. Everything was studied to the last detail, and the chef carefully explained all the dishes  both the tempura and the nontempura ones. Both the prawn tempura and the sweet potato tempura are most likely the best ones I ever ate. Service was excellent, and on top of this the price for the set menus was incredibly low considering that this until recently was a 2 star Michelin restaurant. Amazing! First time coming here and already like the atmosphere and the service they provided, and of course for the food zenbuu oishii desu

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 3-chōme−1−１ 大阪ステーションシティサウスゲートビルディング 16F
리뷰:
Very friendly staff, though there were no physical English menu, there's a scan version and staff is very friendly and helpful with her recommendations of menu dishes selection and its spot on what we wanted to order.

Family dinner was a treat, in fact we felt endless loop of continuous dishes being served like a grand feast.  We ordered the pork duo set, a beef sukiyaki set plus a tofu  vegetarian set has a dishes of steam egg.

Kids get to do some activity to extract tofu bean sheets from the square special pot.  Everyone was very happy with the food, presentation and service quality

Highly recommended for an exceptional dining experience. The wife and I went here for lunch on sa sunny Sunday morning. We haven't eaten at a tofu restaurant before so we didn't know what to expect. We were happy with the friendly service. The staff were warm, friendly and accommodating despite us not knowing Japanese. The food is spectacular, especially the oboru tofu. We had an amazing meal and would definitely visit this restaurant again. Highly recommended! Definitely for my tofu fanatics. Everything was incorporated with tofu. We thought we wouldnt get full on the sets but no we were wronged. Very unique ways to eat tofu. Everything tasted really good. The service was excellent, with staff taking the time to explain the dishes and how to enjoy them. The food is both healthy and delicious, offering a unique dining experience for those seeking plantbased options. Generous portions too! EVERYTHING IS TOFU! Which is very fascinating. The food was  delicious and the service was excellent. We didn't know how to cook one of the meals and the waitress offered to demonstrate. She was really friendly and chatted with us about her travel stories.
Make reservations if possible as they can get busy even after 8pm.

이름: Hitsumabushi Nagoya Bincho Grando Front Osaka
주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−２０ グランフロント大阪 南館 7F
리뷰:
We had visited this restaurant chain for a few times, in Osaka  Tokyo, tried this one in Osaka twice, never been disappointed.
I like the way they grilled the fish without steaming it beforehand.  The crispy skin was super yummy, even though the meat was thin compared to other eels restaurants.  The sauce made the rice very tasty, not too salty nor too sweet.  The roasted eel wrapped in rolled omelette was also delicious.
Highly recommended! The unagi lunch was delicious. The skin was bbq till slightly crispy.  Absolutely delightful......... Cost for a 4 and 5 pieces set around 7000 yen. This is my second time having Hitsumabushi eel. The first time i had Hitsumabushi eel was at Tokyo Sky Tree.

The taste is consistent across the stores. The eel was grilled perfectly, crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. If youve never been, Id recommend ordering the set to try different parts of the eel  this is not something you can eat in every country.

Service was friendly and welcoming. Booking online was easy  its better to make a booking to avoid queue. We were in the area looking for a good unagi place and ended up here.

We got the crab liver tofu as an appetizer, the taste is pretty unique, I enjoyed it but my partner did not.

The eel box was quite good and we were enlightened about multiple ways to enjoy the eel on its own, with pickled veggies, and with ricebroth.

The food was a bit expensive for what it is in my opinion but otherwise enjoyable.

Friendly staff and nice clean interior. Unagi was crispy and savoury! Really delicious accompanied by the warm broth. I enjoyed the hitsumabushi way more than the unagi don. Price was slight expensive but understandable.

주소: 2-chōme-4-21 Toyosaki, Kita Ward, Osaka, 531-0072, Japan
리뷰:
It's a house in a back alley, so had a bit of trouble finding it in the dark.

But once we arrived, the staff were very friendly greeting us. They tried really hard to figure out how to communicate with us, as they don't seem comfortable in English. Google translate helped and their service was top notch.

The food was incredibly creative. We had all sorts of fresh fish and vegetables in combinations that I have never seen before. They all tasted great. Some highlights were an amberjack "sandwich" with white radish as the buns, oyster rice in an iron pot, and their take on monaka for dessert.

We'll definitely come back next time we're in Osaka. Unforgettable Omakase experience. Chef is extremely kind and will explain all dishes in English for foreigners. Food is outstanding and extremely creative. Dishes are presented like if it were an art gallery. Definitely must come here if in Osaka. The atmosphere, staff, and food are at a level of the best restaurants in the world. Being American we decided to celebrate our Thanksgiving here and it was marvelous as the owner and staff made us feel like family. Our knowledge of the Japanese language is little but we had no issues in communication. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants not just a meal but an experience. You can definitely taste the love and skill put into each dish. This place is simply amazing.  Some of the finest food in Japan.  Do not even think of missing Kawahara if you are in the country.  Kawaharataisho and his wife are delightful hosts, making the place even better. Nakatsu No. 1 shop


Basically a counter
There are also seats on the second floor.

All the dishes are great 

Thank you for the meal

There was a person working there who spoke very good English to help explain dishes. My friend recommended this restaurant since it's her favorite and the one she revisits the most in Osaka. They were all very particular about the ingredients, explained things well, and it was fun to listen to, and the food was delicious. The radish ring is also amazing! The shark fin, wagyu beef, crab rice, etc. were delicious and filled me upThank you.
Thank you for the meal 5 minutes walk from Kitashinchi Station on the JR Tozai Line. A wellknown creative restaurant that has been in business for over 50 years and has earned two Michelin stars.

Owner and chef Yoshifumi Mori, who will soon be 80 years old, is still in the kitchen, serving unique cuisine that is full of his worldview.

리뷰:
This was my second visit, but there wont be a third. Honestly, the sushi is really disappointing. Nice presentation, but its tasteless, like they made it the day before and its been sitting in the fridge for a day. We tried the eel  butter, the beef and pepper, and more. We tried to find a good one but  Giving up on sushi, we switched to hot food but the Orange Chicken was covered in think, gummy dough and tasted like something from the supermarket heated up in the microwave. This decor is nice but I think this place is targeting tourists who just dont know any better.  Osaka has many great restaurants this is not one of them Entered the restaurant,thinking it was gonna be a nice fancy experience, the atmosphere is nice and music is jammy.

First thing I noticed when I entered was how expensive the food is. I thought wow the food much be great.

First i ordered a Bellini, i am not sure if they know what a Bellini is because what i received was not a Bellini.

Second i ordered 4 nigiri to start. Once i got the nigiri i noticed they did not give me a soy sauce plate. Its little things but for how expensive their menu is i would expect better service. The nigiri rice was cold and fish tasted not as fresh as one would expect in japan.

The worst part is I ordered their steak. But on the menu and what I received was different. On the menu there is 5 nicely cut steaks. I received 2 steaks pieces. this decisive marketing, its nicely presented but you should not deceive your customers.

When i asked the server for clarification, she went back and then started laughing with her colleagues.  Later when i was able to ask her what her manager has said she said the meat is cut thicker. I am also a cook, another lie. What i wanted was a sorry not an excuse.

This place is nice on the outside but cheap inside. I wish I could write a review focused solely on the amazing food, but unfortunately, the service at this restaurant was completely disrespectful. The sparkling wine we ordered was out of stock, and instead, they brought us a cheaper prosecco, charging us the same price. After two overpriced bottles, we were informed that they had run out of all sparkling wine. There was no effort to compromise, no discountnothing. It felt like we were not welcome there, especially after noticing their flaws such a shame. Ive passed by this restaurant many times over the past few years but didnt try it until now. I really should have gone way earlier because the food was superb!! The best sushi Ive had so far in Japan. The drinks too were very nice and the service and atmosphere were great too! I definitely recommend trying this place at least once! Next time we come were going to try the terrace seats so we can enjoy the night view too. Great stuff. I really appreciated the scenery and outside seating. The sushi was delicious and the service was fluid and efficient. It's definitely pricey though. The sushi was good, and the drinks weren't bad.

리뷰:
This was our first tasting in Osaka and did not disappoint. I can definitely see why it's on the Michelin guide. We enjoyed the presentation and quality of the food. We didn't love grilled dish, but would definitely try again if we were in the area! Just the best sushi we had in Japan. It was so well rated on tabelog and bib gourmand.
There were so many tastes and textures. Personal favourites were the squid and tuna, even the egg in dessert was so surprising, fluffy.
Right from the sashimi starters we loved this place.

The chef and the staff were so welcoming, talked very good English and took their time to explain each dish.

Thank you!

 Hands down to a great  value for money omakase place I havent experienced in a long time. Superb quality ingredients. Love how the chef is so happy and passionate at what he does. Staffs are also cheerful and providing great service. They can speak decent English, good enough to explain the dishes. Totally recommend. A Michelin Bib Gourmandselected restaurant that is out of the ordinary

1. The friendly clerks and owners comfortable smiles will satisfy your heart.
2. And the extreme costeffectiveness covers many shortcomings. Based on this premise,

let's look at a few disappointing points
a It's too hectic. Due to the store's concept, it receives several customers at the same time, so it is not the expected omakase atmosphere with customers leaving and entering, clerks, and people mixing together.
b. The quality of the sushi was worse than expected  the rice was a bit dry.

There are pros and cons, but I would like to check it out again the next time I visit Osaka. The place was already buzzing when we arrived with locals and tourists alike. Food was amazing for the price and service was tops!

Ok too many photos to load so just the menu this time..

Oh yes alittle hard to find initially.. it is on the 3rd floor if I remember correctly so keep a lookout for the building directory.

Recommended!!

주소: Japan, 〒553-0003 Osaka, Fukushima Ward, Fukushima, 6-chōme−20−６ 藤井ビル
리뷰: It's a small restaurant. It took me a while to find it because there was no sign. There were seats available during the time I visited. The prices are reasonable. The atmosphere is also good. It's within walking distance to Umeda Station, and I'd like to go there again if I have another chance. One of the best meals I have had in Oosaka,Japan. The price point was perfect for the quality of the food provided. Highly, highly recommend this place. If I am ever lucky to get a chance to visit Oosaka again, I shall definitely go there. We were a party of three and we ate everything on the menu literally. Amazing experience with amazing service that was authentic and delicious. Not many foreigners come here but they do have an English menu which is a big plus for me. We pretty much tired everything on the menu. The eel and cucumber was super delicious with amazing texture.  I usually don't like eel so I liked it way more then I expected. They do take reservations A hidden, cozy place. They don't speak English but they have an English menu. All dishes are small, reasonably priced and delicious. The local sake is nice, there is a separate menu for it. Everything is delicious but the sushi is what they are known for. Try to get there in the early evening. They seem to close around 12 a.m. but I came on a day when they closed at 2 a.m. so maybe it depends. I definitely recommend this place. In spite of the language barrier, it was one of our most enjoyable meals here in Japan. The chef and his assistant were patient with us. They have an English menu upon request. The seafood tastes fresh. Highly recommend the squid and octopus nigiri, and the negitori temaki. The sake was amazingly sweet and flavourful. And I really appreciate that this place is open late 6pm to 1am. Great if you are staying in one of the nearby hotels.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0003 Osaka, Kita Ward, Dōjima, 1-chōme−5−１ エスパス北新地２３ １Ｆ
리뷰:
What a great experience!  The food was incredibly flavorful!  The staff were absolutely wonderful and took good care of us. Our favorite items were the charcoal dipped chicken skewers, broth and chicken rice. Great yakitori omakase experience focused on fire grilled chicken and its many parts!. I was the only foreigner when I came and it was an amazing experience to be there with all Japanese guests, I really got to feel the love of food all the other people in the restaurant had! Every course was delicious and nicely grilled over the fire, which we could see from our counter seats. Some cuts were not as cooked as I am used to, but my North American palette is to blame for that! The chicken thigh with scallion, the chicken liver, the cheese in broth, the chicken burger sandwich and the chicken meatball were my favourite courses. The chicken prosciutto was super interesting as well. You can also order extras of your favourite skewers at the end before dessert if you wish. The chef also made sure I was okay and took the time to explain to me what each course was in English, which was much appreciated as there was no written menu. We had a great night here. Food was amazing and staffs were friendly and active. Dining here is full of joy and laughs. The chef came to every seat to deliver or explain dishes. Very relaxing atmosphere and we will come back again. Words really don't do justice to this place, nor pics. The fowl maestro plays well with fire here, and his good team helps keep the flow smooth. For chicken lovers, you definitely MUST come! 2 seatings  4pm or 6.30pm. There is a small 4 seater private corner away from grill, but otherwise, you will be seated at the open kitchen to see the master and his team at work. No issues at all with heat or smell from the grill after the meal.

Funnily, the toilet of all places carries a spectacular pic of the maestro at work.

The highlight meal of our NakaSendo trip. APRIL 2023

Dined here a week after Yakitori Matsuri and I enjoyed the omakase course just as much the quality of the chicken and the execution of the grilling was on point, very delicious. Most of the chicken skewers are the same as the sibling restaurant but with some variations in the other dishes so if you eat at both restaurants you get to try something different. Twothirds into the course they offered a menu where you can order additional skewers including rare parts of a chicken. Decided to give the ovary a try which I don't think you will find outside of Japan, and it tasted just like egg yolk, very creamy. The chef and staffs were friendly and the service was great they check with the diners if they are ok with certain dishesany dietary requirements.

리뷰:
I used it for entertaining 8 people.

This is my second time at this restaurant, and it's not just about steak.
This is a restaurant where you can enjoy all kinds of teppanyaki dishes such as abalone and shrimp in course meals.

It has a nice atmosphere and a spacious structure, so I think it's a good place to entertain or entertain your loved ones.

We have a wide variety of alcoholic beverages, including champagne and wine, and while you enjoy delicious food, you can enjoy the drinks and have lively conversations, so you can enjoy the fun atmosphere and feel happy.

I didn't tell the staff anything, but through a casual conversation, I learned that my daughter had been accepted into university, and she decorated the final dessert plate.
The production was wonderful, and my daughter was very happy with it, making me glad that I chose this store.

They were able to accommodate food allergies and provide a separate menu.

If you want to entertain important customers and make them happy, I think this restaurant is well worth using.

Thank you for the meal. Not only was the food delicious, but the restaurant's atmosphere and lively conversationfilled presentation made all participants feel happy.
Thank you very much. Thank you very much. It was my first time taking you there!
I didn't know there was a place like this on Kamidori in Shinchi.
Even though it was a weekday, the place was full so it took a little while for the food to be prepared, but everything was delicious.
We enjoyed the wine and had a happy time with a full stomach  The staff came to greet us and the customer service was polite and we had a pleasant meal! Resort Trust Group It was delicious.
I will visit you when I eat Teppanyaki in Osaka  Membership system under direct control of XIV
A counterstyle iron plate restaurant.
This time, I was invited by a customer.
First, we baked small pancakes.
Served with caviar, capers, etc.
The height of luxury such as foie gras, abalone, and lobster
Thank you very much. As a token of my gratitude, I went to have Christmas dinner with my husband 
The food was served slowly and at a reasonable pace, and the staff was very attentive to every detail, so I was able to enjoy the delicious and leisurely meal 
I had never had a steak with miso before, but I had it with miso and wasabi leaves and it was delicious
I would like to visit you againThank you very much

주소: Japan, 〒530-0047 Osaka, Kita Ward, Nishitenma, 2-chōme−1−１８ 中之島 LOVE CENTRAL
리뷰:
Good riverside view. The location is a nice, sophisticated restaurant in the city with a terrace along the river.
The store is very clean and the interior is nice.
However, the restroom was clean so it was good, but it was unusually dark and other customers were surprised.
For the meal, I selected and reserved the specialty lunch course.
I'm sorry for the service, but I thought it was the worst for the store.
First of all, why is there no menu for course meals?
Even if you are asked to choose your pasta at the beginning, there is no explanation of what kind of dishes will be served later, so it is difficult to choose because you cannot see the balance of the entire course.
For the main meat dish, which is better pork or roasted beef? Even though I was told this, there was no explanation about what kind of part it was or the taste of the sauce, so I was left wondering...
I chose beef, but it was so raw that it looked like it was only seared on the surface, so I thought I should have chosen pork instead.
If it's that rare, I think it's a good idea not to ask about the doneness.
Furthermore, the beef was a bit smelly.
The squid oil pasta and sauces were delicious.
So other dishes may be delicious.
I wish Dolce had incorporated even a small amount of seasonal fruit.
The appetizers had a rather strong flavor, and I wish they would serve the bread at the same time even if the order was different.
I don't like it when the service lady comes to clear the dishes right after I finish a plate.
I also thought it was strange that even though he was idle and not busy, he didn't have a smile on his face and was unfriendly.
It's a nice shop, but it was very disappointing. I went there for lunch with my boss at work.
It was raining, so we ate inside the restaurant, but if it was sunny, we would have eaten on the terrace along the river. You can also eat there.
You can see Nakanoshima Public Hall across the river.

It was quite busy at noon.
The lunch course was plentiful, and they also asked if we would like to have a lunch break and what time we would like to leave the restaurant.
There were two types of pasta and meat to choose from.
The food was very delicious, but we also had a variety of desserts, which were both very pleasing to the eye and delicious. I made a reservation at 6pm and received a simple course.
I left out one dish of pasta.
It was a decent volume.
The taste is good and the view is even better! The view is nice and the food is delicious, but the portions may not be enough for men. Unfortunately the volume.

주소: 4-20 Ōfukachō, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0011, Japan
리뷰:
We went passed only to get to some attractions, umeda building if I'm not mistaken, so not much comments.... just The Grand Front Osaka complex is the sum of three buildings, Building Tower A in the South, and Tower B and C in the North n it huge, U could easily get lost in there... There are many brands stores  restaurants n so very crowded...  One large shopping center in Japan, the only remarkable "icon" was the green bear at the fountain... My wife and I got lost in this mall and decided to get something to eat. There were a ton of restaurants, but we settled on the Kitchen Miwaya Osaka. We had a really nice meal with amazing service. The server was very patient as we tried to overcome the language barrier and figure out what we wanted to eat. We asked for recommendations, and what he provided was a great and delicious choice. Modern mall, with less crowd.

There is a hidden gem situated on top of the building where you can chill while enjoying city view and bunch of sakura trees Massive onestop shopping and entertainment centre, divided into North and South wings. From indoor shopping malls to outdoor areas with cafes and restaurants, this place definitely draws the crowds. Weekends are usually packed to the brim, so choose your day of visit wisely to maximise your outing. Overall a pleasant experience being here. The Grand Front Osaka complex is the sum of three buildings, Building Tower A in the South, and Tower B and C in the North. There are many brands and stores in the complex that first appeared in Japan. This is the largest shopping center in Japan, located in the center of Osaka, so it is always crowded and bustling. In Grand Front Osaka, there are a total of 266 rental booths including shops and restaurant areas such as fashion, grocery stores, furniture stores, largescale bookstores, coffee shops, and restaurants. , bar... Most of the stores here are popular domestic and foreign brands.

리뷰:
Good traditional japanese cuisine in private room.
This beef bowl lunch sukiyaki is Y3300.
The beef is really in good quality. I was brought here by a friend of mine, and when I told him I wasn't good at biology that day, he changed the course, and even though I'm not good at biology, I still had a delicious meal.
The staff were friendly and the store had a nice atmosphere. For lunch on December 28th, I went without a reservation and only one room private room was available. The tempura gozen came out one by one, and I felt that not only the taste but also the timing of the dishes was exquisite. At only 2,000 yen, I felt this hospitality was the best value for money. I had the Korinbo course for lunch 
I wasn't able to take a photo of just the sashimi. 

The atmosphere is elegant enough to be used for business or dates. There is also a smoking area next to the entrance, making it ideal for entertaining guests.

The food was also very delicious.
The taste of the elegant soup stock made me feel very happy.

Because it's located near the station and in the basement of a building, you don't have to worry about the heat or cold outside. The hospitality provided by the landlady was also very satisfying.
Thank you very much for the meal  When I entered the basement, it was very spacious, quiet, and beautiful. This is a high quality store.

리뷰:
Complete gem by the station! A popular restaurant that is popular on Gyukushi Street

Immediately under the guard to the south from Tsuruhashi Station
Even though it was around 8pm on weekdays, the restaurant was full!

Characteristics of the store
Narrow space between counter seats and table seats
You can enjoy sashimistyle skewers mainly made with beef offal.
All seats are nonsmoking and cash payment only

Menu ordered
Chinese cabbage kimchi 500
Unsweetened kimchi with great sourness and spiciness

Kobukuro sashimi 1,200
A glossy texture with a crunchy texture that gives you a fresh feeling!
Kobukuro is so delicious that the more you bite into it, the more flavor you get!

Shinzo 250
The sauce pickles are sweet, delicious, and have a nice soft texture!

Korikori 250
Similarly, pickled in sauce has a good flavor!
Beer goes well with its elastic texture!

I was allowed to sit at the counter, so I was able to watch mom cook and talk to her!
This mass feeling is strangely calming!

Gochisousamasan! A must have for those who like raw meat!

Kushiyaki is delicious, but raw meat is exquisite!

Raw cabbage served with a secret sauce
This is terrible.

It's open from 4pm, but you'll have to get there early.
Almost sold out.

It's also good to eat by yourself!

I'm getting excited! Kushiyaki Matsuyoshi Enjoy skewered yakiniku with the warm customer service of two hostesses. Isn't the sweetness of grilled liver irresistible?

Kushiyaki Matsuyoshi is located under the elevated Tsuruhashi Station in Ikuno Ward, Osaka City, next to three longestablished Kushiyaki restaurants.
The critters and skewers you can enjoy in this small shop are truly exquisite. The crunchy kobukuro sashimi and sweet grilled meat are irresistible. The atmosphere is lovely, run by two friendly proprietresses. Tsuruhashi is a mustvisit restaurant for drinking.



The two of us ate and drank a lot and it cost about 6,000 yen per person.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−10−２８, Shinsaibashi M, １階
리뷰:
I found myself returning to this charming coffee shop 4 times within just 3 days, both during the day and at night. I had a variety of their offerings, including iced drip coffee, hot drip coffee, iced latte, and hot latte, and each one surpassed my expectations.

I asked for the barista's recommendation, and she took the time to learn my preferences, providing great suggestions with patience. Despite the bustling daytime crowds, the staff managed to provide exceptional service even though there were a lot of customers. Personally, I found the evenings to be the ideal time to visit with fewer customers, I could savor the coffee and the ambiance at a leisurely pace.

Additionally, I purchased some beans and drip bags from the shop to experience their flavors at home. In summary, my experience was nothing short of perfect  a solid 1010 rating.  Cute tiny spot offering a large variety of coffees to choose from. Great tasting coffees, probably the best weve had so far here in Osaka. Service is really good and every order comes with a small booklet about the coffee house and its founder.

The only unfortunate side effect of their popularity is that it can get really crowded at times, as you can see in my pictures. Come at the wrong time and youll be in line behind maybe 56 people waiting to order as well. Not a big deal, youll just have to wait maybe 1015 minutes for your coffee, and sitting situation might be a bit of an issue, especially in the heat of the summer, but not too big of a deal breaker. Funny enough, at other times, the shop will be empty with only one or two people enjoying their coffee.

Regardless, great place to go to for coffee.

Oh and a small side note I do feel that they give you the most coffee out of the other spots Ive been to so far. Most other places only gives you this small cup of coffee while at Lilos youll get a decent sized coffee. Friendly service, great coffee. I had the pour over of Uganda light roast and Nicaragua medium roast and both were so smooth!

They take cash only when I visited so be prepared!

There is almost always a line but it moves fast. Be sure to check the menu while you wait in line!

A highlight of my short visit to Osaka. Definitely worth it! Great coffee roaster! They have a menu of coffee beans from many countries featuring different flavour and profile. A tad pricey but okay to pay for the quality. Limited sitting space but great for take out. Very friendly staff! Efficient! I happened to smell the aroma of coffee while walking in Osaka at night, so I bought light roasted coffee beans is China  Brazil. After returning to Taiwan, I brewed a cup myself. Its really delicious and fragrant

I will buy coffee beans and enjoy coffee again next time

I must say that the waiters are really classy, friendly and considerate

리뷰:
Great place with awesome service from a nice guy! The place is downstairs and has an amazing atmosphere with a lot of fun things to discover with games and storys on the walls.
We had some grilled cheese ham sandwiches, an affogato, black sesame drink and a surprising good salted caramel porter. Everything was very tasty! Highly recommended for a visit! Awesome little pocket with toasties, coffee and some beer and cider if youre here at that time of day. Great breakfast place to start the day. Friendly service, very cool atmosphere and decorations. Can also leave your name in chalk on the walls. Sign out the front makes it easy to find. Definitely worth a visit Great place to stop by! It was a bit packed when I went, but luckily I was able to sit at the counter. Drinks are so good! I really like the espresso martini. They mainly serve sandwiches and desserts . I love their PB nutella cookies! Too bad i ate it all before taking pictures. Great coffee and cookies. I've tasted an oat milk hot latte and it was really good. It's smooth and intense at the same time. Matcha cookie is amazing I visited the cafe in the evening. The place is quite tiny. The pudding was just perfect! The peanut butter cookie was great. The staff is very nice and  helpful.

I recommend this place if you come with friends , want to socialize and play board games there are bunches of games available on shelf.
As a tourist, I don't think this place suits kids, elders or a people who travel alone.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0085 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Shinsaibashisuji, 2-chōme−8−１６ ルイ・ヴィトン メゾン 大阪御堂筋 7F
리뷰:
What an experience! We went into this understanding that we are probably paying for the experience so we expected higher than usual prices.
The entrance to the cafe is on the right side of the building. Theres an elevator you have to take up to the floor the cafe is on.
My friend and I got there at around 1120 on a Thursday and we were the only ones in there at first. Its a beautiful cafe. Love the artwork on the walls, which I think they might swap out from time to time.

We each ordered a lunch item, a dessert item, and a latte. Everything we got was good. Our total came out to about 134 for everything, or 67 each. This isnt a cafe I can go to all of the time so it was a great splurge spot. I would go back again for sure.

The staff were wonderful too. They were all so nice and just attentive enough. Le Caf V in Osaka, Japan, is Louis Vuittons first caf in the world!  Situated on the 7F of LVs flagship store in Shinsaibashi, the restaurant is as chic and artistic as the iconic white building.  Guests who do not need to shop can reach the caf via the elevator hidden in the side alley.  Outdoor seats are available.  The spacious and bright main dining room has a very high ceiling.  Servers are polite and professional.  However, food quality is a bit inconsistent!  Drinks and desserts are the most delicious and pleasing to the eye.  While the medium rare Sandwich Filet de Boeuf Wagyu GyuKatsu JPY 5,000 looks more rare than medium rare and tastes a bit dry, the medium order of the same dish looks more medium rare than medium and is noticeably juicier.  It feels like tea time would be the best time to visit this IGworthy caf. We stoped by after seeing good reviews and there was a big queue. I got a affogato rum raisin and my friends got a coffee which can be personalised in how they make it and cheese cakes. The affogato was very good and the expresso was high quality, but the cheese cake was way too small for the price considering I have had better for way less. The place was a bit small but the overall look of the place was nice. Swanky and beautifully designed to allow plenty of outside light. This is a perfect spot of an afternoon tea with a side of sweets. During my visit the place was quiet and smaller than I expected, but felt very intimate. The menu is very limited on true meal items, however diverse enough to satisfy all taste buds. Wagyu sandos sell fast so make sure to go early if this is on your list.  To enter, you will need to go through the side of the store not the main entrance. There will be an elevator that will take you to the top floor. Upon your exit, feel free to spot by the exhibit in between floors to the grounds. Nice experience, I would return for tea time. LV la viva. Visit here for Louis Vuitton's V drink and popular desserts. Get yourself a moment of tranquility away from the busy shopping streets and purchase queues of Osaka Namba.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0071 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Dōtonbori, 1-chōme−4−２７ パセラリゾーツなんば道頓堀店 ５Ｆ
리뷰:
I would rate this place 10 stars if I could, because everything from the vibes, service and food were amazing!
The Osaka outlet has a way more welcoming vibe than the Akiba outlet which I did not have a good experience at. The staff here had great energy and was always hyping up the place, even when serving food and  even complimented my mini WoLs!  A must visit for ffxiv fan!

I have great experience visiting this Uldah theme cafe.... The giant scions poster are great for a pic with them. The food was fine.

The staff are very friendly, lively and helpful.

Our table also won the Jumbo Cactpot and got this giant honey toast. Lucky!  The Eorzea Cafe is a must for any FFXIV fan. I've been here twice now and each time the staff has been so nice. The drinks are absolutely delicious and the food is great to. I highly recommend this as a stop for any FFXIV fan while in Tokyo or Osaka. I had a amazing time with friends in both the Osaka location and Tokyo location, service was great and they have given me a free placemat for the new Arcadion raid when I made a mistake with the lamination. 1010 would visit again whenever in Japan. The drinks were fun and tasty If you enjoy or ever played the FFXIV game, you will enjoy your time at the Eorzea Cafe! The food was delicious, the atmosphere was fun and the staff was so very kind and helpful! There's even a lottery depending on your seat number and you can win some prizes. I had a great time and would definitely come back again on my next visit!

이름: Green Tea & Sweets CAFE Osaka Chakai
주소: Japan, 〒530-0041 Osaka, Kita Ward, Tenjinbashi, 2-chōme−1−２５ 1F
리뷰:
We stumbled upon this place without expecting it and let me tell you, it was the best matcha and green tea latte in Japan. They offer you the experience of preparing your own matcha in the traditional way, using a ceramic cup of your own choosing. The latte is foamy and you can add sugar to your own taste for me, much better without any. The service is excellent, they explain about the different kinds of tea leaves and they even have a little shop where you can buy ceramics, matcha powder and green tea powder. This was a placed I had saved as a place to visit. I was glad to have found it.  Kaoru... whom greeted us with the most warm welcoming took care of us. As it is our first time she was more than happy to make suggestions and answer any questions. I loved her customer service was above and beyond. We learned about her green tea and its origins  I had the green tea ice cream and latte were just amazing after a nice light snack. I believe we made a new friend we will b back as much as we can for the delicious desserts cant wait to try more recommendations. Drinks did not make the picture drinks were too good. Adorable green tea shop so good I came back twice on my trip!

Lovely menu with a great variey unsweetened as standard to really get the matchagreen teahoujicha flavours. The freeze dried adzuki beans were a lovely accompaniment!

And being able to pick your own cup was such a lovely way to browse Japanese ceramics! Went during a weekday and immediately given a seat. Sell all things matcha and even the bowls and tea powder. Had just the matcha 900yen and they served with dried red beans which was heavenly! First time having that and the natural sweetness of it! Must go if you are a matcha fan, away from kyoto. Great tea rest stop for travellers alike with free refills, loving the matcha tea variety available in stores. We made some tea purchased from this store and the quality is premium.

Do step foot in and order yourself a lovely kettle of green tea

주소: Japan, 〒541-0056 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Kyūtarōmachi, 2-chōme−5−１９, Maruchu 3rd.Bldg., 1階
리뷰:
Kind service, good meals, cute place. What else do you need?

We had both salty and sweet toasts, they were excellent.

1 for the Englishfriendly
1 for the milk alternatives cow, almond, oat

Totally recommend the place for a breakfast. Their black coffee boasted a rich, fullbodied flavor with subtle hints of chocolate and a pleasant, lingering aftertaste. The aroma alone was enough to awaken my senses and set the tone for a delightful experience. Paired with the coffee, the cheesecake was light and fluffy, with a creamy texture that melted in my mouth. The sweetness was perfectly balanced, ensuring that each bite was a harmonious blend of flavors This is the best cafe I have been to in a long time. Though the interior is pretty small, the atmosphere and decor is really nice and calming. The customer service was excellent and the foodcoffee was amazing. The workers also speak English so it is definitely tourist friendly. The latte art was also really stellar. It was love at first for me! Enjoyed morning coffees here. We tried the organic blend in both iced latte and hot americano and were great. We waited a little while despite there being a couple the only ones who ordered before us so wouldnt recommend it youre in a rush. Staff are so friendly and upbeat, great relaxed atmosphere! Came here for breakfast. Firstly I like they open at 8am which is earlier than other cafes around and easier for tourists who want to start the day early
Coffee was good but toast was even better
Really recommended the French toast
Also I got the window seat which was fantastic and you can see the cars and people walking by
Overall great vibes and good coffee and food

주소: 1-chōme-18-１８番２１号 Edobori, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0002, Japan
리뷰:
Cozy coffee place on our way to Art museum. Speciality coffee, cold brew, seasonal positions, classic cappuccino and latte and more. Menu available in English. Friendly barista made one of the best coffee for us to go. Best roasted green coffee in Osaka and wonderful atmosphere as well  I'm really picky about coffee but this shop surprisingly met my standards. It's on a little side street, not far from some museums.

The owner is strict about quality control so he runs it himself. I recommend bringing your own food as it's allowed.

If you order cold brew, it comes out quickly but other coffee will take time as he carefully makes it by hand drip style.

The mango Calpis espresso cocktail looked good but I wanted to drink pure coffee. The cold brew was really deep and had strong bold intense flavor. The iced Kenyan was like dried apricots, acidic and fruity.

The size of the coffee here is really generous. Much, much better than any chain coffee shop. Try it out. Bring your own food, for an even better experience. With many coffee options within this business district, we came across this small, quaint and cozy shop that offers quality if not the best coffee Ive had in a very long time! The owner and operator will seat you and create a perfect cup of  pour over. The owner speaks English which was nice to converse with. Spend your money at a small business like this and trust me it will be worth every penny. Affordable pricing! Small coffee shop but with good music and good coffee!

The shop are surrounded by nice coffee fragrance. Highly recommended especially for coffee lover! Thanks!

주소: Japan, 〒541-0041 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Kitahama, 2-chōme−1−１ ライオンビル
리뷰:
The place is just amazing! The vibes are 1010, the staff are sooo nice and educated about diets restrictions, I ordered something and the staff came to to us to tell us that what we ordered contains alcohol and its not halal and he offered us the halal options available.

The food ,we ordered the tuna sandwich and the egg sandwich they both were very delicious and have unique taste.

The place was pretty quiet and calming when we went! I highly recommend it The cafe offers decent view of the river and quiet space. The staffs were friendly and genuine.

The building is very narrow but has 3 floors.
Basement 1 Has no window view
1st floor Queue machine, cashier and terraceoutdoor seats
2nd floor, 3rd floor small room of window view Just love this cafe. I did try iced latte and tuna sandwich. All is good and perfect. Staffs are very friendly and helpful.

It is located just right at the corner of the bridge with a beautiful view over the river. Long waitingQueueing just because of the river view. But we have no luck for the outdoor seating Excellent food and view was amazing. Tuna sandwich was really delicious. Also love their coffee and desert was really nice.

Only problem was the waiting time. We wanted to sit in the terrace and there was a table empty but for some reason we still has to wait and the other 2 tables people were just sitting and chatting after they finished their meal which i think didny make sense to let people wait while others are done with their food and just chatting.

I recommend to put a time for each table once their done they can let others get inside.

Overall outstanding customer service and exceptional food.

주소: Japan, 〒541-0041 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Kitahama, 1-chōme−1−９ ハウザー 北浜ビル 1F
리뷰:
I had come here a long time ago, when Brooklyn didnt have shops in Tokyo. I had a very good memory from it and came again after so long to see how it was. It remains as an excellent choice for having a nice coffee next to the river, even better if its during a nice autumn morning. There are more customers than before, but still it wasnt hard to find a place to sit down in the terrace outside. Went here because of a recommendation from a content creator. Almost couldnt get to enjoy the view since we were lost.

This place is definitely a must go to enjoy tranquility in the heart of Osaka. Their coffee are also so smooth and foamy. I ordered latte and the coffee is enjoyable during the dawn.

The staff are so friendly and helpful. The barista is skilled. Save this place and visit later This location is special with an incredible atmosphere. They have a huge variety of coffee for sale but unfortunately only serve one kind of drip coffee per day, I which we could pick the beans. We had a bagel that was so so, the bread wasnt very good but the cream cheese and salmon were generous and tasty. The variety of drip bags for sale was also great, will do for great souvenirs. One of my favourite coffee shops in Osaka. This place at kitahama has a great view of the river if you sit outside at the patio area
Coffee is great and one of the best in Japan that Ive had this trip
Very good for sit and relax on an afternoon esp when its not too hot
Great atmosphere and coffee overall This coffee shop is located by the river. There are indoor and outdoor areas. The atmosphere is very good. It is suitable for sipping the shop's delicious coffee. I like it here.

주소: 1-chōme-2-8 Saiwaichō, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0021, Japan
리뷰:
I had breakfast here and tried the smoked salmon eggs Benedict along with the coconut custard cream pancakes.

The eggs Benedict was delicious, though I personally would have preferred the egg to be cooked just a little longerabout 30 secondsso that the egg whites weren't quite as runny. But thats just my taste.

The pancakes were I think kinda classic American style and absolutely delightful. They had a great balanceneither too sweet nor overpoweringly coconutty.

I had read some comments suggesting the coffee here wasnt great, but I disagree. While it wasnt extraordinary, it was perfectly finenothing exceptional, but certainly not bad. For true coffee connoisseurs, perhaps consider trying the lemonade instead. 

Overall, it's definitely worth a visit!  I was going to go to A Happy Pancake, but after a redditor commented on my itinerary that Micasadeco  Cafe is better, I decided to go there instead. And I was very glad that I did because the pancake was so good! It was the best and fluffiest pancake I ever had. I would definitely go again. I got there around 11AM, there was no wait, but after I sat down, the place got full and the people after us had to wait. The location I went to was tiny so if you go at 12PM you may need to wait. The pancakes are made fresh after it is order so it takes about 20 minutes for it to be ready. After 20 minutes, I got my pancake, and it was definitely worth the wait! 1010. Very Disappointing today of what they have served for the supposed to be yummy fluffy pancakes.  I went there six years ago and the fluffy pancakes are light and  yummy.  However, today I went again and found that the pancakes are heavy, tasteless, textures are harddry and honestly for about 2000 per serve which is not quite make sense and justify for the pancakes.  Drip coffee is super weak and matcha latte was ok.   I wouldnt recommend it personally apart from taking photos.   If you are foodies and love foods more than taking photos, this will not be justified.  2 people 2 serve of pancakes and four coffee costs 5980 which I could have done better quality meal  in somewhere else.  Few minutes walk from  JR Namba Station.  The cut off time for the fluffy pancake order is 11am.  No queue as we arrived on Sat around 1045am.  But people start queuing up around midday.  All the customers there are tourists while I was at the cafe. Fluffy ricotta cheese pancakes were good, soft, flavorful  presented well. The spicy vegan curry was nice not much kick to it but well executed plate with brown rice cooked properly with a small refreshing side salad. The atmosphere well the food makes up for the lack of. Nice job overall guys We came here on a weekday around 12 noon for brunch and there was no queue. The airconditioning was perfect for the summer heat.

The menu however was rather limited and you needed to have 3 thick fluffy pancakes with no other options with lesser pancakes priced at 1,750 yen. It was slightly overpriced in my opinion as weve had better and more affordable ones.

They have a seasonal menu which could be fun.

주소: 1-chōme-6-16 Kitahorie, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0014, Japan
리뷰:
Ordered an iced mocha here and my gosh  was it amazing!
Its been the best mocha Ive had since coming to Japan. Perfectly balanced mocha as the drink was not too sweet and coffee was very strong. The barista even asked girlfriend and I to choose whether we wanted a medium or dark roast. Mochachocolate flavor did not overwhelm the drink at all.

The male barista that helped us spoke very good English. Cute little nook of a coffee shop. Most of the cafes in Shinsaibashi open at 9am onwards. If you are looking for a cafe that opens early, this is the place to go. Coffee is good. Staff is very friendly. The cafe atmosphere is also nice. Good place to start your day.

Coffee latte is great! Highly recommended.

Cakes are good but the banana cake was a bit too hard expect to be a lot softer, cheese cake and strawberry moose cake are delicious. Kitchen is the selling point of this cafe, both the salad props to the kawaii toasts and the montblanc were quite good. I had the egg sandwich and it was amazing! I highly recommend it! The coffee is more on the pricier side 600800yen for a latte but it was very tasty as well. They offer more desertssweet foods than savory food, but the menu is not that small. I would come back!

주소: 1-chōme-7-1 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-8501, Japan
리뷰: A good experience that is locked behind a wall of reservations that are booked for over a month, there is a line where you can wait hoping someone cancels, but dont put too much faith in those. Food was above average and the whole cafe was decorated extremely well, prices were more on the expensive side but thats to be expected. This place is very cute but honestly overrated and over priced. There is no options for vegetarians or vegans and the kitchen is unable to make adjustments to any dishes on the menu, something to bear in mind if you have dietary requirements. The food presentation is 1010 but the taste is just fine. The pikachu show is cute but goes for so long, you can't leave your seat at all during this time. Also you can get in without a reservation, there's a queue for cancellations we waited about 30 mins and were able to get in.  Great experience, food is okay. Nothing like this in Australia. Booking online tip. Yes all bookings are gone in the first 10 secs. Wait an additional 1520 min, timeouts will start to occur, and sessions will open up. Keep refreshing between the 1520 min window.you need to be quick. I bought into the hype and went here for late lunch.   I did not think the experience was worth it.   Food was rubbish, drinks rubbish and service rubbish.  Also I found the staff a bit rude.  They wouldnt even take a group photo of us.  Is that not super rude?   I contrast this with Kinopias cafe Nintendo land in Universal Studios where the themed food was tasty and the staff were so nice they offered to take group photos of us. We saw that there were some seats available so we tried a walk in without any reservation. Got our table in just a minute! Amazing given how folks who come here tend to book way in advance. The food is okay. You are paying for the decor and experience. Gengar drink was too sweet but the ice koohii was smokey enough. There is also a  mascot meet and greet towards the end of the dining experience with some interaction. The mascot who came out was the chef Pikachu! Very cute. There are also some merchandise that you can get only if you dine in. Great experience if you are a pokemon fan!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0085 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Shinsaibashisuji, 2-chōme−5−１５ 1F
리뷰:
Delicious and fluffy pancakes, there is custard inside the whipped cream. The cream was thick and fragrant. I was pleasantly surprised to see vanilla beans in the custard too. The strawberry jam paired nicely with the pancakes.

Beef hamburg steak was tender and juicy. I did not expect it to come with rice, but its good to eat it with the hamburg.

Beautiful interior. Popular with local ladies and hotel guests. There were chairs beside us to place bags, but they were occupied by current guests, so not every guest has an area to place their belongings. 1010 a great place to stop for a coffeetea and sweet treat. Food options are a bit limited, but their sweets and coffee are great. Service is great too, friendly, welcoming and quick on refilling water. A very relaxed atmosphere and lots of space for a crowded area in Osaka. Many tables. If you need a sweet pick me up I'd recommend it. They also have alcoholic beverages if you want to have a sweet brunch. This place more suitable for dessert and drinks rather than full dinner. They only offer 5 different set rice menu.
Overall it's a good food. The price it's affordable price. The atmosphere comfy and nice for meeting or chilling. Opted for one of the recommended dishes, i believe it's their seasonal item. Love the variety and taste! Ambience is perfect too. Looking for a breakfast place for lunch. Food was delicious and the coffee was strong and good. We got the pancakes with egg and bacon  and the chicken over rice. I got the coffee float which was amazing!!! Highly recommend. Last note, the pancakes have cream cheese in the middle!!!!

주소: 4-chōme-4-15 Chikkō, Minato Ward, Osaka, 552-0021, Japan
리뷰:
MENU CHANGEDNo more gluten free options and breakfast is not being served anymore. Initially came for both of the aforementioned but ADAPTABILITY is key in life.

So we opted for the Shepherds Pie, Vegetable sandwich and a cheese pizza. Really nice portions are served and the taste of the Shepherds Pie was absolutely extraordinary.

The Veggie sandwich was art. So, beautiful with an array of bright colored layers. The 'ORANGE' pumpkin  was most prominent star, as it is currently Pumpkin season.

The pizza unfortunately   was not good dry, no taste, and tasted similar to a matza cracker. The sauce and cheese though were really good but the crust tasted plain and gluten freebut it wasnt??!  Reheated in the air fryer home and it was really good.

The mango juice and citrus tea were refreshing.

The service was good. The Bears were cute. There was a que at the door, and upon entering we were advised there would be a 30min wait for food but it was much shorter.  Our server spoke excellent English. Such a hidden cute cafe!
Love the crazy bear decor, and the staff are diabetes level friendly!
The food may seem a wee pricey, but soo worth it! You get a HUGE portion! Go with your belly empty and leave with both your heart and tummy full  The waitress was super nice to us, the portion was unbelievably big, and the food was delicious.
The burger patty itself wasn't that great to be honest, but the additions bacon and egg were incredible and compensated for the patty.
The place is really nice and comfy.
I also took a cold americano with soy milk which was nice. The aesthetic are unbearable, in the best way. It gives a nice cozy atmosphere and vibes. The staff is super friendly and helpful. They even made sure we didnt have any food allergies after taking our order. We got the Hawaii burger and Kuma burger and to drink the grapefruit ade and the Italian soda litchi. The buns were fresh and delicious, the kuma burger had a little to much sauce. But it still tasted great! The drinks were refreshing and hit the spot. Best place Ive eaten in Japan thus far. Staff is so friendly, food is DELICIOUS, great portions for the price  everything sooo cute!

리뷰:
Best coffee we found in Osaka, and as it turned out, just around the corner from our apartment. It became our daily stop before going out to explore. Coming from Melbourne, it's nice to find good coffee. Greeted kindly by the awesome Coffee Team and was introduced to the Coffee experience which consisted of amazing single origin coffee  plus the ice coffee version to really have both the Hot Cold experience it was epic for the taste buds  a cookie . I enjoyed it 100 hoping to come back one day  y'all are awesome.  Sending you all a big hug  Best coffee Ive had in Japan. The light roast Ethiopian pourover was perfect. The cheesecake was also fantastic. The seating area is very pleasant on two floors. Service was polite and friendly order at the counter and they bring it to your table. A great place to spend a rainy afternoon Super nice and cozy coffee place with strong espresso, and we also have an ice latte and a roasted cheesecake, which was topnotch! English speaking staff One of the best coffee place in Osaka, located 510 walking distance from Osaka castle.

The place is really comfortable for chill and work, and most importantly their coffee is amazing

I ordered Colombia Los Cauchos Light, and you can really enjoy the aroma of Passion Fruit and Papaya right away, great if you are looking for fruity and balance acidity!

Excellent coffee and service from the lovely team. Great tasting black coffee and flat white with superb art work. Tasty scones and muffins and a busy bakery next door. Definitely recommend Lead Coffee you will enjoy the friendly service and one of the best coffees in Osaka. Amazing cafelatte
A small cafe near the station from very hot Osaka. Cafe latte and other drinks are both delicious. Both the female owners seemed to be baristas. It is small inside, but the toilet is right outside and there is no inconvenience. BEST COFFEE SHOP IN TOWN!! 1010 latte and cappuccino, had to go back every day we where staying here! Lovely barista shes so sweet and takes her time to do amazing latte art thats so great and creative and even cappuccino has perfect leaf! The baked goods are fresh made that morning so please give them a try if youre there we got the cookies and the scones. Highly recommend for good cup fit for an Australian liking  Best coffee in all Osaka  Im so happy I found this beautiful place, food is tasty and the details of everything are super cute! I had coffee here on each day of my visit as I was lucky enough to have it just around the corner.
It was fantastic.

리뷰: Great experience and I'm very happy to celebrate Cowboy Bebops 20th year of existence at this caf! I was looking forward to this visit, and I'm very pleased with my visit. Great merchandise sans plastic figures which I miss!. The food was good, the real star of the show was the drinks especially good "Old fashioned"!. Omedetou Cowboy Bebop! Had an absolutely lovely time here with my wife back in October during the Persona 5 theme cafe. Great desserts, sweet drinks, wonderful memories. Would recommend it if the current theme is a favorite of yours! Unfortunately all seats were reserved the day we came. So we weren't allowed to enter. Apparently this happens frequently. CafRestaurant with Anime Themes. In my case it was Cowboy Bebop. Unfortunately the Staff does not speak English, the translation of the menu wasn't very helpful. The theme decoration was a disappointment, just some posters on the wall and some slides on a TV screen. With every meal you get an collectors card. The meal was small and not even tasty. Collaboration day, reservations only. No walk in

리뷰:
What an interesting concept. First of all the people that work there are quite nice but the show is really when the bear paw comes out. My daughter was quite delighted when the paw not only gave her the drink it also wanted to play a game and Hifive such a sweet concept. my matcha was slightly weak and milky but i still enjoyed it nonetheless! there is an air conditioned seating area around the back, decked out with so many bear decorations!! love this place so much thankyou mr bear !!!! What a lovely concept this place is! We came just after 11 and got served straight away. Everything was well explained and our matcha latte was great.

The bear at the little window interacts with you for a few seconds and it's all really adorable and a feel good place!

There's also seating available. Highly recommend for a little heartwarming start to the morning at a reasonable price. I'm usually very picky when it comes to cafes and eateries. But oh my goodness, when I say there's cafe is the best cafe in Osaka, I mean it! The matcha parfait was beautiful. Quite sweet but the matcha flavour came through so strongly. The atmosphere was very cute and comforting. It really makes you feel like you found a little nook in the middle of a fairy tale story. It's very unique with the bear hand service and it really adds a cute experience when receiving your order. Don't forget to check out the seating area around the corner where you can buy a souvenirs and little goodies. Would highly recommend this as a mustsee on your Osaka itinerary. I will definitely be coming back for sure!! Came on 2 Dec 2023 with my hubby and 2 boys 16 and 8 yrs old.  We were lucky that after ordering 4 drinks and 2 cookies, we could sit inside to rest and write a note.  It was a wonderful experience, especially for my little boy who had been very tired after so many days of travelling and not being able to get the thing he wanted from this trip.  The bear paw hand shake makes him forget all the pain.  The drinks and cookies are very good.

주소: 3-chōme-7-15 Chikkō, Minato Ward, Osaka, 552-0021, Japan
리뷰: Every time I go to this shop I am more than happy and satisfied. It is a great place to eat. The customer service is amazing and so is the food. I always get the veggie burrito  my brother likes the chicken burrito as well as the tuna melt. We love it every time. It's always fresh and filling. They also have amazing drinks. I haven't been to a more friendly and professional place during this visit, yet. They also have dinein options. They close at 1800hrs and start cleaning around 1730hrs so, if you want food, I'd suggest you get there by 1700hrs to give them time. Trust me, you will not be disappointed. It's well worth the visit with portions worth the yen. Great customer service and a great menu. The vibes and set up in this cafe are wonderful Theres a large communal table, it was great to chat with so many new faces from all over the world . We drink coffee everyday, two to three cups sometimes. And we have one of the best cappuccinos we have ever had here. Their classic was a blend of Colombian, Brazilian, and Ethiopean beans, dark roasted but had flower aroma and fruity taste. Surprisingly without a tinge of bitterness. Generous portions too. Enough for two to share at just a small cost. A coffee place that feels like home in Melbourne! Aussie cafe vibes are definitely shining through here. Great coffee for 500600yen. The creme brulee syrup was a nice sweet addition. Ham and cheese toasties with pickled mustard hit the spot before a few hours at Osaka Aquarium. Card payment readily accepted. On our way the the aquarium we needed a pick me up and noticed this beautiful coffee shop.  Our crme brle iced lattes were delicious and hit the spot.  Adorable open air atmosphere and I loved the plants.  I wish this shop was close to our Airbnb.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−2−３ A-Place心斎橋 B1F
리뷰:
Food could be better, beer was delicious but expensive vs. other places around.

Still though, a nice place to visit. Seems like a trendy place and a nice place to have if you don't want to deal with the cramped food shops.

Perfect place if you want a sit down after your wife has shopped until we dropped.

Service could be quicker.

I had the salmon cheese baguette, lacked taste, was probably vegan. The burgers tasted amazing, they are on the smaller side compared to AmericanAustralian standards as I ordered a large.
The service was quite upsetting, I felt that because we were foreigners maybe they had something against us or a bad experience? Not sure but everyone around us had been given water with their meals except us, there was a station with jugs and glasses of water and when we poured some at our table the wait staff got upset and said we werent supposed to. We apologized but we were just after some water with our food and at the time there was no staff around to ask. Additionally we ordered some fish which came in a little metal dish covered in oil with some bread on the side, we were not given any cutlery or chopsticks to dish the fish onto the bread and when I politely asked the waitress she rudely said that you need to use the bread. I have never written a negative review before and have had such a positive experience so far in Japan and this actually upset me a little. Would just like to add that the male waiter was lovely.  I thought the price was good.  Updated 12152023

Been a long time patron dating back over 6 years, so it is really sad that I have to leave such a negative review.

Food 45 Fresh ingredients and food tastes good
Service 25 Servers gossiping instead of making the rounds
Value 35 Lunch sets doesn't include drinks
Ambiance 45

Went back after 6 months from my last visit.

The entrance on the side was closed, not sure if management is trying to shut this location down on purpose.

Arrived around 1110AM, online menu ordering system was not up and running and had to bring that up with the server,  server wasn't too receptive about my feedback.

Ordered food around 1117AM, servers were just gossiping around given that the establishment was completely empty.

Food arrived around 1132AM, as always the food seemed appetizing and all the ingredients were fresh.

Had to ask for mustard on the side given that the restaurant no longer carries the Heinz mustard packs that used to be served along with the silverware and the single pack of Heinz ketchup.

Went to make a payment, there is a touch free reader that clearly can read RFID equipped credit cards, was told that it wasn't functional.  Kind of unexpected after all of these months, guess their system upgrade cycle must be every 3 years or longer, more and more establishments accept touch free payment methods.

Also mentioned to the cashier that the side door was not open and that from the outside the building prospective customers could not tell if the establishment was open for business.  Cashier did not seem to be too interested about my comments.

Such a shame to see this establishment performing so poorly, if you want to be treated like you are back in the US dining at an establishment that is been manned by tweens, then Brooklyn Parlor is your place. The burgers are still good but that is about it, don't expect service that matches the quality of the food.

Previous review from 2019

Food 45 Fresh ingredients
Service 45 Good service when not crowded
Value 45 Good value, best values are the lunch setsspecials
Ambiance 45 Loft style, individual and shared tables seating along with sofa seating

Had a chance to try out the new Japanese lunch set at Brooklyn Parlor, everything on the tray was fresh and tasted great, the finishing touches were a bit off since the salad dressing wasn't distributed uniformly.  Other than that the kitchen staff did a great job.

The Root Salad has been revamped slightly with the dressing been served on the side instead of been included when the salad used to be tossed. The brownie and French toast were really delicious. I was kinda disappointed with the creme brle. It was really watery inside, felt like just eating sweet liquid , and the top layer wasnt crunchy at all. In terms of the environment, I think its quite spacious and the seats are comfortable. I really hate the music in the daytime
Edit the music is better now. But the coffee is very bitter and not tasty despite being 750 yen. 
Great burgers as always though!!

주소: Japan, 〒550-0003 Osaka, Nishi Ward, Kyōmachibori, 1-chōme−4−１６ CENTURY BLD 1F
리뷰: This place is incredible. My husband and I found it by chance back in March, it was right in front of our hotel. We had the most delicate, cute and tasty crepes. My husband had this fabulous looking mimosa crepe and I had the lemon butter one. It was definitely one of the best crepes Ive ever had. The coffee was also delicious. The ambiance alone is worth a trip, its so cozy. Beautiful cafe with a lot of soul and love in it. Great coffee, crepes and service. We enjoyed a lot staying here. Tiny cute cafe with only a few seats. Loved the atmosphere and the crepe!! Lovely little cafe hidden inside an office building with a very unique and stylish interior. They serve the best latte I ever had in Osaka. Cosy and warm cafe. The owner is very friendly! Also highly recommended to international travelers!

주소: 1-chōme-16-9 Minamihorie, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0015, Japan
리뷰: Food was very delicious! The pancakes was amazing, had the classic pancakes and they were very good. They didn't have French toast at the time but hopefully when I come next time they will. The place is small but very cozy very chic. If it's crowded, there are two lines, so be mindful when you walk up. I also had the ice mocha and the croque madame. Loved the croquet but the ice mocha had too much milk but still very delicious. Overall great place to visit when you come to Osaka and want some western style breakfast. Maybe I just didnt choose a great dish but the food was not good. I had the fried egg bacon cheese sandwich with salad on the side. The salad was just undressed spring greens, plate decoration really. The sandwich looked good but was incredibly rich. The bread is fried in butter, with butter heavily spread on the insides as well, plus the cheese in the sandwich. I couldnt stomach it. I had a good experience, however I think I may have ordered the wrong thing. The Avacado toast was a little funny  the bread they use reminded me of banana bread. It is very sweet and moist which threw the flavor of the dish off for me. However the latte was very good and the service was as well. I arrived at 1145am and waited in the queue for 1hr 15 minutes. With such a long line and all the amazing reviews, I was excited for an amazing meal. Honestly, in the end, it was average and a little disappointing. Once I got inside, I didn't wait long to be served my food which was great because I was ready for food haha. Everyone was hard at work, and the service was very nice. I got the pancakes, bacon, and eggs. The bacon was crispy but very greasy. The eggs needed seasoning, and the pancakes were just everyday normal pancakes. I also got the cookies milkshake, which was very good. I feel like this place was over hyped. I would come back to eat here again, but I wouldn't wait in line unless it was an under 10 minute wait. A fantastic little breakfast place in Osaka. It's a bit hard to find a place open before 10am in Osaka, so this place is a life saver. I got a pancake set while my partner got a croque madame, and they were both delicious. The staff was fast, attentive, and polite, and the atmosphere was great. A, I'd definitely go again.
