주소: 1-chōme-20-4 Shinmachi, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0013, Japan
리뷰:
Excellent coffee choices for pour over. Wish there were more selections for espresso only two. Went with the Ethiopian. Given the quality of single origin, was definitely overpriced. The pour over game however, appears well worth it. I'll be going back to try others.
It is a take out cafe, best be prepared for that as there are no seats.
Staff really know what they are doing and take their time to hear your needs and aid you in the selection. They are warm and inviting.  Was definitely worth the detour. Probably one of the more impressive coffee experiences I've ever had. Masa and his team are a phenomenal example of what specialty coffee truly is. A tiny space, using absolutely every single inch to its fullest, jammed in with an L5 and Linea. The pourover of Takesi was likely the best cup of coffee Ive had in a year. Huge kudos to his team and to the business and shop theyve built, and thank you for being so kind and a wonderful example for our industry. we ordered 2 cups. the ruiru is good and fruity. and the other geisha with long name is just typical geisha taste with unpleasant starbucks americano aftertaste 

Mels Caf The perfect spot for delicious cappuccino and impromptu photo shoots!

After two weeks of caffeinated exploration through Tokyo, Nagoya, and Kyoto, I finally stumbled upon Mels Caf and discovered a truly delightful cappuccino  definitely worth the 700 Yen! The blend was rich and velvety, making it the best Ive had in Japan so far.

However, a couple of things kept this experience from being perfect. First, they serve their amazing cappuccino in a paper cup. Because who wouldn't want to sip a delicious, meticulously crafted drink out of something thats typically reserved for office coffee? Its a bit like serving a gourmet meal on a paper plate  just doesnt do it justice! Plus, not exactly a win for sustainability.

Secondly, the caf seems to be a hotspot for the youngsters social media enthusiasts. Expect a backdrop of camera clicks and selfies galore. Its like being in the middle of a spontaneous photo shoot. So, if youre looking for a quiet place to enjoy your coffee, you might want to bring noisecanceling headphones.

All in all, Mels serves up a fantastic cappuccino worth trying, even if you have to drink it from a paper cup while dodging selfie sticks. If they switched to real cups and toned down the photo ops, it would be a 5star experience for sure! The service was next level! I absolutely enjoyed the coffee. The barista was very kind to recommend me some coffee beans and gave me a very thorough introduction of each kind. If you are a coffee lover, this is a must go!

주소: 1-chōme-7-17 Shinmachi, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0013, Japan
리뷰:
Great little with a nice atmosphere and feel. The tiramsu and iced coffee were very high quality and fresh. Nice coffee shop to take a break in Desserts were delicious, got the oreo caramel croffle, tiramisu latte and cat pudding in my photo. They don't sell pasta or any other meals, just desserts and beverages.

Came at around 12pm on sat and there were several empty tables for 2 and around 2 empty tables were 3 or 4. Opposite of fresh farm.

Service was nice, its a serene and cosy place to chill!  love the plants and korean RB music! Extremely nice and cozy place. The strawberry croffle and tiramisu mocha were both extremely delightful! Theres also a cute photo spot in the corner of the cafe that I recommend trying! Nice Korean style cafe. Popular with the younger crowd teens  early twenties. The coffee is good and the sweets are good and are a decent size.

Service could be better. I've been here twice once with a friend and once alone. The first time the staff were okay but the second time, they were kind of rude. No greetings and just shoved the English menu in my face  not every foreigner is a tourist. Later on, they were all sitting down,looking at their phones.

Both times, there was this funky, unwelcoming vibe like some reviewers mentioned. Kinda contrasts with the stylish and chill decor. Won't be going back. Hard to chill with negative vibes. Cute food tho'! Stylish cafe with a variety of drinks and desserts. Out of the way of the hustle and bustle of Doutonburi, but still nearby, this cafe is also surrounded by other restaurants and bars.

주소: Japan, 〒556-0011 Osaka, Naniwa Ward, Nanbanaka, 2-chōme−3−１８ 2階
리뷰:
We ordered almost everything on the breakfast menu and loved it all. We were happily surprised at the cafe space when it opened and we were seated right when it opened at 9 am. Good thing we got there early as it is a very popular place and it fills up quickly. The food was fresh and everything was delicious. If we had been in Osaka for one more day, we would have gone back for lunch but we ran out of time and couldn't make it back! This was my favorite place in our time in Osaka. Highly recommend going here and get there early! A nice hangout place for a morning breakfast.

The toasts are nicely made with soft and sweet bread. The toppings are a little off in their spices as my egg for my French toast is kinda salty.

Overall, it is a worth place to visit and the wait isnt that long even if you did not reserve.

Not sure if reservation is possible. Cute little cafe, known as no 1 cafe to visit in osaka from many reviews. The place is indeed very cute, with a little garden on the entrance of the 2nd floor. The bread is soft and nice, and a little expensive too. The food took quite long to come out and by the time we were there at 2.30pm, most of menu were sold out. The earl grey jam is so good and I bought 1 bottle of it to bring home.  They also have different place in the same road for bakery only and coffee only. I bought some breads at the bakery and most of them are nice. The red bean butter bread and truffle salt bread are nice Their bread is a bit sweet and its the best part of it!!!
We really loved their bread!
You can get a discount for the bakery downstairs if you dine in!

Youll need to order your food by scanning the QR code on your table.
I highly recommend you make a reservation for lunch! A nice and cozy coffee shop with delicious breakfast options, however, I wish they also served the items of the bakery at the cafe. In the morning, they only provide a limited set of options to have on site, mostly involving toast or croissant, the items of their bakery downstairs are not included. The atmosphere is super nice and chilled, being a great option for a brunch on a rainy Sunday like I did. Make sure to arrive early as it can get pretty crowded!

주소: 2-chōme-5-18 Tenjinbashi, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0041, Japan
리뷰:
We love their food, their coffee and their hospitality.
My partner ordered brown sugar latte and he said it was so good.
Their egg sandwich is really good too, we had to comeback the next day to have more.
If you are in the area, we suggest you come and try their food. Loved the breakfast today. It was home away from home. They have Assam tea and bread butter. I was craving Assam tea and bread butter for breakfast and I found it here. I also ordered the egg sandwich. Everything I ordered was simply tasteful. The person at the cafe made them carefully and spoke very good English. I had requested to give some milk along with the tea. He also interacted with me.  It was a lovely morning and a soul satisfying breakfast. Thank you. Absolutely wonderful food! Had an amazing apple pie that everyone should have alongside their lunchdinner. They may not speak English but the food did the talking.

There is an English menu if you ask though. It's a nice small cozy place with not too many seats but good for 2 person party stopping by. Best apple pie! The taste of the whipped cream plus ice cream plus pie perfectly melts in your mouth YUM YUM me  my friend actually ate this after enjoying katsu curry rice there is always room for dessert

 clean toilets We had the delightful experience of this cafe. Their warm welcome and lovely food makes this quite simply the best cafe in Osaka.

리뷰: Ecopresso and the Apple Tart Tartan were amazing .  The tart's balance of the sweet apple, crumbly biscuits and flavoured cream was perfection. The quiet atmosphere  on a lazy Sunday afternoon was just right. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially because my Japanese is very limited. Cozy spot with funky retro music. Coffee was delicious, cookie cups were the right amount of sweet. Our 8 yo said it was the best cafe shes been to. The barista noticed her seal bag and created a latte art in the form of a seal face A cafe in Osaka located close to the river. The waitress was quite helpful and kind. Their coffee and strawberry milk were tasty. Their famous cookie cup was cute but not tasty as expected, it's just for the gimmick. Such a fun thing to have an edible espresso cup! My wife got a macchiato with very cute latte art, and I got an espresso shot in the edible cup to balance out the sweetness. So fun! Music is on point. Cookie cup latte is so cute. You can make bathing rabbitbear when you order Financier. The workers are so nice.

이름: ufotable Cafe Osaka / Machiasobi CAFE Osaka
주소: 3-chōme-3-3 Nipponbashi, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0005, Japan
리뷰: If you're a tourist don't bother coming here. Went to many places during my 1 month in Japan and this was the most convoluted reservation system I encountered to the point where I just gave up. Restaurant was totally empty btw Specialty Cafe which is affiliated with the animation company Ufotable. And no, Emiya will not be serving food today. Their Menu is not that diverse but the quality of service is very good. Note that at the time of visit, there was no support of English in the menu, so making sure what to order beforehand there is a menu outside with pictures will help trouble later on. Enjoyed my visit, would recommend for people willing to cash out a bit more for a parfait. Service is excellent, atmosphere is really chilled and the dining area has two projector screens. One showed a selection of currently airing anime, one at the time was showing Kimetsu no Yaiba. Good range of items to buy inside for Fate and other ufotable shows. Prices are a little high for what you get, but this is par for the course with themed cafes. Foreign travellers be aware that there is only a Japanese menu. Needs reserve and doesn't serve food without it but has a nice goods shop and the way they treat their fidelity clients filled my heart with joy. Friendly staff, food is quite good. Be sure to have enough cash with you! Cash only!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−18−１１ LIBERTY心斎橋ビル１Ｆ
리뷰:
They have special breeds of cats. Super cute and fluffy. Down side is the price. We paid 5000yen for 1 hour, including 2 lollipop cat snacks. The drinks are included and unlimited from the machines. The drinks taste ok. Nothing compared to freshmade ones. I can imagine this place gets very crowded during busy hours, and its hard to get cats attention.

They also have a collection of manga. I think this was a cute experience, the cats werent too shy and some were friendly and let you pet them. I went in for 30 minutes which was around 1000 yen and you should keep track of your time as they dont remind you and you pay extra if you go over time. The free drinks were refreshing! You have to take your shoes off and put your bag in a locker. The staff are friendly and sweet. One of my fave pet cafes so far because the cats interact more and are more curious  it also looks like they are groomed well and taken care of. My favourite one was the Maine coon, Milo!

Im not sure if there is an adoption option so that cat lovers can have a chance to adopt a pet local and overseas. I think it would create a more positive environment to help cats find a home and loving family rather than being in a pet cafe for the rest of their lives  A cat cafe that works very differently from any cat cafe I'm used to from my homeland. You pay here by the time you spend inside, and during that time, you can get any drink from a vending machine for free, but you have to pay extra for cat treats. Even a short visit is a bit expensive, though. But the place is very nice and clean, and the staff is friendly. A great setup, very relaxing and interactive environment. Also very clean.

The cats are treated well and saw them being rotated out of the room. They can also go vertically to get away from the people if needed.

A great place to relax with cats but dont expect snuggles or attention, these cats know they are the stars and interact on their terms. There is an option to buy treats if you want to buy their affection. Cats look healthy and very well cared for. A little pricey but if youve got a cat lover in the group that needs a feline fix this is a good spot.

주소: Japan, 〒550-0003 Osaka, Nishi Ward, Kyōmachibori, 1-chōme−9−１４ O-KYO 1階
리뷰:
Was here on 29th Sept and 28th Sept in the morning.

Had the iced latte both days as it was superb. Tried the cheese toast, beef pastrami sandwich and the peach sandwich. All were delicious but the main standout was the peach sandwich.
The combination of flavors was just fantastic. Sweet, fragrant, creamy and salty from the ham. The bread was crispy and fluffy as well. What a great dish.

Pro tip come early as seats are limited and waiting time can drag to 1 hour if the place is full.

Definitely worth a visit. Amazing coffee and a lot of food choices, especially for brunch, like some awesome Japanesestyle sandwiches.

There's also an English menu card available.

The space is not too big, but couples can find a place to sit in the few tables.

The coffee was one of the best I had in Osaka.

Only negative is that the air inside might smell of food because there's an open cuisine, and that smell can stay on your clothes. Also, while I was there, they were cutting onions and we all started tearing up in the shop like someone had thrown a tear gas bomb  My favourite cafe from my trip at Osaka. Ordered the matcha latte and cafe latte with hazelnut and both were so good.

Cheese toast, turkey eggs and maple French toast were also very delicious.

Highly highly recommend! A cafe with great coffee best I had in Osaka this trip and yummy brunch options  Came here for breakfast and I loved everything about this place!  I had the french toast which was crunchy on the outside, yet soft on the inside. I also had the raspberry matcha latte which was super delicious and not too sweet. On top of that, everything looked amazing and the latte art on my boyfriend's latte was the prettiest i've ever seen. The atmosphere was amazing and the staff was super friendly and made us feel comfortable. Even though the food took a little while to be prepared, that didn't take anything away from the experience and most likely just proves have freshly everything is being prepared. Highly recommend to check this place out!  Delicious breakfast spot  we'll be coming back tomorrow. The iced latte was one of the best coffees I've had. The cheesy toast, tuna sandwich and iced matcha latte were excellent too.

주소: Japan, 〒541-0041 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Kitahama, 1-chōme−1−２８ ビルマビル北浜2F
리뷰:
My family and I came to this place for our first breakfast in Japan. When we entered, one of the waitresses greeted us, and we sat down on an outdoor patio overlooking a river. The atmosphere of this place is phenomenal, while we waited for our food, we looked out and admired the view. I ordered the avocado toast and my daughter ordered the caramel banana pancake. I really appreciate that they had two menus, one in Japanese and one in English, so it was easy to order. The food only took about 15 minutes. I LOVED the pancakes!! Japanese pancakes are so fluffy and light, with the chopped bananas and caramel toppings. The avocado toast was average. It was still very fresh though, but its not something I would order again. Overall, I enjoyed this experience and would definitely come here again. This place is absolutely beautiful and relaxing to enjoy a quality meal with a stunning view. Originally I was a bit worried about the review, but then I realized that people gave one star reviews just because they waited too long for their food. Go to McDonanld if you are in a hurry and let other people enjoy this place. Its better to come when they just open at 7 AM though. I have seen long lines of people waiting to get in. Food looks and tastes great! We came in within the hour of opening on a Friday morning. Would've appreciated some coffee art. We went to a cafe in Tokyo that gave us both coffee art and the total bill was less than this place. And unfortunately, they only had avocado toast and no other toast on their menu. Okay, I just being honest. The foods and drinks are just fine. It is pretty standard that you could probably just get it from any shops that sell the same thing.
But I still give 5 stars, not for other reason, but just for the pretty waitress! She seems like my type! The shrimp sandwich soup set is really good. Its fresh and not overrated at all. The ambiance is also really nice! Plus points cuz this place opens at 7 am! Perfect for early risers like me

주소: Japan, 〒540-0006 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Hōenzaka, 1-chōme−4−６ 法円坂ハイツ 1F102
리뷰:
Osaka's Vegan Fusion Dream
5 stars!!   

This place is a MUST visit for anyone in Osaka, vegan or not!   The vibe is incredible  super chill with tons of wood, natural light, and killer music.  The staff are super friendly and laidback, making it the perfect spot to relax and enjoy a delicious meal.

Speaking of delicious...the food here is to DIE for!  I'm not even vegan, but their fusion dishes are mindblowing.  We had to try one of their "outofthisworld" sandwiches, and it did not disappoint!  Seriously, the best sandwich I've ever had vegan or not.

The cafe itself is super cute and conveniently located in central Osaka.  Perfect for a break from sightseeing or a relaxing lunch date.  This place has everything  amazing food, awesome atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Don't miss it!


Update Went back for the Veggie burger and Iced Chai and wow  again! I had BLT sandwich it was juicy and very delicious. It had lots of  salads, tomatos, thick bacon and side maple syrup. Bread was buttery. Only side carrots were not good
Cappucino and latte was also very good.
Mango bowl, mango tart amazing also. Cold and refreshing.
Its not very cheap but good food! They have 90 min seating rule and queues. Best breakfast in Osaka!
We dined in, but I loved the idea that they let you rent picnic gear with takeout so you can enjoy in a nearby park.
We both got sandwiches, ricotta pancakes, and I got the banana espresso smoothie. Incredible food and everyone was so nice! The line was long but only took about 20 minutes.
We ordered through a QR code on my phone that had and English option. Best breakfast before heading to Osaka Castle. Its an Aussie style breakfast. We got ricotta pancakes and MBLT maple syrup sandwich. Perfectly portioned, bread was great, what looks like pickled carrots on the side was a good addition, and the strawberries were very sweet. Best of all coffee was strong. Hot chai with shot of espresso was a delight. One of the best breakfast cafes Ive ever been to. Toast is good, first time it came roasted Angus is well done but the picture was medium rare and the picture is looks more nicer than the real food , after I told them they changed it. Then its fine.

Pancake is okay, cute like egg cloud. I think thats egg white mix with some pancakes power liquid , so you can feel two texture, highly not recommend that order the banana blueberry pancake one

I saw their peeled banana didnt use protect cover to cover the surface area of the banana,  full of peeled bananas box put on the other full of peeled bananas  box top box bottom is dirty, and put it on the peeled bananas  half of bananas is turning grey, ill .  I saw the 4 eyes girl didnt wear groves to touch the banana and put it in fridge without cover. Unhygienic  easy to tummy pain

Many are tourists like me. Just one time shop.

주소: 1-chōme-6-13 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
The puppies are very cute and small. You can pet them and enjoy a coffee. The space is not very large, so the atmosphere is nice and friendly. It is quiet and peaceful, a nice experience worth to have. Amazing place!
Mame shibas are cute and unaware. Try to enjoy them by themselves. Trying to force any kind of interaction might ruin the experience.
Choose any drink and watch them until one of them reaches you. The staff is always helping and might help you if theres any chance.
Remember mame shibas are not puppies, theyre small but theyre grown up, and each with different personality. Not the greatest Shiba cafe , there are a lot of rules that you wouldn't find in other Shiba cafes. There are rules like no touching the dogs anywhere other than their chest. You must sit on the sides of the room  can't go into the center of the room etc. There were no toys , so you just sit there and watch the dogs while they sit in the center if the room.  if you're looking for a Shiba cafe I recommend trying other places. It was a cute experience but its quite a small space for people to cram and sit around just to try and get attention from the dogs. The staff were informative and helpful but most of the dogs were just not interested. One of the staff members were friendly and kind so thank you for the chat! It would be ideal if there was a bigger play area for them and more space for people to sit and interact. I understand the Shiba Inu is quite shy and cautious so it was interesting to learn this and get to know a Japanese breed like this.

Im not sure if there is an option to adopt the dogs local and overseas but I think it could be great to incorporate that option for dog lovers so that some of the dogs can find a happy and loving home rather than just trying to entertain people all day. We could come in straight away, no waiting line! The dogs were very shy, but the staff was very good to make them play with you and showed us some tricks!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0081 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Minamisenba, 4-chōme−9−３ 東新ビル 2F
리뷰:
A very trendy teahouse that just feels so aesthetically made. The preparation of the tea was also meticulously done, with the sweet candied fruits prepared on ceramic chips. Each serving of tea is truly an artwork of its own.

Here was what we ordered
 Matcha latte  milky, smooth
 Iced hojicha  smoky and bitter, I really like the intensity of this cool and refreshing drink
 Hojichai  Chai made with hojicha, warm and flavourful spices mixed with the earthiness of the tea
 Kakigori  very refreshing for a hot day. I added condensed milk to make it sweeter.

A must visit for tea and pottery lovers.
 Cozy place for a rest with your dessert  tea.
Ive been travelling around Osaka and recover from super tired by spending an hour here.
Peaceful vibe. Nice food. Beautiful setting. I ordered the shaved ice with Japanese black tea syrup comes with one refill, which came with a cup of hojicha for 1200 yen. The gentle and delicate flavor of the black tea syrup was an unexpected and pleasant surprise. The hojicha was very smooth and comforting as well. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Highly recommended. After waiting about 15 min in the heat for it to open, I was really shocked when I walked inside and saw there were already about 10 loud foreignerstour group? inside. I assumed they had some private event and would be leaving but I was surprised when they began to sit down at the same time as well. Luckily I was able to get a seat, but I felt bad for others who showed up before opening time and could not get a seat. They were very loud and even the noise cancellation on my AirPods could not drown them out. I thought that at a cafe style like this, the staff would ask them to keep their voice down, but they did not. When they left, the mood immediately changed and I could feel the calm atmosphere I was looking for. I hope if this cafe lets in private group tours early, they could make it end before the public comes in.

However, the tea was wonderful. The summer tea was very clean and refreshing and it paired well with the savory grilled mochi which was also delicious. It was a bit expensive, but I was able to drink multiple glasses of tea from the pitcher. The presentation was also very beautiful. wad is probably my fave! I loved my time here, the staff were so accommodating. I got the matcha and chose my own matcha bowl.

주소: Japan, 〒541-0041 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Kitahama, 2-chōme−1−１４ KITA2 BLD.
리뷰:
Great VEGAN restaurant.
From the photos here on Google, we expected a wider variety of dishes than just bowls, but the menu seems to change. We had the Optimus Buddha Bowl, Spring Buddha Bowl, and fried soy meat. The food and drinks were excellent I recommend it. Nice view of the river. Excellent place for vegetarian and vegans. We took a cab from the osaka palace, cost about 1100 jpy. It's a small eating place like many Japanese restaurants. Total about 25 seats, mostly indoor and 8  outdoor sitting. The outdoor seats along the river view that's nice and windy. The serving portion is just nice. It's delicious and well presented. Service is great. Highly recommended. Lovely bistro beside the river. Since it was a bit busy and we weren't informed that we needed to order using a QR code, the service was first a little slow, but that was to be expected. The meal was amazing and of the highest quality. Possibly one of the nicest lunches I had while in Japan. The soy meat was cooked nicely, with just the right amount of batter and not too much grease, leaving it lovely and crunchy with a perfect seasoning. All the vegetables were so fresh that you could taste the quality. great, fresh ingredients were used, and there was a great seating space with a soothing view. In addition, the chocolate cake was excellent, with really highquality chocolate. The ideal way to finish a meal. Suggested for both meat eaters and vegans! Great fresh menu with vegan options that doesnt feel like a compromise on creativity and flavor.
Outdoor terrace has an amazing view to the river. Went to Optimus Cafe a few times when we were in Osaka.

One time we ordered the corn fritters to share. Then I had the Optimus Buddah Bowl with an orange juice set, and the fried soy meat plate was also ordered.

Another time we shared the kaarage, then I had the kaarage pita bread and the soy milk ramen was also ordered.

Honestly, always a good meal here, and the staff are lovely. Also, if you're lucky enough, you will get a seat right on the balcony overlooking the canalwaterfront, which is absolutely lovely.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0016 Osaka, Kita Ward, Nakazaki, 3-chōme−2−１４ 珈琲舎書肆アラビク
리뷰:
Dolls, used books, and delicious coffee The cafe has a gentle pace and it feels like an old doll house. Its a refreshing aesthetic from all the  overly sterile instagramworthy  places cropping up in every city.

After reading previous reviews, we expected a possibly unpleasant time, but everyone in the cafe provided excellent service. My Japanese is choppy, but everyone spoke English pretty well. The menu also had English.

There are few around 4 tables in Cafe Arabiq and once they are full, they obviously cant seat any more people. Be prepared to be turned away if they are full up. It really isnt you, its them. Theyve built a small mythology online, so they keep busy it seems. Coming early is your best bet.

I ordered the MariaTheresia, a coffee cocktail of sorts, that contained orange liquer, absolutely delicious whipped cream, and adorable konpeito. I loved it. We also order a premium coffee and the quality was high. They also had denki bran and their food looked tasty, so perhaps next time. After the coffee, I browsed the dolls and wished I could buy everything. The gentleman working was very kind and informative.

TLDR Tasty drinks in an eclectic environment. Super busy, so be patient. Definitely worth going to, especially if dolly stuff is an aesthetic you enjoy. This is truly a oneofakind cafe! There are bookshelves lining the shop and really interesting art on display, which apparently changes every couple of months. The owner makes incredible drinks try the Maria Theresa! Or the rum coffee and the waitress is super friendly. Great place to sit down with a book or a coffee and a long chat. It seems super cozy. Unfortunately my boyfriend and I just came from another cafe and wanted to browse the books here...thinking it was a bookshop. We wanted to order tea to support the local business, but they have a rule where you need to order 1 drink per person. It's totally understandable but since I thought it was a book shop, I didn't want to pay 12 yen just to browse the books. On the other hand, if you have time to sit in relax, it looks like a comfy place. A comfy cafe in a beautiful old house. A good collection of a bit dark and mysterious dolls and paints is exhibited for sale. It'll remind you of the world of Pan's Labyrinth. The ginger coffee was delicious and the interior of the shop was really interesting and unique. Also appreciated the kind service.
영업시간: no operation time
카테고리: art_gallery, cafe, book_store, point_of_interest, home_goods_store, store, food, establishment

주소: Japan, 〒530-0005 Osaka, Kita Ward, Nakanoshima, 3-chōme−6−３２ ダイビル本館 １F
리뷰:
The staff are all very nice  great great service. And they serve apple strudel!And order coffee you can get a drip coffee bag as a small present. A quiet and pleasant environment. Very near two art museums and along a lovely urban river walk. Had the chicken sandwich which was filled with vegetables, so perfect for a hot afternoon. Decent interior design and cutlery.  A quiet place to relax.  Only two choices of breakfast set.  Ive ordered the pancake set.  The food is and latte is just average. As a native Austrian i can say the food was authentically German, the portion size was adjusted to Japanese standards. The service was good as well. The beer is brewed in Japan but the ingredients are important from Germany. cafe is very quiet and have the mood
kafftt?coffee and frazzle sandwach is delicious. coffee is acerbicbittersweet taste and milk soft foam.

주소: Japan, 〒543-0002 Osaka, Tennoji Ward, Ueshio, 3-chōme−6−１８ ラルゴ上汐 一階
리뷰:
What a beautiful family run cafe. The owners are lovely and the menu is varied and offers options for any palette including vegan options.

From grilled cheese sandwiches to poutine to salad and homemade muffins and smoothie and drinks they have an impressive array of delicious food and you can tell that its a community place. Super nice canadian owner, lots of vegan  vegetarian options available. Grilled cheese with tomato soup and the balsamic veggie sandwich were super tasty. Great atmosphere too! One of few places you can get a poutine here in Osaka. The owner is Canadian and it really nice! Cafe has some board games and a good selection of sandwiches. Deserts vary and there are other snacks available. We found the cafe while Googling for a brunch place nearby our hotel. We loved the ambience cozy yet not cramped, and the Christmas decor had a really nice touch! Had a lovely chat with the owner and his wife while dining, went back for a second visit because we loved the place!

The portion of grilled sandwiches were definitely worth for its price. Would recommend the grilled sandwich with gorgonzola cheese  Shimeiji mushrooms.

Would definitely visit this cafe on my next trip to Osaka! Been here 4 times over the 2 trips we made to Japan. Its has become a muststop for us when we are visiting Japan. A mixture of Canadian and Japanese hospitality is an experience on itself. The food is great and well worth it. We will come back again to this awesome place!

주소: Japan, 〒541-0059 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Bakurōmachi, 2-chōme−2−１３ 大阪堺筋ビル 1F
리뷰:
Great place for a fast and inexpensive sandwich. I got the typical sandwich from the store. It was a sandwich cut into three pieces with roasted chicken, lettuce, egg salad and some slight mustard sauce. The bread is quite delicious, but the sauce drips out of it which made it a little messy and the chicken is a little dry. It comes with a little salad mix. Not bad for only 680. Great simple cheap breakfast in 24 hour diner. We went to Bread Espresso  Sakaisuji previously and liked this place more. The tea is loose leaf and comes with a bone china cup and saucer better than BES and the hot dog is lovely! Good place for breakfast, not much options but does the trick for some simple sandwiches and pancakes. Visited the Bakuromachi location. Nice relaxing place with reasonable prices. The blend coffee was smooth. Ordering is via 2D code with your mobile to save on staff costs, but the service was still good. There is a smoking section if you require it. Had the typical "morning" breakfast toast, coffee and a salad. Taste was good for the price. Open 24 hrs. Other places near our hotel to get a "morning" breakfast opened by 800 or later. Pancake slightly hard, overall good and not a must try coffee place.
There is a designated room for smoking customer.
Service is good.

리뷰:
Stumbled upon this little quiet caf and really liked the atmospherevibes inside! The montblanc dessert was really good but unfortunately the matcha latte was just way too milky, could barely taste matcha  A lovely little caf in a quiet part of Osaka. Stumbled upon this as we were walking between Tenmangu and Osaka Castle and it was a perfect break. The decor is relaxing and the barista is extremely friendly.

I tried the Cafe Au Lait and it was exactly what I expected. I accompanied it with a brownie which was elegantly served and tasted delicious.

Overall, I highly recommend giving this place a visit next time youre in Osaka. Beautiful cafe with incredible coffee  quality food. Best coffee I've had in Osaka. Recommend going early, as it fills up very quickly! Nova is a stylish caf with a rustic and Japanesestyle interior. The cafe has a calm atmosphere and delicious red bean paste toast for breakfast. Staff is very polite and friendly. Will visit again. Wonderful interior. Great menu. Calm atmosphere. Stylish vibe. The experience is worth the long line. I suggest going earlier to avoid waiting.

리뷰:
We made very lastminute reservations, and it ended up being one of our favorite experiences! The young man who instructed my kids and husband was fluent in English, super friendly, and had a lot of knowledge and skills. He was so nice to my 7 and 8 year olds. We had a great time. Highly recommend booking an experience here! WE HAD THE BEST TIME!!!

Our family of four kids 11 and 14 had a wonderful experience. Our Ninja Master Seiya taught us the ways of the ninja and gave us skills in throwing stars, blow darts and Katana. Afterwards we ate like Ninjas.

Seiyas infectious laugh and encouragement made the experience unforgettable. Definitely recommend this to any families looking for a fun activity. Not just for kids! We had such a fun time learning to be ninjas and eating yummy food. Couldn't have asked for a better instructor  Seiya was fun with such a great attitude! Was such a great experience our 12 year old loved it. Highly recommend.
We did not order food so can not comment on food but the experience was our sons highlight. We have done axe throwing in the US  and I wondered in "Ninja star" throwing thing was a thing.  Google brought me to this place.  Super fun! We are two adults  no kids  and had a blast. The two employees were enthusiastic and great! Loved dressings up as ninjas and doing stars, blowguns, and swords. Whole experience was just under an hour.  A nice personal experience with just our party.

리뷰:
delicious home cookedstyle food! roughly 1200 yen for a lunch set with the choice of fish or meat, both of which was delicious!
finished the meal off with 2 of their stunning cakes in the case strawberry cake and old fashioned pudding both were wonderful! This cafe is so far my favorite. I've been to all of their branches in Namba, in Nakazakicho near umeda and this one their main branch. It has a homemy vibe that makes you want to stay longer unless it's not crowded. These are one of the delicious food on their menu. I ordered Canele ,  assorted baked goods , homemade lemonade . Such a cute and cozy caf! So happy I found it on google maps, before our trip to japan. The drinks and food were as amazing as I had hoped. Super cute retro cafe. Good sized food portions and food has a real homemade taste to them. Homey feel caf to sit and chat but drinks are too expensive 600800yen for basic coffee, latte, chocolate drinks, etc. They also require each guest to purchase a drink. Ordered strawberry shortcake and cheesecake which I preferred more than the drinks but nothing spectacular either.
I think it's a nice spot to chat and stay which we needed after a long walk but I wouldn't go for the drinks specifically.

주소: 1-chōme-12-19 Tenjinbashi, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0041, Japan
리뷰:
This place is a perfect 5 star. The food was magnificent, the vibe was amazing and breakfast was perfect and delicious cakes. Must visit breakfast and lunch spot! What a great breakfast spot. The food was amazing, the service was fantastic, and the decor and vibe next level This Caf sets a standard for what a french toast can be. Im looking forward to coming here again one day. This cafe is such a gem!  From the decor to the food to the hot beverages, its really a fantastic find!  The tables are all old footpedal sewing machines the tea and coffee mugs are absolutely gorgeous fine china the plates are Le Creuset the decor reminds me of what my grandmother tells me her grandmothers house looked like and the music ranged from lovely 20s jazz to early rock and roll.  The black tea was very high quality and the coffee was expertly blended.  The pieces of bread on the breakfast menu were huge and fluffy!  Do yourself a favor and treat all your senses at this fine cafe.  Itll be the best decision you make all week! This place sets the bar really high!

Im quite picky when it comes to curry  especially when it uses many spices  and
I was a little skeptical when it said the curry is made with Japanese dashi.
But it was soooo goooood. The combination of Japanese taste and curry spices worked out perfectly.

The space is also very comfy with nice decorations and staff are friendly.
It was superb lunch that I really enjoyed and would love to come back

주소: 3-chōme-6-11 Kawaramachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 541-0048, Japan
리뷰:
This historic coffee shop in Osaka is a true gem! With over a century of serving locals and visitors, it offers a unique blend of tradition and quality. The coffee here is incredibly strong, brewed to perfection with a rich, bold flavor thats perfect for coffee lovers who appreciate a robust cup. The donuts are a perfect complementfresh, fluffy, and delicious with just the right amount of sweetness. The atmosphere exudes nostalgia, making it a charming spot to relax and take in a piece of Osakas history. Highly recommend! Hiraoka Coffee is one of the oldest coffee shops in Osaka. The black coffee was nothing short of exceptional. Brewed to perfection, it boasted a rich, robust flavor with just the right balance of bitterness and acidity. The aroma alone was enough to awaken my senses. The donut was a perfect compliment to the coffee. The texture was something very new to me in super enjoyable ways, hard to describe but thick moist a bit chewy. So delicious One of the oldest cafe in Osaka. They still making coffee and donuts with old appliances. The atmosphere is cozy and nostalgic. The place is small so there is chance you can not get a chair.

I tried their 100year blend coffee, their original signature that has been served for a century. The taste is not strong, but relaxing enough. Together with their signature donuts which is more like a cake, making the coffee taste really good.

If you have time, you should try this place. The gentleman who greeted us and took our orders, an older gentleman who certainly looked like he owned the place  was very hospitable. Welcoming and warm he was.

Warm legendary cup. Cold Windy Osaka morning. Sipping history. Chances upon this shop and intrigue with the 100 year old tag! A small lovely joint and very friendly English speaking owner.

Ordered the Columbia medium roast and donut. The coffee is grind and tasted beautiful, full body and aroma. The donut is on the harder type but goes well with the coffee.

Going to make this my regular joint!

주소: ヒルトン大阪, １Ｆ, 1-chōme-8-8 Umeda, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0001, Japan
리뷰:
21.55 for a bottle of water and a bad dessert. You can't sit in the cafe lounge area in the lobby without ordering something. Then, they didn't even have the dessert I thought I could stomach cheese cake so I tried this shitty piece pictured here.
Every time I stepped into the caferestaurantbar area they acted like they owned me. Their idea of service in this area of Japan is ordering you around. I'm a Hilton honors member and I'll bet I can just stay at other places In a member at like Marriott, Hyatt, or elsewhere next time. This hotel in general sucks. Super pretentious here. Food is good, but the atmosphere was awesome because they have great onsite singers. Services were top of the line as well. I dont usually mention names in my reviews but this time I think I really have to do so.

Came to have afternoon tea with my wife and 2 year old son, my son was pretty loud and out of control but the the staff Ms.Mori was really professional and took great care of us , gave us an isolated seat so we wouldnt be bothering other customers and she really made us feel like home.

The food was very tasty, but the service was exceptional, really appreciated.

Thank you for the great service. I happened to be at the Hilton Osaka on vacation this week and the two evenings I spent relaxing at the bar after long days of walking were highlights of the trip.

The whole staff was great, and the live jazz performers were top notch and took requests, but Shigematsu, the bartender, was incredible. He was very attentive, well humored, and was able to come up with amazing drinks when I asked him to 'go off menu'. Would absolutely recommend this place for a great cocktailevening. Had lunch, drinks, dinner, and breakfast at MyPlace during our recent stay at the Hilton Osaka.  Favorites were the MyBurger ordered it twice, Pork Ramen, Shrimp and Avocado sandwich, Black Forrest Gateaux, Alond, Pear  Raspberry Tart, among others.  Must also try the house cocktail, Chivas Mizunara Whisky. Attentive and courteous staff.

주소: 4-chōme-13-22 Minamisenba, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0081, Japan
리뷰:
This felt like an American cafe and I assume that's what they were going for. The coffee was very mid, and the coffee jelly wasn't very good. But they have ample seating for a coffee shop, which was very uncommon for us during our coffee expeditions in Japan. We only came here because the coffee shop we wanted to try was closed. If you need a place to chill, this checks that box, but if you are searching for good coffeejelly this isn't it. It IS better than Starbucks though. Large space to sit and relax. Desserts are great. Coffee was good but a little on the milky side. Staff very friendly Nice atmosphere but not my kind of coffee. Ordered cappuccino with oat milk.. way too much milk. I cannot even taste the coffee. It's way too milky.

My friend ordered hot Americano and it was served at room temperatureit wasn't crowded at that time. They were nice enough to make us another cup.

So 2 stars for coffee and 4 stars for service and atmosphere Cafe Saturdays NYC in Osaka is a trendy place for a coffee break. The cappuccino was fantastic, rich and smooth in texture, perfectly balanced with the rich taste of the espresso. The foam is soft and just the right temperature. The vegan matcha sesame cookie was also excellent, moist and soft with a mix of flavours. If you like match you need to try it! Thank me later. The atmosphere is perfect for getting some work done, with plenty of power sockets and a good wifi connection, although I had a few hiccups while I was there. All in all, a great place to grab a drink, a snack and get some work done. If you have time go upstairs and shop some fancy clothes. Will definitely come back in the future. Cool cafe. Stylish, delicious, pleasant music. Cappuccino, matcha latte and cookies from matches are delicious

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 1-chōme−12−６ Ｅ～ｍａ B1F
리뷰:
Tried the signature pancake. It was a bit dense on the inside not the fluffy kind. As you pair it with the cold cream and fruits, every mouthful was well balanced with the sweetness of the cream and pancake and slight sourness of the fruits. It doesnt leave a starchy aftertaste as well. A quiet cafe to relax and kickback after much walking around the malls. The shop was a bit hidden and hard to find if you're not from the area but I'm very glad to have discovered it! Very delicious pancakes, they were soft and had a fluffy texture. I would definitely recommend trying the strawberry pancakes! The server was also very kind and took his time to explain the menu. Overall a very pleasant experience. Visited on 6th January 2021 lunch time. Although there are only five lunch dishes in the menu included one pasta. The food are really great. Delicious, nutritious, rare to see, with enough volume. They put some citrus in the water. You can feel the friendliness from the staff. If they provided a little butter or jam for the toast, that will make the gratin dish perfect. The price is acceptable. Superior restaurant with balance nutrition. Worth to visit again and again and deserve recommendation. Visited this place in a group mixed with foreigners and 1 other Japanese. I ordered their seasonal peach pancake, but even after my friends had finished their meal, the pancake was not served. They did not miss taking my order since the staff clearly mentioned tea for cake set when serving my tea. So when we checked with the only male staff working during this period on our order, he told us that the peach pancake was finished, and recommended us to order the other pancake. I ultimately ordered peach shortcake instead. As we were about to leave the cafe, we saw the table near ours with two Japanese young ladies being served the very same peach pancake. So we asked the same male staff why it was not served to us, which he responded with a single liner that because the pancake took time. If that is the case, why recommend another pancake to us? It is alright to admit that you missed our order, but lying directly to us, not once but twice, is unprofessional. Just because we are foreigners does not mean we dont understand Japanese. Greatly disappointed with the service and this whole dishonesty and lack of remorse spoilt our meal experience.

Visited this place on 1 July 2023, receipt time was 1354. Great atmosphere. Sleek and not crowded.  Good quality food with very nice flavors. Will definitely go back.  Quick service, friendly staff.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0043 Osaka, Kita Ward, Tenma, 3-chōme−4−５ タツタビル 1F
리뷰:
Food art! I saw this on instagram just before travelling to Osaka and I was not disappointed. The smoothies are as delicious as they look. The dessert was also amazing.

The owners were really friendly and their skills are very impressive! This is easily one of the best cafes I've ever been to. The art smoothies are not only so beautiful but also so fresh and delicious. The entire atmosphere was so cozy and the decorations are so beautiful. The background music was Disney songs which only made it more magical! The staff are incredibly friendly and they helped us choose the best table for our photos! If I'm visiting Osaka again I am definitely coming to this place in a heartbeat! Thank you to the staff  Wow! This restaurant feels like a hidden gem in Osaka. We tried the smoothies and were blown away with how delicious they tasted and how cute they looked. The pricing is more than okay, paid 1000yen per Smoothie plus the staff is super friendly, will definitely come back for more! I stumbled upon this charming cafe on Google Maps just before my trip to Osaka, and it turned out to be a delightful find. The photos online had already piqued my interest, but experiencing the desserts firsthand was even better. What truly sets them apart is the exceptional quality of the ingredients they use. The use of real vanilla beans in their cream speaks volumes about their commitment to excellence. The owner was incredibly welcoming and even assisted me in arranging my desserts for some stunning photos. I highly recommend this spot to anyone seeking topnotch desserts. JTRRD is a great cafe in Osaka with very nice staff. Whether you order a drink or a meal, every item on the menu has a lot of care and personal touch. The restaurant, although small, is exceptional and if you are in Osaka  I definitely recommend it.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 3−１ グランフロント大阪 北館 1F アクタス梅田店内
리뷰:
Overall good experience but the food is expensive for what it is. It's only a salad buffet usual lettuce leaves, peppers, cherry tomatoes,  various dressings and toppings croutons etc and also a couple of "salads" such as grated carrots with sultanas and a vinegar based dressing and a broccoli based salad also came with basic drinks water, orange juice, teas and coffee. Would be nice to have bread you got a couple of small rolls with your meal, but nothing else or something with potatoes or even rice as an option with the buffet. If you want fried potatoes or rice you have to pay extra and they're not cheap for the size of portion you get.
Giant meat ball was a bit bland and needed seasoning eating it with the heavily salted fries actually ended up helping it taste better. It was basically the usual Hamburg steak you get in Japan just round instead of flatter and oval.  Schnitzel was ok although some of the pork was a little fatty.
Think 2000yen was a little expensive for what you get, but not completely unreasonable  definitely ok if you eat a lot of salad!
Staff were very polite and the young man who served me even used a little bit of English which was unexpected and kind.
They are kid friendly  saw lots of kids and they also have a few high chairs. We were waiting outside for about 30mnt before we can get a seat no reservation for weekend. The staff told me that i only hv 90mnt in there. Ordered crepes and chips for 3 of us. It looks spacious in google map photos but when i came there, it not that spacious. Coffee and dessert is ok ok.. great view.
Not so sweet dessert, but toi may found it tasteless for something like pancake. Had a long wait to get in Saturday lunch place very popular with young mum's and babies very airy with outside seating. Buffet had salad, soups and some nice breads ... Staff were friendly and tried their best to communicate.... Recommend This place is combined with a cafe and furniture interior shop.
Youll enjoy shopping browsing while having coffee and tea.

Long waiting queue on weekends

주소: 2-chōme-8-22 Fukushima, Fukushima Ward, Osaka, 553-0003, Japan
리뷰: Cute cafe with power outlets and a good vibe. I left my laptop power cable on Friday night and they carefully looked after it until I came back the next day. I had the cafe mocha and New York cheesecake set which was very nice. Then the toast set with honey and butter the next morning with the ice cocoa, which was also very good. I also tried the lemon squash, which was pretty nice too. Both times I visited there were plenty of people but it wasn't crowded, and there was a movie playing silently on a tv screen with Japanese subtitles, and western music. All in all, a great vibe, and a great place to workstudygo with friends. Great place to have an oat milk matcha ask for otsumiruku henko. Bit pricey for the large mug, but they give you an actual bowl of matcha. The coffee is delicious and fresh. On a hot day the vanilla latte is amazing for a sweet and caffeine hit. Absolutely love this place. We've been looking for a good breakfast spot with coffee with milk substitutes which is surprisingly difficult to find in Japan and the oatmilk latte I got here was fabulous! The lady who helped us understood english really well too. We'll be back! Nice small coffee shop with English menu and English music.

A very tasty experience!!! Fresh and natural food, tasty cake in a very comfy ambient! The owner was helpful and very kind, a real added value! What a lovely cafe really close to Osaka Castle and the subway. We had iced teas and puddings which where really tasty. Absolutely delicious. Very friendly. Alot of thought and effort has gone into this little slice of heaven. Loved it. Would definitely recommend anyone to visit. Coffeee is perfect !
Cake is perfect !
The service is perfect ! 
Definitely want to come back again ! Employee there is learning English so I was able to have my first conversation with a Japanese person. I had been pronouncing everything wrong even the wards and provinces. Food is beautiful and tasty. Great flavor combination. Quick service. Cute atmosphere. They also sell to go good and tea.

리뷰: In my next trip to Japan, and in all others, Sad Cafe is going to be the first place I visit, and every day if possible. The place and the food are great, and the staff is amazing. They are all sweethearts. I made friends and I miss them. Charming small cafe on a quiet resifential street near Hanazonocho station. The owners are lovely and the food is basic but nice. This cafe became our goto breakfast place and every visit brightens our day  Like most other japanese cafes they have a number of breakfast sets tk choose from but way more than others!!! and there is a menu in English too. We tried many other local cofe houses in the area but Sad Cafe is by far the best! First of all great service. The food and coffee were great. Beautiful little coffee! This is such a cute little cafe! My friend and I randomly found it in our area a few months ago and it's so good! The food is delicious and you get a lot. It's also really cheap pricewise. The owners were also really nice. I definitely want to go again if I'm ever in the area. Reasonable prices see picture. I had set B and my partner had set E. Delicious with the fruit

주소: Japan, 〒530-0003 Osaka, Kita Ward, Dōjima, 1-chōme−5, 堂島地下街 9号
리뷰:
Had breakfast here one morning. Food  drinks was pretty alright. But the waitress didnt made a slight effort to speak English and feel frustrated with us.

Plus note they do have usage fee charged by the hour. So dont come here just for breakfast, this is more of a coworking space. They do not speak English or have any English written anywhere, I went knowing exactly how everything works after reading the reviews but she was still insisting on explaining it so we had to use Google or we would be stuck there, the system is very simple, you pay per hour to use a cubicle and pay for the time before leaving, any consumption is paid in advance when you order, that is it, but with no Japanese you will not get in without Google translate as they want to make sure that you understand that being there costs money, It would be so much easier with a simple text written in English that they can hand to foreigners so you could just agree with the prices and move on. Still very friendly and they are helpful despite the language limitation, she was happy to use my phone and write everything It's great that you can rent it by the hour!
It's perfect for when you have an impromptu zoom meeting and need WiFi and an outlet, or the nearby cafe is full and you can't get in!

The maximum daily amount is also fixed, so you can stay forever! You can also bring in items you bought nearby!

I think I will continue to use it a lot! Located in the Dojima underground shopping center, it is convenient and ideal for work.
If there is a meeting nearby, you can go a little early to check and revise your presentation materials.
You can also reserve a private room with a door for remote access, which is very convenient. I used it for the first time on a weekday afternoon.
The interior of the store is bright, simple, clean, and stylish.
A female staff member will carefully explain the system etc.
Selfstyle drinks available
Special coffee, tea, scones, toast, etc. are also available for an additional fee.
You can find a seat that suits you and concentrate on your work.
People who were using computers, remote, meetings, studying, and those who were allowed to bring their own meals were spending their time in their own style.
It's very comfortable and you can concentrate on studying.
A well thought out and thankful shop
The coffee recommended by the staff was delicious, so I'll try the toast and scones next time.
It seems like there are several stores, so I'd like to use them again when I'm on the move.

이름: &ISLAND(アンドアイランド) 北浜
주소: 2-chōme-1-23 Kitahama, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 541-0041, Japan
리뷰:
Beautiful location at night, Friday had a live DJ, food was yummy but portions are a bit on the small side. We got to sit outside by the river, but had to go inside to flag down the staff a few times to order since they couldnt see us and had no way to notify them bellQR code otherwise. Overall would def go again though just for the vibes! The place itself nice, but the sandwiches are not OK sadly. The chicken didnt seem well cooked through and all the ingredients are offbalance. Bread was bit soaked.

Maybe the rice dishes are nicer.  only time in japan that a waitress sat us, brought us a menu, took our order and brought the food usually one of those things is done on your own in japanese eateries. fantastic view and the prices are the most affordable of all the spots on the river. salad was ok but the chicken that came with it was excellent. helpful staff, clean, hip, relaxing. highly recommended. Went in for lunch once. The food quality is good and compared to chain stores I think it's fresh. The orders can take some time to prepare but it's a reasonable waiting time.

Seating is available indoors and out by the riverside. Indoor seating itself feels quite spacious, but you can may prefer outdoor seating if the weather is nice.

They serve their food in a cardboard box that I think they actively recycle, so don't toss it in the trash with all the other trash when you finish! Not a planned visit but surprisingly a great experience. Not much talked about the place but surely worth trying the food and drinks.

리뷰:
Had a terrible experience at this cafe. We were only allowed to order drinks since we didn't have a reservation. The drinks are 110... drinks from family martlawson711 are way better. They charged 900 yen for a glass of iced tea. I went for the Frozen collaboration. I ordered frozen yogurt, but it was 80 ice and was hardly a drink.
There is almost no taste. The image is of the ice taken out. 1490 yen is a ripoff for this  Anyway, the inside of the store is full of cute aliens.
I made a reservation online in advance.

Order drinks and food using a pad set on the seating table.
There were a lot of goodies and it was fun. As mentioned in many other comments. Although it's a concept cafe, it's cheap.
I was surprised that neither the drinks nor the parfait were delicious.
There's a reason it's empty even though it's Saturday. It's a terrible store. I can't believe that Keema Curry, everyone's choice, was sold out so quickly even at lunchtime. Couldn't it have been predicted even with the reservation system because it was New Year's? I will never come again. I definitely do not recommend it to others.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, 北区Kita Ward, Umeda, 3-chōme−1−１ 大丸梅田店 6F
리뷰:
so weve been to Harbs several times and it had always been satisfactory. this time,  it was not up to par. the lemon pasta was way too salty and we asked the waitress to see if they could  make it less salty  or remake it and it was an emphatic No! Well, we ended up not taking another bite and it left a bad taste in our mouth, no pun intended. nope, the chef should have offered to remake it. not everyones taste is the same and i guess voicing your displeasure in Japan in frown upon. hopefully this was a branch specific experience. rest assured we are not coming back to this particular one at Daimaru Osaka. Be ready to down a lot of H2O with your meal. the long time waited for a table during holidays lunchtime.. so nice food and desert. the staff was very kindly. The cakes are a bit pricey, but the serving is quite large and very tasty. English menu is available via QR Scan.

If you like light texture cake and fluffy cream, Harbs is your place. It has all the trademarks of a good Japanses style cake. The fruits in the cake are also of high quality. Royal milk tea is also tasty.

There is usually a bit of a queue not too long. Chain desert restaurant, specializing in creamy cakes, such as Mille crepe layered with various fruits, chocolate cake, cheesecake, strawberry cake, etc.  They are all wonderfully delicious, light tasting and fresh.  Pastas are also pretty good.  A bit noisy with all the yelling by the servers Japanese culture?.  Service staff friendliness varies. The shops in japan are very fancy, just like this cake shop. We ordered two cakes from the menu because thats Kens birthday.

Harbour fresh fruits cake  There are so many layers inside  by using different kinds of seasonal fruits. Even though I dont like the taste of the cream but its definitely make from premium local milk products. One thing I feel so amazed of the cake , thats Even there are so many layers of the fruits and cake and creams , its stable as Taishan... and never fall down.  Its a large piece of cake , Shd have shared with someone. Its a bit pricy, but just go and have a try.

이름: à la mode osaka アラモード大阪
주소: Japan, 〒542-0084 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Souemonchō, 4−５ センタービル B1
리뷰:
At night the bar becomes a hub where you can meet people!
Foreigner friendly! They dont make it clear from google or the signs but this is a womens only dessert bar. We tried to go with our male friend and were turned away without explanation, at first we thought it was because we were foreigners until we looked at the instagram. Please add a sign outside to avoid awkward encounters Nice place with good cake. Lovely cafe! As for price, way too expensive portions are much tinier than you expect! You also have to get a drink when going. There's even a charge for going there later than 10pm.

As for taste, everything is cheapsugar tasting. Just go to Walmart instead!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0085 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Shinsaibashisuji, 2-chōme−8−１ 心斎橋ゼロワンビル1F
리뷰:
Ordered the ice cream with the original cheese tart set.
The original cheese tart is great.
Its soft and with strong cheese taste.
The base is the biscuit cookie type.
The ice cream is quite normal.
Compare with the ice cream, the cheese tart is a little more sweet.
Worth getting if no queue.
Staff is friendly. Will take care of the queue too. I had these cheese tarts for the first time in Canada, i knew it was from Japan but i wasn't exactly sure from where.
so eventually when i knew it was from here i got super excited to try it!
we took many flavors but the one we liked the most was with speculoos! highly recommended.
 i would like to say that the one I've had with Canada was better tho. Despite the long line, the wait was definitely worth it. The crme brle cheesecake was a standout, with its rich and creamy texture, perfectly caramelized top, and indulgent flavor. It was easily the highlight of the visit. I also tried the original and strawberry flavors, both of which were delightful, smooth, and satisfying. The original had a classic richness, while the strawberry added a fresh, fruity twist that complemented the creamy base. However, the matcha flavor was less creamy compared to the others, and while it had a distinct flavor, it didnt quite reach the same level of indulgence as the other varieties. That being said, the overall experience was fantastic, and I would happily wait in line again for another taste of the crme brle. Each flavor offered something unique, but if you're visiting Pablos, Id highly recommend trying the crme brle or the original. The balance of sweetness and texture in those flavors is truly exceptional. While the matcha might appeal to those who enjoy a less creamy texture and a bold flavor, it didnt quite meet the high bar set by the other options. Nonetheless, Pablos is a mustvisit spot in Osaka for cheesecake lovers, and I left feeling completely satisfied with the experience. Cheese tarts are super tasty. Theres a hint of salt. Not too sweet at all. We liked both original and crme brle. Queue moves up quickly, dont be discouraged. Worth it!! Visited the store a week ago. Queue may look long, but it clears pretty fast. Waited 5 mins before its my turn to order. The cheese tart is great! Nice and chewy. Would definitely try the creme brle version next time! Pricewise, its okay.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−２０ グランフロントショップ＆レストラン大阪南館 2F
리뷰: I visit every time Im in Japan. This place has the absolute best fruit tarts. The matcha strawberry one is my favorite and all the other fruit tarts are delicious as well. Got a seasonal strawberry tart to go because this place was amazing in 2017. I dont know if its the particular tart I picked or the store in general, but its definitely not as good as I remembered. The crust is still great texture wise, but the fruit and filling was a bit tasteless. Best Cake shop so far. They have in season fruit tart which are very delicious. Expect long queue but well worth the waiting. Highly recommended. Try in season fruit. Winter limited is Luxury White Strawberry Tart The fig really tasted fresh and i really like pie crust. It crumbly and soft, the balance of tartness of the fruit and sweetness of the crust was perfect. It was a bit pricy though. Their coffee was good too. The place is a bit cramped and the line is always long. Minimum waiting time could be 20mins and i think it could go up in an hour during weekends. I wish they could to a bigger place since it's very popular. They also had a wide selection of fruit tarts and other souvenir treats. One of the best cake I ever had in my travels. Fresh fruit, the taste is sweet yet not too much that makes you feel bloated.

주소: 1-chōme-10-6 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0077, Japan
리뷰:
Last night, we stumbled upon Lord Stows Bakery in Dotonbori. Their egg tarts were a delightful surprise! With a flaky crust and a creamy, custard center, they rivaled the best Pasteis de Nata I've tasted. A musttry for any sweet tooth visiting Osaka. Little shop that sells tarts and a couple of other small pastries.

Depending what the people in front of you are getting, the line can move very quickly or very slowly.

I just got an egg tart, and it was great. It's a bit greasy and difficult to eat while just standing around the busy street. If you can wait, I recommend taking it home to eat.

As you can see, I couldn't wait, and I took a bite before remembering to take a picture sorry about that. Prices for tarts are fair, other items such as the apple pie seemed a bit absurd. Service was great. Way better than Pablos in my opinion  the crust is flaky and perfectly baked compared to a premade base. The filling is gooey and creamy. Overall not too sweet for the original egg tart which is what I love in a dessert. Had one on my first day in saka, couldnt stop thinking about them so Im back on my last day and bought a box of 4  yes, theyre that good  FEB 2024

Bought three different egg tarts to try. The chocolate flavor was rich and decadent with some fresh cream on top to balance the sweetness. Matcha red bean was mildly sweet with a decent matcha strength which is not overpowered by the red bean taste. Both were pretty tasty but the original egg tart is still my favorite simple yet delicious with the perfect pairing of the flaky and slightly buttery tart crust with the sweet, mildly eggy and creamy custard. Absolutely amazing!! One of the best egg tarts place in Osaka, my opinion. Their egg tarts are nice and crispy on the outside, fluffy and deliciously flavorful on the inside. We got 4 flavors, chocolate, caramel, matcha, and regular. They were all delicious. My favorite is the chocolate. Highly recommend this place to get egg tarts.

주소: 2-chōme-1-1 Ōtedōri, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0021, Japan
리뷰:
Bonnys Bake Shop is a charming little cafe and bakery in Osaka thats perfect for anyone craving homemade treats in a cozy setting. Tucked away from the citys busy streets, this small, intimate bakery offers a delightful selection of baked goods, including cakes, cookies, and pastries that are made with care and attention to detail. Each item feels freshly prepared, and the flavors are wellbalanced, not overly sweet, which makes it a favorite for both locals and tourists.

The cafe itself has a warm, welcoming atmosphere, with a few tables where you can sit and enjoy your coffee and baked goods at a leisurely pace. The staff is friendly and helpful, adding to the overall inviting feel of the place. Whether youre stopping by for a quick coffee and pastry or picking up a cake togo, Bonnys Bake Shop is a hidden gem that provides a sweet escape from the hustle and bustle of Osaka. Perfect for a relaxing afternoon treat! A homelike atmosphere cafe with many kids of snacks They have cakes and cookies, which are so attractive!! I had a piece of cheese cake. The taste was nice, not too sweet and the texture was smooth. I hope they had many more tables to enjoy eating in the cafe. Ordered the Sweet Potato Lemon Cinnamon Loaf, Bluebarb Pie not pictured, Iced Coffee, and Passionfruit Italian Soda not pictured. All were delicious and the hospitality shown to us foreigners is amazing. I speak no Japanese other than thank you and hello, but the person up front was patient and understanding as I pointed to the items I wanted to order. In Osaka for a couple of days, thinking this will be my goto cakesweet spot. If you love American baked sweets cookies, cakes, brownies, pie, etc. you will love this place. I go in for a treat and usually walk out with three  good taste coffee  delicious cake

주소: 1-chōme-6-17 Utsubohonmachi, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0004, Japan
리뷰:
Got the smooth and the retro flan. We really enjoyed both, just the perfect amount too. No place to sit down inside the store so we ate them standing outside. Only then we realized that there is a park across the street with benches, I'd recommend to enjoy your delicious desserts and some quiet time in the park. I stayed in Hommachi for a holiday in Osaka and tried all the flavours over four days.
It's delicious 
The jelly in the fruit and coffee flavours is very refreshing.
The matcha and pistachio flavours are both flavourful.
The regular nameraka pudding is my favourite.
I recommend trying at least the nameraka pudding and another flavour. Since the reviews were good, I thought I'd like to try it at least once, so I bought Nameraka Pudding and Retro. The smooth pudding was so soft that it fell apart and tasted like eating custard. Retro pudding was a harder pudding and I preferred the texture of Retro. It was an excellent pudding!
I bought this as a White Day present for my wife.
I was looking for takeout pudding in Osaka for my wife who loves pudding, and I found this one.
This shop is famous for its melty pudding, but they also have a wide variety of seasonal puddings and puddings of various flavors.
When I was unsure about what to buy, the store staff carefully explained what features it had.
I bought Retro Pudding'' and seasonal pudding Sakura Pudding'' for my wife who likes hard pudding.
Actually, I wanted to eat them all, but I'm going to hold back this time and go buy them again. Prusik is a cute shop right in front of Utsubo Park.
A chiffon cake and pudding shop.

The store is a takeout specialty store.

Fruits that are in season now
The showcase was gorgeous, with bottled fruit jellies of peach, shine muscat, cantaloupe, and mango.

Everything looks delicious, including today's recommendation 3 and the pudding introduced in Matsuko's Unknown World!

I'm confused and it will end soon.
Bottle Jelly Shine Muscat

Bottle jelly cantaloupe
Muskmelon is from Shizuoka Prefecture

Juicy jelly with plenty of fruits
Smooth pudding underneath soft jelly
A luxurious bottled jelly that you can enjoy as both jelly and pudding.

new product
Pumpkin pudding
smooth pumpkin pudding
Pumpkin syrup boiled all over the bottom
Delicious slightly sweet pumpkin pudding

standard
Smooth pudding
Pudding introduced in Matsuko's Unknown World
Very smooth as it is hardened only with egg yolk.
Vanilla beans are from Madagascar
This pudding has a very nice texture and aroma.

Cheese pudding
Pudding introduced in Recommendation 3
Rich but refreshing pudding with pudding and cheese
Perfect with the sweet and sour berry sauce

Shine muscat, cantaloupe, and peach are almost out of stock, but new products such as marron and sweet potato will be released following pumpkin, so I'm looking forward to those as well!

It would be nice to buy some pudding and enjoy it at Utsubo Park!

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 3-chōme−1−３ ルクア地下 1階
리뷰:
First try in Kumamotos branch . Cant forget the fantastic taste , for me this apple pie is a MUST while travelling in Japan 
Hong Kong s branch really cant compare with  Food 45 Apple pieturnover with custard filling
Service 45 Good service
Value 35 A bit pricey for what you get
Ambiance 45 Food is to go, confectionery visible from outside

Ringo means apple in Japanese, the store specializes in miniature apple pieturnovers with a custard filling that varies by season.  In addition to regular custard I have seen chocolate as well as chestnut flavored custard offered in the past.

The pieturnover itself is yummy, sadly it i not that big, and the price is a bit up there for how relatively easy it is to make the pieturnover.  Best value is to get a set of 4 and share with family and friends.

There used to be long lines about 3 years ago when the store opened, these days there might be 35 people lined up to purchase at the store.

Worth trying at least once to experience the flavor of the apple pieturnover with custard. So delicious! We came back after 4 years and it is just as good as we remembered  Judging from the line of people waiting, these are very popular pastries. I picked up a couple of the basic custard cream apple pies and I was pretty disappointed. They were so overpoweringly sweet that I could barely taste the custard or the apple. 1st try and test amazing! Will try again if possible during the trip!

주소: 2-chōme-11-9 Nishishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0086, Japan
리뷰:
The 10 Cheese Coin places in popular tourist areas are always crowded and busy. So when we walked past this place in the late afternoon, we decided to try it out since there was no queue at all.

We bought the Cheese Coin and the Custard Coin. We can't compare them with other vendors', but we thought they were delicious.

I'd like to think that they were made to order and we really waited a long time for the server to make them and with lovecare. That's why they tasted great. LOL Cheese coin pastry here is tastier than by the river and touristy stands. You can actually get a decent cheese pull, pastry is a tad dense but crispy and not too sweet. Overall one of the better cheese coin pastry. This may have been a promotion while I was there September 2019 but I bought a cheese dog from this place.
Hot dog and mozzarella cheese deep fried, rolled in sugar, then topped with ketchup and honey mustard.
An abomination  yet so delicious. I ate it like a complete animal sitting in the street. 5 stars.

If they have this promotion when you visit GET IT.
Also, I wish I would of bought the beautiful ice cream. It was my intention. Yet the cheese dog seduced me, I couldnt resist. Cute little ice cream shop. The interior design of the shop is unique. I only bought snack, the taste is yummy compare to dontonbori area cheese coin pancake

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 2-chōme−2−２２ ハービスPLAZA ENT 4F
리뷰: The food and drinks were excellent, but they were expensive. We went there around 200 pm. We had to wait for a table for a half hour. Visited on 6th January 2021. Some desert photos in the app  are not offered anymore. Guess they change their menu every few months. The choco cakes and chocolates are exquisite. Drink set is recommended, since the soda fit the cakes surprisingly well. They provide lots of flavors of chocolates that theyre quite special. Like black current, champagne, honey, pistachio, citrus and so on. They do explain what chocolate when they serve. If therere name tags on them will be very appreciated. Because theyre too many kinds. The price is relatively high, but its worthy in my opinion. The takeout chocolate are also good for special day like Valentine. Excellent chocolate desert restaurant. Nice cakes and very nice settings. Expensive. The queue is lonng waiting at least 1.5 hours. Chocolate is good but a bit too fancy Good chocolates but very expensive.

주소: 1-chōme-6-24 Sakuragawa, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0022, Japan
리뷰:
Taste of food
It's not fair to say it is the best canele in Osaka, i would rate it above average. Crispy outside bit it's sticky inside. I taste it more than 30 minutes after purchase.

 Atmosphere
It looks so good from it's appearance and interior design

 Service
Wonderful and extraordinary service with patience. Very friendly employees and delicious pastries! We got one of each and they were all fantastic. My favorite was the apricot and the lemon. I could eat these every day The top of the top Mini Canele de Bordeaux.
After many years followed in Instagram, i finally got a chance to visit this tiny shop in Osaka.

Its worth to visit if you staying in Osaka if you love traditional Canele .

All the flavour of the canele were outstanding.
Perfect recipe and temperature control.
Crunchy outside but moist inside. Super tiny shop only afford to stand max 2 customers I guess, only take away available. Tastes average, not my kind of canele. Price at the high side. Suprisingly reasonable pricing, especially considering how much work goes into these! The set we bought came with an English menu. The busier flavors sounded good on paper but kinda fell flat. My favorites were the coffee and walnut. Those two had the best textures and the most assertive tastes, IMO. My friend's favorites were the plain and the rum raisin. If I were to go here again, I'd probably get a box with one coffee, one walnut, maaaybe one anzu or houjicha, and fill the rest of the space with plain.
