주소: 1-chōme-14-22 Minamihorie, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0015, Japan
리뷰:
Beautiful cake with a vanillalike taste I've never had before! I'm coming back soon to try some carrot cake. Lots of vegan options and a cute little upstairs dining area. Love it!  Unreal vegan bakery in Osaka! We tried the strawberry cake, strawberry donut  chocolate chip cookie and they were all delicious. Everything is freshly baked and the cream used is so good! The prices are reasonable too, a must visit for vegans and nonvegans alike. Amazing vegan donuts! The designs are really cute and theres a variety of flavors. Savory pizza looking donut was perfect! Lemon, blueberry and matcha are great.
The founder and the staff speak English, the place is busy and genki. Definitely going to get my birthday cake there! Thank you for opening this place. It helps animals and people. We had the Victoria sponge cake and the chocolate cupcake, both of which were glutenfree and delicious, especially the Victoria sponge. The sponge was slightly dense which I loved. My girlfriend isn't a fan of chocolate bakes, and has now been converted by the cupcake. We also had coffee which was skillfully prepared.

All of the cakes are vegan, too.

The caf is small and cute. It also has seating upstairs which was a pleasant surprise. Even if there's no space in the caf, there's a park across the street where you could sit and enjoy the goodies.

The staff were very polite and helpful.

The only downside was that there's no toilet.

Overall, we were very satisfied and would gladly return. Absolutely amazing donuts!
There wasn't any space when we went 6 seats only, so we got them to go. Absolutely delicious, fried I think!. Really fluffy, not overly sweet and very good value.

Definitely recommend, vegan or not.

Coffee was okay  quite fruity, went nicely with the donut.

Price  around 3500 so about 1.703 at the time of this and exchange rate. You absolutely wouldn't get this quality at this price in London.

리뷰: It was my first time trying an ice dog, and it was amazing! This place has some nice hot dog buns that are a perfect combination with the ice cream they serve. I will definitely visit this place again. This is a must do if youre in Osaka. They have it going on!!! The perfect combo of fat and sugar, the temperature difference between the ice cream and bun is delish. Get the caramel topping. very tasty cold ice cream with warm bread is good combination It is placed in the middle of America Machi. Small place and no seat available. But collaboration of hot bread and ice cream is amazing!! This ice cream with fried bun is super underrated. There was virtually no que and we tried it on a whim as we walked past  it was absolutely delicious. The bun goes so well with the ice cream. Try it to believe it.

리뷰:
If you want a posh place and playing Korean place but less crowd, this is a cafe to go. But no wonder, even the place is nice, I dont think sugar conscious people will go here. The strawberry waffle was way too foamy and waffles very hard. The sweet potato was way too sweet. And also, they wont give you another bread knife if you ordered a single waffle. So you and your buddypartnerfriend will share one knife to eat an overrated waffle, thats only good at when served. To sum it up, not recommendable! Shaved ice is a must. LOOK AT THOSE FLAKES!
Sweet spot. Super hidden. Definitely chill was here on a Saturday noon

Right by the riverchannel. If you're looking for a very good bingsu I can only recommend this place ! The atmosphere is really nice, it feels like being in korea. We had matcha bingsu which was amazing , good refreshment during hot summer days Strawberry is so good. Shaved ice and waffles. Amazing must try!

주소: なんばウォーク 三番街, 5-12, 1-chōme-3 Sennichimae, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0074, Japan
리뷰:
dango and ice cream
 amatoumaedawalk
 nambawalk

 Beeessssttttt dessert of the trip! Nothing beats traditional desserts like this! Amato Maeda is a cute little shop located in the underground Namba Walk.

 Love a fresh skewer of warm chewy dango. It was really hard to choose what to order but I did not regret what I ordered at all! Warm dango with cold softserve, brown sugar jelly, rice crackers, and red bean. Ahhh if only I can have some right now I had the Match  Icecream Kakigori. It was really good!

The Yuzu Soda was absolutely fantastic.

Service was OK. Took a couple extra "sumimasen" to get the staff's attention for ordering. We were strolling around the underground Namba Walk area and this mochimacha dessert spot caught our eyes.

We ordered two different types of desserts and both are really good.

Good place to get your legs rested and try out some dessert before burning the calories off with more walking in the Namba area. Delicious traditional sweets shop located in a subway station. Staff was polite and kind, and the sweets were definitely something worth coming back for. Highly recommend the cream anmitsu and the black sugar warabi mochi with ice cream. Really good Japanese sweets shop. Loved everything we got here, including the zenzai, dango, and mochi. Could be too sweet for some though. Staff were nice, no english menu available.

리뷰:
We were tempted by the Hanamitsu Gelato didnt know what it is, tempted by curiosity. Anddddd it just wasnt us. It was only until doing this review I realized its vegan sugar free ice cream. Which explains why we taste what we tasted. Just didnt fit our taste buds!

Overall Kel rating 5
The good well priced!
The decent vegan friendly
The ugly just didnt fit our taste buds! Saw this place on YouTube and had to try it!  It did not disappoint.its Halal ice cream so no sugar added but you wouldnt be able to taste the difference! This is a quaint place with vegan options. I would say that the service is really good. The staff helped a deaf guy very patiently and tried to use English with me. I got a pistachio baklava while I thought was small was very tasty. I find the English music in the background though a little off touch with the vibes the interior creates. Lovely cafe within Osaka station serving yummy vegan meals and desserts.

I ordered 2 flavors  dates cacao and fig  really delicious. You can taste they use fresh ingredients to make the ice cream.

Will come back and order other flavors  Hanamitsu Milk gelato is a musttry! Its honey and milk but yet so delicious and not overly sweet. I even went to buy seconds. Wild Berries gelato was light and refreshing. Almond gelato was thick and heavy.

You can choose to have your gelato with nuts and cornflakes for free! Two scoops of gelato for 660 yen is quite affordable. The staff are friendly and speak English. You can also sample the ice cream.

리뷰: Beautiful cakes here!! They all look delicious so make you wanna eat them all. I would love to come again for more. I asked about the cream and the patissier explained thoroughly, which proved that he has a huge passion for what he does. He puts it in cakes! Not really located in touristy spot and we purposely came over because this shop high rated in Google. No dine in option available, can only take out. Taste average . Real french patisserie, loved the crossaint and caramel thing we had. There is a lovely park nearby where you can enjoy the food. Average selections of cakespastriesice cream. Seating not available as section was closed when we visited. Disappointed as the weather was scorching hot and we were looking forward to dining in. Ended up having ice cream and tiramisu on the street As people mentioned, this is the best cake shop in Osaka. How it looks each cake is just like a jewely. I also love their pastries.

리뷰: Absolutely incredible! We were just passing by and saw a line beginning to form and decided to hop in. Everything we ordered is gorgeous in form and taste. Even though the shop was busy, the experience was delightful as the staff kept everything, moving and orderly with great hospitality. Cannot rate this place highly enough. On exiting the shop my wife dropped her bag of cakes and staff immediately helped and replaced them all. Super friendly chef chatting outside in his valrhona chocolate apron. And of course great selection of pastries. Try the griottes pistache! Delicate and complex flavors. I enjoyed several flavors in one cake. Perfect for a treat for myself. Extremely delicate and delicious. Best bakery Ive been to for pastries in Osaka area. I ordered one of every macaroni as I could not decide which I wanted most. The quality was great! Pleasing cookie, and very rich ganache. Moreover, the service here is incredible too. The staff will walk with you while holding your purchase to hand it to you in the way out. The chocolate and cakes look divine as well, and I cannot wait to try them.

주소: Japan, 〒541-0043 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Kōraibashi, 2-chōme−6−９ 山源産業ビル 1, 2階
리뷰:
After checking out from our hotel, we had mediocre a brunch nearby at Cacaotier Gokan.

Upon arrival we were escorted to 2F where the "Salon du chocolat" is located.

Heres what we ordered and our thoughts

Drinks
 Hot Ghana Chocolate, no sugar added
 Hot Kyoto Matcha White Chocolate

Cakes
   rectangular
  cubeshaped

If you order one cake  drink, it becomes a set, with discounted price at JP100 per drink.

For all our order, we paid JP 2,772.

We highly recommend trying the cubeshaped cake, . It was a delightful experience, especially with the nutty cracker on top. The taste profile was incredibly dynamic, evolving with each bite and chew. Initially, it was buttery, then transformed into a nutty flavor with mild bitterness reminiscent of cacao nibs, but very fine. It concluded with a surprising fruity note.

Every bite and sip was worth it! Make sure to finish your drinks to the very bottom, as the tasty sediments there are not to be missed.

We had very good time! Enjoy your visit to Cacaotier Gokan! Upstairs cafe for drinking chocolate, choose from no sugar added nutty Vietnam, fruity Ghana, or smoky Trinidad Tobago, and a second menu of snack items. Downstairs is separate for 70 dark bean to bar chocolate bars, among other confections. I have tried Cacaotier Gokan for the first time in Sapporo and I have immediately regretted we havent purchased more, absolutely the best dark chocolate cacao sand I have ever tried! The staff are helpful and shop is great too. I am an expert in Chocolates and was looking forward to try the 70 Bean to Bar Dark chocolate.

Sadly it tastes exactly like Lindt cant taste a difference  but Lindt is at least 3 or 4 times cheaper for 50g and can be be bought everywhere. Beautiful delicious chocolate cakes. Discovered this place near my hotel. You can buy cakes to take home on 1F or stay in the queue for dine in  on 2F

주소: 1-chōme-3-17 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
Stumbled upon this spot while strolling along Dotonbori and decided to try their milky strawberry soft serve. While the texture lived up to its milky name, it may not be for everyone, especially if you prefer lighter flavors. Unfortunately, the strawberries didnt taste as fresh as Id hoped, which left the overall experience a bit underwhelming. The exterior of the shop is quite eyecatching and tends to draw a crowd, so expect a bit of a queue. They also offer a variety of other strawberrythemed sweets, which might be worth exploring if youre a fan of the fruit. strawberry soft serve 650 was really good, so creamy and milky, it tasted more like ice cream than actual soft serve. strawberry daifuku 500 was quite sweet, and the strawberries werent sweet, like what others said they didnt taste fresh. ill give the ice cream 5 stars while the daifuku 2, averaging to 4 as the ice cream was too good! strawberry flavour is more towards the sour side while the milk was sweet which balanced out the flavour really well. it melts really quickly though The mochi was delicious, but the filling was not. I got the bean one which I wasnt a fan of.

The texture is soft and very flexible. Strawberry was fresh, and tasty. The one my partner had was peach and strawberry and would recommend. The ice cream was incredibly deliciousdefinitely worth the wait. Theres usually a line, but the rich strawberry flavors make it totally worthwhile. Oh my goodness! Daikufu mochi  we had both, strawberry and matcha ones. 1010! Especially the strawberry ones, the red bean filling is perfect, not too red bean which kids love. The daifuku is soft and perfect texture.

Has the strawberry crepe too! Yummy!

We just stood to the side to eat it, it was the less busy corner of Dohtonbori street

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 3-chōme−1−１ JR大阪駅 改札外
리뷰: That's very nice waffle, smell is good and tasty. Unfortunately, the waffle with cream is sold out as very fast. Heaven in my mouth. Very delicious and don't forget to eat while it's warm. Musttry item is the original butter and honey, you cannot go wrong with that. The shop is available around station, the pic is from Osaka station's branch. The shop usually have queue, but fastmoving queue for sure. Enjoy!! Just a small stall and take away concept. But really love the waffle. Their texture was so good, and they have many flavors. I tried the original, chocolate, and strawberry. My favorite was a strawberry one. It didn't sour, but yet tasted so fresh. Simply delicious. Had the pumpkin spice waffle seasonal, it was nice and hot, and the custard filled waffle. No, there are no toppings on these, but they don't need them. They are very sweet and flavorful on their own. Nice to just grab and go for a sweet treat. Every time we pass through in front of this store, we always smell the freshly made waffle. One day we finally decided to buy it, and it tasted as good as it smelled. And also, the price is very affordable!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0077 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Dōtonbori, 1-chōme−10−７, Weed21, B1
리뷰:
For people who like to eat chestnuts  You can try this menu for 1300 yen. Taste is good. The location is under the bridge. Amazing food, 5 stars. Super delicious! I went to a waffle sweets shop located just down the river from Dotonbori Bridge.

It seems like they only specialize in takeout.
There are some chairs in front of the store.
You can also eat there.

Various fruits and plenty of fresh cream
I ordered a sweet wrapped in a waffle.

I heard that they also had delicatessen items such as egg salad, but I thought they only had sweets items.

Two of us went there and received .
If you want to take cute photos, you might want to buy a recommended color ribbon 

Strawberry regular 1,000 yen
Ice topping Vanilla ice cream 150 yen
Sauce Strawberry
Popular color Ribbon yellow 10 yen

Nuts regular 1,000 yen
Ice topping Chocolate ice cream 150 yen
Sauce Hojicha
Other color ribbon Orange 10 yen

Plenty of strawberries cut into easytoeat pieces and fresh cream that isn't too sweet.

The waffle dough was fluffy and had a bit of a castellalike feel to it.

The corn flakes had a nice crunchy texture and although it was quite large, I was able to eat it till the end without getting bored. SUIPARA'' is a waffle specialty store located at Dotonbori River Walk, 2 minutes walk from Osaka Metro Namba Station, diagonally below the Glico signboard.
You can enjoy bubble waffles, which are popular overseas and have a pinky, fairytale look and are arranged in a crepe style.

Bubble waffles are round, chewy eggbased waffles that resemble baby castella and are inspired by a Hong Kong sweet called chicken egg.
After ordering, the waffles are baked,
Cornflakes and fresh cream inside
Layered with strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries, topped with strawberry Pocky and sauce.
Fullbodied fresh cream
The fresh cream is light and full of sweetness. Very satisfying for fresh cream lovers. The waffles are just the right thickness, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.

The waffles come in regular size and half size, and come with a variety of toppings.
You can attach colored ribbons to any size, and the original visuals will enhance the fun of taking photos.

Although it is a takeout specialty store, there are benches outside where you can sit.
With summer in full swing, it's a good idea to stroll along the Dotonbori River while eating Dotonbori waffles.

What a gem of a find, especially on a hot day! The ice cream is quality and the flavors are deep. The pistachio might be the best Ive ever had and the earl grey chocolate is fantastic. Original flavour and nice people inside. I took earl grey chocolate  hazelnut and it was very tasty. Good experience at a homey store, service and atmosphere was great and definitely ideal for a date. Earl grey chocolate could use more Earl grey since the chocolate flavor was overpowering but otherwise no complaints! Lovely ice cream shop!

Had 2 scoops earl grey chocolate and hazelnut. Hazelnut was fantastic but earl grey chocolate mainly just tasted like chocolate.

Service and atmosphere was impeccable, staff were extremely nice and atmosphere was nice and cozy. Great date spot overall! Super fresh and delicious ice cream! The texture is amazing, and make sure to try the pistachio flavor!!

Not really the same taste as in France. Average taste. Staff is nice. Atmosphere is good. I am recommending to order the take away sweet crepes only. I followed the reviews on Google maps and didn't disappoint. The restaurant is just a little bit off the main path but it's surprising to see there is almost no foreigners here. There is a slow flow of Japanese customers always stopping by for a crepe or two and that gives us confidence that the place would be nice.

There is a menu on a board in front of the shop with an English version right at the counter. Our order was done quickly and it tasted delicious. A dainty place with three floors of seating though that is still not enough for each floor only have 6 tables of 2. Oh yes the 1st floor is only for takeaways.
By the way, they do not allow sharing and ask you place one order each if dining in.
We had a set that came with soup, drink, galette and crepe. Sort of a savory and sweet mix.
The ala carte galette of chicken with cream cheese was so good.
A happy place to be on a saturday. Nice crepes with very aromatic house tea Alcyon Bleue. Note The cafe has 1 person 1 order rule. Dropped in for a couple of crepes today. We dined in. Overall the experience was average. The atmosphere of the restaurant is nice but the crepes are nothing special. I saw many reviews saying these are the best crepes ever. They really are not. We had two of the most popular ones and were not wowed by them. On the plus side, it is very cheap.

리뷰: The strawberry shortcake and tart were quite good. They have a dinein area but it was closed off in the evening, not sure if thats a regular thing or not but theres a rooftop garden in the building where you can take the cakes to eat. Great cake shop, there are plenty of options you can choose from. Apart from doing takeaways, they also have dine in option where you can pair your cake with a drink. However due to covid restrictions, there are only a few seats available so there is always a line if you go there in the afternoon. Poor Service ! Wait 30 minutes after tell me afternoon tea finish !  so packed The New York cheesecake was very light. The iced tea was delicious without any harsh taste. There were not many seats, but there were some seats for one person, and there was a good amount of space between each other, so I was able to have a relaxing tea time.

주소: 1-chōme-6-20 Namba, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0076, Japan
리뷰:
What a charming cafe for afternoon tea! At first glance, you might not realize it has seating, as all the chairs and tables are upstairs with only the bakery counter visible downstairs. Intrigued by a sign advertising unique fruit teas, we decided to venture inside. Once there, we discovered a cozy seating area upstairs where we could enjoy various pastries along with our coffee and tea. Fresh from a nail appointment, my friend and I found this cafe to be the perfect spot to conclude our afternoon. The atmosphere was relaxing, the service attentive, and the pastries and teas delicious! Afternoon tea set was delicious, everything is seasonal. Accidentally ordered for one instead of two but there was enough food for a light afternoon meal for two to split. Their custom teas are heavenly and sold separately downstairs. The best part was the Earl grey meringue and their alcyon blue tea. Small restaurant is upstairs, not wheelchair accessible. Seats 18 people max. Pastry shop is downstairs. No English speakers We stopped at the Salon "de the" Alcyone for dessert while visiting Osaka. The decor is quite French themed and looks like a place you'd want to try for a first date. We ordered a parfait and fruit pavlova. They were really good! Seating is on the second floor and the first floor has many cookies, cakes, teas, etc. for sale to take with you. Were in patisserie heaven!!! I had the seasonal Hotacha Montblanc  their local version of Mont Blanc made with local chestnuts. Refer to the pics below. I hope I did justice. It really was exceptional.
Tucked in a quiet corner just a short walk from the busy main Dotonbori artery, its a fantastic respite from the bustling thoroughfare. Highly recommended! A great little cafe above a pastry shop.
Been there 3 times in the last 3 years, they have seasonal special which are something that must try.
Good spot to have a chat and enjoy some fruity teas.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−17−１５ 丸清ビル 3階
리뷰:
So glad we had a chance to stop by this cafe on our trip to Osaka! This is located on the third floor of a side street building and could be easy to miss if you aren't looking for it. The atmosphere is very comfortable and relaxing. Staff speak a little bit of English and are very helpful  kind. The parfaits are a work of art and are delicious. A must stop if you are in the area! Must visit if you are a dessert lover. Their parfaits are exquisite and unique. I had to come twice so good it was, and the price is very reasonable 1516 usd for such a high level of preparation. My favorite was Banana  Chocolate and second best was limited edition  the Marigold. They have tables and bar seating options. The crowd and service was very nice. Open late. On Sunday night around 10pm we had to wait for 57 min to get a table. They specialise in parfaits. Each parfait is uniquely design and crafted. If Im not mistaken, the menu changes each season with the parfaits highlighting the ingredients that are in season. A queue start even before the cafe opens, so do go early! All of the parfaits contain alcohol but there's only a tiny little hint of it which enriches the flavor.  The coffee was unexpectedly tasteful and aromatic.  It goes along perfectly with the parfaits. The parfait was amazing!!!

I never understood the hype of parfait until I got to Japan and this place PERFECTLY encapsulates the artistry of parfaits.

Our last stop on our way to the airport after a 10 day trip in Western Japan. DELICIOUS cheesecake in a glass pot. They also have many other delicacies, like puddings and such. I kept the glass pot as a souvenir from Japan   Morozov's pudding for the first time in a while. My whole family loves it. This time, we made Mont Blanc pudding, pumpkin pudding, bees and honey pudding, and the standard custard pudding, all of which were fall products. It was so delicious. I received it as a souvenir
Special rich pumpkin pudding!

Two people ate the size that could be shared by a large number of people lol

Currently not on sale for a limited time.
For reference, price 1,080 yen

It was a pudding with a rich pumpkin flavor with a hint of cinnamon I hope they release it again this year!

Thank you for the meal! I purchased three types Toro Raw Pudding, Salted Caramel Pudding, and Double Caramel Pudding. All were well received.

리뷰:
Check out haandfood on Instagram for more Japanese food spots and travelling tips!
Best tanghulu Ive ever eaten! The sugar coating was thin and slightly sweet. Not too hard or sticky. Dried sweet potato was yummy as well. The selling lady was very friendly and pleasant. Great experience of quality of food and interaction with good looking locals in the service location. You can enjoy great quality of strawberries while taking to good looking at cute and handsome japanese men preparing your order for takeout  make sure to come in the morning for less crowd and more time to flirt and stare without bothering other customers  Owner was friendly.
Ichigo daifuku strawberry daifuku was good, 350 a piece, which was the average price for daifuku at similar places.
Two types of red bean fillings to choose from, smooth paste or chunky paste.
Packed nicely for takeaways. Strawberries on the stick are fresh.
Strawberries are a little sour, goes very well the sugar coating.
Strawberries are juicy and one bite the juicy will drips down.
Selling small rice balls and its plain and simple. Strawberry daifuku is terrible

주소: 2-chōme-4-3 Minamihonmachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 541-0054, Japan
리뷰: I took two different types of dessert here and I had one directly on the spot. The staff was so friendly and the long stick was very soft and nice. Excited to try another egg tart tomorrow  Back to back visits to this lovely establishment. A plethora of unique egg tart  cheese tart dessert for your consideration. The complimentary ice tea is equally amazing. Absolutely worth of visiting. It's a very cute small tart shop by the street.  They have various kind of flavors and they're all look beautiful and taste great! You can only do takeout and their services was fast and great  My god, the cheesecake was incredible! To top it off, they even gave me a free iced coffee, which paired perfectly with the dessert. On point pastry production and you cant beat the super delicious free ice tea free ice coffee!

이름: ピエールロッティカフェ
주소: 1-chōme-7-1 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0077, Japan
리뷰: Loved the surprise show! Awesome matcha ice cream as well.  A lot of negative reviews but honestly our experience was positive. Paid money, kids got an ice cream and a laugh with the usual great silliness of a Turkish ice cream. Happy kids, not much to complain about. As I can see, many Turkish ice cream places were very happy to let people record photo or video of them, because it helped to advertise their business. But not this place! After i took a photo from a distance but not buying his ice cream, he said a lot of bla bla i think bad words to my face while there were some other foreigners took photos as well, i think he targeted on Asian women because we are weak and not really fight back. I was just landed in Japan so of course there are things that i was still not clear or forgot, if you are not happy of what i did, as a business owner, you should behave more civilized. This is the ONLY bad experience i had in Japan in my trip 2 years ago. If you live and work in Japan, at least learn to be respectful like Japanese, because literally, its the first thing comes in my mind when i think of Japan! Dondurma is in Osaka. Good job. amazing Turkish show  i buy ice cream by playing show very delicious ice cream first time in my life i got real ice cream nanny and i recommend it to everyone

Matcha flavor is very delicious The taste was okay, but it was too pricey. This time we visited "PRESS BUTTER SAND".

Butter sandwich
It has a very buttery flavor and has two layers of buttercream and butter caramel inside.
The cookies outside were crispy and delicious.

Is there a repeat? none? 
It was a dish that could be an option when you want to eat a butter sandwich 

Thank you for the meal uA You can eat freshly baked food

Whenever I come to Osaka, I always
I will buy many for myself .

Crunchy cookies are fragrant
Mixed with the melty contents

I want to buy a different flavor next time.

리뷰:
Great melonpa! They come out fresh. The crust is crispy, sweet and compliments the rest of the bun very well.
The bread was super soft and fluffy. It paired well he the green tea ice cream I had.
Lines can be slightly long but service is quick. Warm melon bread with good ice cream shoved in the middle. What can I say, it was amazing and one of my favorite desserts I have had in Japan.

It's a small little stand on the main drag. That makes it incredibly popular and something you need to walk around a find a spot you can eat it at, as there's so many people in this area. If you love melon pan, stop here while youre in Dotonbori. They have fresh melon pan, with smooth ice cream in the middle. We still think back to how good it would be to have one every now and then. You know its a good spot when you think that way! Reasonable prices too! Was good! We chose the one with the matcha tea. There is also vanilla and strawberry flavors! We had to wait for 10 mins or do but the line goes pretty fast. Overall was a nice dessert and I would have it again! Delicious!! My boyfriend and I got one each and it was the perfect afternoon dessert snack. I got the cherry blossom flavour tasted like cherry, was 800 yen and would 1010 do it again. So tasty
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 3-chōme-3-10 恵東須東 Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0002, Japan
리뷰:
When being a tourist and we see a lineup, the best thing to do is to join it first and ask questions later! We have never gone wrong doing that and this time we lined up for 25 minutes to get some egg shaped waffles on a stick. They are you with me Japanese a little bit different from their traditional life Chinese counterpart.

I realized that I already had this little stall marked as a viral dessert place and I can see why! These were delicious! They were fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside and mildly sweet but not too much salt! The staff were super friendly! They were a reasonable price for a long skewer. The staff is really kind and helpful, even with foreigners. Nice flavor and texture . The food is good, and the staff are pleasant. I would recommend this shop to every tourist. Great customer service! Will definitely come back next time Im in Osaka. For those who love eggs cake you can have it a go in a very baby cute shape, expect some queues

Very delicious ice cream, had to come back to have more after the first time before we left Osaka Absolutely amazing soft serve. Just great, no matter what flavour you get. Great place to try out for those into deserts. Seats are very limited, but still worth making the journey just to get them and have them while standing out in the middle of the cold. Ice cream is good for a photo but doesn't taste very good. It's not creamy, no richness, and almost like an Italian ice. 600Y is not worth it at all Icy and refreshing soft serve! If you prefer lighter and icier soft serve as opposed to the creamy and dense ice cream, consider this place! It's 420yen for their basic soft serve, and you can top it up with brown sugar syrup for another 50yen.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−１ グランフロント大阪うめきた広場 B1F
리뷰:
I had a gelato cup with pistachio, chocolate chip, and chestnut tiramis for 1000. I expected something of high quality, but I just think that the price is typical for that kind of area, Umeda. It is usually more expensive than other areas. I went there before 9 p.m., and I was lucky to get a gelato the staff was in a hurry to close the shop . So, at 845 pm, it was the last order, and 10 people couldn't get it. I felt that they could have served them in a few minutes... 10000 Don't you need money? Lol. If you're looking for highquality gelato, I suggest trying somewhere else. Superbly delicious gelato, delicate flavors and not overly sweet. I tried the Gorgonzola. It had a mild but distinct Gorgonzola flavor Its located right on the basement a little hard to fine but you have to listen to that water fountain and thats where the store is. The flavor of the ice cream was just OK. The branding on this store triggers me. First of all, why bar? Because you serve coffee?
And your subtitle? They are ristorante made gelato. We made them in the same way as cuisine?

You used a word generator to create this dum text? Or hired a child to do your work?

Enough about branding. Ice was decent, Mediocre, but small portions and pricey. The gelato here is nice and the have an outdoor seating area right next to a fountain which is really peaceful.

리뷰:
Lured inside seeing apple pie on a display and bought their number 1 cake as advertised. To our surprise, inside there was a sweet potato filling instead. Taste is fair, yet I was craving for a juicy baked apple with cinnamon to be honest. Ive never had a sweet potato apple pie before so thats what I got. Cant say Im a huge fan of the combination because it feels heavier in the stomachthe pie is so dense. The texture is different too. Wonderful test Post only gourmet food you want to repeat 

Sweet potato 650 yen
Takeout


My favorite store for a long time! ! 
My dad used to buy this for his sweet potato loving daughters 

I went for the chestnut tart this time, but I knew the sweet potato was delicious too, so I bought it! ! !

Chestnut tart is available for a limited time only
I really liked the rich flavor of Shibukawa chestnuts! ! !
The sweetness is modest and it's really rich! All I can say is...! 
There are a lot of chestnuts on top, and there's even gold leaf on it, giving it a luxurious feel... This cake is made with ripe roasted sweet potatoes and is irresistible for sweet potato and chestnut lovers

I have never met a sweet potato that is better than this one! ! !
It has two layers, and the bottom is just the roasted sweet potato itself! The whole skin is attached! The skin of a roasted sweet potato is also delicious, and it's great to be able to eat it as is! 
The top is a sweet potato with a sticky and warm baked potato flavor! This combination is the best! ! The best part is that they use roasted sweet potatoes as they are! ! 

I don't have a chance to go to Osaka Station anymore, so I'm sad that I don't have many opportunities to buy them
I will definitely buy it again if I have the chance! By the way, Daigakuimo is also delicious in the past! ! ! ! JYP702 tax included Sweet Potato Custard Tart
Pass by the sweet potato dessert shop on your way to Yaban Shrine
Sweet potatoes with skin are super sweet  there is a thin candied pound cake sandwiched with pudding custard like the pudding custard sold by Taiwanese family  there is a layer of syrup on the top
The sweet potatoes are sweet and delicious, very big
The entrance is cold

Summary Sweet potatoes are the best eaten alone

주소: 3-chōme-6-2 Tanaka, Minato Ward, Osaka, 552-0005, Japan
리뷰:
I don't think it's an exaggeration to say that it is Minato Ward's representative sweets store.
It is famous for having received numerous interviews.
And not only famous,
You can enjoy it in a unique way, and
It's a good restaurant with delicious food.
I wonder if there is a normal whole cake...
I've never seen it before, but
The whole cake here is
Break the sweet meringue into crisp pieces,
Eat it with whole cake cream on top.
This creates an indescribable sense of fun and deliciousness.
We also have a variety of baked goods,
I haven't bought it yet.
I want to eat it lol I've known about it for a while, but this time I went by car for the first time. It's a wide back road, so I parked a little in front of the store before entering. A variety of products are lined up in a stylish store with a black theme. Since I came all the way, I bought the most expensive item, Summer Night Matcha Tiramisu Ameya''. The outside is coated with chocolate, and the inside is cream, matcha, and citrus jelly, making it the perfect summer sweet, but at 1,188 yen, it's quite expensive. There are many products that are perfect as souvenirs, such as cheesecakes and roll cakes, so if you're interested, it's a good idea to stop by once. Apparently it's made by a famous pastry chef.
We ate cakes and sampled roll cakes.
To be honest, the roll cake might be the best deal in terms of price and value.
I wonder if there are other places where the cake really stood out.
Cash payment confirmation
PayPay payment confirmation
Maybe there are chairs outside?
Can I use a wheelchair? I had some business nearby and stopped by for the first time.
It's a cake shop tucked away in a quiet residential area, and it blends in with the surrounding houses, so if you're not conscious of it, you'll miss it.

Brightly colored and gorgeous cakes were displayed in the showcase, and baked goods were displayed in a chic and calm booth.
Light and shadow, brightness and darkness, black and white of exterior and interior, hardness and softness.
It's a stylish shop with a modern design and lots of colors.

I wanted to try it all, but I was worried about it.

Shortcake
Concentrated roll cake
Smoked cheesecake half

Choose from 3 types.
The shortcake comes in a transparent square container, and the strawberry slices are bright and glossy.
It was covered in powdered sugar and decorated with cute strawberries, and it was the first time I had ever seen a strawberry decoration where perishable strawberries were cut out.

I thought the transparent containers were well thought out, not only for their appearance, but also because they made it easy for the store staff to pack, they were easy to eat anywhere, and they could be reused.

It was a cake with plenty of cream and strawberries, with sweet and sour strawberries, fresh cream with a light and elegant taste, and a little bit of fluffy sponge.

Personally, I would have liked the cream to be a little richer, or have a lingering taste and aroma, but they also provide a spoon if you wish so that you can eat it immediately after purchase.
I think it would be easy to use as a souvenir or gift 

The concentrated roll cake has a strong and rich egg flavor, is fluffy, but also elastic, with a fine texture, a moist sponge, a smooth custard, and a concentrated raspberry filling, or rather a hard jam. Even though I don't like framboise, it had a nice flavor and was easy to eat.
I felt like the cream was a little off compared to the sponge and framboise, but it was a delicious roll cake

Smoked cheesecake is glutenfree, and as the name suggests, it's smoked with rosemary, so a sharp, rich smoky aroma passes through your nose, and the richness of the cheese is lightened, making it a refreshing cake. I think you will either like it or not, depending on your preference for smoked foods and cheese, but it's a mature taste that can be enjoyed as a snack with wine 

As for the price, due to the recent price hikes, I feel it's a little higher than the cake prices I'm used to, but if you register as a member free, you'll get a 10 discount on all items, so it's a good deal. .
There are also benefits such as being able to buy seasonal memberonly cakes, birthday benefits, and smoother preordering.

There is no parking lot, so if you are driving, we recommend that you park nearby or pull up to the park side on the road in front of the store and purchase quickly.
Apparently they are also sold online.

In addition to soba, I have recently become allergic to rice, and have recently started to suspect that I might also be allergic to wheat. Now that I'm starting to reduce my intake, I'm glad I had a cake with less wheat.
The clerk was also kind, polite, and friendly. As a chef who honed his skills as a restaurant pastry chef, there were a number of playful sweets lined up in the showcase, and I got excited and bought 5 fresh cakes and a zerogravity castella.
I was impressed not only by its bright appearance, but also by the excellent balance of texture and taste.
This is a shop that does a great job and is worth the trip.

리뷰:
A great cake shop around Kitahama Station. They have the take out on the first floor, and the restaurant on the second floor. The restaurant is bigger than I expected. They offer various type of cakes.

I ordered 3 different types of cakes strawberry short cake, roll cake, green tea pudding. The strawberry cake was refreshing and not too sweet, the roll cake was soft and not dry at all, and the green tea pudding had a balance elements and toppings. I also ordered their matcha and ice coffee each person has to order one drink. In total, I spent 3,333.

Highly recommend to relax and have tea time while eating delicious cakes. A nice cozy place to have high tea.Although it was very busy, the service was quick and friendly. We were very impressed with the delicious flavors Amazing patisserie! The pastries on sale were both eye candy and delicious. Queuing to eat at the cafe on the second floor takes patience as the queue is long. Go to the front of the queue to get a number from the ticket machine and wait. But it is well worth it  This is a decent dessert store. Foreigner friendly, describe all the items properly. I went there for cake breakfast as I heard the high tea session will have long queue. Staff will show us a selection of cake display to choose from which is quite fancy, and I picked a black bean chestnut cake with organic coffee.

주소: 3-chōme-2-28 Namba, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0076, Japan
리뷰:
Whether you are in a rush, hungry or not, we recommend you to come here before leaving Osaka.

Very different from the classic NY cheese cake or the classic cheese cake from the Basque Country, the Japanese fluffy cheese cake will surprise you with their texture and flavor. It tastes more like egg and milk than cheese. It is not as sweet as the other classic cheese cakes. It is not served with anything else, which helps you eat more of it.

Fast line and the option to pay by card or with cash. Handy that they offer you the option to buy a plastic spoon, knife or fork. The best thing for the shop is started by how they separate the queue line. There is a line for just baked longer but quite fast and ready shorter.

The cheese is delicious and a must try while you are around the Namba area.

The also have a seating table in the second floor but need to reserve days before.

The less point is, the cake is best eaten while still hot, but it's only take away because the second floor is limited table and you need to find another place to eat. Fluffy jiggly Japanese cheesecake that melts in your mouth when you eat it fresh from the oven.  Theres always a queue but it moves quickly, and the baking is quite fast.  Best lightweight fluffy cheesecake we have tasted, and the raisins at the bottom give a flavourful touch.  So glad that we went looking for it!  We also managed to buy a second time on our day of departure, to bring home to family  Would be great if they have an outlet at the airport. Love how well they managed the queue! They separated the line based on Just Baked or Baked a few hours or so ago, so you get to choose the level of freshness. The staff was efficient so even though there was a considerable crowd, we got our cake in no time.

We got the fresh one and loved it! The cake was soft and had enough sweetness, but not too overbearing. But in terms of enjoyment, it was just okay because there was just one kind of taste throughout so you might get bored by the second slice. It was alright to try but wasn't my fave cheesecake. Awesome experience getting a got fresh japanese cheesecake right from the oven. Even though there is a line, it moves super fast, very efficient.  You can also get the cake that was made 2h before no line for that. It was great to see how they are being made also!
There is one shop at the airport as well where we headed right after, but this main  branch  was still worth the visit  Keep it up! Bravo!

주소: Japan, 〒542-0086 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Nishishinsaibashi, 2-chōme−10−３２ TRN心斎橋 B１F
리뷰:
Was there on a Tuesday around 4.45pm. There were about 3 groups of customers queueing. We were being seated in about 10 minutes, it was the waiting of our food order that was quite long. Food was being served about 15  20 minutes after we were seated.

Ordered the Classic Happy Pancake and Pancake with Banana  Chocolate Sauce. The pancake is really spongy, soft and smooth. Impressive by the high quality of the pancake that it makes the wait worthwhile. Hands down the best pancake I've had so far! Wanted to try the original because that's what mostly people recommend but the hubs wanted chocolate and wow, IT WAS MINDBLOWING!

The dark choco and granola was a perfect blend. We requested the staff to split out the sauce , cream and topping so that we can taste the original pancake without anything on. Staff was very friendly and helpful too.

They have free water station too , with and without lemon.

Will definitely visit again! The half hour wait to get inside, was the maximum amount of time we were willing to spend waiting to enter a place  They seated us at the big table at the entrance next to other couples and families, and took our orders some happy pancakes, some pancakes with cheese mousse and berry sauce, and some shakes. The fluffiness of the pancakes is indeed delicious. The service was quick and friendly. You can also see the chefs preparing the pancakes in "the kitchen" behind glass panels. We really enjoyed it. Definitely worth the wait and hype The pancakes are so fluffy and delicious. You get a lot of toppings and whipcream on your pancakes so they are very filling !! The staff is very sweet and understands very good English. There will be a wait of 40 minutes and you need to get a ticket first! The most delicious, fluffy, light pancake I have ever eaten, with the Tiramisu option. We also had a savoury option with cheese omelette, also good. There is usually a queue so we arrived just before opening at 11 and were 12th in the queue so we're inside for first orders. The entrance is below ground level, down stairs so not obvious if walking past. There is a ticket machine on left of entrance to get a slip with a number for queuing.
Service was very polite and efficient. Nice seeing the spotless kitchen and how the pancakes are made.

리뷰:
At around 5 minutes before noon, I happened to pass by and see that a line had formed in front of this store before open.  Curious as I was, I ended up getting a cheesecake and a pudding.  The cheesecake was good but the pudding was the best.  Get the pudding! For Halloween

After returning from Kitashinchi lunch, my sister and I stopped by to buy some food.
I don't have time to eat cake

I went there with the intention of buying custard and chocolate.

That. . . The usual custard and chocolate versions are missing. .

Or rather, it was changed to custard and Halloween chocolate.
Batshaped chocolate
Red particles. .

red? What does that mean?

The price was also higher than usual.

I am grateful that my sister gave me a present.
I received it, but

Red grains, crunchy texture

The chocolate bat was also delicious.

The box was cute and Halloweenthemed. The whale Marine cake is too cute. By noon, there were only two left. There are many other cute cakes besides Marinkun. You can eat in at the seats in the back. Since it's a onedrink system, I ordered a mixed juice and was surprised to find that it was chewy. For parking, use a nearby coin parking lot. Poire's petit choux, which I have been buying for years.
There are two Poire stores in Kitashinchi, and the other one is a baked confectionery store.
Great as a souvenir or for home use, it's an affordable item that's sure to please
The eatin space inside the store is also popular.
The cakes are beautiful and delicious, but I really like the petit choux here 
The choux pastry is very soft and fluffy
The cream is small but heavy.
Not too sweet, you can eat as many as you want
There are also cream puffs mixed with chocolate and topped with fruit. naaami.737

주소: Japan, 〒542-0081 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Minamisenba, 1-chōme−17−８ ＴＥＲＲＡＣＥ ＭＩＮＡＭＩＳＥＮＢＡ 1階
리뷰:
I was craving some dessert after having late dinner. I spotted the place around an hour before closing and the owners were really nice. Got the Hozenji night parfait. It had great matcha chiffon and ice cream. For matcha lovers, would recommend!

The nice music is also a plus! Im not local and Im new to this area of Osaka, near Tanimachi and I would like to buy a surprise cake for my wife. Good thing that the owner is very responsive via google maps chat, I sent him my location and we were able to transact via google translate even without a local number. Delivered very fast and quality birthday cake. Very elegant and the owner is very friendly and courteous. If you're looking for some delicious dessert in Osaka, I would highly recommend BooBoo Pink! My partner and I stopped by late on a Friday evening at 9 pm because we were craving some cake and couldn't have been happier with the result!

We got the cake set, which includes a slice of cake and a beverage! We chose the Early Grey flavored chiffon cake and paid an extra 100 yen to get a refreshing iced Hojicha tea! The cake was decadent but light and just slightly sweet, pairing perfectly with the tea.

We also got the PortofinoTiramisu, which is a Tiramisu shaved ice dessert! The ice was perfectly shaved and melted on the tongue. The Premium cocoa powder was perfect, being just sweet enough! Hidden underneath the dessert was some coffee jelly that was an awesome surprise and definitely completed the entire dish.

We were also lucky enough to be given a free sample of another one of their delicious chiffon cakes.

The total came out to about 20 USD, or about 3100 yen. Trust me when I say it's worth checking out Boo Boo Pink! I went to BooBooPink late at night, near closing, hoping to see whether I could get a last minute cake for my father's birthday. I was thoroughly surprised to hear that they were able to make me a cake if I waited a bit, and I was touched by the fact they were able to make something special even though it was so late!

The cake was absolutely delicious, not too sweet, and the cream was fresh as ever it was made right before my eyes!. The price was reasonable as well. I was offered also some water and food as I waited. Everyone there was so incredibly friendly and kind to me. I want to thank BooBooPink again for making my father's birthday memorable for both him and myself! I don't write reviews ever, but I had to for this place. We had a great cake and tea at BooBoo Pink! The staff were lovely and we will return.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 1-chōme−12, 大阪駅前ダイヤモンド地下街 2号 G112 区画
리뷰:
Great ice cream, but you can't be selling a commodity that starts melting and dripping within seconds without offering a place to eat it. There are no tables or anything on the inside. We went outside and sat on the stairs nearby but were soon chased off by security staff. The other customers were standing in throngs outside the shop in the underground arcade. The location is just wrong, if it had been placed closer to the Umekita Plaza things would have been so much better. Also the prices for their pick and mix chocolates are outlandish. 150 yen for one miniature piece of cremino?? Is it in Rome's price range? I felt it was expensive Setsuko, this is not uni! Osaka! 

Osaka's physical decline
As you go underground
The Italian wind suddenly begins to blow
What is that stylish exterior that you can see ahead of the wind?
Yes, this is Venkidia Mall Osaka store.
It looks great from the outside and looks like girls will be attracted to it.

Because it's a chocolate shop
Of course we also sell chocolate.
It melts in your mouth as smooth as silk.
The price of the assortment is a bit steep though.
Single item at an affordable price
It's delicious so we recommend this too! 
However, the most popular one is that one.
Gelato

Available in 3 sizes
Toppings and customization
There are various things
Seriously, the name is a spell level from a certain magic school.
I don't remember
The store staff will kindly tell you
Find your best custom!
My favorite is whipped cream

Types of gelato
There are so many names I've never heard of.
You'll be lost to the brink
But that's part of the fun of being a gelato shop.
No matter which one you choose, it's sure to be rich.

After receiving the gelato
At the bright table in the back
Let's take a photo
This is the sequence of events

By the time I leave the store
I think I can get into a certain magic school.

Next time, I want to make a chocolate convex debut. A sticky and delicious gelato shop 
If you go towards Dia Mall from the central exit of Osaka Station, you can find the store right away 

What I ordered was
"Piccolo 2 types" Chocolate beer and raspberry!
Both were super delicious 

There are only two desks for eatin, so...
I want it to increase  Authentic highend chocolate shop
Chocolate is sold by weight, and the shop's chocolate is also used in the ice cream.
As it is a highclass item, the price per item is high, but this quality is certainly worth it.
Taste4.5 Price1.5 Atmosphere3.5
Total 3.13

Gelato piccolo cone 650 yen 4.0
Chocolate is expensive, but this one is affordable. The chocolate gelato is rich because they use chocolate from the shop.
Why not buy a sample and sample the taste of chocolate?

주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−１ グランフロント大阪 1F うめきた広場
리뷰:
Finally get to try this famous Millefeuille near Osaka station. Crispy and sweet. It didn't disappoint. Went around 1230pm, short queue and fast service. Don't miss this spot if you are around Osaka Station. Musttry Millefeuille near Osaka Station! This popular pastry shop be prepared to wait! features a signature Custard Cream  Strawberries Millefeuille. It's a delightful dessert  a light strawberry millefeuille with their homemade custard cream, all nestled in a delicious and wellbaked savory almond pie crust.

The wait is even more exciting because you can watch their skilled staff freshly prepare each millefeuille right in front of you, adding to the anticipation before you dig into this delicious treat I love the flavours and crisp of the pastry. The crust is thin. Even my elderly mom enjoyed it. We tried both savoury and sweet. Perfect for a bite I recently ordered the seasonal melon pie and was thoroughly impressed. The pie was crispy and caramelized to perfection, creating a delightful texture. The melon was fresh and sweet, perfectly complementing the pie crust.

The service staff was prompt and efficient with the takeout order. The pie was prepared in minutes, and there was no queue, making the experience smooth and convenient. This was supposed to be a longlineup dessert restaurant but I was very lucky that I didn't have to wait on the day I visited the place.  Scrumptious dessert and special mix of  ingredients make this dessert place worth visiting.

주소: 2-chōme-8-93 Nanbanaka, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0011, Japan
리뷰:
A nice little ice cream shop that has a good selection of flavours and a small inside seating area where you can sometimes watch the ice cream being made.

The pistachio and chocolate hazelnut ice creams are my favourites but the black cherry sherbet was also nice and refreshing.

The quality and serving sizes are great, especially for the price. Ice cream is unexpectedly good and tasty
Excellent staff service and the portion for tasting is quite generous too
Indoor dining area is also quite spacious
Very close to Namba station
It usually closes on Wed and some occasional days though Recommendation to first time foodies
Pistachio

My personal fav
Avocado, Mont Blanc

It was so good that I had 2 cups!

the first cup standard avocado  yogurt, standard pistachio, seasonal mont Blanc  newly picked tea.

The second cup seasonal jasmine tea with milk, seasonal bing cherry sherbet and standard mont blanc again.

In order of my liking


Avocado
100 Not sweet
Very rich very thick


Mont Blanc
95 not sweet
The chestnut flavor is rich


Jasmine tea
Not sweet 


Pistachio
Pistachio is their  most recommended item. They use the rarest pistachio that is only harvested every other year for the strongest flavor.
The aroma of pistachio is indeed very strong and aromatic. However, too sweet to my liking. But I dont like anything sweet so its just me. I would recommend pistachio to everyone who comes here the first time. It is a memorable taste.

Note
 The shop is quite small. Only 8 seats.
 early morninglunch time less crowded
 staff does not speak English.

They only have 3 standard flavors
Pistachio, chocolate hazelnuts, avocado  yogurt

All the other flavors
are seasonal.
they change it every 3 months. Arrived quite late when they were closing the store but they still welcomed customers!
It would be regretting if I didnt try their ice cream! Its best of the best ice cream for my entire trip to Osaka.
Didnt plan and expect, just passing by after having ramen in a shop nearby.
The taste of Sake strawberry is amazing, matcha is always as good as it should be.
Definitely will come back for next trip to Osaka. It doesn't come cheap but it's definitely very tasty! As others have mentioned, the pistachio is great and the mango is perfect to refresh yourself in those hot summer months!

주소: Japan, 〒540-0021 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Ōtedōri, 2-chōme−2−９ サンマンション大手前 1F
리뷰:
Stumbled upon this cafe while looking for a place to have a morning drink before exploring Osaka Castle.  A lovely couple runs this little cafe and they are very nice and friendly.  The aroma from their freshly made baked goods fills the cafe and it smells amazing. My wife enjoyed her cup of americano coffee so much that she ordered a second cup right away. I very much enjoyed my glass of white grape juice which was new to me.

We commented to the owners that we liked the artwork on the walls and found out they were made by their children. They shared a video with us of their daughter painting one of the pictures that we loved.

We purchased a couple of handmade coasters to remember our visit to Tawanico coffee. We would visit this cafe again next time we are in Osaka. Our friend from Osaka invited us over from New Zealand and recommended this place. They have the best sweets and their Tawanico Blend coffee is great for everyone even for new coffee drinkers. If you want to relax or practise your Japanese then this is the place to to  Went searching for Tawanoa but found Tawanico instead. They are sister cafes. Tawanico has awesome cakes and very aromatic coffee. Great for a pit stop to have sweets  coffee before continuing. Cute coffee shop. Relaxing music. And most importantly, great coffee. Stop off here on the way to Osaka Castle! Yum! We stopped in for coffee and cake while visiting Osaka. The cakes were sensational! Almost too beautiful to eat but too delicious not to. Highly recommend.

리뷰: Best Belgian waffles. The food and coffee are great. Order one of everything if you can. We came here for breakfast one morning and returned the next day since it was so good. There are many choices for chocolate milk. The kids and adults loved it here. This place is incredible! Super authentic Belgian waffles. The owner is incredibly kind and super quick to serve you! If youre in Osaka, you MUST visit this place. The waffles are super soft and the freshly squeezed apple juice is INCREDIBLE. You must order the apple juice if you visit The waffles were really good. It was light, crispy and fluffy. And it goes so well with banana and chocolate. The chocolate milk seemed recommended on their online menu so we gave it a try. I was impressed they had various percentage of cocoa content. I myself like a dark bitter chocolate bite so I ordered one with 80 cocoa. It was very good. The owner is very friendly and they have doggies near the counter and they too are super friendly! The waffles are crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside, and taste great with an ice cream pairing. The owner is very friendly and welcoming, and there are also 2 well behaved pets near the counter. Ambience was very pleasing and comfortable, a great place to hang out with family and friends. Delicious delicious waffle, hot and crunchy with a lovely soft middle. Served fresh the strawberries on top were so good on their own but even better on top of a waffle

주소: 1f, 大手三谷ビル １丁目-２-1 大手通 中央区 大阪市 大阪府 540-0021, Japan
리뷰: Very magical place, small, cozy and filled with love. The muffins are delicious and so is their caramel latte. You can tell this is the owners passion. Cute little bakery. Staff was very nice and used translate app to ask if she could warm up the muffins. The coffee was freshly prepared for us. Excellent place for a powerup on the way to Osaka Castle. Culmal is a lovely little muffin shop located near Tenmabashi Station exit 4. They have 2 types of muffins sweet or savory that come in 16 flavors. There is also a small cafe area with a few seats for eating in. Recommend the ice latte with muffins although the tiramisu looks really good too. Will come again. Laidback place that serves really delicious muffins and coffee. It's some distance away from Osaka castle but it's worth the walk. I ordered the fermented butter muffin, sweet, soft, moist and tasty!

Bakery is good. Ice cream is too small. Shaved ice is huge. This place is a 8mins walk from Tenma Station and it's worth the walk! The shaved ice Kakigori is substantially filled with ingredients and the ice is of very good quality that did not melt quickly even though it's so warm.

There's indoor and outdoor seating and you can request for an English menu. Though take note that the English menu only have the basic Kakigori flavours without their food and drinks items.

I will suggest that you look at the wall for "Seasonal speciality" flavours. Even if you don't read Japanese, you can understand their cute and beautiful drawings.

We had the Mango Kakigori at 1000 and it's worth every yen.

Awesome place and I will highly recommend a visit!!!! I would say this is the best kakigori Ive had so far I had the peach. Peach chunks were generous, and was a great refresher in the summer heat.

My companion did not like the chocolate one very much though. I really recommend this place for kakigori!
It was a bit tricky to find this place since google maps doesnt work optimally in Japan. However, when we finally found it, we loved it at first sight! It ls a really cozy place where you have to take off your shoes if you want to sit on the mats.

They have a menu with pictures but also seasonal specials which are promoted with handdrawn posters. We found the small already quite big, but to was just too tasty that we ordered one more! And we also tried some of the takiyaki and the hojicha tea 

Our favorite is the mango kakigori  Delightful shop with indoor and outdoor seating. They have both savory and sweet items. Had a cosy cup of coffee and a stellar anmitsu

주소: 2F, 1-chōme-2-14 Kitahorie, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0014, Japan
리뷰:
Popped in here for lunch, although there wasnt a lunch set available, not sure if that is normal. Anyway I had a hummus pita and a kebab, food was very tasty and they were very generous with the hummus portion, although it was served in a wrap rather than a pita. Still, Im not picky so it was fine.
The kebab was very nice and the owner gave me some extra spice too.
Nice little place with friendly staff, cant complain!
A little on the expensive side is all, but fairly standard for Japanese prices!
Will definitely come back and try some of the other options! The place is nice, has a varied menu with reasonable prices. The location is quite convenient and easy to reach. We enjoyed our Persian and middle eastern food here very much in Osaka. I am always a fan of Persian food and this restaurant did not disappoint at the heart of Osaka !
The owner was great at greeting us and making sure we are served great food !
Food is amazing, simple, and tasty
We brought our Japanese friends here and they really enjoyed it as well. Highly recommended if you wanna try Persian food!
Went there for lunch on Saturday.

The staff was very kind.
He speaks both English and Japanese.
And the service was fast too.

It was my first time trying Persian cuisine and everything was DELICIOUS!! This is the best and most delicious food I've ever eaten in japan.
The prawns rice was something else, so tasty.
The kabab was perfectly seasoned and cooked.
Too bad this is my last night in Osaka and I've just known this place.

주소: 2F, カサドマートビル ２丁目-９-36 西心斎橋 中央区 大阪市 大阪府 542-0086, Japan
리뷰:
The staff were very friendly and the food was delicious, thank you very much for a lovely meal

The whole lunch menu is Vegan so it's great for anyone that wants to try

It's on the second floor, to get in go straight through to the lift where the sign is on the street and go to the second floor2F. The lift doors open straight up into the food place An unassuming place for it's food, but it was amazing! Delicious ramen that I got, i would recommend to those looking for a humble but tasty vegan dish in a slightly unexpected atmosphere. Would come again and recommend to anyone in the future for it's food, the drinks were also decent Very friendly  nice staffs here. Enjoyed their company as well! The drinks were affordable and strong enough. Especially the Fireball shot! Will patronize again next time when we are back to Osaka  Fire Cafe in Osaka is an absolute gem, and as an American rapper who loves to hit the nightlife, I can't recommend it enough!

From the moment you step inside, the vibrant atmosphere hits you like a bass drop. The decor is on point, blending modern aesthetics with a cozy vibe that makes you feel right at home. The staff? Super friendly and always ready to mix up a killer cocktail or recommend the best dishes on the menu.

If you're into live music, you might just catch a local artist performing, adding to the already electric ambiance.

Whether you're out with friends or looking for a chill spot to unwind, Fire Cafe delivers a fivestar experience that keeps you coming back for more. If you're in Osaka, make sure to swing by and soak in the good vibes! One the best Ramens I have ever had. Wow absolutely incredible. Staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming had an amazing experience. I highly recommend you visit this place!

I wanted to come back in person but I didnt have time but I would also like to apologise for being an asshole last night please forgive me Mina and Simone 

Mo from last night Shaks friend x

주소: 11-11-28 Sennichimae, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0074, Japan
리뷰:
My family and I had a great time with the comfort food by the restaurant.  The fried rice and the noodles were delicious but a bit on the salty side. You can request to have less salt for a healthier choice.  Strongly recommended for a dinning spot in Osaka.  Awesome restaurant! Went twice, once in Tokyo and once in Osaka, and loved both of them! Super affordable and great good. We really did eat a lot and it wasnt more than 35. Id definitely recommend! A place with chill vibes and staff who treat you like a Osaka King, this is it! Tourist can even scan a QR code for an English menu techsavvy dining! 

I wanted to try a bit of everything... Ended up there's this "set menu" of their noodle, fried rice and the fried dumpling called Gyoza FlavourExplosion!  The gyoza? Packed with so much flavor, and follow my picture on how to let it soak with maximum vinegar for maximum flavour bathe it in a spoon tub.  And the fried rice? Finish it with the dumpling before the noodle 

And remember to do a Google review to try a free soft drink or Ice cream! 

Being a king is lonely.... So if you become a line friend with them, they will treat you to a coupon, free gyoza right nowwww or the next time without any purchase!! Just be careful not to accidentally press "use coupon", or your king won't honour it. Now to enjoy my free machaaaaa hahahaha. I was just out and about in Namba looking for good, cheap food.
Then I discovered this place near the Kuromon market.
The food was quite good and the staff very friendly.
If you want to eat for less than 12, take a look. Very chill vibes. Staff who are very kind. With the option to have a English menu by scanning a  QR code! We got one of their ramen sets! Very delicious! Their gyoza's had a lot of flavour and so did there fried rice. But for us we really enjoyed the ramen the most it has such a delicious flavour!

주소: 1-chōme-15-24 Higashishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0083, Japan
리뷰:
Would not recommend. Was looking forward to this place but it was just junk food they used frozen vegetables and potatoes.. not fresh at all. You order and pay when you go in and then you have to go downstairs and collect your food  fast food vibes and tasting. You can get a drink and help yourself to the alcohol but its very cheap and two drinks made me feel terrible the next day. The place is really cool and quirky and has potential but the food is just veggie vegan junk food. I don't have any dietary restrictions but I ate here and their okonomiyaki is really good! It tastes healthy since it doesn't use flour.

The downside is the really long wait to get in. I came here Friday at dinner time and it took me an hour to wait in a long line outside. You can go in early and buy some drinks while you wait.

After you are called in, you order at the front desk and then find your seat anywhere in the building. The owner will call your number via the intercom when your food is ready.

It is actually amazing that one woman runs the whole thing! This is an incredible place! This restaurant  has a great atmosphere and amazingly delicious food. The owner of the establishment is a very friendly person, who runs the place by herself alone! We were impressed by her hard work! Despite waiting in line, we enjoyed our visit, this place has a super positive vibe and various vegan and vegetarian options, highly recommended! I had this place on my itinerary since planning our trip as it caters for Vegetarians however the experience was so much better than I expected.
The restaurant is ran by one lady called Shiho, she takes the orders and makes everything.

We ordered two vegetarian medium Okonomiyakis and one vegetable yakisoba. For a medium the Okonomiyaki was massive, it was super tasty and when you order you can choose 5 vegetables you want in it and if you want cheese, vegan cheese or none.
Taking the order was really quick and easy.

As OKO opened up at 6 we got there 40 minutes early to queue, other people didn't start queuing until 5.30, as this is ran by one person then there will be a wait for food the longer in the queue you are.
We were first and we only had to wait maybe 20 minutes at most for our food, probably less.

Shiho speaks through a microphone and will call your number to go and collect the food from the bottom floor. You can also talk to Shiho through the microphone as well, we said that we were on our way to collect the food.

Each table you clean yourself, there are wipes in packages on the side and each table has plastic over it.
It was very clean when we sat down and we made sure to keep it that way.

It you are visiting please remember to tidy up after yourselves and be patient if you are waiting to be served.

A great experience and was nice and filling to! Incredible Okonomiyaki place run by Shiho alone. Props to her she does everything from taking orders to cooking. The menu is vegetarian and vegan friendly, and you can choose how you want it made along with a few other dishes. The place has several floors so find a seat and enjoy. The serving was huge! I wasn't expecting so much for a medium size. It was absolutely delicious and happy I got to try this dish as a vegetarian. You can also make your mark by writing on the walls. You can pay with card here but I believe the alcohol which is on tap needs to be paid in cash and is 200 Yen per glass.

주소: 14-13 Nanbasennichimae, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0075, Japan
리뷰:
The food here is delicious, one of the most tender yet crispy chicken katau i have ever eaten. And the curry ramen is also really unique and tasty, noodles cooked to perfection. The shop is small and u have to order on the vending machine before you sit down at the counter seats. Get to watch tbe chef at work  The best Japanese curry in my life
Both Cook and server were super friendly and nice. Their kitchen is organized and you can see how they cook all kinds of dishes  definitely recommend and worth the wait!
Server was super cute  Good curry.
I got lucky and got in before a queue formed behind me.
I went for a very late lunchearly dinner at 430pm.

Extremely affordable, great value, friendly staff.
You order on the touch screen by the entrance and pay up front.
I ordered extra pork and a tea.
Dinerstyle, limited seats so it may be difficult for larger groupsthe group of 4 after me had to split up 2 and 2 to get seats Always a queue for this curry joint. Recently they have a new queuing system where you order, and get a queue number. I think it's a fanatic idea.
Been there a few times and the food is always consistent in taste and quality.
Fast and friendly service.
Always feel welcome when eating here. Amazing curry!!!the spice level on the curry was perfect. There is limited seating. So when you get here you have to go inside and order on the machine what you want. After you order what you want on the machine it will print out a paper and you will wait until you are called. Well, this was the situation when we went because it was busy. But the wait is worth it, it goes by fast.

주소: 1-chōme-4-16 Dōtonbori, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0071, Japan
리뷰:
This is a benchmark of how a good ramen should taste. The food was good, but the queue was terrible. Prepare to wait for one hour late at night. It was so long that I had to go there for breakfast to satisfy my cravings.

Try ordering rice and eat with the soup. Great experience! The wait was very hot and long BUT I do think its worth it if youve never been. The ramen booths are so cool. You get a direct water line. And you dont have to talk to anyone. Also the food is very cheap and delicious. Fun experience, you order via vendo machine, sit alone at an empty booth and someone will open the window in front of you to serve your ramen. You cant stay too long since a lot of people in queue arw waiting for you to finish. Patience is a must since the queue is always long! Ichiran Ramen is so famous that no introduction needed. We decide to try one here since we at Japan. One word to describe, great.
We came around late night 11pm and actually manage to get in around 10 minutes. Theres an order sheet that you have to choose your preference of the ramen broth, noodles texture and condiments. I choose noodle with firm texture and rich broth and its perfect for my need. The broth is so good that Im actually finished it.
The concept is also special with you sit on your own cubicle and the ramen will served to you in front of the cubicle like a fast food concept. Quite a great experience. This ramen spot certainly lives up to its reputation 6800 reviews and counting!. The wildly popular Ichiran Ramen warns you that at its busiest time, the wait in line just to have a seat in its single booth is 6070 minutes.

And it was worth it! The broth is light, but savory and salty without going overboard. The medium spicy was good but I'll go one or two step up, as well as one more beyond the medium garlic.

I'm glad I got the firm noodle as recommended by a few, and I'll try one softer next time.

The tonkotsu slices are lean and tasty. The whole dish just works so well together.

And the experience of receiving your food through the window behind a bamboo curtain is unique and unforgettable. It really adds to the atmosphere!

Love this place and I'll wait another hour for another serving!

주소: 2-chōme-5-27 Motomachi, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0016, Japan
리뷰:
One of the best ramens Ive ever eaten. Not only is the overall taste good, but the broth and chicken are also on point. I always come here with my friend, and whenever people visit Osaka and ask me for a good halal shop, I always bring them here. Five stars for everything . Had some delicious Spicy Fried Chicken Ramen here and Gyoza as well.

My only suggestion would be to ask the Spicy Fried Chicken on the side so it maintains its crisp.

I found the prices quite reasonable for the amount and the fact its halal.

The place can seat maybe 1015 people so theres a chance there may be a wait.
Keep in mind youll need cash to pay at the ordering machine. The best spicy ramen I've ever had. Still craving for this one. Everytime I go to Osaka, I'd make sure to include a trip to this small restaurant. It is quite out of the way but located within walking distance from the nearest train station. The seats are very limited, much like many of the Japanese shops here so time yourself well and go outside holiday season or peak hours if you can. We ordered spicy ramen, gyoza and chicken which was very delicious. However place was a bit tight, can only host 10 guest at one time..so have to come early for your seatings. Other that that, staff was friendly as well. Also you have to pay first at the kiosk before seating down. Really delicious ramen, liked the friendly staff and atmosphere. If you need to spice your life up, come and try the spicy chicken here. No cap. Thank you

주소: Japan, 〒530-0027 Osaka, Kita Ward, Dōyamachō, 16−１２ F2
리뷰:
Food was gooooddddd, staffs were extremely friendly and helpful too!! Ambiance wise, had a nice subtle touch of Turkey. Chef looks like he is from Turkey too.
I went for dinner and enjoyed my meal!!
The restaurant itself is pretty compact and has limited seats  theyd start to reject customers if its packed usually during their peak hours like 9pm. So just call them before coming in to make a reservation or to just check if they have a spot for you. Amazing place although a bit small.
Easily full. I think can fit only about 20 ppl max.

But food was superb and most importantly halal. The chef was turkish who speaks japanese and the lady was also super friendly Turkish restaurant in the middle of Osaka. You can find the place by looking at the Turkish flag. They have lunchdinner set with more economical price. The taste was good and plentiful. Maybe in peak time, reservations are recommended. Really tasty fresh Turkish food.
After 15 days of Japanese food  we really needed some good middle eastern food,
So we came with high expectations, and was not disappointed.
The cook also serves the tables, and some how both the service and the food were excellent.
Everything came out fast, fresh and warm.
Definitely worth the relatively expensive price. I found tasty halal turkish meals here. At first I doubted the taste of the mackarel sandwich. But then after the first bite it turned out to be sooo yummy. They are perfect combination of materials for a sandwich. Combined with the cold mashed potatoes and hot lentil soup, they even enrich its taste.
I also tried the chef kebab taken out. The lamb meat is sooo delicate. It is well composed with the mashed potato inside the pastry outer skin. I bet the taste is even more appetizing when you eat it in the restaurant.
