주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−17−１ 心斎橋 コスミビル １F
리뷰: The quesadilla is good. Originally we wanted ramen but the store next door only took cash so we walked across the street. Saw the reservation sign and was about to leave but decided to ask first. Meal took 2030min to arrive as theres only one chef, but its worth the wait. What a find! One evening in Osaka, we discovered that most places required reservations, so we wandered until we stumbled upon this charming Mexican spot. I savored two tacos, with pork and beef, while my husband opted for chicken. They were delicious, and I found myself wishing for more even after finishing. The only thing missing was some salsa or pico de gallo, but everything we had was tasty. Spent my 33rd birthday here and had the best time with the team and customers alike. Living in California, I'm a huge fan of Mexican food and couldn't have been more impressed with Mexican Ola Tacos Bar. This restaurant makes the best Mexican Food i've had so far. I love Mexican Food and they did so amazing. So flavorful which i like. The server was so nice and good service. I'd love to go back and try enchilada i also ordered "Kitty Drink which is red wine  gingerale. It was so good. Great Mexican in Osaka. Very cool small restaurant with great staff. Very friendly.  One Cheff dose all the cooking man's a machine. Do your self a favour and check them out great if you need a break form Japanese food.

주소: 4-chōme-16-15 Nipponbashi, Naniwa Ward, Osaka, 556-0005, Japan
리뷰:
Came with a group of friends. Was super fun and wholesome. They made everybody feel welcome. My wife was especially ecstatic about being there. Definitely was pleasantly surprised by the experience! My wife loved the place so much and it made her extremely happy. Food was also surprisingly delicious. The Hamburg steak and omurice was super tasty!
They were very attentive and upbeat. I really enjoyed my experience. We asked for the maid to draw a pikachu and she was so amazing! Check out the photo. A whole new Maid experience with 1000 service, including nice meals. Specially recommending strawberry milkshake. The other desserts taste perfect  highly recommend this home for all of the masters and princesses First time in Japan, we wanted to try this and were a bit shy, but the waitress was accommodating despite not speaking English and sometimes used Google translate.

Food is cute, but of course the prices are a tad high, since you're also paying for the high energy service. You can also order via phone if you're very introverted.

My brother did not like it at all, but for me it was quite an alright experience. Would probably go again with someone else next time. If you want to experience Japanese maid cafe, this is the No.1 place to go in Osaka. It was Oct.13, my last day in Japan. And I decided to spend the afternoon here to relax from my morning shopping. 1 About the food. They were surprisingly good. Strongly recommend the Yakitori skewers. The performance drink also tasted good. Plus an interesting performance. 2 About live dance. I ordered two of the live danceone famous , and one of their original songs. Maid girl named Shampoo performed really amazing of these two dances especially , I can feel that was not easy. Other customers also ordered some dances from other maid girls, which gave me the opportunity to see more amazing cute dances. 3 They also offered socalled lotterybefore live dances, for 880 yen each time. Its basically guaranteed to win something. I was lucky to get the First Prize in the first trial. The prize was a group photo with ALL the maid girls in the cafe. 4 As it was my last day there, I wanted to try as many things as possible, so my expense might be a little higher but still reasonable. For the memories, happiness and experience I got, it was worth it. Nyan Nyan!
P.S. I dont know if I can post the picture of maid girls here, so I only posted the food in this review.

주소: 2 Chome-21 Nipponbashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0073, Japan
리뷰: Famous local wet market that sell great food and good. Open early in the morning and you can find lot of fresh seafood over here. Huge variety of seafood with different pricing available and you can eat over there. You can compare with several stall and decide. Kobe beef is also famous over here and I quite enjoy it as the beef literally melts in my mouth. Plenty of street food also available here that one day is not enough that you might visit here another day. One of the best seafood and fresh produce markets we've been to. You can select what you want and the store will cook and serve it at the store. Also sake tasting stalls. Many others for souvenirs etc. It's touristy and not the cheapest but a good experience. Nice market to enjoy mostly seafood and whatever else you like! Prices are reasonable and the service is fast. You can find pretty much anything you wish for. Definitely worths checking out. Such a fun market. The prices of the fish are so good! I could get a whole fillet of bluefin tuna for only 2000yen! I went here for breakfast and it wasnt too crowded and it was so cool. There are so many seafood options, from Urchin to Fugu, and definitely worth a visit while youre in Osaka. Kuromon market is a mustvisit in Osaka. The entire street is inundated with mouthwatery food stalls. You will have to choose wisely in order not to over budget your calorie count. The sashimi is ridiculously delicious and the crab having been gently roasted, emanates the alluring smell of the sea.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: ジュノン八幡 2F, 2-chōme-4-8 Higashishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0083, Japan
리뷰:
I've been here 3 times to eat Romanian food Very good reminds me of romania  Good food, good service.Will be back when I'll be in town again BAR x RESTAURANT
Authentic Sri Lankan food in the heart of osaka
If you like spicy food pork curry deviled pork and chilly chicken are highly recommended.

they also Ceylon Sri Lankan arrack
place is beautiful decorated with Sri Lankan art and craft.. Ive travelled all over the world, and this is one of the best barsrestaurants Ive been to. Vibes, food, and service were unreal. Staffs are super friendly and the chef is just too good. I will definitely be back here next time I am visiting Osaka. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for good vibes and a night out in Osaka good place to start your pres and you probably wont even leave here until you cant walk anymore haha If youre in the mood for a rare salad in osaka, this is your spot!! I was feeling real desperate for some greens, and this hit the spot. They also have other delicious foods too, and good drinks  We had an amazing time. The staff is international, accommodates tourists and are extremely friendly. They offer very tasty dishes, I was surprised at the diverse food options, Brazilian, sri lankan and Romanian options. Their drinks are superb, I recommend this place.

주소: 2-chōme-7-27 Nishishinsaibashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0086, Japan
리뷰:
Delicious traditionalstyle omurice shop! The rice and egg portion is very generous, but do take note that the meat portion is a bit small. This is a popular spot with locals and tourists, and the waiting time can be quite awhile, but you can walk around while monitoring your queue number on their website. The staff are all very patient and polite! Thank you for having us!  During our trip to Osaka, my group of four had the pleasure of dining at Hokkyokusei, and it was an experience to remember! We were seated right away without any wait, which was fantastic for a busy city like Osaka. The restaurant specializes in traditional "omurice", and it truly lived up to the hype. The omurice was absolutely delicious, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting.

The ambiance is also something specialvery traditional with a lot of charm, making it a memorable experience, especially for tourists like ourselves. It felt like we were stepping into a piece of Japanese culture, adding to the overall enjoyment of the meal.

The staff were friendly and attentive, always making sure we were comfortable. As for pricing, its quite reasonable, with omurice dishes ranging from 1080 to 2100 yen, making it an affordable yet authentic dining option in Osaka. Whether youre a local or a visitor, Hokkyokusei is definitely worth a stop! Food is quite alright. The egg was drier than expected. The curry sauce was pretty good though.
We were seated in the bigger room with tatami seating without the garden view and it was quite hot and stuffy inside with the other three groups of guests. I'd suggest requesting for a private room if you have a party of 34 and you might have a way better view. Good omurice served fast on traditional tatami mats and popular among locals and tourists. At first, there is a ticketing system to keep for a seat. But that line goes by rather quickly, especially since the restaurant is so big. Most of the menu here is only omurice, but there are many different toppings to choose from chicken or ham or beef stew. Food comes out quickly. Would go here again. Unassuming from the outside, it aims to let you have an authentic Japanese experience. The garden in the middle adds a pleasant touch, and Im just grateful to still be able to cross my legs as the seating is tatami style. The food can be characterised as homey, like the one being made by someones mom or grandma. Recommended for a quick fill.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0076 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Namba, 5-chōme−1−１８ 髙島屋大阪店 ７･８･９Ｆ
리뷰: This restaurant was on the top floor of the mall and could have been easily missed but it was a great find.  The Japanese hamburger steak is their specialty.  You can also get a Kobe beef hamburger steak instead.  Give this place a try if you are in the area. i was eager for an eel bowl at lunch and didn't mind to pick a chain store. although it's a china, the quality is kept consistent and guaranteed. simple eel bowl set just around 4,000 yen but very promising. the eel was fat and juicy. in addition we ordered an eel egg roll and an eel liver skewer, i think both are the must try item in every eel restaurant in japan. both were good. it's slightly after lunch time so plenty of seats. Never a big fan for deep fried pork cutlet, but this one at Nanba Osaka was pretty good. Very crispy outer bread crust  still reasonably tender pork inside. Steam rice  cabbage salad are all you can eat. Pretty good services. Considering the price, it was quite attractive. Love both deep fried pork chop  oysters   Children friendly, foods are very home cook. As you can see, it's a feast to the eyes too. No rushing to finish the meal and no pressure. They even have English menu. Love it!

주소: 2-chōme-1-3 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
We were there today the second in line just before the opening time. I requested seats with backrest, because my dad needs it. We were then taken to the bar area on the first floor.

Then I went to the second floor to the toilet and saw empty tables and chairs with back rest. Requested to change the seats and was denied by the chef, said its all full.

The food we received were not consistent, two pieces of the beef tongue were like from yesterday and reheated pale  looking ones hidden behind the fresh ones  very difficult to chew. The oysters had a strong taste, not fresh at all.

I dont recommend the place, not family friendly, chef has attitude. Id give it a better rating, however an old chef was extremely rude to me and my family. He yelled at us in front of the entire store over his own misunderstanding, refused to back down or understand, and only calmed down when another chef told him he misunderstood. Whats even better, he refused to apologize. I really want to recommend this place but with such atrocious service I really cant. If you plan on coming, beware this guy and dont be surprised if youre yelled at for no reason. Beef tongue is chewy and bouncy.
The soup is reasonably good.
Pickles n miso provide the saltiness .
Portion on the low side, price on the high side
A different experience for those who has never tried the beef tongue. Would I go there again? Would prefer premium beef steak cut, unlikely Great grilled beef tongue and gyutan shabushabu for my dinner in Osaka! Amazing place with very good, honest and local food. No touristy place but an authentic Japanese speciality restaurant.

주소: 2-chōme-7-4 Fukushima, Fukushima Ward, Osaka, 553-0003, Japan
리뷰:
beef tendon and radish are good. Tofu skin is delicious. Just to be noticed here there are two stores, one is the original one and another is close by with a few steps. Either one should be good and you can choose one with fewer people lined up.

You won't get it wrong with the low price. We have about 20 food orders for two of us and three drinks. It just cost us 3600, and we are totally full. We first queue up at the Hanakujira Honten then lead by their staff to this branch afterwards, more seats are available here. Love their oden. We finished the broth it was too tasty  Tried their hot sake too! Queue starts at 4pm but its worth it. Delicious oden and priced very very reasonably. Best oden ever in my life, must try white radish! Probably the best oden you can get anywhere.
But its just oden after all, is it really worth the 45minute wait?

주소: 1-chōme-1-86 Noda, Fukushima Ward, Osaka, 553-0005, Japan
리뷰:
A sushi restaurant open from 615 in the morning the perfect place for early birds. We came at around 730, so the restaurant was practically empty. Choosing omakase was a great choice as we got to try a brilliant selection of fresh cuts. Two plates of 5 pieces for 1300 yen each feels like Im robbing this place with how much of a steal it is. I saw another review complaining about the waiting time, but I feel that they didnt take much time between the two  it was just a short break to enjoy the sushi. The waitress was also very attentive and friendly managed to get a whole mountain of gari upon request. Probably the freshest sushi you can get unless you want to eat the fish alive. Fantastic quality. I love to Miso Soup too. Strong taste and not the commercial type. The place is small and expect long queue. Try not to go during peak hours. Will visit again when in Osaka. Come here. That is all.       It you want more to my reasoning start that it is perfect. You wander out of the busy city into a working fish market to a lonely stall. You have entered a new space.     You want more reasons? You are still reading? Fine, you can Ignore the fact that the staff is impeccable and kind. Ignore the thoughtfulness on every dish and in the best soup I have ever had a clam and miso umami bomb you will remember on your death bed.
Ignore all that and focus on the sushi, some of the best in the world without doubt. Flaky eel, perfectly boiled crab and a tuna that has the smallest amount of connective tissue holding together delicious fatty flesh.
Come here. Come a bit early. Then come again. They open at 630 and are open until 130. You can come twice in one day. We made a trek out to Endo Sushi because we still remember how good and fresh the sushi was from 7 years ago.  Location a little hard to get to especially coming from Noda Station. Lots of trucks and cars driving fast to the Market. We waited maybe 30 min or so on a Saturday around 1015 am.  It might have been longer but didnt feel like it. There were about 34 parties before us. When we left around 1110ish, there was a line of maybe 1520 people waiting outside. Sushi options 1 and 2 are the best deals.  One can swap one fish out. The salmon is so soft, it almost melts in the mouth. Uni was fresh.  Partner had the clam miso soup and enjoyed it. We each ate three plates.  Fresh sushi made upon order. The queue is long due to very limited seat inside. Price is very reasonable for the quality given. All the set is only 1300yen for five pieces of sushi including one toro piece.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0017 Osaka, Kita Ward, Kakudachō, 5−１５ HEPファイブ １階 たこ焼マーケット
리뷰:
I tried 4 different shops to see which one was best. All of them have a sample box to try different flavors. All of them were delicious. I enjoyed all the shops and flavors thoroughly. You order on a screen so it is easy for English speakers. Great place for a quick bite and a beer, won't break the bank, and the atmosphere is great. A couple of shops to choose from with seating inside and out. Good price for Takoyaki in town. Taste is quite good, and Tako is big! A great way to try takoyaki from several vendors, none of which disappoint. Get the takoyaki senbei takosen, the texture is great! Loved the food, very affordable
Still I used the coupon from my travels
Great staff too, the young people there especially who spoke english were so cool

이름: Hakodate Gourmet Kaitenzushi Kantaro Grand Front Osaka
주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−２０ グランフロント大阪ショップ＆レストラン南館 ７Ｆ
리뷰:
A good option for sushi that is wellpriced and easy to access for Japanese and nonJapanese people. People were standard in terms of service, typical Japanese. The menu can be ordered on the screen, which is really helpful for all. Lots of seating and a great selection of food. They have specials on certain fishes that are limited and must be tried as they are flown in from Hokkaido. If you're in the grant front or Umeda area, definitely check out. Pretty good for train sushi, not bad for quality and value and they had a number of fresh items from Hokkaido when we were there including Hokkaido scallops which were delicious.

Tourist friendly, can order additional items off tablet with English menu. Would recommend. Came here for a later night snack, went exclusively for the salmon, and it did not disappoint! Several different cuts of salmon, and they were amazing. Only con is the price is definitely on the higher side for rotating sushi, but so is the quality. The food tasted okay. The sashimi I had was a little rubbery and the eel was not soft.
The sushi didn't look that fresh nor did it taste that fresh.
Would not go out of the way to come back here. We visited this sushi bar around tea time and got a bar seat which gave us a great view of the sushi chef as he prepared our meal. We ordered unagi, tuna and salmon sashimi. All were great, with a special mention to the salmon sashimi which was absolutely delicious. Service was also extremely prompt, and the chef was really quick. Thank you!

주소: Japan, 〒531-0075 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōyodominami, 1-chōme−4−２０ 長谷川ビル 1階
리뷰:
Handmade pasta sounded good to me, so I stopped in. Luckily, as a single diner, I could eat quickly before reservations had the place booked. It's quite small, so I recommend going early.

I ordered the salmon pasta, which was pretty good. Not quite as good as my own homemade pasta, bit the presentation tableside was a really nice touch.

The dishes are a bit on the expensive side, especially given their size 2000 yen. But, it is not absurdly expensive. If you want meat or wine here, be ready to cough up 45000 yen each. I just wanted pasta, so I can not comment on the other dishes

Overall, it's a place with good food and nice presentation, that is trying to go for a more upscale atmosphere. What a fantastic little Italian restaurant! Hand made pasta in a beautiful 5 table venue that I believe is run by father and son. You wont be left disappointed with generous sized pasta portions, warm bread and friendly service including a demonstration of how the pasta youve ordered is made. A really lovely venue all round. This fourtable fatherandsonrun Italian restaurant is an absolute gem. From the moment we walked in the door, we were treated as family. The waiter, who is the son of the 77yearold Italiantrained chef and father, was especially attentive and caring of our 5yearold daughter. The freshlymade pasta was some of the best weve ever had, which is saying a lot considering Italian is our familys favorite food. The garden salad was fresh and perfectly seasoned with tomatoes that were absolutely out of this world. And the tiramisu was to die for. We would have gone back the next night had we not been departing Osaka for Kyoto. Make a reservation, as the space is tight and demand is high. Dont miss this duo! Small quaint restaurant that seats less than 20 specializing in handmade pastas. All the dishes were done well here, with a special mention of that chicken porcini mushroom and the al dente texture of the pasta. It's great that the chefowner still personally prepares all the dishes by himself instead of hiring line cooks because it really adds to the character of the dish and restaurant likewise. Fresh pasta, would recommend the tiramisu as well. The waiter seemed a bit rude at first because he spoke to us with a raised voice upon entering and cut me off as I spoke, but he spoke normally afterwards so it was overall alright.

리뷰: The Best Cheap, Tasty Gyoza with draft beer We came across this place by accident but omg we consider this place one of the best meal we had so far in Osaka. Love it  Came here a bit late at night. The  I would like to go close at 2300. So, not much choice around, and I was attracted by the eel menu, I have a go. The eel fry rice really surprised me. The eel meat itself is a firm one, it is different from what you usually can have in a high class restaurant, but not bad indeed. The fry dumplings Gyoza are ok. Reasonable price, worth a try. Great food w decent prices. Staffs are real nice too. Great value Osaka street food. The are great and they have well priced eel over rice. Drinks are around 500.

주소: 3-chōme-1-101区画 Ōsakajō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0002, Japan
리뷰:
It's average food for a tourist attraction. I like my tonkatsu pork. Though it seems the cooking oil could be old and service is not so friendly. We can't eat the miso soup due to its saltiness. Maybe it's a local taste  Curry was rich and flavourful! Cutlet was thick and tender! Yum!
Staff was friendly and English menu is available for tourist. This place should have more  reviews!

 the staff was friendly and professional,
 the food came fast and it was amazing!
 Really convenient place between the entrance of the castle and the train station,
 Great value for what you get!
 Ive tried the tonkatsu pork cutlet and suggest you try the same with any combination.  Seriously the worst restaurant I have been so far in Osaka. Our group of 4 people have to split in two to seat on the bench for single people dine because they put two people to seat on the table of 4. Seriously one time only, food is not worst trying to eat. Never comeback against. TonKatsu in the garden offers a delightful dining experience. The ambiance is serene, and the food is exquisite with a blend of flavors that truly stand out. Highly recommended !

주소: 2-chōme-2-14 Tokuichō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0025, Japan
리뷰:
Undoubtedly the best taco place in Osaka. Especially, the suadero tacos were absolutely  divine. Went there with my Mexican friend and he was very satisfied with the quality as well. This place is seriously good! I did not come to Japan to try Mexican but wow  I would really recommend all the tacos in particular.

Also the staff were able to confirm which items on the menu gluten free  everything except the soup!  which is great to know as a celiac.

Plus all the staff and super friendly and speak a decent amount of english. Other reviews mention making a booking  we tried calling and no luck, but we came on a Thursday and had a seat straight away. Although we did try to drop by on Saturday and it was booked out. I can't believe we found an authentic Mexican place in Osaka, Japan. The food and drinks are AMAZING. At least one staff member speaks English and some Spanish.

If you're missing home while abroad, stop here for a taste of Mex. Mexican here, certifying these tacos as the best in Osaka! You must try them. I recommend suadero, adobada and carnitas. And please get the guacamole and chips, its a must appetizer.
And their Jamaica water is a perfect balance between sweetness and sourness that will refresh you and make you want more.
Will definitely be back. Gracias! Top tier, way better than I was expecting. The taste of the tacos and nachos were as good as in Mexico. Call in advance to book because they get full quick. The menu was easy to understand and all the ingredients are fresh. When I return to Osaka this will definitely be on my list! The wait is worth it, you will be surprised on how delicious the meat is and the size of the tacos are good.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0071 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Dōtonbori, 1-chōme−9−１９ 大阪松竹座ビル 地下1階
리뷰:
Found on one of our excursions into Japanese buildings where venues are underground  so don't give up if Google Maps feels like it's leading you astray.

It was incredibly quiet when we arrived at a weekday ahortly after lunch time service was efficient but polite, and food tasted really good! Nothing mindblowing but a solid tonkotsu. The sides were nice to sample too.

The presentation with the stream wafting off of it was impressive to see.  Pretty good pork cutlet but nothing too special in my opinion. Maybe something was lost in translation but we were turned away the first time only to come back and be let in a minute later. To be fair they were in a rush to close as it was late. This is located in an underground area of restaurants right in Dotonbori. You will recognize this place because it has a statue of a pig in front of the shop. The service was pretty all right as they were quick and efficient. They do have an English menu and accept credit cards. They are a chain from Nagoya, which is famous for the miso. I recommend ordering the halfhalf so you have two styles of katsu, at a very reasonable price. Both were very delicious. I usually dont ever order katsu but this was recommended as Osaka and Nagoyas speciality. The sauce is made from red miso but isnt overpowering. What I loved most was its efficiency, the juiciness and fattiness of the pork cutlet. Great place, great tonkatsu, staff is very helpful and they have english menu.

주소: Japan, 〒556-0017 Osaka, Naniwa Ward, Minatomachi, 1-chōme−4−１ OCATモール 5F
리뷰: One of the best all you can eat halal yakiniku in Osaka. Fresh beef cuts, tender chicken, assorted seafood octopus, kimchi, bibimbap etc. Few minute walk from Gamba Osaka station. Friendly and attentive staff. A very awesome restaurant. It provides halal meat, in addition to many types of wonderful meals. I recommend trying it. There is also a prayer room. The food is delicious and the service is great we were lucky to visit early at 12 to eat on Friday. As they had reservations at 1300 so better make a reservation. Booked much ahead of my lunch date here. Very quiet on a Wed morning at 11am. Did not opt for the Eat All You Can but an upgraded Brown Beef Wagyu instead.  Much cheaper eating set meal if you are not greedy. Food is okay but comparing with their competitor, this is below par. Halal bbq? Heck yeah! Absolutely amazing food at an amazing price. Came with my family for lunch and we got the red all you can eat course. Kids were only 500yen each which was a steal. Absolutely amazing and will come again.
카테고리: meal_takeaway, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment

주소: Japan, 〒550-0014 Osaka, Nishi Ward, Kitahorie, 1-chōme−9−６ ウイングス・ギザ 1F-B
리뷰:
Kind people and definitely delicious food, I have tried quesadilla, chicken and beef burrito  both were delicious. Recommended if you wanted to try Mexican food. Even though it was past the typical lunch rush hour, the seats were mostly full. We luckily came when there were open seats, but we saw others turned away. I was happy that there was a small discount during lunch hours on weekdays until 3PM I believe. My chicken burrito was not bad, but I also wished it had more flavor. If I visited again, I would try a different flavor. My partner liked his beef burrito well enough. We ordered guacamole to go with our chips, and it was good. Small complaint would be that the drink cup size was good, but as is common in Japan it came about  full and less than that if you take out the ice. Being from California, this place satisfies my need for good Mexican food in Osaka. The chicken burrito is amazing and the owners are so sweet. Delicious! I eat here semi regularly, and the burritos here are excellent, the size and taste is great and doesnt taste japanified at all, as so much foreign cuisine does here.
Less than 1000 for a big fat burrito, I recommend the chicken one personally. There is also a selection of world beers which is nice, the side menu offers some good stuff too but the burritos are by far the best.
The store itself is somewhat lacking in atmosphere but isnt bad by any means, and the lady owner can be rather cold in her service, but again not horrible or anything. Definitely worth a visit if youre craving a burrito! This cute diner is conveniently close to Yotsubashi station, and has vibes of a SoCal bistro. Offering more than 30 craft beers and liquor, the menu was condensed compared to most taco eateries in Osaka a welcome change to do a small menu well!
Food was prepared fresh with minimum wait, with sounds of the owner cooking in the background.
The food was very good, authentic. I will certainly return to this restaurant next time I am in Osaka.

주소: osaka Umeda, Eki Mae daisan Biru B1 - 40 shi １丁目-１-3, １丁目-１ 梅田 北区 大阪市 大阪府 530-0001, Japan
리뷰:
Good tasty food with friendly staff. Butter chicken is amazing, and Naan is fresh  crisp. Lot of places Naans are rubbery but this pla e serves very good well cooked Naan, my 10 year old kid loved it.
The staff is very friendly and hindi speaking. The place is bit tough to find, you really need to keep your eyes open while looking at the map. I just went to check if the negative reviews are true or not.

Yes, absolutely true.

Look at the bill. 4901200300  1990
They add 10 for tax which not written in the prices as you see in the pictures.

Be careful from this place!!

The food is small and you can not be full.

Aslo in paying the bill. I gave them 3089 that can give me back 900. But they counted and gave me only 722. I told them that is not true. Then they count it again and give me the 900.

Count your money and dont leave until you confirm that! Its nice to have in this big cross mall place esp for having vegan and vegetarian dishes. The taste was good but the plate was small and in terms of price was high in comparison to other restaurants that offer bigger dishes with the same or a hit lower price or with having the option of eating bread and rice as much as you like. Also no wifi but the service man was kind and supportive. Also social abd communicative A great find. If youre in the Umeda area and looking for tasty food with many delicious vegetarian options come here. Relaxing place with friendly staff and fair prices. I got the eggplant curry set and it was a passionate love affair with flavor. Food is OK
Charge 10 for tax without bill
I have tried at least 10 restaurant
No other place found charging tax on written amount
If tax is genuine than proper bill should be given. Tax is collected on behalf of govt not for additional income of restaurant owner.

주소: Japan, 〒540-0002 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Ōsakajō, 1−１ MIRAIZA OSAKA-JO1階
리뷰:
Came to the Osaka Castle as we were wrapping up our wonderful vacation to Japan. And there was this little indoor mall kind of at the base of it. Inside was a little restaurant that sold the golden geese of Osaka cuisine, the Takoyaki and the Okonomiyaki.

We got an okonomiyaki. They usually come with a rich array of toppings and sauces. But this particular place had a topping bar, where you could completely customize what you put on top of yours. Very cool. I poured on a bit of bonito flakes and various sauces and we made a very good okonomiyaki.

It was delicious. Not exactly the same as getting it from street vendors, like you see on TV, but I was jonesing real bad and needed one ASAP. Not complaining. It was so good. The food was very expensive. Definitely some major tourist tax. It wasn't bad though. 900 yen for ice scream in a cone is WILD though. Total trap with the tourist tax.
750 yen for a coffee and its not even a full cup and not great compared to a lot of other coffee out there.
Food was ok, noting great.

Worst part is the price. Konamon Bar Rikyu, located near Osaka Castle, is a great spot tucked away from the crowds for those looking to indulge in Osaka's famous street food, offering a unique combo set for diners torn between okonomiyaki and takoyaki.
Even though the takoyaki was a little undercooked and the okonomiyaki wasn't the best I've had. The combination set is perfect for visitors who want to sample both without choosing one over the other.
The restaurant features a condiments bar where guests can customize their dishes with bonito flakes, okonomiyaki sauce, and mayo to their liking. Additionally, selfservice water is available, ensuring diners can enjoy their meal with ease.
This combination of decent food and the ability to personalize your dish makes Konamon Bar Rikyu an alright spot for visitors exploring the area around Osaka Castle. Absolutely the worst takoyaki ive had. I think being in osaka you should do yourself a favor and skip this place. There are so many very delicious takoyaki restaurants around. I made the mistake of coming here and paying 1200 yen for very bad takoyaki in my opinion. The staff was nice although, nothing to complain about just the food was not what i was into. Very mushy possibly raw. Definitely a spot to get tourists to spend extra money.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0047 Osaka, Kita Ward, Nishitenma, 4-chōme−2−７ 昭栄ビル 1F
리뷰:
Very tasty food and unusual combinations, the impeccable service made our first proper food experience in Osaka truly unforgettable! Highly recommended It's a wonderful place where you can eat elaborate kushikatsu while drinking wine in a restaurant with a French atmosphere, with wine and exquisite kushikatsu that go well with it.
The interior design and food offerings are no wonder why there are so many female customers.
It's so delicious that I want to go again. It's cheap and delicious
I think it's even better if you drink alcohol. The restaurant has a calm and mature atmosphere, but the staff are cheerful and serve the food at just the right pace, making it an easygoing restaurant.
There is a wide selection of wine, and the various kushikatsu and fried foods are delicious. The bowl of soup stock is also the best.

Is it okay to add? That's why I asked for the petit course for the time being.

The eggcooked rice with one push was more than I expected.
it's recommended!

주소: Japan, 〒550-0014 Osaka, Nishi Ward, Kitahorie, 1-chōme−3−７ 倉商グループ本社ビル 地下1階
리뷰:
The Indian cuisines of this restaurant tastes REALLY REALLY great! I visited here twice within three days.

There are many kind of food here, and I really recommend the masala curry with naan and samosa.

The masalas here are flavorful, and the spices inside are authentic! You can even meet the spices in your mouth!

The naan is really huge, authentic and scrumptious! If you prefer curry with rice, their rice is also great!

The samosa tastes stunning, crispy and mouthful!

I love their salad with sprouted green beans which is cute and appetizing.

The soup may be different everyday. I have tasted two kinds of soup during my visits. I love the flavor of the soup!

Last but not least, the snack and Lassi are good!

By the way, I boxed up the rest of the food, and I found it still delicious after several hours even without warming up it! Very cozy and super tasty Indian Restaurant in a basement. The portions are huge and you can choose how spicy you want it to be. Everything was delicious, the Nan as well. Highly recommended! Super priced Vegan restaurant near Dotonbori. Food is below average. Service is delayed because only one person serves all the customers and tables. I didn't know why it was  given such a high rating. May be mostly due to Vegan restaurant options. Prices are more than double compared to other Indian restaurants in Osaka. So called Veg biryani see picture they serve is just steamed rice with some veggies and spices. The location is in the basement and tiny. Nestled in the by lanes near the most crowded Dotombori, this is a peaceful hidden gem that services the BEST  most authentic vegetarian Indian food in Japan!! If you are in Osaka, please eat here. The food will you remind of you home  how. The vibe is too good. Best Jain Food I had in Osaka. Tasty food and amazing quantity. Cannot believe that I found this hidden gem in Osaka. Must visit for jain food and tasty vegetarian food. Do not miss this place if you are looking for jain, vegan or vegetarian food.

주소: Japan, 〒542-0083 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Higashishinsaibashi, 1-chōme−19−１９ ケイテイーズ心斎橋 4F
리뷰:
I was so happy that the rendang here is authentically made or at least very close to it compared to other rendang outside of Indonesia.  The rendang seasoningbumbu is not liquidycair inauthentically made rendang has liquidy spices which changes to whole texture and taste.  So if you want to taste authentic rendang in Osaka, come here!  The waitress was sweet and friendly and my food was served quickly I didnt have to wait long.  The decoration of the restaurant is authentic of that of local warung or restaurant in Indonesia.  If the music could be changed to traditional Indonesian music instead of Western pop hits, it would give the ambiance more authentic and 5 stars worthy.   Thank you, Cafe Bintang!  a truly satisfied  customer. The menu we tried was all delicious.. they also served mung bean porridge for breaking the fast.. But the staff is somehow not friendly and the service time is also a bit slow.. Overall, recommended halal Indonesian restaurant in Osaka.. Halal Indonesian or south east Asian food in the center of Osaka. It has the Indonesian ambience. The price of the food is average compared to other local restaurants. You might find the taste is also good. Also the portion for the food is quite large  I ordered fried duck . Very recommended place to hang out, available for reservations too. Authentic Indonesian cuisine and atmosphere are provided here. Must try the Batagor and Fried Duck, really tasty and tasted the same like what you got in Indonesia. I hope they improve the hospitality The Food Is Delicious, but the waiting time is somewhat time. It is worth waiting.

The Stuffs dont really speak english but theyre able to understand.
Or you could just point it out on Menu.

주소: Japan, 〒550-0013 Osaka, Nishi Ward, Shinmachi, 1-chōme−14, 西区西区新町１丁目１４−２
리뷰:
As a vegetarian, it was quite hard to find food in Japan. I ordered a Palak Paneer and naan that was so good that I came back the following day for more! Went here on the 14th for lunch as a colleague invited me. Was impressed with the stores decor! The food was excellent as well  lots of flavor!!! I ordered the keema curry rice set with coffee Lvl 5. Price came to about 900 and I was stuffed but I think the curry should have been way spicier. One star for service as none of the staff speak English which is a real downside The only Tibetan restaurant in Osaka where you get the best and authentic MOMO's. A must visit restaurant if you are interested in Tibetan food. They also have a wide range on Indian and Nepali food to choose from. There are various books and ornaments from and about Tibet which one can experience at the restaurant. It was amazing! I tried Nepal food for the first time and Im in love 
Also this place has a nice vibe. It was like trip to Nepal doesnt leave Osaka If you're looking for Tibetan or Indian food and atmosphere, I recommend the Snow Lion. Friendly staff, very nice looking place, and very tasty food.

주소: 3-chōme-3-24 Miyahara, Yodogawa Ward, Osaka, 532-0003, Japan
리뷰:
Located on the 3rd floor with Karaksa Hotel Grande SinOsaka, this restaurant serves a great selection of buffet breakfast spread. They have over 40 different dishes served, with options including fresh bread, a salad bar, soup, hot dishes and sweets. They also have an Osaka specialty corner, with local dishes from the neighboring areas of Kyoto, Kobe, Nagoya and Wakayama. With 200 seats available, space is not an issue. Overall, we enjoyed the food here over the 6 days staying at this hotel. Hidden gem inside the hotel.  Its a little bit cramped inside but most of the food is really delicious.  Staff is really quick in entertaining customers and quick in clearing up the tables.  Was not expecting a hotel restaurant to be this good! The food and the customer service from the people in the hall were very good, but I was really concerned about the elderly man in the kitchen who was cooking without his mask on.
They are forcing customers to wear masks, but I don't understand why they aren't doing so.
When that person comes out to the hall, he comes out with his nose sticking out, and are his shoes slippers? I don't think it's very hygienic as it looks like sandals.

이름: Osaka Noren Meguri, Osaka’s well-known delicious shops
주소: Japan, 〒532-0011 Osaka, Yodogawa Ward, Nishinakajima, 5-chōme−16−１ JR 新大阪駅 新幹線改札内
리뷰:
Good options for Japanese food, and pretty reasonable. I can recommend the Udon store. Beer and sake also available.

Great little spot to wait while for your train As I was on the roll the battered prawns were not only quick but delicious along with a beer Visited June 2023
After traveling around Shikoku with some friends, I stayed with my friends back in Niigata in Okayama and had a nice brunch before splitting up in ShinOsaka.
There are daruma kushikatsu and takoyaki kukuru, so there seems to be no problem drinking it. When I tried to order daruma around 930, I was told that I could only order alcohol and that food would be served after 1000.
I looked at the shops around me and it looked like I could order takoyaki, so I waited for 10 o'clock while eating takoyaki.
In the end, in addition to takoyaki, I ate kushikatsu, cutlet sandwich, and oyakodon oyakodon to finish off my meal, and I was completely full.
Everything was delicious and very satisfying. When you think of Osaka, you think of Kushikatsu!
Darumasan is a mustvisit place.
It's nice to be able to get off the Shinkansen and go straight to orgasm.
Here we have beer and kushikatsu and head to our destination.
The crunchy texture of the freshly fried kushikatsu and the oil may be due to the use of lard?No matter which skewer you eat, it has a slight pork taste that makes you addicted to it. The eatin area was very small, so I ate while huddled with the person next to me.
However, the kushikatsu was very delicious.
I received oysters and shrimp as an addition to the set. You can have it quickly before boarding the Shinkansen.

이름: Mango Tree kitchen Grand Front Osaka
주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−１ グランフロント大阪 うめきた広場 B1F
리뷰:
After about 1 week in Japan, I was craving for spicy food, which was my usual diet in Sg. I googled and saw this small eatery. I ordered green curry, basil chicken I gobbled this up and forgot to take a pic first  and tom yum soup. They were all so delicious that I could cry  and most importantly very spicy. The restaurant also had chili condiments which were rare in most Japanese restaurants. I helped myself with the spicy condiments and my stomach was full and warmed by the spicyness. This shop literally saved me lol Only suggestion is for this shop to add Thai iced tea to the menu and this shop will flourish. A nice Thai restaurant in Umeda area. The khao man gai was delicious. Chicken was tender, especially when I poured the ginger sauce. Fried chicken version has less chicken for some reasons.
In winter there is pad thai that also tastes great with chicken from khao man gai.

The place is not large. Accept most payment methods including IC cards Good chicken and sauces, and decent portions for 900 yen. The rice is very bland, however. Not your usual chicken stock  ginger garlic rice that comes with Thai chicken rice. It was just plain white rice.

Overall  good in a pinch. Would be great if the rice had some flavor, but the location, price, and atmosphere make up for it. Mango Tree in Umekita is a great little Thai restaurant. Staff are friendly, though service is far from great at busy times. There's usually a wait, so you may queue for a long time.
The food is however is really good! Really taste Thai chicken over rice. I recommend the boiled chicken over the fried chicken. Goes really well with the sauces they provide. I wish I took a picture. Cost performance is great!

주소: Japan, 〒530-0003 Osaka, Kita Ward, Dōjima, 2-chōme−1−１ 堂島地下街 9号
리뷰:
Went there during a visit to Osaka. We were craving good Pakistani food and this place dis not let us down. Big selection of dishes. We tried butter chicken, Muton karahi, BBQ platter and Biryani and they were all delicious. The staff was super friendly and we had a long chat after the meal with them. Amazing food by Amazing people. We will be back again for more. For the food, the aroma of the rice, the taste of mutton and chicken are very good and tasty. The service of the staff cashiercookermanager are well presented friendly and the atmosphere is very welcoming. I am a Bangladeshi who traveled to Japan and wanted to find Halal restaurants for my meals.

I found Dojima Mughal from Google maps. I was not expecting much but I was blown away when I tried their Mutton biryani, white tikka kabab, chicken tikka and mixed salad. It was super delicious!

I have to thank the chef as he helped me choose their best items.

The only downside for me was that I had trouble finding the restaurant as it was located underground.

Service 55
Location  45
Food  105 We were a group of 11 people. 9 from Bangladesh and 2 from Japan. We were on a business trip so it was important that our guests have some halal food for dinner.

We found this place with google maps and was unsure if the food was good as it was important to us that our guests have a great dinner.

Surprisingly, the food was delicious. Our guests praised the chef's cooking a lot. Our japanese guests also liked the foods as all the items had the right amount of spices to suit their taste buds.

The chef's, hospitality was top notch as well. He helped us understand the menu and order the right amount of food for our group.

The food that I liked the most mutton biryani, white chicken tikka and mixed salad. Nice little Halal Pakistani restaurant. I ordered a vegetable curry and nan bread which were very good. The curry was well spiced and was good value for money. The people who worked there were very pleasant and efficient.
The waiter went through the English menu and helpfully explained all the options available. Good value for money. Recommended.
TOP TIP the entrance is down a staircase to the left of the entrance to MacDonalds. Its in an underground shopping centre.

리뷰: Great skewer meal. Very nice ambience and the services so good. The servers very lively and helpful. Delicious food too. Will be back Reasonable price for normal set. Weekday lunch set is cheap. Service is good. The chef introduce the kuwayaki to us one by one and tell is use which sauce. Salomon one is very tasty. Should try it. Pleasantly surprised by this quite little restaurant surrounding by bigger ones. Lunch menu for a reasonable price and good kushikatsu. The recommended sake matched perfectly with the food. You can order on top of the menu if you want other tastes. And you can ask for rice refill. Very good service. Yummy food. Beyond expectation! Delicious

주소: 3-chōme-7-24 Namba, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0076, Japan
리뷰:
There were quite a number of shops selling the famous Takoyaki. But this one stands out and caught the attention as it was touted as a Michelin Guide awardee. You can either dine in or do a takeaway away. Well it really tasted different and good. The value for money is unbeatable 850 yen for 12 takoyakis! They are served hot, very flavorful with the sauce, and have the perfect texture, both melting and chewy from the octopus. Visited Takoyaki Wanaka, a place highly recommended by a local friend as his favorite spot for takoyaki in the city. It's a chain, so there are several locations in Osaka, making it convenient to find one near you. We chose the one closest to our hotel and weren't disappointed.

We arrived about half an hour before closing and were fortunate to snag one of the last few orders of the daythey close up once they sell out, which can be a few minutes before the official closing time. So, it's wise to arrive a bit early and be prepared for a possible wait.

We opted for the 8takoyaki set, which allows you to sample four different flavors. It was a delicious introduction to this iconic Osaka street food. Highly recommend stopping by Takoyaki Wanaka for a genuine taste of local cuisine! Ordered 8 plain Takoyaki as a pre dinner snack, and it was very flavoursome and piping hot. There was a long queue when I first walked past, so I didn't join the queue but made a mental note. When I walked past it again, the queue was much shorter so I decided to buy some. Takoyaki seems to be everywhere in Osaka, and I've never been a big fan, but this one is quite yummy. Tried as it's one ot the local specialties but it's not really my favourite dish. So for my own taste I would give a 3, but I assume if you'd like this type of food that this would be a good stall to eat it.

Balls are quite bland, the toppings really give the taste to all of it.

For more content, follow foodpatroll on Instagram

주소: 3-chōme-1-3 Umeda, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0001, Japan
리뷰:
Osaka Station, located within the shopping complex of Osaka Station City, is the biggest and busiest station in Western Japan.

Like its neighbour Kyoto station 29 mins train ride away, Osaka station offers plentiful facilities and services to tourists and locals. The station is well liked by people as a great recreation and entertainment haven.

The station itself has North Gate building and South Gate Building which are linked at ground floor by the station concourse. There are department stores, restaurants and many recreational facilities in both buildings. If you stay in nearby hotels, then you dont need to venture out  to any other area like Namba or Dontonbori for a huge and convenient shopping spree.

You can go between the two buildings via two bridges on 3rd floor and 5th floor respectively. If you are a train enthusiast, then go to these two bridges and watch the trains coming and going on the rail tracks below.

We spent a beautiful morning at the North Gate Building which is a 28 stories tall premises. Popular  department stores like Lucua my favourite store and Isetan are located in this building. Shop till you faint. There are also a cinema, a fitness club and offices in this building complex as well.

First we went up to the Tokinohiroba Plaza on the 5th floor of Osaka Station City. There is a bridge, decorated with 2 large clocks  one is gold and the other is silver in color.  If you can get some snack like spaghetti, pizza, lasagna etc from the Caffe Bar Del Sole here on 5th floor.  From this floor you can also see the train tracks and platforms below.

We continued to visit the 10th floor of the North Gate Building.
There we found a traditional Japanese style garden called Yawaraginoniwa Garden the meaning is peaceful garden. We saw many people enjoying the fresh air and warm sunlight peacefully whilst we were amused by the stunning city view calmly.

Then we continued our exploration by going up an outside staircase to the Kazenohiroba Plaza on 11th floor.  Kazenohiroba means garden of the wind.   The plaza is quite true to its name because it is a long and breezy garden. However this garden is famous for its multiple and colorful fragrant flowers. A lady gardener was carefully tending the flowers and plants while we were there. She was really really focus on tending of the gorgeous flowers see photos. Many young kids were playing joyfully at the water feature garden next to the flowers garden.

There is a Tenkunonoen Farm heavenly plantation located on 14th floor. It is a small rooftop farm 3 floors above the Kazenohiroba Plaza. Well the name is really appropriate for this plantation! Why? Let me tell you. We would love to see the plantation, but we have to walk up an almost 70 degree angled long flight of stairs. When I looked up the long stairs I felt as if I were going up to heaven.I made 3 attempts but my legs went jelly and could not move so finally I gave up. For some unknown reasons, I felt the staircases were  built in a scary straight angle at least to me. I have climbed 12000 ft mountain in Tibet but it did not make me feel scary as I faced  this only 3 floors high staircases. Unfortunately  I chickened out after trying several attempts otherwise I would have taken some nice photos of the plantation to share with you here. All I know from my research is that  a small vineyard and local vegetables herbs and fruits are planted in the plantation.  Anyway I saw the same gardener from the 11th floor garden walked up elegantly and relaxingly up the stairway to heaven shortly after I quit walking up the stairs.

Last but not least lets explore the South Gate Building. You can find Daimaru department store and Hotel Granvia and Taiyonohiroba Plaza plant of the sun.

I find that all the big train stations such as Kyoto, Tokyo and Osaka stations have provided many great entertainment and recreational facilities for people to enjoy and explore. An incredible indoor shopping malltype experience that seems to offer virtually everything you could think of buying.  It is, however, a bit daunting for newcomers who are going to spend some time figuring out where  everything you are looking for is located. Very confusing when you first arrive but when you get used to it, it's ok. Lots of stuff including an underground supermarket called Eki Marche and food stores to fill up time before catching your train. Place is easy to navigate as the layout is quite straightforward. Just follow the signboards if you're not sure where to go. A Vibrant hub next to Osaka Station, offering shopping, dining, and entertainment for all.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 3-chōme-1-3 Umeda, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-8558, Japan
리뷰:
Very large and so many things to browsing. Loft store name is also large, there were stationary and make up things like lip tints and so on. Including Ghibli store there are many kinds of character stores. I recommend IZUMO eel don restaurant, workers are nice food were lovely. The food selection on the B2 floor has so many delicious things that I spent about 30 minutes and couldnt decide what to buy for dinner. There is an area where you can buy the takeout and eat it there. They have a washbasins, a microwave and many tables to sit down. So while other restaurants around are closed at 9 PM, you can still order food here. They even give discount for some food around 8 PM. Shopping mall within the perimeters of Osaka Rail Station. More premium brands on display including local brands to feast your eyes upon. 7 floors of shopping til you drop as you browse through floor by floor of various fashion wear and accessories. Easy to navigate around as it isn't too big within each floor. This was a pretty nice shopping center. Had many floors to go up to get to the sushi place I had found in google to eat at but that was ok. I did appreciate the little smoking room on the same level of the restaurant as I popped in there to puff on my vape for a couple minutes while I waited for the sushi place to let me in to be seated. I didnt do any shopping but I did look around a bit and it seemed very nice, clean and well organized. If I had more time I would have went and looked around each floor more extensively. Really enjoyed the bottom floor of the LUCUA mall as a jewelry and perfume lover. They called this area Isetan Urban Market and had many boutiques of local brands or Japanese made brands.

This place is great if youre into niche interests such as this. I was able to buy high quality gold plated to gold fill jewelry and some very softgentle fragrances. 2040each.

The 2nd to top floors had lots of premium cosmetics, clothing and other items however I felt they were a bit expensive like 100 . Still very beautiful mall and worth walking around!

주소: 8-7 Kakudachō, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-8350, Japan
리뷰:
A more upscale shopping more with boutique brands to common brands. Some unique items. The basement food items is a heaven for those who crave for fine pastries, snacks, etc Amazing experience!
They have an amazing floor for food.
I went to discover the sweets and it turns out it was one of my favorite places in Osaka.
The price was ok  it wasnt cheap but not too expensive. Bustling places with a lot of people to buy something. When you visit the food court in this place at around 7 PM, which is an hour prior to the closing time, you'll be able to get a special discount offermore than 20, generally up to 50 for many food, including dumpling, sushi, pudding, Japanese dessert, and more. The feeling I have for Japan is that I can't see, feel enough for so many things, people, and their culture.
It's pity now there's overtourism every where in Japan, I feel sorry for that. In the meantime enjoy all the nice things in Japan, I hope they will not one day raise up the bar high to block some bad quality tourist...... But again maybe that's not a bad idea. .
Hope to visit Osaka again soon. Hankyu Umeda Main Store is a premier shopping destination in Osaka, known for its excellent accessibility and diverse offerings.

Located above Hankyu Umeda Station, it features 15 floors filled with luxury brands, cosmetics, gourmet food, and lifestyle products.

The store is particularly popular for its "DepaBasement Gourmet" food hall, showcasing exquisite food displays and a variety of dining options.

Additionally, it provides convenient services for international visitors, including taxfree shopping, free WiFi, and hotel delivery, making it a mustvisit for both locals and tourists.

주소: 6-chōme-2-61 Shimaya, Konohana Ward, Osaka, 554-0024, Japan
리뷰:
After spending countless days at the theme parks and all the other attractions of Osaka, it was good to come back to the hotel and have this area close.

Just a quick trip down the lift and there was everything we needed, from good restaurants to a cheap bite to eat, this place has it all. A large complex with various restaurants and vendors to check out. You can find anything from fast food to more classic Japanese food. A very enjoyable arcade in front of Universal Studios in Osaka, Japan. You can find a variety of restaurants and shops, perfect for enjoying time with your kids and family. The atmosphere is welcoming and fun, offering options for everyones taste. Its a great place to spend time before or after visiting the theme park. I highly recommend it to anyone in the area looking for a fun experience! Since we stayed at the Front Park Hotel, this becomes our daily neighborhood. It's amazing with food options, shops and also entertainment. The only thing is avoid the crowd at the park closing time that is 810pm each night One of the best amuzment park, but night parade is not available in slack season.

리뷰: Namba Walk is an underground shopping street with a wide variety of shops, cafes, and restaurants. Its a great place to hang out if youre looking to escape the heat or rain. Youll find everything here, from trendy fashion stores to unique souvenirs, and the food options are endless. Its location is super convenient, as it connects directly to major subway lines. Definitely worth a visit if you enjoy shopping or exploring local spots. Shopping gallery and food corner place in Namba station. You can walk hundreds meters straight in parallel street in basement with many different shops and services. In the middle there is connection to metro lines and there are many exists So fun! We got a bit lost but everywhere is connected so you will 100 find your way around. You can get a map and there is one on the wall too! spider web like underground mall with many restaurants and shops. nothing facy interms of brands but you can still have satisfying meal and fun walking around. many exits leading to the ground level, as well as metro entrys. worth a visit if you have lots of time to kill. although, there is renovation going on so some of the connecting parts are closed. Lots of shops, lots of restaurants, lots of walking!! Namba Walk is a nice long strip of shops split into North and South within the subway system. If you're not used to confusing japanese stations such as the OsakaUmeda station complex or the labyrinth that is Shinjuku Station Tokyo, then it may be confusing to navigate.

리뷰:
This is one of many famous tourist attraction spot in Osaka. A busy shopping street with quaint stores and FB outlets.

This 2 kilometer long roof covered shopping street streched between Senba Shinsaibashi Shotengai at the North side through to the front of Takashimaya building at the South side.

Best time to visit is at night. So we can enjoy sparkling colorful lights along the way full of signage and displays. So many offers not to be missed.

osaka longest shopping street Great place for tourists to spend some time. Make sure you are hungry when you walk around as a lot of resturants all around and good to try the local specialties The entrance of this shopping street is near the "Glico Sign", and a great spot for night photography. Be watchful as there is a bunch of crowd at night. One of the many many pedestrianised covered shopping streets. More interested in the quaint FB outlets rather than shops selling trinkets and souvenirs. One of Osakas oldest and busiest shopping destination which runs around a kilometer in length between Umeda and Namba, and at Datambori, Shinsaibashi Sui becomes Ebisubashi Suji, though the same shopping atmosphere remains, obviously, I'm sure you must have guessed? Indeed retail therapy. Till 6pm. Didn't do down well with me. I think I have already told you before that I am done and over with shopping. Well, I suppose its one of those things you can't avoid when you are tour group travelling? You bet.

But if you look for clothing shoes, many other big brands available in this mall, could have shopping planned here for at least half day. Also many food choices as well. Shopping mall within Tennoji area with around 9 floors of fashionwear for your eyes to feast upon. Place is quite hip and trendy in terms of design, and one can get so immersed while browsing around that you tend to forget time. GU outlet has just opened recently so it was a timely visit to this place to venture further. Located just above the JR Tennoji station, this shopping mall is home to over 300 shops selling merchandise ranging from designer clothing and homewares to vintage fashion. There are also eateries, pastry and dessert stores, convenience stores where you can grab your food or drinks.

As it was a Saturday evening when we visited there, the mall was quite crowded.

It's convenient and accessible to shop here as you can move around easily within the building or through the walk bridges that link you to Abeno Q mall that is on the opposite side of the road.

Do dropby if you happen to be in the area! Sprawling shopping mall with 9 floors of shopping and two floors of dining on the 10th and 11th floor. This doesn't take into consideration the countless dining options in the JR station that's connected to it.

Lots of boutiques here with the occasional souvenir shop or two. Great for women looking for bargains but otherwise not much for us men to do except to wait and wait  This train station is huge and confusing for new comers. But Japanese are generally friendly and very helpful to give good directions to places.

Overall a nice shopping mall, personally I'm interested in the animecartoon character shops on level 6 as they sell a lot of merchandise, if you are a fan of anime, you probably would like to visit here. Parco Mall is a highend shopping destination that offers a unique mix of stores catering to both tourists and locals. The mall is home to a variety of wellknown brands and specialty shops, including the evercharming Snoopy Town, which is a mustvisit for fans of the beloved Peanuts character. Another standout is Hands, a threestory variety store that stocks an impressive range of stationery, arts and crafts, and home goods. For those with a taste for fashion, the Issey Miyake store showcases innovative designs and luxurious fabrics.

With its sleek design and upscale atmosphere, Parco Mall provides a delightful shopping experience. Its a great spot to explore, whether youre looking to splurge on highend items, pick up unique souvenirs, or simply enjoy a day of window shopping. Great place for shopping. Something here for everyone. Also attached to another mall that has some high end stores. Spacious department store with a huge variety of brands, especially for pop culture fans!
The Ghibli store is a must visit for fans with its life size characters for photo taking no purchase needed Quite busy, but lots of good stores. Elevators can have long queues. Good washrooms.

For some reason when we came in early May 2024, the rooftop was closed for unknown reason.

That's what my experience was today when I accidentally walked past this bakery at the Osaka station and decided to queue up for 30mins to buy a cheesecake. The queues can run into other shops as I learned when fresh cheesecake comes in and they put notices when they run out to stop people queuing unnecessarily. 주소: 1-1 Tenmabashikyōmachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0032, Japan
리뷰:
After finishing a day or touring around Osaka, looking around this mall was a good way to end the day. A large variety of shops await, with plenty of food if you're hungry. It's located right next to a river walk, so if you staying nearby, it can be a nice to place to walk to. There is also a train station below if you are coming from further away.

The mall doesn't feel very "touristy", and seems like a place that locals actually go to. So I wouldn't go here looking for souvenirs, but if you are looking to buy Japanese clothing, books, electronics, and other household items, this might be a place to spend some time! Nice location beside river and connect metro station
Nice service always good
Environment clean and quiet
Highly recommended Large mall with many shops in a convenient location. It is right next to a subway line! If you buy food here there are tables outside, next to the river, which is a great place to relax and have a snack. Large shopping mall with everything you need from households, phones, TVs and electronics, toys, gifts to clothing, snacks, traditional Japanese goods and computers including your favourite security software.

The top floor offers high quality dinning and a golf training academy service. Looks nice but we did not shop. On our way to the subway.

리뷰:
Shopping enthusiasts visiting japan, Osaka is a must! We first got lost in the whiteys underground shopping city. We found an entrance right outside the station after we found the trippy elephant statues lol we got there early so places were just opening up. It's
Like a multi floor mall  indoor swap meet in some sections. We did shop around a little, grabbed a quick snack an made our way over to Shinsaibashisuji  Dotonbori afterwards via a short inexpensive Taxi ride to avoid the crowded buses. The driver was super helpful and gave us some local insight  recommendations  Good underground shopping center. A little old and hard to navigate but lots of good shops and convenient exits, too. The fountain area is great to meet up with people and has seasonal displays that are pretty ridiculous and fun. In warmer seasons, the fountain runs like a normal fountain. When you wonder where everyone is during the day, theyre all in Whity underground mall  its another world. Street filled with food stores and shops. Nothing spectacular, unless your in the area. I would not come here if it was out of the way. This underground shopping mall is so vast that you will be surprised to find yourself getting lost.

What's even more surprising is that even this underground shopping mall is only a small part of Umeda's entire underground shopping mall.

Time flies when you're wandering around.

주소: 1-1 Ōsakajō, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 540-0002, Japan
리뷰:
Did some shopping here after the walk around osaka castle. There's clean restrooms, water cooler and shops selling souvenirs and food at the mall. There's a figurine museum at the basement too. The Miraiza OsakaJo is a old building with history, now it has been transformed into a modern commercial complex. There are shops , restaurants, cafe and rest areas.  It's a pity that the 2nd and the roof floors were closed in winter time.
A small history room about the Osaka Castle is on the ground floor. A great place to explore when you visit the Osaka Castle. This building also has an interesting history in the area and now houses several souvenir shops, cafes, restaurants and public facilities.

In the heat of the summer, this place is air condition and a good place to come in and cool down. There's also a mini museum with the complete history of the Osaka Castle. There's also a few water machine here. Just on the path towards Osaka castle. Nice place to take a break to get a drink, lunch or shipping. Such a great place to shopping, buy souvenirs and have a short break with a milky soft serve ice cream

주소: 3-chōme-2-2 Umeda, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0001, Japan
리뷰:
I went to KITTE Osaka's preopening event
There were many antenna shops from each prefecture!
It's fun just looking at the unique assortment of products.
There were a variety of restaurants, from unique restaurants to wellknown restaurants.
There are some stores that are opening in Kansai for the first time, so it's nice to visit various stores
There were some shops that weren't that expensive even though they were in prime locations. Since it had only recently opened, there were a large number of customers.
This time we mainly visited the second floor, where antenna shops from all over the country are gathered.
First, I went to Miwa Yamamoto's directly managed store in Nara Prefecture, the birthplace of handstretched somen noodles.There were products I had never seen before, such as instant somen noodles that you just pour hot water on. There were also many other products that are not normally available at antenna shops in Hiroshima and Wakayama.
On the way to shopping, I stopped at JP Cafe and ordered a craft cola, but it didn't really suit my taste.
Since I only had a limited time this time, I wasn't able to see everything, but I'm sure there were a lot of products I'd never seen before, so I'd definitely go back again. I went there for the first time in August 2014. Even after opening, I was surprised to see so many people there. It was easy to get to as it was right next to the JR West Exit. There are so many antenna shops and restaurants that choosing one can be difficult. There are many restaurants and antenna shops such as Kagoshimaya, Izumoya, and Satosa.
The toilets are also clean. There is also a theater and mailbox, which is cute.

Everything decided to each floor, nice flow and easy access. Nice mall with a nice variety of stores as well as restaurants. Items sold here are more budget friendly, which was very nice.

Just because of new construction visitor will come, but no further more. We need something more?

주소: Japan, 〒541-0055 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Senbachūō, 2-chōme−3−６ 船場センタービル管理事務所 6号館 4階 401号
리뷰:
OMG!! This place is a hidden gem for tourists looking for affordable purchases.
Fully airconditioned shopping arcade!
Total, 10 sections.
Each sections consist of 2 Lane, and 100m long.
2 levels of retail shops, and 1 level of FnB!
Just retail alone, that's 4km!!!!
Not extremely crowded since I believe not many people knows about this place.
Some retail and wholesalers found in here!
Highly Recommended to visit this place! Worth a visit. An underground wholesale market for precious stones, clothes, kimonos, fabrics and more full of small knickknacks.

Theres a fabric shop MOSQUITO NET  NETING 19 at one of the two entrances of building 5, clearance fabric for 110 per roll. Bought 9 rolls for 990.

Theres a shop  selling things from Obi, street clothes, furniture  precious stones at the middle of building 4, Bought 3 skirts, 2 for 500 each and 1 for 300. My travelling companion bought precious stones for his mom for 9,000  3,000 total 4.3kg.

Also in building 4, theres a shop HERMITAGE selling fur and leather goods. Bought a coat with neckline fur trim for 1,000.

Basement 1 of building 2 connects to Sakaisuji Hommachi station. Underground complex with variety of cloths and others at wholesale price There are many stores that sell clothing and fabrics. Did not expect many stores to open at 11am plus. There are Semba 1 to 10. A variety of shops and restaurants in the basement.
Not all shops here accept IC cards use cash or cr card and most restaurants have smoking. There are seats near the elevators which is nice.
It was raining and in the basement, we couldn't get reception but on street level it was back to normal so that was interesting.

There is also a family mart and a lawson near building 3 on street level.

You can conveniently access Sakaisuji homachi station from B2 its connected and one of the exits is also next to building 3.

And a convenience store next to the station in B2 sells hot canned coffee!

주소: 2-chōme-2-2 Nishimiyahara, Yodogawa Ward, Osaka, 532-0004, Japan
리뷰:
Went here at 6 pm, most of the shops are closed already. Cool I found a shop called Doctor Reform that does hemming, repairs of clothes, bags, etc., and used it for the first time. A single hem was 1,210 yen including tax.
There were no shops like this around here, so it was a relief.
Dr. Reform is open from 930 a.m. to 630 p.m., except on days Seni City is closed and during the yearend and New Year holidays.
Sen'i City itself has declined considerably compared to what it used to be, but there are still some clothingrelated shops operating here.
Also, Daikoku Drug recently entered the market. When I heard that it had been renovated, I went there for the first time in a while and it didn't look like it used to. The number of stores has decreased considerably, with most stores catering to elderly people. I watched it while feeling the flow of the times. About 45 years ago, when I was in junior high school, I went fishing because I wanted a transformation suit, a combat uniform, or a jumper suit...I ate standing at Mikuni Soba...At that time, Sen'i City was a great textile town''. There were also a lot of clothes shops that looked like they were unscrupulous...The ones that were used by bad boys at the time...Clothes shops that were frequented by Teru from Joto, like Parion'' from Bebop...There were a lot of cutlets hiding in the shadows...People were being targeted. There were two of us...so I remember being prepared when we went... The futon store Daishin has a wide variety of products and is a very friendly shop.

Mika's women's clothing store is also cheap and has a wide selection, and they sell not only clothes but also underwear, bags, and many other things

Came here to check out Disk Union. New and used records, CDs and other merch. Techno, House, Jazz, RB etc. Highly recommend to stop by and check out the shop. If it's not in stock at the store, go to the website. Amazing! Umeda act III
Doyama Nakazakicho Shopping

Located on the way from Umeda to Nakazakicho,
Core shopping building act III

This is a fun building with lots of shops that people like!

Desk Union is a used record shop where you can buy core records.

DADA, a secondhand clothing store for women with outstanding taste

A store that I personally have been going to for a long time is
Desk Union

When I was a record collector,
I found a lot of bargain records at this store, and it became my sacred place

It had an atmosphere that was a bit difficult to get into, and although I had recognized it for a long time, I just walked past it. When I entered the building, I saw that it was an ordinary building with many restaurants and other shops. The location isn't bad, so I'll look around to see if there's a good store. It was a little dark, but the two restaurants serving lunch were busy.

주소: Japan, 〒553-0003 Osaka, Fukushima Ward, Fukushima, 5-chōme−6−１６ ラグザ大阪
리뷰:
A coffee shop and coworking office are located next to each other! The best environment for longterm remote workers who work from home! There are many food shops.
The alley on the ground floor looks like a bicycle storage area, but I think parking is prohibited in the areas marked "NO PARKING." I wonder if it would be readable if I said "No parking" or "Don't park your bicycle!" A complex with impressive yellow objects. It's right in front of Fukushima Station on the Loop Line. Contains hotels and restaurants. There are various shops, and I was satisfied with the place to eat!  I thought that in Osaka they would be more concerned about quality, but they were influenced in the opposite direction and turned out to be a bad restaurant, comparable to Bgrade gourmet food. The toppings are flimsy and come in a plastic bag for delivery.
The staff's hands are all oily from touching the food, and the smell is so bad that I can't eat it.
The tuna in particular is very good, and I've used it twice for delivery, but this time I took another bite and it all went straight into the trash.At least Kura Sushi's food is better.

Samples and exhibits introduced on TV shopping are sold at outlet prices approximately 46 off the regular price. All the staff members serve customers cheerfully. There is no need to force it. It's fun to watch as the items change every two weeks. They have a good selection of leather products. The shop channel is targeted at women, so it is difficult for men to get into it, but it is an outlet that offers products with packaging and other problems at low prices.
Clothes samples are quite cheap, and depending on your timing, you can make some great purchases!
The staff's response is also good  I sometimes take a look. Once a year? I once purchased a large amount of chairs and storage items at an event sale at the plaza. I don't really watch the Shop Channel broadcasts anymore, but it's a valuable place where you can get your hands on the actual product. Although it's not surprisingly cheap because it's already expensive, it's also a place where you can check the size before purchasing online. It varies depending on the manufacturer. They only have some products, but they sometimes have Bgrade products, so I check them out when I'm nearby.
It's a shame that the location is a little inconvenient even though it's in Umeda. It was on the corner of Third Avenue. It was new to me because I didn't know about it. After all, I think shopping like this is fun because I see it on TV. The clerk is nice o
