주소: Japan, 〒542-0076 Osaka, Chuo Ward, Namba, 5-chōme−1−６０ なんばスカイオ 17Ｆ
리뷰:
My friend and I went to Art Bar, which I had always wanted to go to.
Last year, there weren't many events held and I felt lonely, but recently when I looked at them, there were a lot of them held on weekends 

This time, I painted Van Gogh's View of SainteMarie''. Its really difficult 
However, by actually drawing, you will realize the greatness of Van Gogh. You'll never understand this just by looking at it 
I also thought Van Gogh's color choices were cute.

However, I have been painting since middle school
This time, the teacher Mr. Aki wrote a draft so that it could be finished in two hours.
So all that was left was to color itI was planning on doing it. . . 
It's not that easy 

The teacher was very easy to talk to, and I felt like we were friends, so I enjoyed spending time with him.
By the way, the reason for the 4 stars is that 2 hours is not enough.
I started drawing it a long time ago, so I wish I had continued to do it for a longer period of time.
The teacher said it was okay if I stayed longer, but if I went along with that, I would probably stay for 3 or 4 hoursI had time after about 2 hours

But I wanted to draw again, so I made an appointment right away 
Personally, I would be happy if the event was held on weekdays too I'd love to take a detour on my way home from work

By the way, it's great because you can go emptyhanded 
No paints or aprons needed 
While drawing, there will be wine, soft drinks, and snacks, so you can draw while half drunk 

Paintings are 5,500 yen per person.
I think it was 7,700 yen per person to drop paint. Even though I am an amateur who can't draw while eating alcohol and sweets, I was able to draw a very good picture! The instructors are amazing I had a private charter with my wife and my friend, and we had a great time drinking together in the morning  It was a really fun time and I learned so much from you!

리뷰:
I mistakenly bought a wrong size Japan Soccer jersey and returned to the store. The store manager was extremely accommodating and professional. Swapped the smaller size jersey for the correct size without any hassles or complications.

I strongly recommend the Adidas store in Shinsaibashi! Professional, courteous and friendly! I tried to exchange for a size but the staff was very rude and angrily told me he cannot change without shoes box , I told him I didnt receive box he said he will check video and still decided to not approve exchange . He had no care at all . Came to grab a pair of shoes. Great service! People like Takashi are wonderful ambassadors for Japan. He was incredibly helpful and polite today when I purchased some shoes and other items. I had to end up going back 3 times due to my fault and he was helpful and patient on each occasion. He also very kindly researched a great coffee location for me, which didnt disappoint. Thats 5 star service. Love your country and love people like Takashi  The service here is the best. Special thanks to Kana  for helping me get the right size for my shoes! They have some staff that speak a little bit of English.

리뷰:
A bit out of the way, poorly laid out, staff was not particularly friendly. The store is very narrow and had a movable ladder in the way of the front door used for getting jeans from highup shelves. Ladder was in the way but the staff made no attempt to move it to clear the way. They seemed more interested in chatting with their regular customers instead. The female staff tried to be nice but the male one seemed to lack the ability to do so. I ended up leaving without buying anything, not that it bothered them. Excellent shop with products of the highest quality.  The staff were friendly and very helpful! Fortunately, I was able to purchase DSB 1001XX. I also purchased laundry detergent, and the staff was kind and the store was clean. The lower floor is a warehouse and the upper floor is made up of denim. Recommended. The male staff is really friendly.
I was looking at 4601 tshirts, and he asked me about my size and brought me all the tshirts in sizes that fit me.
You can also hear a brief explanation about the shrinkage rate and fabric after washing.
4601 I only bought one pocket tshirt, but if I could afford it, I would have liked to buy a printed tshirt as well.
However, you cannot try on the Tshirt and it is not taxfree. If you're looking for real American casual, this is definitely the placeI went to the sample sale this summer as well. I bought two Tshirts.

리뷰:
This bookstore is quite big with many books. I especially love the comics section, huge selection of old and new Japanese comics. One of the places in Osaka to find english books to read if you are short of them  There are several Junkudo in Osaka and Kobe. This one is a short walk from Osaka station, and has a particularly extensive selection of technical, professional, medical, and engineering books. This bookstore looks like it's best days are far behind it. On the west side of central Umeda, it's fairly convenient, however the layout, atmosphere and staff just seem confused and tired. There is no flow from the moment you enter. No logical layout compared to the other big stores in Umeda.
The ESL and EFL selection of books has also greatly diminished from several years ago. They carried very few publishers and didn't carry more than a copy or two in stock. Won't be going back there! On a plus note the new junkudo in chayamachi is modern and huge! It is the very quiet space.Because this book store is far from the Osaka station.Many businessmen use this place.

리뷰: I was extremely pleased to discover this store online, and after spending a couple of days admiring their amazing selection, I decided to visit their store in Osaka. I was very impressed by the minimalistic and clean decor of the place, which made browsing very easy. I purchased this beautiful Dior necklace, and they kindly allowed me to try it on before buying. I will definitely frequent this shop every time I'm in Osaka, but in the meantime, I noticed they ship internationally, so I may take advantage of this option as well. Hedy has a great range of bags and other items, theyre authentic, great value and in excellent condition. Sales assistant was very helpful in getting me the perfect bag, she was patient and gave me great suggestions on how I can wear the bags I was browsing. I ended up purchasing this gorgeous vintage denim YSL bag! Im so sorry I didnt catch your name, thank you for your help! Hedy has a great selection of authentic designer items and I felt really comfortable browsing through the store. Our sales assistant Ayano was very patient, wellversed and thoughtful. She made the process super easy for us I discovered this store by accident while taking a walk through the neighborhood. They have a curated collection of beautiful vintage and preloved pieces bags, accessories and clothing, all in very good condition. I found a Chanel Medallion bag from the late 90s. It is in pristine condition, practically unused. The ladies in the store are very sweet and helpful and they let you take your time looking at the pieces. At the time of shopping, there was a promotion with a gachapon machine. I tried my luck and got an extra 5 for the bag. I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend everyone to visit this store when you are in Osaka. Found this shop on my tiktok! Incredible items and unbeatable prices. the employees were beyond sweet and attentive. I did not feel pressured or uncomfortable looking around and seeing the selection.

이름: Books Kinokuniya Grand Front Osaka Store
주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 4−２０ グランフロント大阪 ショップ＆レストラン南館 6F
리뷰:
Kinokuniya Grand Front Osaka is an absolute haven for book lovers. The selection is immense, with an impressive range of both Japanese and international titles. The store is spacious and beautifully organized, making it super easy to find exactly what youre looking for or stumble upon something new and exciting.

The atmosphere is chill and inviting, perfect for spending an afternoon browsing through shelves. The staff are knowledgeable, friendly, and always ready to help you out, whether youre searching for a specific book or need a recommendation.

They also have a fantastic collection of stationery and unique gifts, so you can pick up some cool finds while youre there. If youre in Osaka and love books, this place is a mustvisit. Its more than just a bookstore its an experience. You can also have a tax refund if you are a tourist and spending above 5.500 here. Less crowd, wide collection of books and magazines.  You can take your time to select books you want. Cool little shop. The place has several level and there is multiple kind of restaurants and stores.

There is a wide variety of clothes shopping store.

The elevator is cool with a big glass window. Cozy place with Starbucks inside. majority of books are in Japanese. You can order whatever you want with a device in different languages include English, Korean and Chinese. Food quality is better if you order it through the device.

리뷰:
Literally going nuts at the food department. There are so many to choose from. I was stuck at the sushi department for 30min just cant decide what to buy.
The dessert department is also full of delicious food which I am going to have a tough time deciding. Osaka Takashimaya offers a delightful shopping experience in the heart of the bustling city. During my recent visit, I was impressed by the wide variety of highquality products and brands available. From fashion and beauty to home goods and gourmet foods, there was something for everyone. The layout of the store was wellorganized, making it easy to navigate and explore. The staff were friendly and helpful, adding to the overall pleasant atmosphere. Additionally, the food court and dining options provided a welcome respite for weary shoppers, with delicious meals and snacks to recharge. Takashimaya is definitely worth a visit for a satisfying shopping experience! Love the supermarket here! 1000010 
Everything just looks soooooo yummy and tantalizing like I wanted to try all of them. From fresh ingredients, butchery, seafood, bakery, pastry, condiments, chocolate ..etc like literally everything.
You will eventually get hungry or end up buying things you didnt know youd wanted to buy.

Caution ! Dont go when youre hungry. Youll be broke  Tax refund was a nightmare even though it was organize . I wanted to queue for my wife when she is in the toilet and coming up .

But the person does not allow me to queue for her . Saying the person who queue must be the one who receive the tax refund .

I have visited many shopping and mall worldwide and This is the first time I heard of this . The rules are not flexible .

The person is not able to show me the exact clause or rules stating this at first and pass me some leaflet to show me . I question her that there is no such clause printed .

. Until eventually she found something look at attachment near the queue . I Believe the conditions can be more flexible .

Only the lady slightly senior with shoulder hair  can speak English . The other are not able to speak English .

The lady attitude can definitely be improved . This is not a typical Japanese attitude . Was a bit disappointed.

1. The bookstore and stationary area is difficult to find, and there is no a dedicated personal that his job is to assist with finding the right book and stationary. I asked the cashier, and she was very kind to provide me with an assistant.

2. Difficult to find nice casual clothes for men. Almost all clothes are for women. The store is big. I ended up annoyed finding a shirt to buy.

3. At some floor, there are two tearoom, but despite the name, there is only one kind of tea to order earl gray. And the tearoom was in felt relatively neglected that requires to be renovated and more attention. I tried one of them. maybe the other one is good, i didnt try it.

But there is NOT secured to be the first one to Pokemon Cafe because the people will just run past you and you wont get the first place at Pokemon Cafe waiting queue. Its terrible and the Customer Service manager  said there is no way he can help. Buy buy buy! Yes, lots of wonderful shops. Lose hours walking around having fun. Eat well, drink well, taxfree for you and me! Bring your passport.

이름: Hanshin Department Store Umeda Main Store
주소: 1-chōme-13-13 Umeda, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-8224, Japan
리뷰:
I wanted to shout out to Kyoko Inazawa and the team for the outstanding customer service! Here is a very heartwarming story I would like to share.

We just came back from Japan for our honeymoon last month. We shopped at Hanshin to buy some souvenirs to take home before our flight later that day. So we bought these Mt Fuji chopsticks, but when we got back to the US and unwrapped them, we realized they gave us the wrong ones. So I rang the department store, found someone who spoke English and told her what happened and asked how we can get the Mt Fuji chopsticks even if need to pay for them. They emailed us a couple of days later to say they will send us the set and will let us to keep the existing set. We received them today by express post from Japan. i felt so emotional by looking at these beautiful chopsticks because I was extremely upset that the wrong set of chopsticks were given to us and for me to only realize it after we flew back. The team was apologetic and communitive. I am so impressed by your dedication for customer service and you go above and beyond to showcase your customer obssession! Thank you so much again for sending us the chopsticks, you made our trip extra special. These chopsticks will remind us the beautiful country we visited and the kindest people we met along the way.  Japan, you are truly special! And Hanshin, we will be back again to visit your beautiful store!! So many delicious food! Good place for people who want to buy souvenirs, too B1 1F are all the food gift  a must place to visit. We went back another 3 times to buy the biscuit. Even when we moved to Kyoto. This review for Hanshin food hall.

We visited during the matcha  tea fair. Which we noticed from their Instagram account. Worth a lot of time because they curated a good matcha shop from Kyoto, Osaka and many more. I was surprised because some shop were a rare find.

So we got to try everything in one place! Really enjoyable to walk around. They arranged the standing space with table for eat in. Really convenient.

Also stop by at their bakery space, variety of selections. It is quite sufficient for brand lovers. Remember brands for man is in a separated building! If you go shopping with family members, there are plenty of facilities for playing and eating.

I purchased some APC items here that are specifically made for Japan. I highly recommend it if you're looking for premium clothing in Osaka.

리뷰:
Had an awesome time walking around this area, filled with tons of shops and delicious food spots. Its the perfect place to explore, shop, and snack your way through the day. And if you havent tried the pistachio shake at the dessert shop, youre missing out! Absolutely worth the visitjust be ready to order one for yourself, no sharing allowed!  Underground shopping at its best! This place covers 3 floors of shopping and food  and we felt that the vibes here aee much better compared to the Namba underground shopping. So much to see or shop, so many choices of food! Can't believe we didn't explore this place in our earlier trips to Osaka. Overall a very satisfying outing here. Comfortable to take a bus to the airport. There is an area with air conditioning that you can sit. The airport bus comes every 1015 mins. This a underground arcade full of small cafes, restaurants and shops under the Hankyu Umeda train station.
The cafe Roma, serves a range of spaghetti dishes at a reasonable price. There is a mix of high counter and table seating. Service is quick. Picture menu. Awesome stores located here. But can be at two different building as they are not linked. This is also a bus terminal and train station so there are many people around. Its very crowded!

Highly recommended to walk around as it maybe confusing at first but eventually it will be just two building.

주소: 16-7 Chayamachi, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0013, Japan
리뷰:
I love LOFT since I first chanced upon it in Tokyo. Its a departmental store with fashion, kitchen, beauty segments.

A great place to shop for souvenirs imo! I recommend the Shupatto reusable bags as theyre big when opened and flat when folded. I used to think SGD1120 is too expensive for a shopping bag but Ive already bought a small and medium size for myself and 34 more for friends.

The way the goods were displayed were very attractive to me! I love nice crockery and kitchenware and bought some items for myself and my friends.

Theres also a huge beauty section with various make up and skincare products on level 2.

TAX FREE FOR TOURISTS Check with staff or read posters regarding the minimum spending  I believe it is 5,000 yen. Once youve made payment at the various levels, present the receipts and items at the taxfree counters at level 4 for taxfree refund.

Just a tip, some people mentioned the staff are slow. Do hold some items and receipts in your hands. I was standing in queue and there were some idle staff but the moment I took my items and receipts out to prepare as I wa next in line, a staff swiftly offered me a basket and processed my items.

As usual, these will be packed in the taxfree transparent plastic packaging that you are not supposed to open until you leave Japan. Hence, if you need to strategize how you want them packed, pls inform the staff. A total of 8 floors and definitely one of the largest LOFT in Osaka.

There are wide variety of items from stationaries to household items and many more. Spend almost half of the day here to browse and shop. The items are all neatly organised and categorised which improves the shopping experience.

Love the store staff too as they are all friendly and helpful.

Will surely return to shop here! Nice shop if and only if you are not shopping taxfree! Tax refund procedure was a hell. First of all we had to pay at the cash register including tax, then you must line up again at the tax refund counter for half an hour. Then the procedure started with two persons, the one had to fill in some form on paper and the other one had to check if everything was done correctly. After then we had to wait for more than 30 minutes before every step was taken correctly by the staff. Then we discovered that we had to pay around 14 handling fee. A great place for shopping. Very good selection. Loft's staff was kind, courteous, and attentive.
The store was fairly clean, and the staff did a good job of attending to foreigners needs as best they could, though I did not personally need such assistance.

리뷰: I had a great shopping experience here! They have a fantastic selection of Rimowa luggage options. Whether you're looking for something stylish or functional, there's plenty to choose from. The store is always lively and offers so many unique products. Highly recommend visiting! Donquijotes are great. Good place to kill time at 5 am when you have jet lag lol. It's too bad that the elevator in this one isn't usable right  now. Looks like they're fixing something, so your way is blocked if you try leaving the elevator on the 3rd floor. They don't allowencourage strollers up the escalator either. You can still get a good amount of shopping done on the first floor alone How ever,as how as another reviewers back down. I felt the same when I was there to shop. As a traveler I bought goods there and paid with my tourist visa for free taxes. An old Japanese lady gave me a wear look. I saw another Vietnamese works arubaito  there and gossiped something. Really wear and not polite at all! Definitely the worse experience in Japan. Literally no customer service inside the shop. You can easily find same products with lower prices in those drugstore inside the metro station. Can you even imagine in Japan when you go to the cashier, they dont even say hi? Eventually we returned the products havent opened the whole tax free package which initially they said no, BUT, when we asked for the official document just to demonstrate the consumer law, they said ok you can return them all. Definitely the dark side of Japan tourism specially here in Osaka. Worst shopping experience EVER in Japan. Bad customer service, mean attitude, didnt wanna help customer to find goods I wanted. Check out procedures were blunt. The cashier was a robotlike without customer care service. PLEASE VISIT OTHER BRANCHES!

리뷰:
The worst store Ive ever visited in Japan!

We entered this ZARA store at 7pm. For some reason the fitting room on the 1st floor is closed without explanation so a train of customers starts climbing the stairs to use the fitting room on the 2nd floor. The female clerk straight up yelled at everyone because apparently the 2nd floor is kids section only. She kept yelling at everyone without listening to reasons. Everyone just walked out frustrated.

We travelled to Japan many times and never been yelled at any store for any reason.

Something is fundamentally wrong with the staff here. This store completely destroyed the ZARA brand for us. Do Not Visit! The fitting room assistant girl is very rude.
When I gave her back unnecessary items, she told me put myself to the rack inside. Nice store very rude workers. This lady was very rude while my girlfriend was checking out and I was sitting by waiting Store is fine just met a very rude staff hence I give a 1 star for bad experiences. Dont miss Zara is completely different

리뷰:
Occupies 3 floors, a great shopping experience.
We went to look for a limited edition pen, the website says this store still has one left but it was sold out. Still a good experience nonetheless. Nice selection of all type of products.  From beauty products displayed in a nicer way than Donki or pharmacies to kitchen products.

This store occupies 3 stories of the building.  Floors 10 12.  Tax return is done at the 10th floor.

Its the same building where Pokemon Store and Nintendo store are at so you can leave the family there and get some metime exploring Hands. Nice place to visit for all sorts or merchandise. This outlet has a few levels, and sells a variety of goods, including stationery, back and knee braces, seats with back support, electronics, household items, toiletries and office essentials. We spent a bit of time browsing at some of the novel items.

Shop is clean and bright. It is located in Daimaru Osaka station. Sell lots of interesting stationary, stickers, handcraft, cosmetics, kitchenware and bathroom accessories. This is a perfect store for strolling around in and indulge yourself in the vast varieties of Japanese merchandise. The kitchencooking section is a personal favorite of mine, it was great to find unique kitchen equipment you probably won't find outside of Japan.

A must visit for every tourist that has the opportunity to visit it.

리뷰:
We stopped by one of the official KitKat stores to stockup on all the excitingly odd and delicious flavors! It was a must before leaving shinsaibashi shopping street Osaka on our day trip. They had all kinds of flavors I didn't see anywhere else or at Don Q. These simple snacktreats were a great souvenir for my friends  family back home. My coworkers couldn't get enough of the matcha flav!   This is where we bought all the yummy Japanese snacks from Kit Kats to mochi to rice crackers to bring back home. The only thing that was upsetting about this store was that it wasnt tax free whereas most stores in the area were. Sweets and chocolate shop with lots of japanese specialties Matcha KitKat,Meji Chocolate etc.
If you plan to buy some sweet souvenirs, you should consider visiting this place instead of buying them at the drugstores around. It will be a little cheaper and you have a way larger selection. Only cash as payment accepted. Great selection of candy and snacks, and better prices than the local convenience stores. Good place to get gifts. Both most flavoured kit kat here for reasonable price.

이름: ルイ･ヴィトン メゾン 大阪御堂筋
주소: 2-chōme-8-16 Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0085, Japan
리뷰:
We did have to wait in line for a little bit, but that didnt bother us. Once we got inside, a sales person came over and introduced herself. We explained what we were looking for we had a few different items we were interested in and she was very accommodating. She brought us the items we were looking for if they had it, and then was more than happy to show us other items we asked about.
Overall a great experience.

Also, I had no idea that this is the largest LV store in Japan. Its a beautiful store inside and out. Looking forward to visiting again. We came to this LV store on a rainy day but there was still a long queue to get through. After around 20 minutes, we were assisted by 2 staffs. One was miss Oishi and sorry I forgot the other ones name. They were both so supportive and friendly, trying their best to communicate in English with us. We even asked them for food spots recommendations lol.
The store offered a great selection of products. New collection pieces were on display.
The packaging process was a bit slow due to some problems with the engraving machine we were the last customers to leave. However, we still left with satisfaction and got what we wanted! I visited the Louis Vuitton Osaka flagship store with high expectations, but unfortunately, it failed to impress. Compared to the stunning Singapore store, the Osaka building was a letdown. The exterior design, inspired by traditional Japanese cargo ships, fell flat for me. While the concept is interesting, the execution didn't quite work.

Upon entering, I found the interior to be surprisingly plain and lacking the luxury feel I've come to associate with Louis Vuitton. The nautical theme continues inside, with wooden floors and metal ceilings, but it didn't wow me. Perhaps my expectations were too high, but I left feeling unimpressed.

While the staff were friendly and helpful, the store's architecture and design didn't meet my expectations. If you're a diehard Louis Vuitton fan, you might still want to visit, but for me, it was a disappointment. We enjoyed our experience at Louis Vuitton. My son was looking for a custom bracelet and he found exactly what he was looking for. The service was impeccable as always and we would recommend the experience. Pro tip A line forms to get into this location, which can be quite long, so be sure to plan your visit accordingly. Ayaka HORII served us and we had the best experience.

We came back multiple times and made 2 purchases on 2 different days.

She was very patient. Ive seen reviews on other people that they were mislead or urged to buy stuff and this was not the case at all.

She was always waiting for us at the entrance, just brilliant and always punctual and adaptable.

Ayaka took pride in her work and allowed us to explore all product ranges and customisable options.

I also wanted to try on some clothes and she accommodated that very quickly and she didnt question it at all.

Great store, Great cafe, and a great buying experience. We were offered comfortable seats and water during the buying process and leaving the store had a great structured etiquette and routine.

주소: 10-12 Nanbasennichimae, Chuo Ward, Osaka, 542-0075, Japan
리뷰:
Purchased Jinbei for a friend that did not have any available in Little Tokyo in Southern California. They had three or four options at 5000 yen they did not have the sleeve design separated from what I was looking for. I also believe they had no zipper on the short. Colors available are black with thin stripes, also a navy blueindigo color.
 was helpful. We did not speak Japanese, we are thankful the younger lady helped us with the transaction. This spot was perfect for grabbing food, and entrance is not too busy. ! I was looking for a jinbei in Kyoto but the prices were insane. Luckily I found this shop in google and managed to get two jinbeis here. The couples were really nice and know some english. The shop has been selling Japanese souvenirs for almost 75 years. They managed to sort out my jinbei dilemma as well. I highly recommend for anyone whos looking to buy japanese souvenirs here because prices are quite reasonable. I visited here twice, once when I lived in Osaka, and a second time a year later on vacation. Each time, they were super friendly and polite, and made the experience extremely memorable! Many of the uniforms they have in stock are the standard traditional cooking attire, but unlike many of the other uniform stores in Osaka, they also stock a large amount of independent designs made by the young woman who runs the place! If you ever wanted to equip yourself with the stylings of a Japanese chef, support a local artist, and get a good deal on top of it all, I 100 recommend this place!!!!!

I purchased 4 traditional aprons for me and some friends, as well as a cooking apron, chef hat, and 2 bandanas. Each one was perfectly sized, and built to last! The aprons have seen steady use for over a year straight, and look just as sturdy as the day I got them! The shop has nice and cheap clothes, especially aprons. They also have original design aprons which look really nice. The owners are really nice and friendly.
They will help you find the right product for you.
The shop looks a little bit old, but is well organized and has nice goods.
They accept credit cards like visa and cash of course. This little shop is owned and run by a local elderly couple that are an absolute pleasure to deal with. The prices are really reasonable and I definitely recommend them!

It's a shame that this is the only store in Osaka. The back was good and the phone service was good so I had high expectations, but I was very disappointed. Please stop the customer service that overvalues you. I have more money than you. Although it is smaller than the main store, you can receive very good service. The products are all good.

주소: 3-chōme-1-1 Umeda, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0001, Japan
리뷰: Nice place to buy some local souvenir delicacies and snacks. Well stocked 711 on the site . Disadvantage of 711 is juices in small packs only , they not keep 1 litres packs as lack of space, every sq cm is important in this busy next door to the station main exit area. This shop is always busy and crowded, which makes it hard to navigate and move through the difference isles. However, its one of the larger 711 stores and has plenty of souvenirs to look at. This one often visited after traveling on the train, or if we needed a quick snack. The taxfree regulation here is very unclear. The operation time for tax free is from 10am to 5pm and it is not clearly shown outside the shop. And You really need to leave much time for lining up or the the counter will be closed sharply at 5pm even you have been lining up for more than half an hour. Entre Marche is located in front of the ticket gate of the Shinkansen, and it is together with a 7Eleven.They have a wide variety of Osaka souvenirs, goods from the Osaka Expo, Kansai souvenirs, railway goods, bento boxes, etc. , Onigiri , bread, etc. are also available in a wide variety. There is also Uncle Rikuro and 551 Horai Butaman next door. A large 7Eleven that combines souvenirs and 7Eleven. There is a huge selection of souvenirs from Kyoto, Osaka, and Hyogo. I always stop here when I come to Osaka Station. 7Eleven also has a wide selection of bento boxes and drinks. The employees were really nice and courteous in serving customers even though the line was long.

Great products with great selection.
Staff is very helpful and friendly. They are able to speak English as well. Very satisfied with my purchase !  Official Porter in Osaka Porter Exchange PX tanker specialty store.

There are many tankoriented products and various types, so you can choose according to your preference. There are more details than the regular Porter models, so the price feels a bit higher.

Because it is not part of Daimaru Department Store, there was no 5 discount, and only a tax refund was received! Happy to get it!!!!  I finally found an allnew tanker... They say it's the last green one on sale. Even considering that it is the most expensive model with two zip lines, the price is too high 83,000 yen taxfree. Other than the fact that the zipper opens and closes more smoothly and an internal pocket has been added, there are no significant changes from the existing model. The staff was really friendly and it was nice to know what I wanted in detail. There are many new versions of tanker products.
Shinsaibashi Parco 1st floor
The scale is not large, but it is worth a visit for those who like tankers.

리뷰:
Confusing AF to find this place but worth the drama! Its on level 5F of a luxury mall building. Dont give up  keep asking. I was sent to almost every floor of the complex before I found it. If you can avoid going on a weekend, it may not be so crazy. Saturday at 5pm was the wrong time to visit!

Very helpful and friendly staff. amazing clothes that seem oneofakind. I found the clothes to be quite different from the Kyoto store and it was worth the adventure. It's on the top floor of the department store, split into two different stores at each end of the hallway. Staff was very helpful! Happy with the items I picked up. They have staff more than customers but not allowed customers to go inside  Never boring with Kapital, always intriguing to see what is next I went to this store last week. It was just before closing time. I asked the staff to help me find clothes in Size Large and XL. For about the next hour the brought me almost every large sized item they had in the store. It was such a cool experience. I ended up buying a few items. I would certainly reccomend checking this store out.

리뷰: Did not buy any mspc products this trip, as their limited edition this rd is all black. But I had a few seasons of their stuffs. They r durable and value for money. Unlike porter, they did not go global, hence retaining their cost competitiveness. They uses gortex and all the best materials in the market for their products. My shoulder sling bag lasted for 13 years before retiring. While the bag selection was a bit smaller than I expected, the store has other items like apparel and shoes as well. It seems their main competitor Y P has been rising globally and so their prices have gone up a lot  MSPC bags are great value in comparison with basically the same quality. Big thanks to staff member Tokuhiro who gave great service during my visit. Fantastic coffee and hotdog, great hospitality. The barista uses a manual leveroperated machine. Thank you very much! Found exactly what we needed and wanted. Visited on 15 Nov 2023. This is the first time I visited the flapship store. I have bought many MSPC bags and accessories elsewhere. Excellent service from a lady staff, she was attentive and friendly.

리뷰:
Staff very good service. I'm interested in many models of bags. She was happy to show me all the  bags that I want to look and offered others for me to choose. I couldn't decide on the first day so she gave me a business card in case I came back to buy one. The next day I went to another branch in Osaka where the service was very bad. Finally, I came back to buy a bag at this branch with the same staff who took care of me. Even though they didn't have the bag that I wanted but I got a another new collection handbag and a mini wallet. I was very impressed. Next time I'll come back again. Worst customer service ever, SA dont even bother to check for stocks when I asked for other colors. When I agreed to buy the bag, she only shared that they left with display bag which is full of scratches and rushing me to pay before 7.30pm just because she needs to go home? Please beware of SA starts with the name of   cause she is definitely the worst. Horrible attitude. Treated me with such passive aggression just because I spoke Chinese? Told me everything I wanted was out of stock which is hard to believe, it made me wonder if they were just trying to gatekeep the bag from me. Store clerk here is not helpful. Asked to see what earrings were available and he brought 1 tray out. Asked if there might be more, he hesitated to bring another. Asked if theres anymore, and he brought a 3rd tray out. Should have been more proactive. Seemed like he wasnt interested to serve or made a judgement that I wouldnt be a potential buyer. I picked out a pair from one of the trays as the prices were favorable due to the falling yen.
Otherwise, would prefer to purchase from Bkk airport where service is impeccable. Racism. Keep you out of the door. No service. The store was empty and we watched for 10 minutes and no one came in to tell us that the reservation was full, no reservations allowed and no reservations today.

Maybe Chanel doesn't need its customers

Our cashier helped us with our taxfree purchase and offered to take our group picture in front of the massive Godzilla statue. It was a really fun visit. Highly recommend. Its my lucky day today.  I went to my first time to visit Godzilla Store Osaka.  It was truly amazing.  The cashiers are very friendly.  And I love Godzilla Store to collect the new figures to my collection at home. Amazing store with amazing service. Wide variety of interesting Godzilla merchandise  My son loves Godzilla so he was really excited to be here. However the sales assistant seems a bit uptight, the moment he saw us he followed us round like he was more worried we will cause inconvenience. I was about to ask where can I find a product being displayed before he quickly corrected my son not to touch those display. Oh well

주소: Japan, 〒530-8350 Osaka, Kita Ward, Kakudachō, 8−７ 阪急百貨店 阪急うめだ本店 2階
리뷰:
I want to buy a gift for my wife and we dont have specific model to look for, so we 1st go to Namba br. as its not far from our stay. No que and we are the only cutomer in the store but SA a little Japanese guy seems like dont wanna service us he answer only what u ask luckily there is no item we like. So we head to Umeda br. but not expect to get one as it is weekend with crowded people at this area. A bit wait for 4 que 1015 mins. We are finally in the store and my wife find sth. she like. SA is very nice to us. We are from Thailand and SA has visited Thailand for several times and he plans to visit Thailand again very soon. So talking chitchat is very smooth along with the service. So I am very happy to get my wife her 1st Goyard as a birthday gift and you can tell from her smile. That smile make my day.  I recently purchased a Goyard St. Louis PM bag, and unfortunately, my experience has been disappointing. Shortly after purchasing, I noticed that both top handles started peeling off. To make matters worse, I discovered additional defects on other parts of the handles.

I reached out to the company's aftersales service team, but since I live outside their service country, addressing these issues has been incredibly inconvenient. I requested a replacement instead of a repair, as traveling multiple times to drop off and pick up the product is not feasible for me. However, I was informed that only a repair is possible, which will take at least two months.

This experience has left me frustrated and disappointed. I hope the company can improve its quality control and aftersales support, especially for international customers. Based on my experience, I cannot recommend this product. Visited on a Saturday afternoon and there was quite a line but it moved quickly. I enter in 20minutes unfortunately both Osaka stores dont have the regular St. Louis just the one with a heart painted. Prices are very similar to Europe. Staff was attentive and fast. From the moment I stepped into Goyard Osaka, I was greeted with the utmost courtesy and politeness that one could expect from a luxury boutique. The contrast was stark compared to my previous visit to Goyard Kyoto, where the service did not quite meet my expectations.

In Osaka, the staff went above and beyond to ensure that every customer felt valued. One employee, in particular, made a lasting impression as they gracefully navigated through the queue, attentively inquiring about each customer's needs and preferences. This proactive approach to customer service made the shopping experience personal and enjoyable.

While the boutique's selection was somewhat limited, with a few items out of stock and a narrower range of colors than anticipated, the exceptional service more than compensated for this minor inconvenience. The team's dedication to customer satisfaction shone brightly, making my visit to Goyard Osaka a memorable one.

I would highly recommend Goyard Osaka over to anyone seeking not just a product, but a delightful shopping experience. The staff's commitment to excellence is evident, and it's clear that they are the cornerstone of the boutique's charm. The staff at Kyoto should learn how to treat their customers better. We could directly see that the staff had put away additional stock in a separate cupboard, and given that it was large quantities of the exact same product, it was clearly not for display purposes. However, the store clerk denied its existence and refused to sell us the products that we clearly saw was still in stock.

Furthermore, the male staff had shown a non display product to the group next to us for their considerations, but even when they ultimately decided not to buy it, he refused to let us have a chance to purchase it.

It's congested

Packed with people
Lots of food options but you have to stand in line for a long time.

Small and narrow streets. Fair prices and great souvenirs. There are many to choose from like keychains with name on it written in bot h English  Japanese, snacks, shirts  tons of trinkets. The whole of Dotonbori is crowded. We have to come here second time the next day to find this shop. Most of the items you see in the pictures by other reviewers will not be in the shop anymore.  It will be new items by the time you visit it. Pretty disappointed that some of the cute items were no longer available. Only one octopus takoyaki magnet hanging on my fridge, its the only cute souvenir I got from the shop. The pinnacle of tourism in Osaka is right here. Massive crowds and overly priced food.

I wouldnt recommend staying here too long but it is worth visiting at least once if youre in Osaka just for the experience. We greatly enjoyed all the original snacks to buy as gifts for people at home. The selection is huge. The store can be quite crowded but people are polite.

리뷰:
Interesting place where they sell all kinds of souvenirs. Mostly nonrelated to the castle, but in general, Japanese souvenirs.

In the summer, this place serves as a great place to cool down from the hot summer heat. There's also a cafe, food kiosk, toilets and an exhibition area inside here. This shop has a good selection of gifts and souvenirs. In particular, I liked the tshirts and magnets on offer here. A spectacular castle set in Parklands. Food and drinks available nearby. Just a moderate walk from a JR station on the circle line. Some stairs are involved but if necessary an elevator is available. Just Drinks  snacks but not recommended if U r not really Hungry.  BTW can take quite beautiful photo of the castle here Fun little shops and treats.

주소: Japan, 〒530-0011 Osaka, Kita Ward, Ōfukachō, 1−１ LINKS UMEDA 地下 1階
리뷰:
A valuable shop where you can buy Okinawa's special products and goods. There is also a store in the Tenjinbashisuji shopping street, but this one has wide aisles that allow you to walk around more comfortably. I'm glad that you can easily find delicious Okinawan souvenirs such as root beer, island tofu, sea grapes, and chinsuko in Osaka. Here you can find things that could only be bought in Okinawa! It's about 20 more expensive than the local price, but they even have Lloyd's items that you won't find in other Okinawa shops  We also have two types of Nuchimasu salt tomatoes. You don't have to look around for it, it's all here!

I want to eat brown sugar chocolate soon, but I have to restock it lol It's only available a few times a year for a limited time, so I have to call before going. This is one of the few Okinawa shops in Kansai.
I think the selection is quite small compared to Washita Shop in Tokyo, but they have a wide variety of products, from awamori, koregusu, and sanpin tea to shisa figurines and Ryukyu glasses.
Speaking of Okinawa, they had mozuku, but they also had kimchi mozuku! It's a rare item that can't be seen in Honshu, and it's very interesting.
Also, it's great that it's within walking distance from Umeda and Osaka stations!
Although the price is higher than buying it in Okinawa Prefecture, there are various products that will make you feel like you are in Okinawa, so just looking at it will make you feel like you are in Okinawa  They sell Orion beer Tshirts, brown sugar, Sanpin tea, Habu sake, Okinawaonly retort curry, seaweed, and sea grapes, so I often go here 
I was told that brown sugar tastes different depending on the island where it is made, so I compared the tastes and found that Honma was different
I love Nanshikowa! If you go to Umeda, definitely go there! LOL
Of course, they also sell awamori, so you can buy Okinawan things here without having to go all the way to Okinawa! Laughter
If you want to go to Okinawa but can't get there
If you come to this shop, you might be able to recharge your batteries...
The store staff are also kind and polite! Osaka Umeda Links Okinawa products exhibition on the 1st basement floor.
Im grateful that I can buy Zanpa bottlescans without going to Okinawa

리뷰:
Gift Kiosk ShinOsaka is the best place to look for souvenirs inside ShinOsaka Station. The store has a wide variety of products from the Kansai region, ranging from local specialties to standard souvenirs.

We have seasonal limited items and popular sweets. There are sweets that are loved by the locals and popular sweets, and you'll be spoiled for choice. The staff are friendly and will tell you about recommended and popular items, making choosing souvenirs fun.

The store is clean and tidy, with products arranged for easy viewing. In addition, the cashier service is quick so that you can shop smoothly even if you have a short Shinkansen transfer time. Especially for busy businessmen and travelers, being able to purchase souvenirs efficiently is a great benefit.

You can easily find great souvenirs. Its something in the middle of the Obon Day of the Dead weekend to see the hundreds of travelers buying cakes of all kinds to bring to their families. It's bustling and we don't understand all these little cakes but we would love a tasting  The products were neatly displayed and I was able to pay at the cash register smoothly.
I bought hojicha jelly from a longestablished store in Kyoto, and the jelly was refreshing and went great with the red bean paste. It's lively and sells all kinds of souvenirs!
There are also items outside of Osaka Kyoto, Hyogo.
Even though it was a normal Saturday and Sunday, which is not the busy season, I was surprised to see that they were doing sales and tastings.
It was a sight that you don't see in Tokyo or Nagoya, and I thought it was very Osaka. It's crowded with people buying souvenirs.
There are local specialties from the Kansai area.
It is a popular store along with 551!
Depending on the item, you can receive a small bag as a souvenir.
There are also pickles such as senmaizuke.

리뷰:
It's on the B2 level, it might be easier to get to if you go through the gate line.

Be advised, no post cards in sight. Mostly candy and knick knacks. There are a variety of souvenirs available, and it's great that you can buy them at Family Mart before the train departs. It is located near the east ticket gate of Osaka Namba Station on the Kintetsu Line. This was helpful as I was looking for a souvenir shop near my home.

리뷰:
A cool gift shop with exclusive Sky Building and Osaka merch. Prices are a little high but alright.

There are also exclusive sky Building gachas here for those who collect them.

This shop is on the way down from the viewpoint floor right after the first escalator down. This is a souvenir shop on the 38th floor. You can see the scenery from the window here without having to go to the upper garden. The product lineup is similar to that of a kiosk at ShinOsaka Station, but there are also various character goods and stereotypical Japanese products for foreigners. It is recommended to visit the store on the 39th floor of the Umeda Sky Building Sky Garden. It is like digging for treasures. There are so many great souvenirs!

As soon as you walk into the store, you can immediately see the mascot of the 2025 Osaka World Expo "MYAKUMYAKU". MYAKUMYAKU can be seen in many places in Osaka. The bright colors and unique shape make it easy to recognize.

There are also many tourist attractions and limited souvenirs here. I wanted to buy many of them, but because I had other itineraries later, I was afraid that it would be inconvenient to carry too many large and small bags for shopping, so I bought roughly 7 important items and put them in one bag. Bring it back
The products are so diverse that you will spend a long time shopping here if you are not careful.

There are a lot of name pendants near the entrance of the store. Unfortunately, I couldn't find the same characters as my name. But if I have the chance to come across them, I will definitely want to buy them as a souvenir! souvenir shop There are a lot of cute souvenirs that are symbols of the Umeda sky building. But the price is quite high.

The shop is near the escalator. We can stop by and buy some stuff before going back. There are quite a lot of souvenirs that can only be found in this shop
I'm sure everyone has their own hobbies and preferences, but there are many things unique to Sky Building that are perfect for memories of your trip

주소: 9th Floor, 1-chōme-11-1 Minamihorie, Nishi Ward, Osaka, 550-0015, Japan
리뷰:
Perfect little Muslim shop for buying gifts to bring back home to the family! The staff are lovely, very proactive and offer lots of free sample.

Excellent selection of foodsnacks and even some nonedible goods such as tshirts and ceramics!

They also have a prayer room available! A great souvenior halal snack store in Osaka. They offer halal certified halal snack and also Muslim friendly snack in the store. Were lucky enough to be greeted and attended by the store owner. He was really friendly and offered us lots of sample free snack for us to try before buying them. All of the snacks that we tried were delicious and tasty made us buy and spent a lot that afternoon.

They now already moved to Level 9 of that same building. If theres no advertisement or info about their shop, we wouldnt know their existence. Great to know this hidden gem! They already help us do the research of which one can be eaten and which one is not.

There is a space for prayer at the front of the shop. So if you need space, they have one. Looks comfortable and spacious.

Payment for the snacks and food can be made via card. A hidden gem for muslim traveller on the 9th floor! Theres prayer room, a lot of souvenirs, and the shop owner and staffs are really friendly too, they offer a lot of explanation about halal communities, also a lot of tester food for the snacks. It feels like home  I will go back here for sure  All of the snacks here are halal certified by Japan Muslim Association. Delicious snacks for gifts to friends back in your country. Mr Konishi, one of the staffs here was very friendly and accommodating, letting us try the samples before buying. Definitely worth coming to this place, few minutes walk from Shinsaibashi. Best part of all, there is a surau for you to solat here! Very friendly owner, the shop and products are well organised. Just prepared to be feast with various Halal product, all of them are very delicious and worth to buy. Here you can also buy few souvenirs such as Tshirtbagstoys and etc, and more importantly there is prayer room provided which is very comfortable. Located at the 9th floor in a high rise building, you can easily find it on google maps. Dont forget to rate the shop since there is a catch for that

주소: Japan, 〒556-0002 Osaka, Naniwa Ward, Ebisuhigashi, 1-chōme−18−６ 通天閣 B1F
리뷰:
At closing time, a small fat clerk wearing glasses said to a Chinese man, "Get out of here." He said. Learn a little more English. This is beneath the tower and a store with plenty of snacks and souvenirs. Definitely worth stopping by considering you have to go through here to get to the tower anyways. If you're just heading towards the tower then follow the signs for ticketing and the elevator entrance! Lots of cute miscellaneous goods.
The price is also reasonable.
It's a souvenir zone, so you can buy things without going into Tsutenkaku.
It is unclear whether if you call out to the staff while queuing, they will let you through.

There are many products with motifs of various sweets.
Perfect as a souvenir.

There is also a restroom that is clean and easy to use. There were many local products such as Happy Turn and Kaki no Tane, as well as character goods such as Glico, Chicken Ramen, Kyorochan, and Chicochan. Waku Waku Land had Morinaga, Glico, and NISSIN shops.

Especially when it comes to Glico, back in the Showa era, Glico'' would have been synonymous with caramel.
Caramel has become a rare confectionery that is hard to sell these days.

I remembered that my grandfather had asked me to buy Glico caramel when I went to Osaka, so I stopped by.

If you want a souvenir with a Showa retro feel, we recommend Glico's caramel.

이름: Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan Official Store – JR Shin-Osaka Station Eki Marché Store
주소: Japan, 〒532-0011 Osaka, Yodogawa Ward, Nishinakajima, 5-chōme−16−１ JR 新大阪駅
리뷰:
After spending 2 weeks in Osaka I've been seeing this character everywhere. MyakuMyaku, the Osaka Kansai 2025 Expo mascot.

I can't look away. I even. see it in my dreams. Its figure, shape and background origin are all so mesmerizing. There are no words to describe how I feel about this mass of connected cells and water. Now that it has its own gift shop, I ended up buying one! The price is the same both instore and online, plus it's tax free for foreigners. The store is very clean, and organized with everything in place. The employees are very polite and will give you a free bag with your purchase Definitely take a look at it yourself! 주소: 1-chōme-1-79 Tenma, Kita Ward, Osaka, 530-0043, Japan
리뷰:
Items related to currency and coins that can only be found here are displayed and sold. The limited time "Mint Gaufre" cherry blossom flavor cream with cherry blossoms was a great souvenir. When I arrived, I happened to have a coin set from the Jiachen Year. As soon as I entered the store, I was attracted by the dazzling array of products in front of me. From antique coins to modern collectibles, each item showcases the unique charm of Japanese currency. There are also many exquisite souvenirs, such as badges and stationery from the Mint Museum, etc. They all attract me with their exquisite craftsmanship and design.

Those antique coins. They are inspired by real currencies from Japanese history, recreating the culture and artistic style of the time. I saw a copper medallion modeled after Edo period currency, with traditional patterns and text engraved on it, and I was amazed at the sophistication and detail.

While shopping, I also had the opportunity to interact with store staff. They are very friendly and welcoming. They introduced me to some special items and answered all my questions, making my shopping experience even more enriching and enjoyable.

Finally, please note that this store is not taxfree and needs to pay 10 consumption tax, but for me, the items sold in this store are indeed a bit small. I am purchasing anniversary sets and viewing information on the products available at the internet store.
After enjoying a tour of the adjacent Mint Museum, taking quizzes, and experiencing weights, we entered the store to purchase souvenirs. I definitely want sweets! That's what I thought when I made mint rice crackers. I shared it with my family during snack time on the go and it was delicious. Individually wrapped, it was easy to say "Yes, please!" Anniversary sets are gifts for people whose birthdays are coming up. I bought commemorative medals for the families who showed me the way.
For those who like collecting coins or those visiting for sightseeing, I think the easytosee display makes the process of selecting and purchasing coins simple and easy to understand. There are many commemorative coins. They had rice crackers, so I bought them as souvenirs. Next time I'll come when it opens.
After commenting on this, I entered the store when it opened, and there were quite a lot of coins etc. Among the inexpensive items less than 1,000 yen, there were canned drops Sakuma? and rice crackers Kameido.
